        <td id="L8" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="8"></td>
        <td id="LC8" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">                         HISTORY OF PAINTING</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L9" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="9"></td>
        <td id="LC9" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L13" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="13"></td>
        <td id="LC13" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L14" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="14"></td>
        <td id="LC14" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">                       JOHN C. VAN DYKE, L.H.D.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L15" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="15"></td>
        <td id="LC15" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L16" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="16"></td>
        <td id="LC16" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">   PROFESSOR OF THE HISTORY OF ART IN RUTGERS COLLEGE AND AUTHOR OF</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L17" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="17"></td>
        <td id="LC17" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">        &quot;ART FOR ART&#39;S SAKE,&quot; &quot;THE MEANING OF PICTURES,&quot; ETC.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L18" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="18"></td>
        <td id="LC18" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L19" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="19"></td>
        <td id="LC19" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L20" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="20"></td>
        <td id="LC20" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L21" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="21"></td>
        <td id="LC21" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L22" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="22"></td>
        <td id="LC22" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L23" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="23"></td>
        <td id="LC23" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PREFACE.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L24" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="24"></td>
        <td id="LC24" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L25" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="25"></td>
        <td id="LC25" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L26" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="26"></td>
        <td id="LC26" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The object of this series of text-books is to provide concise</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L27" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="27"></td>
        <td id="LC27" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">teachable histories of art for class-room use in schools and colleges.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L28" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="28"></td>
        <td id="LC28" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The limited time given to the study of art in the average educational</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L29" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="29"></td>
        <td id="LC29" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">institution has not only dictated the condensed style of the volumes,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L30" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="30"></td>
        <td id="LC30" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but has limited their scope of matter to the general features of art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L31" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="31"></td>
        <td id="LC31" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">history. Archaeological discussions on special subjects and aesthetic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L32" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="32"></td>
        <td id="LC32" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">theories have been avoided. The main facts of history as settled by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L33" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="33"></td>
        <td id="LC33" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the best authorities are given. If the reader choose to enter into</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L34" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="34"></td>
        <td id="LC34" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">particulars the bibliography cited at the head of each chapter will be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L35" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="35"></td>
        <td id="LC35" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">found helpful. Illustrations have been introduced as sight-help to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L36" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="36"></td>
        <td id="LC36" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">text, and, to avoid repetition, abbreviations have been used wherever</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L37" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="37"></td>
        <td id="LC37" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">practicable. The enumeration of the principal extant works of an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L38" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="38"></td>
        <td id="LC38" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artist, school, or period, and where they may be found, which follows</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L39" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="39"></td>
        <td id="LC39" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">each chapter, may be serviceable not only as a summary of individual</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L40" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="40"></td>
        <td id="LC40" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">or school achievement, but for reference by travelling students in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L41" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="41"></td>
        <td id="LC41" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Europe.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L42" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="42"></td>
        <td id="LC42" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L43" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="43"></td>
        <td id="LC43" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">This volume on painting, the first of the series, omits mention of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L44" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="44"></td>
        <td id="LC44" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">such work in Arabic, Indian, Chinese, and Persian art as may come</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L45" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="45"></td>
        <td id="LC45" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">properly under the head of Ornament--a subject proposed for separate</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L46" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="46"></td>
        <td id="LC46" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">treatment hereafter. In treating of individual painters it has been</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L47" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="47"></td>
        <td id="LC47" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">thought best to give a short critical estimate of the man and his rank</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L48" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="48"></td>
        <td id="LC48" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">among the painters of his time rather than the detailed facts of his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L49" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="49"></td>
        <td id="LC49" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">life. Students who wish accounts of the lives of the painters should</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L50" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="50"></td>
        <td id="LC50" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">use Vasari, Larousse, and the _Encyclopaedia Britannica_ in connection</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L51" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="51"></td>
        <td id="LC51" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with this text-book.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L52" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="52"></td>
        <td id="LC52" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L53" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="53"></td>
        <td id="LC53" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Acknowledgments are made to the respective publishers of Woltmann and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L54" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="54"></td>
        <td id="LC54" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Woermann&#39;s History of Painting, and the fine series of art histories</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L55" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="55"></td>
        <td id="LC55" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by Perrot and Chipiez, for permission to reproduce some few</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L56" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="56"></td>

      </tr>

        <td id="L393" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="393"></td>
        <td id="LC393" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">GENERAL BIBLIOGRAPHY.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L394" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="394"></td>
        <td id="LC394" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L395" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="395"></td>
        <td id="LC395" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L396" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="396"></td>
        <td id="LC396" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(This includes the leading accessible works that treat of painting in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L397" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="397"></td>
        <td id="LC397" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">general. For works on special periods or schools, see the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L398" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="398"></td>
        <td id="LC398" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bibliographical references at the head of each chapter. For</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L399" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="399"></td>
        <td id="LC399" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bibliography of individual painters consult, under proper names,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L400" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="400"></td>
        <td id="LC400" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Champlin and Perkins&#39;s _Cyclopedia_, as given below.)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L401" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="401"></td>
        <td id="LC401" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L402" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="402"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L449" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="449"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L450" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="450"></td>
        <td id="LC450" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">HISTORY OF PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L451" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="451"></td>
        <td id="LC451" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L452" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="452"></td>
        <td id="LC452" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L453" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="453"></td>
        <td id="LC453" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L454" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="454"></td>
        <td id="LC454" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L455" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="455"></td>
        <td id="LC455" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">INTRODUCTION.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L456" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="456"></td>
        <td id="LC456" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L457" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="457"></td>
        <td id="LC457" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L458" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="458"></td>
        <td id="LC458" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The origin of painting is unknown. The first important records of this</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L459" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="459"></td>
        <td id="LC459" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art are met with in Egypt; but before the Egyptian civilization the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L460" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="460"></td>
        <td id="LC460" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">men of the early ages probably used color in ornamentation and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L461" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="461"></td>
        <td id="LC461" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decoration, and they certainly scratched the outlines of men and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L462" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="462"></td>
        <td id="LC462" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">animals upon bone and slate. Traces of this rude primitive work still</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L463" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="463"></td>
        <td id="LC463" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">remain to us on the pottery, weapons, and stone implements of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L464" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="464"></td>
        <td id="LC464" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">cave-dwellers. But while indicating the awakening of intelligence in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L465" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="465"></td>
        <td id="LC465" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early man, they can be reckoned with as art only in a slight</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L466" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="466"></td>
        <td id="LC466" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">archaeological way. They show inclination rather than accomplishment--a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L467" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="467"></td>
        <td id="LC467" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">wish to ornament or to represent, with only a crude knowledge of how</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L468" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="468"></td>
        <td id="LC468" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to go about it.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L469" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="469"></td>
        <td id="LC469" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L470" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="470"></td>
        <td id="LC470" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The first aim of this primitive painting was undoubtedly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L471" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="471"></td>
        <td id="LC471" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decoration--the using of colored forms for color and form only, as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L472" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="472"></td>
        <td id="LC472" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shown in the pottery designs or cross-hatchings on stone knives or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L473" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="473"></td>
        <td id="LC473" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spear-heads. The second, and perhaps later aim, was by imitating the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L474" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="474"></td>
        <td id="LC474" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shapes and colors of men, animals, and the like, to convey an idea of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L475" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="475"></td>
        <td id="LC475" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the proportions and characters of such things. An outline of a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L476" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="476"></td>
        <td id="LC476" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">cave-bear or a mammoth was perhaps the cave-dweller&#39;s way of telling</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L477" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="477"></td>
        <td id="LC477" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his fellows what monsters he had slain. We may assume that it was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L478" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="478"></td>
        <td id="LC478" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictorial record, primitive picture-written history. This early method</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L479" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="479"></td>
        <td id="LC479" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of conveying an idea is, in intent, substantially the same as the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L480" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="480"></td>
        <td id="LC480" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">later hieroglyphic writing and historical painting of the Egyptians.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L481" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="481"></td>
        <td id="LC481" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The difference between them is merely one of development. Thus there</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L482" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="482"></td>
        <td id="LC482" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">is an indication in the art of Primitive Man of the two great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L483" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="483"></td>
        <td id="LC483" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">departments of painting existent to-day.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L484" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="484"></td>
        <td id="LC484" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L485" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="485"></td>
        <td id="LC485" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">1. DECORATIVE PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L486" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="486"></td>
        <td id="LC486" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L487" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="487"></td>
        <td id="LC487" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">2. EXPRESSIVE PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L488" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="488"></td>
        <td id="LC488" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L489" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="489"></td>
        <td id="LC489" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Pure Decorative Painting is not usually expressive of ideas other than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L490" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="490"></td>
        <td id="LC490" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">those of rhythmical line and harmonious color. It is not our subject.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L491" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="491"></td>
        <td id="LC491" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">This volume treats of Expressive Painting; but in dealing with that it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L492" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="492"></td>
        <td id="LC492" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">should be borne in mind that Expressive Painting has always a more or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L493" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="493"></td>
        <td id="LC493" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">less decorative effect accompanying it, and that must be spoken of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L494" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="494"></td>
        <td id="LC494" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">incidentally. We shall presently see the intermingling of both kinds</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L495" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="495"></td>
        <td id="LC495" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of painting in the art of ancient Egypt--our first inquiry.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L496" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="496"></td>
        <td id="LC496" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L497" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="497"></td>
        <td id="LC497" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L498" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="498"></td>
        <td id="LC498" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L499" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="499"></td>
        <td id="LC499" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L500" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="500"></td>
        <td id="LC500" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHAPTER I.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L501" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="501"></td>
        <td id="LC501" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L502" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="502"></td>
        <td id="LC502" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">EGYPTIAN PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L503" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="503"></td>
        <td id="LC503" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L504" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="504"></td>
        <td id="LC504" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: Brugsch, _History of Egypt under the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L505" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="505"></td>
        <td id="LC505" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Pharaohs_; Budge, _Dwellers on the Nile_; Duncker, _History</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L506" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="506"></td>
        <td id="LC506" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     of Antiquity; Egypt Exploration Fund Memoirs_; Ely, _Manual</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L507" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="507"></td>
        <td id="LC507" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     of Archaeology_; Lepsius, _Denkmaler aus Aegypten und</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L508" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="508"></td>
        <td id="LC508" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Aethiopen_; Maspero, _Life in Ancient Egypt and Assyria_;</td>
      </tr>

        <td id="L509" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="509"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L510" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="510"></td>
        <td id="LC510" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Egyptian Archaeology_; Perrot and Chipiez, _History of Art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L511" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="511"></td>
        <td id="LC511" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     in Ancient Egypt_; Wilkinson, _Manners and Customs of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L512" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="512"></td>
        <td id="LC512" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Ancient Egyptians_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L513" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="513"></td>
        <td id="LC513" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L514" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="514"></td>
        <td id="LC514" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L515" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="515"></td>
        <td id="LC515" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">LAND AND PEOPLE: Egypt, as Herodotus has said, is &quot;the gift of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L516" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="516"></td>
        <td id="LC516" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Nile,&quot; one of the latest of the earth&#39;s geological formations, and yet</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L517" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="517"></td>
        <td id="LC517" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">one of the earliest countries to be settled and dominated by man. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L518" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="518"></td>
        <td id="LC518" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">consists now, as in the ancient days, of the valley of the Nile,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L519" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="519"></td>
        <td id="LC519" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bounded on the east by the Arabian mountains and on the west by the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L520" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="520"></td>
        <td id="LC520" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Libyan desert. Well-watered and fertile, it was doubtless at first a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L521" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="521"></td>
        <td id="LC521" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pastoral and agricultural country; then, by its riverine traffic, a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L522" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="522"></td>
        <td id="LC522" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">commercial country, and finally, by conquest, a land enriched with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L523" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="523"></td>
        <td id="LC523" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spoils of warfare.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L524" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="524"></td>
        <td id="LC524" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L525" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="525"></td>
        <td id="LC525" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Its earliest records show a strongly established monarchy. Dynasties</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L526" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="526"></td>
        <td id="LC526" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of kings called Pharaohs succeeded one another by birth or conquest.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L527" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="527"></td>
        <td id="LC527" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The king made the laws, judged the people, declared war, and was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L528" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="528"></td>
        <td id="LC528" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">monarch supreme. Next to him in rank came the priests, who were not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L529" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="529"></td>
        <td id="LC529" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">only in the service of religion but in that of the state, as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L530" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="530"></td>
        <td id="LC530" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">counsellors, secretaries, and the like. The common people, with true</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L531" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="531"></td>
        <td id="LC531" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Oriental lack of individuality, depending blindly on leaders, were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L532" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="532"></td>
        <td id="LC532" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">little more than the servants of the upper classes.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L533" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="533"></td>
        <td id="LC533" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L534" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="534"></td>
        <td id="LC534" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 1.--HUNTING IN THE MARSHES. TOMB OF TI, SACCARAH.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L535" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="535"></td>
        <td id="LC535" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(FROM PERROT AND CHIPIEZ.)]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L536" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="536"></td>
        <td id="LC536" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L537" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="537"></td>
        <td id="LC537" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The Egyptian religion existing in the earliest days was a worship of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L538" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="538"></td>
        <td id="LC538" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the personified elements of nature. Each element had its particular</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L539" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="539"></td>
        <td id="LC539" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">controlling god, worshipped as such. Later on in Egyptian history the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L540" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="540"></td>
        <td id="LC540" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">number of gods was increased, and each city had its trinity of godlike</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L541" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="541"></td>
        <td id="LC541" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">protectors symbolized by the propylaea of the temples. Future life was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L542" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="542"></td>
        <td id="LC542" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a certainty, provided that the Ka, or spirit, did not fall a prey to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L543" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="543"></td>
        <td id="LC543" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Typhon, the God of Evil, during the long wait in the tomb for the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L544" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="544"></td>
        <td id="LC544" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">judgment-day. The belief that the spirit rested in the body until</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L545" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="545"></td>
        <td id="LC545" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">finally transported to the aaln fields (the Islands of the Blest,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L546" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="546"></td>
        <td id="LC546" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">afterward adopted by the Greeks) was one reason for the careful</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L547" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="547"></td>
        <td id="LC547" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">preservation of the body by mummifying processes. Life itself was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L548" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="548"></td>
        <td id="LC548" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">more important than death. Hence the imposing ceremonies of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L549" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="549"></td>
        <td id="LC549" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">funeral and burial, the elaborate richness of the tomb and its wall</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L550" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="550"></td>
        <td id="LC550" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">paintings. Perhaps the first Egyptian art arose through religious</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L551" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="551"></td>
        <td id="LC551" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">observance, and certainly the first known to us was sepulchral.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L552" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="552"></td>
        <td id="LC552" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L553" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="553"></td>
        <td id="LC553" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ART MOTIVES: The centre of the Egyptian system was the monarch and his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L554" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="554"></td>
        <td id="LC554" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">supposed relatives, the gods. They arrogated to themselves the chief</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L555" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="555"></td>
        <td id="LC555" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">thought of life, and the aim of the great bulk of the art was to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L556" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="556"></td>
        <td id="LC556" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">glorify monarchy or deity. The massive buildings, still standing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L557" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="557"></td>
        <td id="LC557" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to-day in ruins, were built as the dwelling-places of kings or the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L558" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="558"></td>
        <td id="LC558" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sanctuaries of gods. The towers symbolized deity, the sculptures and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L559" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="559"></td>
        <td id="LC559" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">paintings recited the functional duties of presiding spirits, or the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L560" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="560"></td>
        <td id="LC560" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Pharaoh&#39;s looks and acts. Almost everything about the public buildings</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L561" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="561"></td>
        <td id="LC561" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in painting and sculpture was symbolic illustration, picture-written</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L562" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="562"></td>
        <td id="LC562" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">history--written with a chisel and brush, written large that all might</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L563" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="563"></td>
        <td id="LC563" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">read. There was no other safe way of preserving record. There were no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L564" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="564"></td>
        <td id="LC564" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">books; the papyrus sheet, used extensively, was frail, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L565" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="565"></td>
        <td id="LC565" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Egyptians evidently wished their buildings, carvings, and paintings to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L566" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="566"></td>
        <td id="LC566" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">last into eternity. So they wrought in and upon stone. The same</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L567" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="567"></td>
        <td id="LC567" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hieroglyphic character of their papyrus writings appeared cut and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L568" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="568"></td>
        <td id="LC568" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">colored on the palace walls, and above them and beside them the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L569" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="569"></td>
        <td id="LC569" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictures ran as vignettes explanatory of the text. In a less</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L570" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="570"></td>
        <td id="LC570" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ostentatious way the tombs perpetuated history in a similar manner,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L571" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="571"></td>
        <td id="LC571" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reciting the domestic scenes from the life of the individual, as the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L572" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="572"></td>
        <td id="LC572" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">temples and palaces the religious and monarchical scenes.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L573" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="573"></td>
        <td id="LC573" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L574" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="574"></td>
        <td id="LC574" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In one form or another it was all record of Egyptian life, but this</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L575" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="575"></td>
        <td id="LC575" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was not the only motive of their painting. The temples and palaces,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L576" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="576"></td>
        <td id="LC576" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">designed to shut out light and heat, were long squares of heavy stone,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L577" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="577"></td>
        <td id="LC577" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gloomy as the cave from which their plan may have originated. Carving</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L578" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="578"></td>
        <td id="LC578" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and color were used to brighten and enliven the interior. The battles,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L579" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="579"></td>
        <td id="LC579" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the judgment scenes, the Pharaoh playing at draughts with his wives,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L580" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="580"></td>
        <td id="LC580" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the religious rites and ceremonies, were all given with brilliant</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L581" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="581"></td>
        <td id="LC581" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">arbitrary color, surrounded oftentimes by bordering bands of green,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L582" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="582"></td>
        <td id="LC582" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">yellow, and blue. Color showed everywhere from floor to ceiling. Even</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L583" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="583"></td>
        <td id="LC583" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the explanatory hieroglyphic texts ran in colors, lining the walls and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L584" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="584"></td>
        <td id="LC584" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">winding around the cylinders of stone. The lotus capitals, the frieze</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L585" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="585"></td>
        <td id="LC585" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and architrave, all glowed with bright hues, and often the roof</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L586" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="586"></td>
        <td id="LC586" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ceiling was painted in blue and studded with golden stars.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L587" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="587"></td>
        <td id="LC587" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L588" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="588"></td>
        <td id="LC588" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 2.--PORTRAIT OF QUEEN TAIA. (FROM PERROT AND</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L589" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="589"></td>
        <td id="LC589" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHIPIEZ.)]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L590" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="590"></td>
        <td id="LC590" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L591" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="591"></td>
        <td id="LC591" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">All this shows a decorative motive in Egyptian painting, and how</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L592" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="592"></td>
        <td id="LC592" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">constantly this was kept in view may be seen at times in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L593" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="593"></td>
        <td id="LC593" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">arrangement of the different scenes, the large ones being placed in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L594" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="594"></td>
        <td id="LC594" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the middle of the wall and the smaller ones going at the top and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L595" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="595"></td>
        <td id="LC595" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bottom, to act as a frieze and dado. There were, then, two leading</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L596" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="596"></td>
        <td id="LC596" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">motives for Egyptian painting; (1) History, monarchical, religious, or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L597" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="597"></td>
        <td id="LC597" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">domestic; and (2) Decoration.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L598" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="598"></td>
        <td id="LC598" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L599" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="599"></td>
        <td id="LC599" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">TECHNICAL METHODS: Man in the early stages of civilization comprehends</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L600" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="600"></td>
        <td id="LC600" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">objects more by line than by color or light. The figure is not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L601" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="601"></td>
        <td id="LC601" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">studied in itself, but in its sun-shadow or silhouette. The Egyptian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L602" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="602"></td>
        <td id="LC602" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hieroglyph represented objects by outlines or arbitrary marks and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L603" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="603"></td>
        <td id="LC603" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">conveyed a simple meaning without circumlocution. The Egyptian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L604" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="604"></td>
        <td id="LC604" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting was substantially an enlargement of the hieroglyph. There was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L605" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="605"></td>
        <td id="LC605" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">no attempt to place objects in the setting which they hold in nature.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L606" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="606"></td>
        <td id="LC606" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Perspective and light-and-shade were disregarded. Objects, of whatever</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L607" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="607"></td>
        <td id="LC607" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature, were shown in flat profile. In the human figure the shoulders</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L608" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="608"></td>
        <td id="LC608" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were square, the hips slight, the legs and arms long, the feet and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L609" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="609"></td>
        <td id="LC609" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hands flat. The head, legs, and arms were shown in profile, while the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L610" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="610"></td>
        <td id="LC610" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">chest and eye were twisted to show the flat front view. There are only</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L611" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="611"></td>
        <td id="LC611" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">one or two full-faced figures among the remains of Egyptian painting.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L612" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="612"></td>
        <td id="LC612" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">After the outline was drawn the enclosed space was filled in with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L613" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="613"></td>
        <td id="LC613" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">plain color. In the absence of high light, or composed groups,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L614" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="614"></td>
        <td id="LC614" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">prominence was given to an important figure, like that of the king, by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L615" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="615"></td>
        <td id="LC615" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">making it much larger than the other figures. This may be seen in any</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L616" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="616"></td>
        <td id="LC616" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the battle-pieces of Rameses II., in which the monarch in his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L617" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="617"></td>
        <td id="LC617" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">chariot is a giant where his followers are mere pygmies. In the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L618" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="618"></td>
        <td id="LC618" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">absence of perspective, receding figures of men or of horses were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L619" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="619"></td>
        <td id="LC619" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">given by multiplied outlines of legs, or heads, placed before, or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L620" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="620"></td>
        <td id="LC620" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">after, or raised above one another. Flat water was represented by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L621" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="621"></td>
        <td id="LC621" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">zigzag lines, placed as it were upon a map, one tree symbolized a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L622" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="622"></td>
        <td id="LC622" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">forest, and one fortification a town.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L623" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="623"></td>
        <td id="LC623" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L624" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="624"></td>
        <td id="LC624" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">These outline drawings were not realistic in any exact sense. The face</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L625" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="625"></td>
        <td id="LC625" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was generally expressionless, the figure, evidently done from memory</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L626" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="626"></td>
        <td id="LC626" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">or pattern, did not reveal anatomical structure, but was nevertheless</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L627" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="627"></td>
        <td id="LC627" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">graceful, and in the representation of animals the sense of motion was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L628" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="628"></td>
        <td id="LC628" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">often given with much truth. The color was usually an attempt at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L629" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="629"></td>
        <td id="LC629" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature, though at times arbitrary or symbolic, as in the case of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L630" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="630"></td>
        <td id="LC630" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">certain gods rendered with blue, yellow, or green skins. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L631" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="631"></td>
        <td id="LC631" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">backgrounds were always of flat color, arbitrary in hue, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L632" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="632"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L633" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="633"></td>
        <td id="LC633" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the processional scenes rose tier upon tier above one another in long</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L634" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="634"></td>
        <td id="LC634" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">panels.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L635" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="635"></td>
        <td id="LC635" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L636" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="636"></td>
        <td id="LC636" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 3.--OFFERINGS TO THE DEAD, WALL PAINTING, EIGHTEENTH</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L637" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="637"></td>
        <td id="LC637" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">DYNASTY. (FROM PERROT AND CHIPIEZ.)]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L638" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="638"></td>
        <td id="LC638" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L639" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="639"></td>
        <td id="LC639" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Such work would seem almost ludicrous did we not keep in mind its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L640" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="640"></td>
        <td id="LC640" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reason for existence. It was, first, symbolic story-telling art, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L641" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="641"></td>
        <td id="LC641" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">secondly, architectural decoration. As a story-teller it was effective</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L642" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="642"></td>
        <td id="LC642" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">because of its simplicity and directness. As decoration, the repeated</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L643" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="643"></td>
        <td id="LC643" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">expressionless face and figure, the arbitrary color, the absence of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L644" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="644"></td>
        <td id="LC644" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">perspective were not inappropriate then nor are they now. Egyptian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L645" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="645"></td>
        <td id="LC645" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting never was free from the decorative motive. Wall painting was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L646" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="646"></td>
        <td id="LC646" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">little more than an adjunct of architecture, and probably grew out of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L647" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="647"></td>
        <td id="LC647" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sculpture. The early statues were colored, and on the wall the chisel,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L648" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="648"></td>
        <td id="LC648" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">like the flint of Primitive Man, cut the outline of the figure. At</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L649" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="649"></td>
        <td id="LC649" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">first only this cut was filled with color, producing what has been</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L650" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="650"></td>
        <td id="LC650" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">called the koil-anaglyphic. In the final stage the line was made by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L651" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="651"></td>
        <td id="LC651" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">drawing with chalk or coal on prepared stucco, and the color, mixed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L652" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="652"></td>
        <td id="LC652" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with gum-water (a kind of distemper), was applied to the whole</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L653" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="653"></td>
        <td id="LC653" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">enclosed space. Substantially the same method of painting was used</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L654" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="654"></td>
        <td id="LC654" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">upon other materials, such as wood, mummy cartonnage, papyrus; and in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L655" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="655"></td>
        <td id="LC655" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all its thousands of years of existence Egyptian painting never</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L656" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="656"></td>
        <td id="LC656" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">advanced upon or varied to any extent this one method of work.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L657" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="657"></td>
        <td id="LC657" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L658" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="658"></td>
        <td id="LC658" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">HISTORIC PERIODS: Egyptian art may be traced back as far as the Third</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L659" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="659"></td>
        <td id="LC659" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">or Fourth Memphitic dynasty of kings. The date is uncertain, but it is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L660" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="660"></td>
        <td id="LC660" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">somewhere near 3,500 B.C. The seat of empire, at that time, was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L661" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="661"></td>
        <td id="LC661" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">located at Memphis in Lower Egypt, and it is among the remains of this</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L662" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="662"></td>
        <td id="LC662" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L663" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="663"></td>
        <td id="LC663" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Memphitic Period that the earliest and best painting is found. In</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L664" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="664"></td>
        <td id="LC664" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fact, all Egyptian art, literature, language, civilization, seem at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L665" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="665"></td>
        <td id="LC665" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">their highest point of perfection in the period farthest removed from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L666" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="666"></td>
        <td id="LC666" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">us. In that earliest age the finest portrait busts were cut, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L667" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="667"></td>
        <td id="LC667" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting, found chiefly in the tombs and on the mummy-cases, was the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L668" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="668"></td>
        <td id="LC668" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">attempted realistic with not a little of spirited individuality. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L669" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="669"></td>
        <td id="LC669" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figure was rather short and squat, the face a little squarer than the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L670" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="670"></td>
        <td id="LC670" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">conventional type afterward adopted, the action better, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L671" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="671"></td>
        <td id="LC671" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">positions, attitudes, and gestures more truthful to local</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L672" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="672"></td>
        <td id="LC672" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">characteristics. The domestic scenes--hunting, fishing, tilling,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L673" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="673"></td>
        <td id="LC673" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">grazing--were all shown in the one flat, planeless, shadowless method</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L674" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="674"></td>
        <td id="LC674" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of representation, but with better drawing and color and more variety</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L675" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="675"></td>
        <td id="LC675" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">than appeared later on. Still, more or less conventional types were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L676" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="676"></td>
        <td id="LC676" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">used, even in this early time, and continued to be used all through</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L677" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="677"></td>
        <td id="LC677" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Egyptian history.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L678" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="678"></td>
        <td id="LC678" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L679" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="679"></td>
        <td id="LC679" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 4.--VIGNETTE ON PAPYRUS, LOUVRE. (FROM PERROT AND</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L680" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="680"></td>
        <td id="LC680" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHIPIEZ.)]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L681" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="681"></td>
        <td id="LC681" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L682" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="682"></td>
        <td id="LC682" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The Memphitic Period comes down to the eleventh dynasty. In the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L683" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="683"></td>
        <td id="LC683" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fifteenth dynasty comes the invasion of the so-called Hyksos, or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L684" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="684"></td>
        <td id="LC684" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Shepherd Kings. Little is known of the Hyksos, and, in painting, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L685" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="685"></td>
        <td id="LC685" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">next stage is the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L686" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="686"></td>
        <td id="LC686" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L687" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="687"></td>
        <td id="LC687" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Theban Period, which, culminated in Thebes, in Upper Egypt, with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L688" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="688"></td>
        <td id="LC688" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Rameses II., of the nineteenth dynasty. Painting had then changed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L689" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="689"></td>
        <td id="LC689" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">somewhat both in subject and character. The time was one of great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L690" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="690"></td>
        <td id="LC690" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">temple and palace building, and, though the painting of _genre_</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L691" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="691"></td>
        <td id="LC691" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjects in tombs and sepulchres continued, the general body of art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L692" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="692"></td>
        <td id="LC692" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">became more monumental and subservient to architecture. Painting was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L693" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="693"></td>
        <td id="LC693" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">put to work on temple and palace-walls, depicting processional scenes,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L694" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="694"></td>
        <td id="LC694" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">either religious or monarchical, and vast in extent. The figure, too,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L695" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="695"></td>
        <td id="LC695" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">changed slightly. It became longer, slighter, with a pronounced nose,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L696" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="696"></td>
        <td id="LC696" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">thick lips, and long eye. From constant repetition, rather than any</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L697" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="697"></td>
        <td id="LC697" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">set rule or canon, this figure grew conventional, and was reproduced</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L698" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="698"></td>
        <td id="LC698" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as a type in a mechanical and unvarying manner for hundreds of years.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L699" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="699"></td>
        <td id="LC699" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">It was, in fact, only a variation from the original Egyptian type seen</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L700" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="700"></td>
        <td id="LC700" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in the tombs of the earliest dynasties. There was a great quantity of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L701" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="701"></td>
        <td id="LC701" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art produced during the Theban Period, and of a graceful, decorative</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L702" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="702"></td>
        <td id="LC702" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">character, but it was rather monotonous by repetition and filled with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L703" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="703"></td>
        <td id="LC703" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">established mannerisms. The Egyptian really never was a free worker,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L704" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="704"></td>
        <td id="LC704" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">never an artist expressing himself; but, for his day, a skilled</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L705" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="705"></td>
        <td id="LC705" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mechanic following time-honored example. In the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L706" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="706"></td>
        <td id="LC706" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L707" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="707"></td>
        <td id="LC707" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Saitic Period the seat of empire was once more in Lower Egypt, and art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L708" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="708"></td>
        <td id="LC708" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had visibly declined with the waning power of the country. All</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L709" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="709"></td>
        <td id="LC709" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spontaneity seemed to have passed out of it, it was repetition of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L710" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="710"></td>
        <td id="LC710" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">repetition by poor workmen, and the simplicity and purity of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L711" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="711"></td>
        <td id="LC711" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">technic were corrupted by foreign influences. With the Alexandrian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L712" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="712"></td>
        <td id="LC712" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">epoch Egyptian art came in contact with Greek methods, and grew</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L713" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="713"></td>
        <td id="LC713" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">imitative of the new art, to the detriment of its own native</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L714" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="714"></td>
        <td id="LC714" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">character. Eventually it was entirely lost in the art of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L715" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="715"></td>
        <td id="LC715" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Greco-Roman world. It was never other than conventional, produced by a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L716" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="716"></td>
        <td id="LC716" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">method almost as unvarying as that of the hieroglyphic writing, and in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L717" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="717"></td>
        <td id="LC717" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this very respect characteristic and reflective of the unchanging</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L718" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="718"></td>
        <td id="LC718" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Orientals. Technically it had its shortcomings, but it conveyed the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L719" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="719"></td>
        <td id="LC719" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">proper information to its beholders and was serviceable and graceful</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L720" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="720"></td>
        <td id="LC720" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decoration for Egyptian days.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L721" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="721"></td>
        <td id="LC721" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L722" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="722"></td>
        <td id="LC722" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     EXTANT PAINTINGS: The temples, palaces, and tombs of Egypt</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L723" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="723"></td>
        <td id="LC723" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     still reveal Egyptian painting in almost as perfect a state</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L724" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="724"></td>
        <td id="LC724" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     as when originally executed; the Ghizeh Museum has many fine</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L725" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="725"></td>
        <td id="LC725" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     examples; and there are numerous examples in the museums at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L726" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="726"></td>
        <td id="LC726" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Turin, Paris, Berlin, London, New York, and Boston. An</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L727" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="727"></td>
        <td id="LC727" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     interesting collection belongs to the New York Historical</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L728" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="728"></td>
        <td id="LC728" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Society, and some of the latest &quot;finds&quot; of the Egypt</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L729" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="729"></td>
        <td id="LC729" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Exploration Fund are in the Boston Museum.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L730" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="730"></td>
        <td id="LC730" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L731" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="731"></td>
        <td id="LC731" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L732" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="732"></td>
        <td id="LC732" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L733" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="733"></td>
        <td id="LC733" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L734" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="734"></td>
        <td id="LC734" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHAPTER II.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L735" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="735"></td>
        <td id="LC735" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L736" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="736"></td>
        <td id="LC736" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHALDAEO-ASSYRIAN PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L737" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="737"></td>
