        <td id="LC737" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L738" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="738"></td>
        <td id="LC738" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: Babelon, _Manual of Oriental</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L739" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="739"></td>
        <td id="LC739" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Antiquities_; Botta, _Monument de Ninive_; Budge,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L740" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="740"></td>
        <td id="LC740" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Babylonian Life and History_; Duncker, _History of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L741" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="741"></td>
        <td id="LC741" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Antiquity_; Layard, _Nineveh and its Remains_; Layard,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L742" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="742"></td>
        <td id="LC742" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Discoveries Among Ruins of Nineveh and Babylon_; Lenormant,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L743" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="743"></td>
        <td id="LC743" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Manual of the Ancient History of the East_; Loftus,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L744" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="744"></td>
        <td id="LC744" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Travels in Chaldaea and Susiana_; Maspero, _Life in Ancient</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L745" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="745"></td>
        <td id="LC745" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Egypt and Assyria_; Perrot and Chipiez, _History of Art in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L746" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="746"></td>
        <td id="LC746" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Chaldaea and Assyria_; Place, _Ninive et l&#39;Assyrie_; Sayce,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L747" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="747"></td>
        <td id="LC747" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Assyria: Its Palaces, Priests, and People_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L748" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="748"></td>
        <td id="LC748" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L749" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="749"></td>
        <td id="LC749" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L750" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="750"></td>
        <td id="LC750" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">TIGRIS-EUPHRATES CIVILIZATION: In many respects the civilization along</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L751" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="751"></td>
        <td id="LC751" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Tigris-Euphrates was like that along the Nile. Both valleys were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L752" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="752"></td>
        <td id="LC752" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">settled by primitive peoples, who grew rapidly by virtue of favorable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L753" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="753"></td>
        <td id="LC753" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">climate and soil, and eventually developed into great nations headed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L754" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="754"></td>
        <td id="LC754" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by kings absolute in power. The king was the state in Egypt, and in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L755" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="755"></td>
        <td id="LC755" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Assyria the monarch was even more dominant and absolute. For the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L756" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="756"></td>
        <td id="LC756" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Pharaohs shared architecture, painting, and sculpture with the gods;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L757" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="757"></td>
        <td id="LC757" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but the Sargonids seem to have arrogated the most of these things to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L758" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="758"></td>
        <td id="LC758" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">themselves alone.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L759" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="759"></td>
        <td id="LC759" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L760" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="760"></td>
        <td id="LC760" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Religion was perhaps as real in Assyria as in Egypt, but it was less</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L761" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="761"></td>
        <td id="LC761" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">apparent in art. Certain genii, called gods or demons, appear in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L762" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="762"></td>
        <td id="LC762" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bas-reliefs, but it is not yet settled whether they represent gods or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L763" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="763"></td>
        <td id="LC763" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">merely legendary heroes or monsters of fable. There was no great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L764" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="764"></td>
        <td id="LC764" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">demonstration of religion by form and color, as in Egypt. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L765" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="765"></td>
        <td id="LC765" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Assyrians were Semites, and religion with them was more a matter of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L766" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="766"></td>
        <td id="LC766" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the spirit than the senses--an image in the mind rather than an image</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L767" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="767"></td>
        <td id="LC767" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in metal or stone. The temple was not eloquent with the actions and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L768" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="768"></td>
        <td id="LC768" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">deeds of the gods, and even the tomb, that fruitful source of art in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L769" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="769"></td>
        <td id="LC769" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Egypt, was in Chaldaea undecorated and in Assyria unknown. No one knows</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L770" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="770"></td>
        <td id="LC770" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">what the Assyrians did with their dead, unless they carried them back</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L771" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="771"></td>
        <td id="LC771" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to the fatherland of the race, the Persian Gulf region, as the native</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L772" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="772"></td>
        <td id="LC772" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">tribes of Mesopotamia do to this day.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L773" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="773"></td>
        <td id="LC773" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L774" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="774"></td>
        <td id="LC774" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ART MOTIVES: As in Egypt, there were two motives for art--illustration</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L775" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="775"></td>
        <td id="LC775" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and decoration. Religion, as we have seen, hardly obtained at all. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L776" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="776"></td>
        <td id="LC776" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">king attracted the greatest attention. The countless bas-reliefs, cut</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L777" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="777"></td>
        <td id="LC777" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">on soft stone slabs, were pages from the history of the monarch in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L778" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="778"></td>
        <td id="LC778" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">peace and war, in council, in the chase, or in processional rites.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L779" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="779"></td>
        <td id="LC779" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Beside him and around him his officers came in for a share of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L780" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="780"></td>
        <td id="LC780" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">background glory. Occasionally the common people had representations</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L781" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="781"></td>
        <td id="LC781" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of their lives and their pursuits, but the main subject of all the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L782" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="782"></td>
        <td id="LC782" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">valley art was the king and his doings. Sculpture and painting were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L783" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="783"></td>
        <td id="LC783" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">largely illustrations accompanying a history written in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L784" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="784"></td>
        <td id="LC784" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ever-present cuneiform characters.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L785" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="785"></td>
        <td id="LC785" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L786" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="786"></td>
        <td id="LC786" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 5.--ENAMELLED BRICK. NIMROUD. (FROM PERROT AND</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L787" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="787"></td>
        <td id="LC787" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHIPIEZ.)]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L788" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="788"></td>
        <td id="LC788" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L789" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="789"></td>
        <td id="LC789" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">But, while serving as history, like the picture-writings of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L790" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="790"></td>
        <td id="LC790" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Egyptians, this illustration was likewise decoration, and was designed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L791" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="791"></td>
        <td id="LC791" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with that end in view. Rows upon rows of partly colored bas-reliefs</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L792" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="792"></td>
        <td id="LC792" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were arranged like a dado along the palace-wall, and above them</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L793" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="793"></td>
        <td id="LC793" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">wall-paintings, or glazed tiles in patterns, carried out the color</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L794" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="794"></td>
        <td id="LC794" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">scheme. Almost all of the color has now disappeared, but it must have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L795" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="795"></td>
        <td id="LC795" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">been brilliant at one time, and was doubtless in harmony with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L796" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="796"></td>
        <td id="LC796" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">architecture. Both painting and sculpture were subordinate to and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L797" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="797"></td>
        <td id="LC797" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dependent upon architecture. Palace-building was the chief pursuit,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L798" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="798"></td>
        <td id="LC798" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and the other arts were called in mainly as adjuncts--ornamental</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L799" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="799"></td>
        <td id="LC799" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">records of the king who built.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L800" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="800"></td>
        <td id="LC800" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L801" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="801"></td>
        <td id="LC801" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 6.--ENAMELLED BRICK. KHORSABAD. (FROM PERROT AND</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L802" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="802"></td>
        <td id="LC802" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHIPIEZ.)]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L803" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="803"></td>
        <td id="LC803" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L804" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="804"></td>
        <td id="LC804" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE TYPE, FORM, COLOR: There were only two distinct faces in Assyrian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L805" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="805"></td>
        <td id="LC805" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art--one with and one without a beard. Neither of them was a portrait</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L806" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="806"></td>
        <td id="LC806" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">except as attributes or inscriptions designated. The type was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L807" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="807"></td>
        <td id="LC807" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unendingly repeated. Women appeared in only one or two isolated cases,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L808" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="808"></td>
        <td id="LC808" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and even these are doubtful. The warrior, a strong, coarse-membered,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L809" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="809"></td>
        <td id="LC809" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">heavily muscled creation, with a heavy, expressionless, Semitic face,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L810" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="810"></td>
        <td id="LC810" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">appeared everywhere. The figure was placed in profile, with eye and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L811" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="811"></td>
        <td id="LC811" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bust twisted to show the front view, and the long feet projected one</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L812" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="812"></td>
        <td id="LC812" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">beyond the other, as in the Nile pictures. This was the Assyrian ideal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L813" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="813"></td>
        <td id="LC813" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of strength, dignity, and majesty, established probably in the early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L814" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="814"></td>
        <td id="LC814" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ages, and repeated for centuries with few characteristic variations.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L815" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="815"></td>
        <td id="LC815" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The figure was usually given in motion, walking, or riding, and had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L816" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="816"></td>
        <td id="LC816" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">little of that grace seen in Egyptian painting, but in its place a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L817" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="817"></td>
        <td id="LC817" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great deal of rude strength. In modelling, the human form was not so</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L818" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="818"></td>
        <td id="LC818" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">knowingly rendered as the animal. The long Eastern clothing probably</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L819" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="819"></td>
        <td id="LC819" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">prevented the close study of the figure. This failure in anatomical</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L820" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="820"></td>
        <td id="LC820" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">exactness was balanced in part by minute details in the dress and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L821" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="821"></td>
        <td id="LC821" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">accessories, productive of a rich ornamental effect.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L822" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="822"></td>
        <td id="LC822" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L823" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="823"></td>
        <td id="LC823" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Hard stone was not found in the Mesopotamian regions. Temples were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L824" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="824"></td>
        <td id="LC824" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">built of burnt brick, bas-reliefs were made upon alabaster slabs and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L825" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="825"></td>
        <td id="LC825" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">heightened by coloring, and painting was largely upon tiles, with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L826" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="826"></td>
        <td id="LC826" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mineral paints, afterward glazed by fire. These glazed brick or tiles,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L827" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="827"></td>
        <td id="LC827" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with figured designs, were fixed upon the walls, arches, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L828" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="828"></td>
        <td id="LC828" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">archivolts by bitumen mortar, and made up the first mosaics of which</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L829" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="829"></td>
        <td id="LC829" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">we have record. There was a further painting upon plaster in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L830" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="830"></td>
        <td id="LC830" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">distemper, of which some few traces remain. It did not differ in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L831" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="831"></td>
        <td id="LC831" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">design from the bas-reliefs or the tile mosaics.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L832" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="832"></td>
        <td id="LC832" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L833" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="833"></td>
        <td id="LC833" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The subjects used were the Assyrian type, shown somewhat slighter in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L834" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="834"></td>
        <td id="LC834" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting than in sculpture, animals, birds, and other objects; but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L835" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="835"></td>
        <td id="LC835" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">they were obviously not attempts at nature. The color was arbitrary,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L836" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="836"></td>
        <td id="LC836" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not natural, and there was little perspective, light-and-shade, or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L837" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="837"></td>
        <td id="LC837" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">relief. Heavy outline bands of color appeared about the object, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L838" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="838"></td>
        <td id="LC838" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the prevailing hues were yellow and blue. There was perhaps less</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L839" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="839"></td>
        <td id="LC839" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">symbolism and more direct representation in Assyria than in Egypt.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L840" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="840"></td>
        <td id="LC840" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">There was also more feeling for perspective and space, as shown in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L841" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="841"></td>
        <td id="LC841" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">such objects as water and in the mountain landscapes of the late</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L842" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="842"></td>
        <td id="LC842" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bas-reliefs; but, in the main, there was no advance upon Egypt. There</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L843" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="843"></td>
        <td id="LC843" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was a difference which was not necessarily a development. Painting, as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L844" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="844"></td>
        <td id="LC844" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">we know the art to-day, was not practised in Chaldaea-Assyria. It was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L845" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="845"></td>
        <td id="LC845" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">never free from a servitude to architecture and sculpture; it was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L846" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="846"></td>
        <td id="LC846" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hampered by conventionalities; and the painter was more artisan than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L847" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="847"></td>
        <td id="LC847" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artist, having little freedom or individuality.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L848" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="848"></td>
        <td id="LC848" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L849" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="849"></td>
        <td id="LC849" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 7.--WILD ASS. BAS-RELIEF, BRITISH MUSEUM. (FROM</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L850" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="850"></td>
        <td id="LC850" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PERROT AND CHIPIEZ.)]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L851" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="851"></td>
        <td id="LC851" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L852" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="852"></td>
        <td id="LC852" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">HISTORIC PERIODS: Chaldaea, of unknown antiquity, with Babylon its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L853" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="853"></td>
        <td id="LC853" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">capital, is accounted the oldest nation in the Tigris-Euphrates</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L854" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="854"></td>
        <td id="LC854" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">valley, and, so far as is known, it was an original nation producing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L855" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="855"></td>
        <td id="LC855" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">an original art. Its sculpture (especially in the Tello heads), and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L856" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="856"></td>
        <td id="LC856" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">presumably its painting, were more realistic and individual than any</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L857" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="857"></td>
        <td id="LC857" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">other in the valley. Assyria coming later, and the heir of Chaldaea,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L858" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="858"></td>
        <td id="LC858" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L859" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="859"></td>
        <td id="LC859" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L860" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="860"></td>
        <td id="LC860" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Second Empire: There are two distinct periods of this Second Empire, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L861" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="861"></td>
        <td id="LC861" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">first lasting from 1,400 B.C., down to about 900 B.C., and in art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L862" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="862"></td>
        <td id="LC862" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">showing a great profusion of bas-reliefs. The second closed about 625</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L863" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="863"></td>
        <td id="LC863" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">B.C., and in art produced much glazed-tile work and a more elaborate</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L864" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="864"></td>
        <td id="LC864" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sculpture and painting. After this the Chaldaean provinces gained the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L865" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="865"></td>
        <td id="LC865" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ascendency again, and Babylon, under Nebuchadnezzar, became the first</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L866" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="866"></td>
        <td id="LC866" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">city of Asia. But the new Babylon did not last long. It fell before</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L867" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="867"></td>
        <td id="LC867" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cyrus and the Persians 536 B.C. Again, as in Egypt, the earliest art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L868" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="868"></td>
        <td id="LC868" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">appears the purest and the simplest, and the years of Chaldaeo-Assyrian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L869" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="869"></td>
        <td id="LC869" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">history known to us carry a record of change rather than of progress in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L870" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="870"></td>
        <td id="LC870" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L871" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="871"></td>
        <td id="LC871" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L872" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="872"></td>
        <td id="LC872" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     ART REMAINS: The most valuable collections of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L873" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="873"></td>
        <td id="LC873" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Chaldaeo-Assyrian art are to be found in the Louvre and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L874" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="874"></td>
        <td id="LC874" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     British Museum. The other large museums of Europe have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L875" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="875"></td>
        <td id="LC875" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     collections in this department, but all of them combined are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L876" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="876"></td>
        <td id="LC876" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     little compared with the treasures that still lie buried in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L877" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="877"></td>
        <td id="LC877" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     the mounds of the Tigris-Euphrates valley. Excavations have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L878" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="878"></td>
        <td id="LC878" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     been made at Mugheir, Warka, Khorsabad, Kouyunjik, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L879" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="879"></td>
        <td id="LC879" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     elsewhere, but many difficulties have thus far rendered</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L880" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="880"></td>
        <td id="LC880" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     systematic work impossible. The complete history of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L881" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="881"></td>
        <td id="LC881" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Chaldaeo-Assyria and its art has yet to be written.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L882" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="882"></td>
        <td id="LC882" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L883" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="883"></td>
        <td id="LC883" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L884" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="884"></td>
        <td id="LC884" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PERSIAN PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L885" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="885"></td>
        <td id="LC885" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L886" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="886"></td>
        <td id="LC886" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: As before cited, Babelon, Duncker,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L887" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="887"></td>
        <td id="LC887" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Lenormant, Ely; Dieulafoy, _L&#39;Art Antique de la Perse_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L888" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="888"></td>
        <td id="LC888" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Flandin et Coste, _Voyage en Perse_; Justi, _Geschichte des</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L889" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="889"></td>
        <td id="LC889" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     alten Persiens_; Perrot and Chipiez, _History of Art in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L890" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="890"></td>
        <td id="LC890" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Persia_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L891" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="891"></td>
        <td id="LC891" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L892" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="892"></td>
        <td id="LC892" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L893" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="893"></td>
        <td id="LC893" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">HISTORY AND ART MOTIVES: The Medes and Persians were the natural</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L894" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="894"></td>
        <td id="LC894" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">inheritors of Assyrian civilization, but they did not improve their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L895" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="895"></td>
        <td id="LC895" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">birthright. The Medes soon lost their power. Cyrus conquered them, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L896" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="896"></td>
        <td id="LC896" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">established the powerful Persian monarchy upheld for two hundred years</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L897" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="897"></td>
        <td id="LC897" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by Cambyses, Darius, and Xerxes. Substantially the same conditions</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L898" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="898"></td>
        <td id="LC898" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">surrounded the Persians as the Assyrians--that is, so far as art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L899" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="899"></td>
        <td id="LC899" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">production was concerned. Their conceptions of life were similar, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L900" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="900"></td>
        <td id="LC900" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">their use of art was for historic illustration of kingly doings and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L901" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="901"></td>
        <td id="LC901" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ornamental embellishment of kingly palaces. Both sculpture and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L902" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="902"></td>
        <td id="LC902" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting were accessories of architecture.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L903" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="903"></td>
        <td id="LC903" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L904" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="904"></td>
        <td id="LC904" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Of Median art nothing remains. The Persians left the record, but it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L905" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="905"></td>
        <td id="LC905" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was not wholly of their own invention, nor was it very extensive or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L906" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="906"></td>
        <td id="LC906" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brilliant. It had little originality about it, and was really only an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L907" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="907"></td>
        <td id="LC907" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">echo of Assyria. The sculptors and painters copied their Assyrian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L908" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="908"></td>
        <td id="LC908" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">predecessors, repeating at Persepolis what had been better told at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L909" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="909"></td>
        <td id="LC909" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Nineveh.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L910" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="910"></td>
        <td id="LC910" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L911" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="911"></td>
        <td id="LC911" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 8.--LIONS&#39; FRIEZE, SUSA. (FROM PERROT AND CHIPIEZ.)]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L912" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="912"></td>
        <td id="LC912" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L913" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="913"></td>
        <td id="LC913" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">TYPES AND TECHNIC: The same subjects, types, and technical methods in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L914" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="914"></td>
        <td id="LC914" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bas-relief, tile, and painting on plaster were followed under Darius</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L915" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="915"></td>
        <td id="LC915" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as under Shalmanezer. But the imitation was not so good as the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L916" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="916"></td>
        <td id="LC916" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">original. The warrior, the winged monsters, the animals all lost</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L917" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="917"></td>
        <td id="LC917" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">something of their air of brutal defiance and their strength of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L918" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="918"></td>
        <td id="LC918" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">modelling. Heroes still walked in procession along the bas-reliefs and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L919" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="919"></td>
        <td id="LC919" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">glazed tiles, but the figure was smaller, more effeminate, the hair</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L920" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="920"></td>
        <td id="LC920" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and beard were not so long, the drapery fell in slightly indicated</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L921" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="921"></td>
        <td id="LC921" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">folds at times, and there was a profusion of ornamental detail. Some</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L922" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="922"></td>
        <td id="LC922" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of this detail and some modifications in the figure showed the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L923" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="923"></td>
        <td id="LC923" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence of foreign nations other than the Greek; but, in the main,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L924" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="924"></td>
        <td id="LC924" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Persian art followed in the footsteps of Assyrian art. It was the last</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L925" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="925"></td>
        <td id="LC925" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reflection of Mesopotamian splendor. For with the conquest of Persia</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L926" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="926"></td>
        <td id="LC926" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by Alexander the book of expressive art in that valley was closed,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L927" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="927"></td>
        <td id="LC927" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and, under Islam, it remains closed to this day.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L928" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="928"></td>
        <td id="LC928" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L929" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="929"></td>
        <td id="LC929" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     ART REMAINS: Persian painting is something about which</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L930" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="930"></td>
        <td id="LC930" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     little is known because little remains. The Louvre contains</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L931" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="931"></td>
        <td id="LC931" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     some reconstructed friezes made in mosaics of stamped brick</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L932" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="932"></td>
        <td id="LC932" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     and square tile, showing figures of lions and a number of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L933" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="933"></td>
        <td id="LC933" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     archers. The coloring is particularly rich, and may give</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L934" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="934"></td>
        <td id="LC934" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     some idea of Persian pigments. Aside from the chief museums</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L935" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="935"></td>
        <td id="LC935" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     of Europe the bulk of Persian art is still seen half-buried</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L936" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="936"></td>
        <td id="LC936" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     in the ruins of Persepolis and elsewhere.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L937" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="937"></td>
        <td id="LC937" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L938" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="938"></td>
        <td id="LC938" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L939" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="939"></td>
        <td id="LC939" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PHOENICIAN, CYPRIOTE, AND ASIA MINOR PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L940" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="940"></td>
        <td id="LC940" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L941" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="941"></td>
        <td id="LC941" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: As before cited, Babelon, Duncker, Ely,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L942" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="942"></td>
        <td id="LC942" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Girard, Lenormant; Cesnola, _Cyprus_; Cesnola, _Cypriote</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L943" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="943"></td>
        <td id="LC943" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Antiquities in Metropolitan Museum of Art_; Kenrick,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L944" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="944"></td>
        <td id="LC944" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Phoenicia_; Movers, _Die Phonizier_; Perrot and Chipiez,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L945" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="945"></td>
        <td id="LC945" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _History of Art in Phoenicia and Cyprus_; Perrot and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L946" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="946"></td>
        <td id="LC946" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Chipiez, _History of Art in Sardinia, Judea, Syria and Asia</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L947" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="947"></td>
        <td id="LC947" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Minor_; Perrot and Chipiez, _History of Art in Phrygia,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L948" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="948"></td>
        <td id="LC948" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Lydia, etc._; Renan, _Mission de Phenicie_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L949" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="949"></td>
        <td id="LC949" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L950" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="950"></td>
        <td id="LC950" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L951" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="951"></td>
        <td id="LC951" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE TRADING NATIONS: The coast-lying nations of the Eastern</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L952" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="952"></td>
        <td id="LC952" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Mediterranean were hardly original or creative nations in a large</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L953" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="953"></td>
        <td id="LC953" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sense. They were at different times the conquered dependencies of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L954" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="954"></td>
        <td id="LC954" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Egypt, Assyria, Persia, Greece, and their lands were but bridges over</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L955" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="955"></td>
        <td id="LC955" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">which armies passed from east to west or from west to east. Located on</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L956" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="956"></td>
        <td id="LC956" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Mediterranean between the great civilizations of antiquity they</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L957" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="957"></td>
        <td id="LC957" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">naturally adapted themselves to circumstances, and became the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L958" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="958"></td>
        <td id="LC958" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">middlemen, the brokers, traders, and carriers of the ancient world.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L959" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="959"></td>
        <td id="LC959" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Their lands were not favorable to agriculture, but their sea-coasts</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L960" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="960"></td>
        <td id="LC960" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rendered commerce easy and lucrative. They made a kingdom of the sea,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L961" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="961"></td>
        <td id="LC961" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and their means of livelihood were gathered from it. There is no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L962" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="962"></td>
        <td id="LC962" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">record that the Egyptians ever traversed the Mediterranean, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L963" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="963"></td>
        <td id="LC963" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Assyrians were not sailors, the Greeks had not yet arisen, and so</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L964" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="964"></td>
        <td id="LC964" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">probably Phoenicia and her neighbors had matters their own way.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L965" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="965"></td>
        <td id="LC965" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Colonies and trading stations were established at Cyprus, Carthage,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L966" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="966"></td>
        <td id="LC966" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sardinia, the Greek islands, and the Greek mainland, and not only</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L967" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="967"></td>
        <td id="LC967" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Eastern goods but Eastern ideas were thus carried to the West.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L968" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="968"></td>
        <td id="LC968" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L969" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="969"></td>
        <td id="LC969" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 9.--PAINTED HEAD FROM EDESSA. (FROM PERROT AND</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L970" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="970"></td>
        <td id="LC970" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHIPIEZ.)]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L971" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="971"></td>
        <td id="LC971" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L972" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="972"></td>
        <td id="LC972" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Politically, socially, and religiously these small middle nations were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L973" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="973"></td>
        <td id="LC973" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">inconsequential. They simply adapted their politics or faith to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L974" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="974"></td>
        <td id="LC974" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nation that for the time had them under its heel. What semi-original</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L975" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="975"></td>
        <td id="LC975" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">religion they possessed was an amalgamation of the religions of other</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L976" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="976"></td>
        <td id="LC976" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nations, and their gods of bronze, terra-cotta, and enamel were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L977" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="977"></td>
        <td id="LC977" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">irreverently sold in the market like any other produce.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L978" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="978"></td>
        <td id="LC978" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L979" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="979"></td>
        <td id="LC979" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ART MOTIVES AND METHODS: Building, carving, and painting were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L980" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="980"></td>
        <td id="LC980" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">practised among the coastwise nations, but upon no such extensive</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L981" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="981"></td>
        <td id="LC981" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">scale as in either Egypt or Assyria. The mere fact that they were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L982" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="982"></td>
        <td id="LC982" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">people of the sea rather than of the land precluded extensive or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L983" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="983"></td>
        <td id="LC983" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">concentrated development. Politically Phoenicia was divided among</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L984" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="984"></td>
        <td id="LC984" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">five cities, and her artistic strength was distributed in a similar</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L985" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="985"></td>
        <td id="LC985" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">manner. Such art as was produced showed the religious and decorative</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L986" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="986"></td>
        <td id="LC986" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">motives, and in its spiritless materialistic make-up, the commercial</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L987" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="987"></td>
        <td id="LC987" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">motive. It was at the best a hybrid, mongrel art, borrowed from many</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L988" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="988"></td>
        <td id="LC988" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sources and distributed to many points of the compass. At one time it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L989" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="989"></td>
        <td id="LC989" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had a strong Assyrian cast, at another an Egyptian cast, and after</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L990" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="990"></td>
        <td id="LC990" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Greece arose it accepted a retroactive influence from there.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L991" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="991"></td>
        <td id="LC991" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L992" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="992"></td>
        <td id="LC992" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">It is impossible to characterize the Phoenician type, and even the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L993" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="993"></td>
        <td id="LC993" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cypriote type, though more pronounced, varies so with the different</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L994" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="994"></td>
        <td id="LC994" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influences that it has no very striking individuality. Technically</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L995" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="995"></td>
        <td id="LC995" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">both the Phoenician and Cypriote were fair workmen in bronze and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L996" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="996"></td>
        <td id="LC996" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">stone, and doubtless taught many technical methods to the early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L997" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="997"></td>
        <td id="LC997" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Greeks, besides making known to them those deities afterward adopted</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L998" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="998"></td>
        <td id="LC998" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">under the names of Aphrodite, Adonis, and Heracles, and familiarizing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L999" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="999"></td>
        <td id="LC999" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">them with the art forms of Egypt and Assyria.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1000" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1000"></td>
        <td id="LC1000" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1001" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1001"></td>
        <td id="LC1001" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 10.--CYPRIOTE VASE DECORATION. (FROM PERROT AND</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1002" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1002"></td>
        <td id="LC1002" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHIPIEZ.)]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1003" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1003"></td>
        <td id="LC1003" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1004" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1004"></td>
        <td id="LC1004" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">As for painting, there was undoubtedly figured decoration upon walls</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1005" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1005"></td>
        <td id="LC1005" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of stone and plaster, but there is not enough left to us from all the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1006" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1006"></td>
        <td id="LC1006" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">small nations like Phoenicia, Judea, Cyprus, and the kingdoms of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1007" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1007"></td>
        <td id="LC1007" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Asia Minor, put together, to patch up a disjointed history. The first</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1008" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1008"></td>
        <td id="LC1008" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lands to meet the spoiler, their very ruins have perished. All that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1009" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1009"></td>
        <td id="LC1009" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">there is of painting comes to us in broken potteries and color traces</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1010" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1010"></td>
        <td id="LC1010" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">on statuary. The remains of sculpture and architecture are of course</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1011" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1011"></td>
        <td id="LC1011" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">better preserved. None of this intermediate art holds much rank by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1012" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1012"></td>
        <td id="LC1012" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">virtue of its inherent worth. It is its influence upon the West--the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1013" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1013"></td>
        <td id="LC1013" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ideas, subjects, and methods it imparted to the Greeks--that gives it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1014" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1014"></td>
        <td id="LC1014" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">importance in art history.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1015" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1015"></td>
        <td id="LC1015" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1016" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1016"></td>
        <td id="LC1016" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     ART REMAINS: In painting chiefly the vases in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1017" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1017"></td>
        <td id="LC1017" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Metropolitan Museum, New York, the Louvre, British and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1018" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1018"></td>
        <td id="LC1018" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Berlin Museums. These give a poor and incomplete idea of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1019" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1019"></td>
        <td id="LC1019" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     painting in Asia Minor, Phoenicia and her colonies. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1020" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1020"></td>
        <td id="LC1020" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     terra-cottas, figurines in bronze, and sculptures can be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1021" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1021"></td>
        <td id="LC1021" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     studied to more advantage. The best collection of Cypriote</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1022" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1022"></td>
        <td id="LC1022" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     antiquities is in the Metropolitan Museum, New York. A new</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1023" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1023"></td>
        <td id="LC1023" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     collection of Judaic art has been recently opened in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1024" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1024"></td>
        <td id="LC1024" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Louvre.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1025" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1025"></td>
        <td id="LC1025" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1026" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1026"></td>
        <td id="LC1026" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1027" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1027"></td>
        <td id="LC1027" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1028" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1028"></td>
        <td id="LC1028" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1029" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1029"></td>
        <td id="LC1029" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHAPTER III.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1030" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1030"></td>
        <td id="LC1030" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1031" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1031"></td>
        <td id="LC1031" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">GREEK PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1032" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1032"></td>
        <td id="LC1032" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1033" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1033"></td>
        <td id="LC1033" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: Baumeister, _Denkmaeler des klassischen</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1034" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1034"></td>
        <td id="LC1034" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Altertums_--article &quot;_Malerei_;&quot; Birch, _History of Ancient</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1035" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1035"></td>
        <td id="LC1035" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Pottery_; Brunn, _Geschichte der griechischen Kuenstler_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1036" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1036"></td>
        <td id="LC1036" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Collignon, _Mythologie figuree de la Grece_; Collignon,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1037" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1037"></td>
        <td id="LC1037" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Manuel d&#39;Archaeologie Grecque_; Cros et Henry,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1038" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1038"></td>
        <td id="LC1038" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _L&#39;Encaustique et les autres procedes de Peinture chez les</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1039" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1039"></td>
        <td id="LC1039" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Anciens_; Girard, _La Peinture Antique_; Murray, _Handbook</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1040" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1040"></td>
        <td id="LC1040" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     of Greek Archaeology_; Overbeck, _Antiken Schriftquellen zur</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1041" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1041"></td>
        <td id="LC1041" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     geschichte der bildenen Kunste bie den Griechen_; Perrot and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1042" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1042"></td>
        <td id="LC1042" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Chipiez, _History of Art in Greece_; Woerman, _Die</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1043" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1043"></td>
        <td id="LC1043" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Landschaft in der Kunst der antiken Volker_; _see also books</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1044" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1044"></td>
        <td id="LC1044" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     on Etruscan and Roman painting_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1045" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1045"></td>
        <td id="LC1045" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1046" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1046"></td>
        <td id="LC1046" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1047" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1047"></td>
        <td id="LC1047" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">GREECE AND THE GREEKS: The origin of the Greek race is not positively</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1048" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1048"></td>
        <td id="LC1048" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">known. It is reasonably supposed that the early settlers in Greece</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1049" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1049"></td>
        <td id="LC1049" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">came from the region of Asia Minor, either across the Hellespont or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1050" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1050"></td>
        <td id="LC1050" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the sea, and populated the Greek islands and the mainland. When this</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1051" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1051"></td>
        <td id="LC1051" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was done has been matter of much conjecture. The early history is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1052" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1052"></td>
        <td id="LC1052" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lost, but art remains show that in the period before Homer the Greeks</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1053" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1053"></td>
        <td id="LC1053" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were an established race with habits and customs distinctly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1054" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1054"></td>
        <td id="LC1054" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">individual. Egyptian and Asiatic influences are apparent in their art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1055" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1055"></td>
        <td id="LC1055" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at this early time, but there is, nevertheless, the mark of a race</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1056" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1056"></td>
        <td id="LC1056" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">peculiarly apart from all the races of the older world.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1057" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1057"></td>
        <td id="LC1057" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1058" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1058"></td>
        <td id="LC1058" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The development of the Greek people was probably helped by favorable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1059" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1059"></td>
        <td id="LC1059" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">climate and soil, by commerce and conquest, by republican institutions</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1060" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1060"></td>
        <td id="LC1060" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and political faith, by freedom of mind and of body; but all these</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1061" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1061"></td>
        <td id="LC1061" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">together are not sufficient to account for the keenness of intellect,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1062" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1062"></td>
        <td id="LC1062" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the purity of taste, and the skill in accomplishment which showed in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1063" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1063"></td>
        <td id="LC1063" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">every branch of Greek life. The cause lies deeper in the fundamental</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1064" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1064"></td>
        <td id="LC1064" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">make-up of the Greek mind, and its eternal aspiration toward mental,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1065" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1065"></td>
        <td id="LC1065" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">moral, and physical ideals. Perfect mind, perfect body, perfect</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1066" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1066"></td>
        <td id="LC1066" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">conduct in this world were sought-for ideals. The Greeks aspired to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1067" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1067"></td>
        <td id="LC1067" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">completeness. The course of education and race development trained</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1068" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1068"></td>
        <td id="LC1068" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">them physically as athletes and warriors, mentally as philosophers,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1069" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1069"></td>
        <td id="LC1069" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">law-makers, poets, artists, morally as heroes whose lives and actions</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1070" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1070"></td>
        <td id="LC1070" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">emulated those of the gods, and were almost perfect for this world.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1071" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1071"></td>
        <td id="LC1071" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1072" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1072"></td>
        <td id="LC1072" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ART MOTIVES: Neither the monarchy nor the priesthood commanded the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1073" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1073"></td>
        <td id="LC1073" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">services of the artist in Greece, as in Assyria and Egypt. There was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1074" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1074"></td>
