        <td id="LC1402" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition was rather rambling and disjointed, and the color harsh.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1403" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1403"></td>
        <td id="LC1403" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In light-and-shade and relief they probably followed the Greek</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1404" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1404"></td>
        <td id="LC1404" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">example.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1405" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1405"></td>
        <td id="LC1405" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1406" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1406"></td>
        <td id="LC1406" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 16.--PORTRAIT-HEAD. (FROM FAYOUM, GRAF COL.)]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1407" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1407"></td>
        <td id="LC1407" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1408" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1408"></td>
        <td id="LC1408" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ROMAN PAINTERS: During the first five centuries Rome was between the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1409" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1409"></td>
        <td id="LC1409" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influences of Etruria and Greece. The first paintings in Rome of which</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1410" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1410"></td>
        <td id="LC1410" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">there is record were done in the Temple of Ceres by the Greek artists</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1411" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1411"></td>
        <td id="LC1411" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of Lower Italy, Gorgasos and Damophilos (fl. 493 B.C.). They were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1412" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1412"></td>
        <td id="LC1412" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">doubtless somewhat like the vase paintings--profile work, without</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1413" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1413"></td>
        <td id="LC1413" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light, shade, or perspective. At the time and after Alexander Greek</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1414" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1414"></td>
        <td id="LC1414" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence held sway. Fabius Pictor (fl. about 300 B.C.) is one of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1415" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1415"></td>
        <td id="LC1415" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">celebrated names in historical painting, and later on Pacuvius,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1416" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1416"></td>
        <td id="LC1416" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Metrodorus, and Serapion are mentioned. In the last century of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1417" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1417"></td>
        <td id="LC1417" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Republic, Sopolis, Dionysius, and Antiochus Gabinius excelled in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1418" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1418"></td>
        <td id="LC1418" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portraiture. Ancient painting really ends for us with the destruction</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1419" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1419"></td>
        <td id="LC1419" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of Pompeii (79 A.D.), though after that there were interesting</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1420" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1420"></td>
        <td id="LC1420" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portraits produced, especially those found in the Fayoum (Egypt).[1]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1421" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1421"></td>
        <td id="LC1421" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1422" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1422"></td>
        <td id="LC1422" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 1: See Scribner&#39;s Magazine, vol. v., p. 219, New Series.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1423" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1423"></td>
        <td id="LC1423" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1424" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1424"></td>
        <td id="LC1424" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     EXTANT REMAINS: The frescos that are left to us to-day are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1425" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1425"></td>
        <td id="LC1425" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     largely the work of mechanical decorators rather than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1426" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1426"></td>
        <td id="LC1426" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     creative artists. They are to be seen in Rome, in the Baths</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1427" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1427"></td>
        <td id="LC1427" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     of Titus, the Vatican, Livia&#39;s Villa, Farnesina,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1428" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1428"></td>
        <td id="LC1428" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Rospigliosi, and Barberini Palaces, Baths of Caracalla,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1429" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1429"></td>
        <td id="LC1429" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Capitoline and Lateran Museums, in the houses of excavated</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1430" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1430"></td>
        <td id="LC1430" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Pompeii, and the Naples Museum. Besides these there are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1431" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1431"></td>
        <td id="LC1431" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     examples of Roman fresco and distemper in the Louvre and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1432" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1432"></td>
        <td id="LC1432" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     other European Museums. Examples of Etruscan painting are to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1433" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1433"></td>
        <td id="LC1433" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     be seen in the Vatican, Cortona, the Louvre, the British</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1434" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1434"></td>
        <td id="LC1434" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Museum and elsewhere.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1435" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1435"></td>
        <td id="LC1435" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1436" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1436"></td>
        <td id="LC1436" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1437" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1437"></td>
        <td id="LC1437" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1438" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1438"></td>
        <td id="LC1438" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1439" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1439"></td>
        <td id="LC1439" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHAPTER IV.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1440" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1440"></td>
        <td id="LC1440" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1441" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1441"></td>
        <td id="LC1441" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ITALIAN PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1442" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1442"></td>
        <td id="LC1442" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1443" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1443"></td>
        <td id="LC1443" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">EARLY CHRISTIAN AND MEDIAEVAL PERIOD. 200-1250.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1444" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1444"></td>
        <td id="LC1444" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1445" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1445"></td>
        <td id="LC1445" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: Bayet, _L&#39;Art Byzantin_; Bennett,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1446" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1446"></td>
        <td id="LC1446" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Christian Archaeology_; Bosio, _La Roma Sotterranea_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1447" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1447"></td>
        <td id="LC1447" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Burckhardt, _The Cicerone, an Art Guide to Painting in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1448" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1448"></td>
        <td id="LC1448" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Italy, ed. by Crowe_; Crowe and Cavalcaselle, _New History</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1449" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1449"></td>
        <td id="LC1449" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     of Painting in Italy_; De Rossi, _La Roma Sotterranea</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1450" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1450"></td>
        <td id="LC1450" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Cristiana_; De Rossi, _Bullettino di Archeologia Cristiana_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1451" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1451"></td>
        <td id="LC1451" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Didron, _Christian Iconography_; Eastlake (Kuegler&#39;s),</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1452" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1452"></td>
        <td id="LC1452" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Handbook of Painting--The Italian Schools_; Garrucci,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1453" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1453"></td>
        <td id="LC1453" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Storia dell&#39; Arte Cristiana_; Gerspach, _La Mosaique_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1454" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1454"></td>
        <td id="LC1454" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Lafenestre, _La Peinture Italienne_; Lanzi, _History of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1455" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1455"></td>
        <td id="LC1455" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Painting in Italy_; Lecoy de la Marche, _Les Manuscrits et</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1456" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1456"></td>
        <td id="LC1456" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     la Miniature_; Lindsay, _Sketches of the History of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1457" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1457"></td>
        <td id="LC1457" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Christian Art_; Martigny, _Dictionnaire des Antiques</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1458" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1458"></td>
        <td id="LC1458" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Chretiennes_; Perate, _L&#39;Archeologie Chretienne_; Reber,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1459" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1459"></td>
        <td id="LC1459" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _History of Mediaeval Art_; Rio, _Poetry of Christian Art_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1460" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1460"></td>
        <td id="LC1460" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Lethaby, _Medieval Art_; Smith and Cheetham, _Dictionary of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1461" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1461"></td>
        <td id="LC1461" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Christian Antiquities_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1462" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1462"></td>
        <td id="LC1462" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1463" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1463"></td>
        <td id="LC1463" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1464" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1464"></td>
        <td id="LC1464" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">RISE OF CHRISTIANITY: Out of the decaying civilization of Rome sprang</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1465" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1465"></td>
        <td id="LC1465" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">into life that remarkable growth known as Christianity. It was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1466" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1466"></td>
        <td id="LC1466" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">welcomed by the Romans. It was scoffed at, scourged, persecuted, and,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1467" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1467"></td>
        <td id="LC1467" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at one time, nearly exterminated. But its vitality was stronger than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1468" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1468"></td>
        <td id="LC1468" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that of its persecutor, and when Rome declined, Christianity utilized</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1469" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1469"></td>
        <td id="LC1469" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the things that were Roman, while striving to live for ideas that were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1470" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1470"></td>
        <td id="LC1470" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Christian.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1471" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1471"></td>
        <td id="LC1471" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1472" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1472"></td>
        <td id="LC1472" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 17.--CHAMBER IN CATACOMBS, SHOWING WALL</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1473" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1473"></td>
        <td id="LC1473" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">DECORATION.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1474" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1474"></td>
        <td id="LC1474" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1475" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1475"></td>
        <td id="LC1475" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">There was no revolt, no sudden change. The Christian idea made haste</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1476" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1476"></td>
        <td id="LC1476" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">slowly, and at the start it was weighed down with many paganisms. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1477" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1477"></td>
        <td id="LC1477" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Christians themselves in all save religious faith, were Romans, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1478" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1478"></td>
        <td id="LC1478" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">inherited Roman tastes, manners, and methods. But the Roman world,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1479" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1479"></td>
        <td id="LC1479" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with all its classicism and learning, was dying. The decline socially</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1480" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1480"></td>
        <td id="LC1480" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and intellectually was with the Christians as well as the Romans.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1481" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1481"></td>
        <td id="LC1481" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">There was good reason for it. The times were out of joint, and almost</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1482" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1482"></td>
        <td id="LC1482" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">everything was disorganized, worn out, decadent. The military life of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1483" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1483"></td>
        <td id="LC1483" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Empire had begun to give way to the monastic and feudal life of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1484" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1484"></td>
        <td id="LC1484" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Church. Quarrels and wars between the powers kept life at fever</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1485" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1485"></td>
        <td id="LC1485" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">heat. In the fifth century came the inpouring of the Goths and Huns,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1486" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1486"></td>
        <td id="LC1486" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and with them the sacking and plunder of the land. Misery and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1487" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1487"></td>
        <td id="LC1487" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">squalor, with intellectual blackness, succeeded. Art, science,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1488" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1488"></td>
        <td id="LC1488" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">literature, and learning degenerated to mere shadows of their former</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1489" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1489"></td>
        <td id="LC1489" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">selves, and a semi-barbarism reigned for five centuries. During all</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1490" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1490"></td>
        <td id="LC1490" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this dark period Christian painting struggled on in a feeble way,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1491" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1491"></td>
        <td id="LC1491" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seeking to express itself. It started Roman in form, method, and even,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1492" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1492"></td>
        <td id="LC1492" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at times, in subject; it ended Christian, but not without a long</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1493" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1493"></td>
        <td id="LC1493" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">period of gradual transition, during which it was influenced from many</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1494" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1494"></td>
        <td id="LC1494" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sources and underwent many changes.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1495" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1495"></td>
        <td id="LC1495" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1496" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1496"></td>
        <td id="LC1496" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ART MOTIVES: As in the ancient world, there were two principal motives</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1497" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1497"></td>
        <td id="LC1497" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for painting in early Christian times--religion and decoration.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1498" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1498"></td>
        <td id="LC1498" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Religion was the chief motive, but Christianity was a very different</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1499" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1499"></td>
        <td id="LC1499" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">religion from that of the Greeks and Romans. The Hellenistic faith was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1500" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1500"></td>
        <td id="LC1500" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a worship of nature, a glorification of humanity, an exaltation of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1501" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1501"></td>
        <td id="LC1501" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">physical and moral perfections. It dealt with the material and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1502" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1502"></td>
        <td id="LC1502" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">tangible, and Greek art appealed directly to the sensuous and earthly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1503" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1503"></td>
        <td id="LC1503" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature of mankind. The Hebraic faith or Christianity was just the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1504" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1504"></td>
        <td id="LC1504" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">opposite of this. It decried the human, the flesh, and the worldly. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1505" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1505"></td>
        <td id="LC1505" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">would have nothing to do with the beauty of this earth. Its hopes were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1506" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1506"></td>
        <td id="LC1506" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">centred upon the life hereafter. The teaching of Christ was the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1507" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1507"></td>
        <td id="LC1507" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">humility and the abasement of the human in favor of the spiritual and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1508" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1508"></td>
        <td id="LC1508" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the divine. Where Hellenism appealed to the senses, Hebraism appealed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1509" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1509"></td>
        <td id="LC1509" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to the spirit. In art the fine athletic figure, or, for that matter,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1510" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1510"></td>
        <td id="LC1510" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">any figure, was an abomination. The early Church fathers opposed it.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1511" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1511"></td>
        <td id="LC1511" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">It was forbidden by the Mosaic decalogue and savored of idolatry.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1512" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1512"></td>
        <td id="LC1512" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1513" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1513"></td>
        <td id="LC1513" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">But what should take its place in art? How could the new Christian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1514" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1514"></td>
        <td id="LC1514" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ideas be expressed without form? Symbolism came in, but it was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1515" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1515"></td>
        <td id="LC1515" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">insufficient. A party in the Church rose up in favor of more direct</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1516" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1516"></td>
        <td id="LC1516" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">representation. Art should be used as an engine of the Church to teach</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1517" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1517"></td>
        <td id="LC1517" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Bible to those who could not read. This argument held good, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1518" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1518"></td>
        <td id="LC1518" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">notwithstanding the opposition of the Iconoclastic party painting grew</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1519" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1519"></td>
        <td id="LC1519" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in favor. It lent itself to teaching and came under ecclesiastical</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1520" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1520"></td>
        <td id="LC1520" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">domination. As it left the nature of the classic world and loosened</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1521" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1521"></td>
        <td id="LC1521" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">its grasp on things tangible it became feeble and decrepit in its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1522" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1522"></td>
        <td id="LC1522" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form. While it grew in sentiment and religious fervor it lost in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1523" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1523"></td>
        <td id="LC1523" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bodily vigor and technical ability.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1524" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1524"></td>
        <td id="LC1524" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1525" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1525"></td>
        <td id="LC1525" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 18.--CATACOMB FRESCO. CRYPT OF S. CECILIA. THIRD</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1526" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1526"></td>
        <td id="LC1526" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CENTURY.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1527" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1527"></td>
        <td id="LC1527" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1528" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1528"></td>
        <td id="LC1528" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">For many centuries the religious motive held strong, and art was the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1529" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1529"></td>
        <td id="LC1529" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">servant of the Church. It taught the Bible truths, but it also</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1530" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1530"></td>
        <td id="LC1530" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">embellished and adorned the interiors of the churches. All the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1531" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1531"></td>
        <td id="LC1531" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">frescos, mosaics, and altar-pieces had a decorative motive in their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1532" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1532"></td>
        <td id="LC1532" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">coloring and setting. The church building was a house of refuge for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1533" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1533"></td>
        <td id="LC1533" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the oppressed, and it was made attractive not only in its lines and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1534" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1534"></td>
        <td id="LC1534" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">proportions but in its ornamentation. Hence the two motives of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1535" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1535"></td>
        <td id="LC1535" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early work--religious teaching and decoration.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1536" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1536"></td>
        <td id="LC1536" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1537" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1537"></td>
        <td id="LC1537" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SUBJECTS AND TECHNICAL METHODS: There was no distinct Judaic or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1538" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1538"></td>
        <td id="LC1538" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Christian type used in the very early art. The painters took their</td>

      <tr>

      <tr>
        <td id="L1542" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1542"></td>

      </tr>

        <td id="L1544" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1544"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L1545" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1545"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L1548" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1548"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L1549" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1549"></td>

        <td id="L1552" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1552"></td>

        <td id="L1553" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1553"></td>

        <td id="L1558" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1558"></td>

        <td id="L1594" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1594"></td>

      </tr>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1598" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1598"></td>
        <td id="LC1598" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting similar to the Roman work, and had no Christian significance</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1599" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1599"></td>
        <td id="LC1599" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though in a Christian place. Not long after, however, the desire to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1600" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1600"></td>
        <td id="LC1600" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">express something of the faith began to show itself in a symbolic way.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1601" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1601"></td>
        <td id="LC1601" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The cups and the vases became marked with the fish, because the Greek</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1602" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1602"></td>
        <td id="LC1602" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spelling of the word &quot;icthus&quot; gave the initials of the Christian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1603" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1603"></td>
        <td id="LC1603" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">confession of faith. The paintings of the shepherd bearing a sheep</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1604" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1604"></td>
        <td id="LC1604" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">symbolized Christ and his flock; the anchor meant the Christian hope;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1605" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1605"></td>
        <td id="LC1605" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the phoenix immortality; the ship the Church; the cock watchfulness,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1606" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1606"></td>
        <td id="LC1606" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and so on. And at this time the decorations began to have a double</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1607" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1607"></td>
        <td id="LC1607" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">meaning. The vine came to represent the &quot;I am the vine&quot; and the birds</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1608" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1608"></td>
        <td id="LC1608" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">grew longer wings and became doves, symbolizing pure Christian souls.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1609" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1609"></td>
        <td id="LC1609" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1610" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1610"></td>
        <td id="LC1610" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">It has been said this form of art came about through fear of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1611" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1611"></td>
        <td id="LC1611" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">persecution, that the Christians hid their ideas in symbols because</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1612" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1612"></td>
        <td id="LC1612" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">open representation would be followed by violence and desecration.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1613" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1613"></td>
        <td id="LC1613" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Such was hardly the case. The emperors persecuted the living, but the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1614" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1614"></td>
        <td id="LC1614" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dead and their sepulchres were exempt from sacrilege by Roman law.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1615" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1615"></td>
        <td id="LC1615" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">They probably used the symbol because they feared the Roman figure and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1616" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1616"></td>
        <td id="LC1616" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">knew no other form to take its place. But symbolism did not supply the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1617" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1617"></td>
        <td id="LC1617" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">popular need; it was impossible to originate an entirely new figure;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1618" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1618"></td>
        <td id="LC1618" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">so the painters went back and borrowed the old Roman form. Christ</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1619" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1619"></td>
        <td id="LC1619" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">appeared as a beardless youth in Phrygian costume, the Virgin Mary was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1620" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1620"></td>
        <td id="LC1620" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a Roman matron, and the Apostles looked like Roman senators wearing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1621" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1621"></td>
        <td id="LC1621" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the toga.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1622" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1622"></td>
        <td id="LC1622" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1623" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1623"></td>
        <td id="LC1623" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Classic story was also borrowed to illustrate Bible truth. Hermes</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1624" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1624"></td>
        <td id="LC1624" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">carrying the sheep was the Good Shepherd, Psyche discovering Cupid was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1625" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1625"></td>
        <td id="LC1625" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the curiosity of Eve, Ulysses closing his ears to the Sirens was the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1626" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1626"></td>
        <td id="LC1626" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Christian resisting the tempter. The pagan Orpheus charming the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1627" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1627"></td>
        <td id="LC1627" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">animals of the wood was finally adopted as a symbol, or perhaps an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1628" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1628"></td>
        <td id="LC1628" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ideal likeness of Christ. Then followed more direct representation in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1629" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1629"></td>
        <td id="LC1629" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classic form and manner, the Old Testament prefiguring and emphasizing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1630" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1630"></td>
        <td id="LC1630" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the New. Jonah appeared cast into the sea and cast by the whale on dry</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1631" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1631"></td>
        <td id="LC1631" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">land again as a symbol of the New Testament resurrection, and also as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1632" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1632"></td>
        <td id="LC1632" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a representation of the actual occurrence. Moses striking the rock</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1633" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1633"></td>
        <td id="LC1633" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">symbolized life eternal, and David slaying Goliath was Christ</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1634" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1634"></td>
        <td id="LC1634" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">victorious.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1635" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1635"></td>
        <td id="LC1635" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1636" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1636"></td>
        <td id="LC1636" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 20.--CHRIST AND SAINTS. FRESCO. S. GENEROSA,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1637" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1637"></td>
        <td id="LC1637" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SEVENTH CENTURY (?).]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1638" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1638"></td>
        <td id="LC1638" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1639" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1639"></td>
        <td id="LC1639" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The chronology of the Catacombs painting is very much mixed, but it is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1640" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1640"></td>
        <td id="LC1640" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">quite certain there was degeneracy from the start. The cause was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1641" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1641"></td>
        <td id="LC1641" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">neglect of form, neglect of art as art, mechanical copying instead of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1642" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1642"></td>
        <td id="LC1642" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature study, and finally, the predominance of the religious idea over</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1643" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1643"></td>
        <td id="LC1643" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the forms of nature. With Constantine Christianity was recognized as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1644" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1644"></td>
        <td id="LC1644" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the national religion. Christian art came out of the Catacombs and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1645" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1645"></td>
        <td id="LC1645" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">began to show itself in illuminations, mosaics, and church</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1646" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1646"></td>
        <td id="LC1646" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decorations. Notwithstanding it was now free from restraint it did not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1647" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1647"></td>
        <td id="LC1647" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">improve. Church traditions prevailed, sentiment bordered upon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1648" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1648"></td>
        <td id="LC1648" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentimentality, and the technic of painting passed from bad to worse.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1649" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1649"></td>
        <td id="LC1649" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1650" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1650"></td>
        <td id="LC1650" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The decline continued during the sixth and seventh centuries, owing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1651" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1651"></td>
        <td id="LC1651" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">somewhat perhaps to the influence of Byzantium and the introduction</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1652" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1652"></td>
        <td id="LC1652" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">into Italy of Eastern types and elements. In the eighth century the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1653" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1653"></td>
        <td id="LC1653" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Iconoclastic controversy broke out again in fury with the edict of Leo</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1654" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1654"></td>
        <td id="LC1654" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Isaurian. This controversy was a renewal of the old quarrel in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1655" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1655"></td>
        <td id="LC1655" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Church about the use of pictures and images. Some wished them for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1656" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1656"></td>
        <td id="LC1656" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">instruction in the Word; others decried them as leading to idolatry.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1657" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1657"></td>
        <td id="LC1657" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">It was a long quarrel of over a hundred years&#39; duration, and a deadly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1658" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1658"></td>
        <td id="LC1658" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">one for art. When it ended, the artists were ordered to follow the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1659" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1659"></td>
        <td id="LC1659" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">traditions, not to make any new creations, and not to model any figure</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1660" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1660"></td>
        <td id="LC1660" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in the round. The nature element in art was quite dead at that time,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1661" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1661"></td>
        <td id="LC1661" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and the order resulted only in diverting the course of painting toward</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1662" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1662"></td>
        <td id="LC1662" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the unrestricted miniatures and manuscripts. The native Italian art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1663" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1663"></td>
        <td id="LC1663" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was crushed for a time by this new ecclesiastical burden. It did not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1664" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1664"></td>
        <td id="LC1664" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">entirely disappear, but it gave way to the stronger, though equally</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1665" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1665"></td>
        <td id="LC1665" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">restricted art that had been encroaching upon it for a long time--the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1666" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1666"></td>
        <td id="LC1666" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art of Byzantium.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1667" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1667"></td>
        <td id="LC1667" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1668" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1668"></td>
        <td id="LC1668" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">BYZANTINE PAINTING: Constantinople was rebuilt and rechristened by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1669" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1669"></td>
        <td id="LC1669" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Constantine, a Christian emperor, in the year 328 A.D. It became a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1670" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1670"></td>
        <td id="LC1670" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">stronghold of Christian traditions, manners, customs, art. But it was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1671" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1671"></td>
        <td id="LC1671" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not quite the same civilization as that of Rome and the West. It was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1672" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1672"></td>
        <td id="LC1672" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bordered on the south and east by oriental influences, and much of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1673" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1673"></td>
        <td id="LC1673" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Eastern thought, method, and glamour found its way into the Christian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1674" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1674"></td>
        <td id="LC1674" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">community. The artists fought this influence, stickling a long time</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1675" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1675"></td>
        <td id="LC1675" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for the severer classicism of ancient Greece. For when Rome fell the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1676" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1676"></td>
        <td id="LC1676" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">traditions of the Old World centred around Constantinople. But classic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1677" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1677"></td>
        <td id="LC1677" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form was ever being encroached upon by oriental richness of material</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1678" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1678"></td>
        <td id="LC1678" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and color. The struggle was a long but hopeless one. As in Italy,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1679" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1679"></td>
        <td id="LC1679" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form failed century by century. When, in the eighth century, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1680" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1680"></td>
        <td id="LC1680" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Iconoclastic controversy cut away the little Greek existing in it, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1681" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1681"></td>
        <td id="LC1681" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">oriental ornament was about all that remained.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1682" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1682"></td>
        <td id="LC1682" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1683" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1683"></td>
        <td id="LC1683" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">There was no chance for painting to rise under the prevailing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1684" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1684"></td>
        <td id="LC1684" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">conditions. Free artistic creation was denied the artist. An advocate</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1685" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1685"></td>
        <td id="LC1685" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of painting at the Second Nicene Council declared that: &quot;It is not the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1686" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1686"></td>
        <td id="LC1686" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">invention of the painter that creates the picture, but an inviolable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1687" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1687"></td>
        <td id="LC1687" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">law of the Catholic Church. It is not the painter but the holy fathers</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1688" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1688"></td>
        <td id="LC1688" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">who have to invent and dictate. To them manifestly belongs the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1689" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1689"></td>
        <td id="LC1689" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition, to the painter only the execution.&quot; Painting was in a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1690" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1690"></td>
        <td id="LC1690" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strait-jacket. It had to follow precedent and copy what had gone</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1691" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1691"></td>
        <td id="LC1691" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">before in old Byzantine patterns. Both in Italy and in Byzantium the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1692" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1692"></td>
        <td id="LC1692" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">creative artist had passed away in favor of the skilled artisan--the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1693" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1693"></td>
        <td id="LC1693" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">repeater of time-honored forms or colors. The workmanship was good for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1694" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1694"></td>
        <td id="LC1694" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the time, and the coloring and ornamental borders made a rich setting,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1695" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1695"></td>
        <td id="LC1695" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but the real life of art had gone. A long period of heavy, morose,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1696" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1696"></td>
        <td id="LC1696" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">almost formless art, eloquent of mediaeval darkness and ignorance,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1697" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1697"></td>
        <td id="LC1697" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">followed.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1698" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1698"></td>
        <td id="LC1698" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1699" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1699"></td>
        <td id="LC1699" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 21.--EZEKIEL BEFORE THE LORD. MS. ILLUMINATION.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1700" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1700"></td>
        <td id="LC1700" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PARIS, NINTH CENTURY.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1701" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1701"></td>
        <td id="LC1701" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1702" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1702"></td>
        <td id="LC1702" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">It is strange that such an art should be adopted by foreign nations,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1703" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1703"></td>
        <td id="LC1703" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and yet it was. Its bloody crucifixions and morbid madonnas were well</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1704" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1704"></td>
        <td id="LC1704" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fitted to the dark view of life held during the Middle Ages, and its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1705" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1705"></td>
        <td id="LC1705" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence was wide-spread and of long duration. It affected French and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1706" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1706"></td>
        <td id="LC1706" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">German art, it ruled at the North, and in the East it lives even to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1707" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1707"></td>
        <td id="LC1707" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this day. That it strongly affected Italy is a very apparent fact.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1708" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1708"></td>
        <td id="LC1708" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Just when it first began to show its influence there is matter of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1709" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1709"></td>
        <td id="LC1709" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dispute. It probably gained a foothold at Ravenna in the sixth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1710" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1710"></td>
        <td id="LC1710" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">century, when that province became a part of the empire of Justinian.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1711" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1711"></td>
        <td id="LC1711" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Later it permeated Rome, Sicily, and Naples at the south, and Venice</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1712" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1712"></td>
        <td id="LC1712" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at the north. With the decline of the early Christian art of Italy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1713" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1713"></td>
        <td id="LC1713" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this richer, and in many ways more acceptable, Byzantine art came in,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1714" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1714"></td>
        <td id="LC1714" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and, with Italian modifications, usurped the field. It did not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1715" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1715"></td>
        <td id="LC1715" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">literally crush out the native Italian art, but practically it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1716" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1716"></td>
        <td id="LC1716" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">superseded it, or held it in check, from the ninth to the twelfth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1717" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1717"></td>
        <td id="LC1717" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">century. After that the corrupted Italian art once more came to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1718" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1718"></td>
        <td id="LC1718" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">front.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1719" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1719"></td>
        <td id="LC1719" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1720" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1720"></td>
        <td id="LC1720" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     EARLY CHRISTIAN AND BYZANTINE REMAINS: The best examples of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1721" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1721"></td>
        <td id="LC1721" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Early Christian painting are still to be seen in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1722" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1722"></td>
        <td id="LC1722" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Catacombs at Rome. Mosaics in the early churches of Rome,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1723" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1723"></td>
        <td id="LC1723" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Ravenna, Naples, Venice, Constantinople. Sculptures,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1724" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1724"></td>
        <td id="LC1724" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     ivories, and glasses in the Lateran, Ravenna, and Vatican</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1725" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1725"></td>
        <td id="LC1725" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     museums. Illuminations in Vatican and Paris libraries.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1726" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1726"></td>
        <td id="LC1726" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Almost all the museums of Europe, those of the Vatican and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1727" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1727"></td>
        <td id="LC1727" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Naples particularly, have some examples of Byzantine work.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1728" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1728"></td>
        <td id="LC1728" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     The older altar-pieces of the early Italian churches date</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1729" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1729"></td>
        <td id="LC1729" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     back to the mediaeval period and show Byzantine influence.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1730" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1730"></td>
        <td id="LC1730" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     The altar-pieces of the Greek and Russian churches show the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1731" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1731"></td>
        <td id="LC1731" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     same influence even in modern work.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1732" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1732"></td>
        <td id="LC1732" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1733" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1733"></td>
        <td id="LC1733" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1734" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1734"></td>
        <td id="LC1734" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1735" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1735"></td>
        <td id="LC1735" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1736" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1736"></td>
        <td id="LC1736" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHAPTER V.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1737" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1737"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1738" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1738"></td>
        <td id="LC1738" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ITALIAN PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1739" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1739"></td>
        <td id="LC1739" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1740" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1740"></td>
        <td id="LC1740" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">GOTHIC PERIOD. 1250-1400.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1741" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1741"></td>
        <td id="LC1741" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1742" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1742"></td>

        <td id="L1743" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1743"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L1748" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1748"></td>

        <td id="L1749" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1749"></td>

        <td id="L1750" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1750"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1751" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1751"></td>
