      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1752" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1752"></td>
        <td id="LC1752" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Rumohr, _Italienische Forschungen_; Selincourt, _Giotto_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1753" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1753"></td>
        <td id="LC1753" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Stillman, _Old Italian Masters_; Vasari, _Lives of the Most</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1754" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1754"></td>
        <td id="LC1754" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Eminent Painters_; consult also General Bibliography (p.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1755" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1755"></td>
        <td id="LC1755" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     xv).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1756" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1756"></td>
        <td id="LC1756" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1757" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1757"></td>
        <td id="LC1757" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1758" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1758"></td>
        <td id="LC1758" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SIGNS OF THE AWAKENING: It would seem at first as though nothing but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1759" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1759"></td>
        <td id="LC1759" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">self-destruction could come to that struggling, praying,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1760" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1760"></td>
        <td id="LC1760" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">throat-cutting population that terrorized Italy during the Mediaeval</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1761" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1761"></td>
        <td id="LC1761" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Period. The people were ignorant, the rulers treacherous, the passions</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1762" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1762"></td>
        <td id="LC1762" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strong, and yet out of the Dark Ages came light. In the thirteenth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1763" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1763"></td>
        <td id="LC1763" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">century the light grew brighter, but the internal dissensions did not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1764" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1764"></td>
        <td id="LC1764" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">cease. The Hohenstaufen power was broken, the imperial rule in Italy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1765" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1765"></td>
        <td id="LC1765" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was crushed. Pope and emperor no longer warred each other, but the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1766" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1766"></td>
        <td id="LC1766" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">cries of &quot;Guelf&quot; and &quot;Ghibelline&quot; had not died out.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1767" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1767"></td>
        <td id="LC1767" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1768" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1768"></td>
        <td id="LC1768" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Throughout the entire Romanesque and Gothic periods (1000-1400) Italy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1769" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1769"></td>
        <td id="LC1769" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was torn by political wars, though the free cities, through their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1770" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1770"></td>
        <td id="LC1770" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">leagues of protection and their commerce, were prosperous. A</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1771" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1771"></td>
        <td id="LC1771" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">commercial rivalry sprang up among the cities. Trade with the East,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1772" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1772"></td>
        <td id="LC1772" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">manufactures, banking, all flourished; and even the philosophies, with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1773" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1773"></td>
        <td id="LC1773" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">law, science, and literature, began to be studied. The spirit of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1774" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1774"></td>
        <td id="LC1774" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">learning showed itself in the founding of schools and universities.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1775" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1775"></td>
        <td id="LC1775" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Dante, Petrarch, and Boccaccio, reflecting respectively religion,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1776" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1776"></td>
        <td id="LC1776" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classic learning, and the inclination toward nature, lived and gave</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1777" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1777"></td>
        <td id="LC1777" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">indication of the trend of thought. Finally the arts, architecture,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1778" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1778"></td>
        <td id="LC1778" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sculpture, painting, began to stir and take upon themselves new</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1779" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1779"></td>
        <td id="LC1779" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">appearances.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1780" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1780"></td>
        <td id="LC1780" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1781" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1781"></td>
        <td id="LC1781" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SUBJECTS AND METHODS: In painting, though there were some portraits</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1782" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1782"></td>
        <td id="LC1782" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and allegorical scenes produced during the Gothic period, the chief</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1783" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1783"></td>
        <td id="LC1783" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">theme was Bible story. The Church was the patron, and art was only the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1784" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1784"></td>
        <td id="LC1784" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">servant, as it had been from the beginning. It was the instructor and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1785" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1785"></td>
        <td id="LC1785" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">consoler of the faithful, a means whereby the Church made converts,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1786" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1786"></td>
        <td id="LC1786" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and an adornment of wall and altar. It had not entirely escaped from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1787" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1787"></td>
        <td id="LC1787" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">symbolism. It was still the portrayal of things for what they meant,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1788" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1788"></td>
        <td id="LC1788" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rather than for what they looked. There was no such thing then as art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1789" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1789"></td>
        <td id="LC1789" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for art&#39;s sake. It was art for religion&#39;s sake.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1790" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1790"></td>
        <td id="LC1790" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1791" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1791"></td>
        <td id="LC1791" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The demand for painting increased, and its subjects multiplied with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1792" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1792"></td>
        <td id="LC1792" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the establishment at this time of the two powerful orders of Dominican</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1793" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1793"></td>
        <td id="LC1793" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and Franciscan monks. The first exacted from the painters more learned</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1794" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1794"></td>
        <td id="LC1794" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and instructive work; the second wished for the crucifixions, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1795" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1795"></td>
        <td id="LC1795" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">martyrdoms, the dramatic deaths, wherewith to move people by emotional</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1796" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1796"></td>
        <td id="LC1796" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">appeal. To offset this the ultra-religious character of painting was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1797" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1797"></td>
        <td id="LC1797" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">encroached upon somewhat by the growth of the painters&#39; guilds, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1798" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1798"></td>
        <td id="LC1798" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art production largely passing into the hands of laymen. In</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1799" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1799"></td>
        <td id="LC1799" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">consequence painting produced many themes, but, as yet, only after the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1800" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1800"></td>
        <td id="LC1800" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Byzantine style. The painter was more of a workman than an artist. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1801" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1801"></td>
        <td id="LC1801" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Church had more use for his fingers than for his creative ability. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1802" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1802"></td>
        <td id="LC1802" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was his business to transcribe what had gone before. This he did, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1803" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1803"></td>
        <td id="LC1803" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not without signs here and there of uneasiness and discontent with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1804" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1804"></td>
        <td id="LC1804" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pattern. There was an inclination toward something truer to nature,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1805" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1805"></td>
        <td id="LC1805" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but, as yet, no great realization of it. The study of nature came in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1806" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1806"></td>
        <td id="LC1806" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">very slowly, and painting was not positive in statement until the time</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1807" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1807"></td>
        <td id="LC1807" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of Giotto and Lorenzetti.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1808" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1808"></td>
        <td id="LC1808" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1809" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1809"></td>
        <td id="LC1809" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 22.--GIOTTO, FLIGHT INTO EGYPT. ARENA CHAP.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1810" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1810"></td>
        <td id="LC1810" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PADUA.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1811" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1811"></td>
        <td id="LC1811" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1812" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1812"></td>
        <td id="LC1812" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The best paintings during the Gothic period were executed upon the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1813" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1813"></td>
        <td id="LC1813" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">walls of the churches in fresco. The prepared color was laid on wet</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1814" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1814"></td>
        <td id="LC1814" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">plaster, and allowed to soak in. The small altar and panel pictures</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1815" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1815"></td>
        <td id="LC1815" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were painted in distemper, the gold ground and many Byzantine features</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1816" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1816"></td>
        <td id="LC1816" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">being retained by most of the painters, though discarded by some few.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1817" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1817"></td>
        <td id="LC1817" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1818" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1818"></td>
        <td id="LC1818" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHANGES IN THE TYPE, ETC.: The advance of Italian art in the Gothic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1819" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1819"></td>
        <td id="LC1819" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">age was an advance through the development of the imposed Byzantine</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1820" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1820"></td>
        <td id="LC1820" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pattern. It was not a revolt or a starting out anew on a wholly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1821" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1821"></td>
        <td id="LC1821" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">original path. When people began to stir intellectually the artists</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1822" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1822"></td>
        <td id="LC1822" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">found that the old Byzantine model did not look like nature. They</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1823" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1823"></td>
        <td id="LC1823" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">began, not by rejecting it, but by improving it, giving it slight</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1824" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1824"></td>
        <td id="LC1824" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">movements here and there, turning the head, throwing out a hand, or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1825" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1825"></td>
        <td id="LC1825" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shifting the folds of drapery. The Eastern type was still seen in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1826" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1826"></td>
        <td id="LC1826" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">long pathetic face, oblique eyes, green flesh tints, stiff robes, thin</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1827" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1827"></td>
        <td id="LC1827" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fingers, and absence of feet; but the painters now began to modify and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1828" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1828"></td>
        <td id="LC1828" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">enliven it. More realistic Italian faces were introduced,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1829" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1829"></td>
        <td id="LC1829" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">architectural and landscape backgrounds encroached upon the Byzantine</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1830" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1830"></td>
        <td id="LC1830" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gold grounds, even portraiture was taken up.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1831" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1831"></td>
        <td id="LC1831" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1832" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1832"></td>
        <td id="LC1832" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">This looks very much like realism, but we must not lay too much stress</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1833" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1833"></td>
        <td id="LC1833" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">upon it. The painters were taking notes of natural appearances. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1834" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1834"></td>
        <td id="LC1834" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">showed in features like the hands, feet, and drapery; but the anatomy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1835" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1835"></td>
        <td id="LC1835" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the body had not yet been studied, and there is no reason to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1836" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1836"></td>
        <td id="LC1836" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">believe their study of the face was more than casual, nor their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1837" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1837"></td>
        <td id="LC1837" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portraits more than records from memory.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1838" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1838"></td>
        <td id="LC1838" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1839" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1839"></td>
        <td id="LC1839" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">No one painter began this movement. The whole artistic region of Italy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1840" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1840"></td>
        <td id="LC1840" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was at that time ready for the advance. That all the painters moved at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1841" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1841"></td>
        <td id="LC1841" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">about the same pace, and continued to move at that pace down to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1842" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1842"></td>
        <td id="LC1842" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fifteenth century, that they all based themselves upon Byzantine</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1843" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1843"></td>
        <td id="LC1843" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">teaching, and that they all had a similar style of working is proved</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1844" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1844"></td>
        <td id="LC1844" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by the great difficulty in attributing their existing pictures to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1845" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1845"></td>
        <td id="LC1845" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">certain masters, or even certain schools. There are plenty of pictures</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1846" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1846"></td>
        <td id="LC1846" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in Italy to-day that might be attributed to either Florence or Sienna,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1847" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1847"></td>
        <td id="LC1847" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Giotto or Lorenzetti, or some other master; because though each master</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1848" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1848"></td>
        <td id="LC1848" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and each school had slight peculiarities, yet they all had a common</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1849" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1849"></td>
        <td id="LC1849" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">origin in the art traditions of the time.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1850" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1850"></td>
        <td id="LC1850" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1852" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1852"></td>
        <td id="LC1852" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">FLORENCE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1853" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1853"></td>
        <td id="LC1853" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1854" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1854"></td>
        <td id="LC1854" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">FLORENTINE SCHOOL: Cimabue (1240?-1302?) seems the most notable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1855" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1855"></td>
        <td id="LC1855" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">instance in early times of a Byzantine-educated painter who improved</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1856" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1856"></td>
        <td id="LC1856" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">upon the traditions. He has been called the father of Italian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1857" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1857"></td>
        <td id="LC1857" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting, but Italian painting had no father. Cimabue was simply a man</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1858" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1858"></td>
        <td id="LC1858" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of more originality and ability than his contemporaries, and departed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1859" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1859"></td>
        <td id="LC1859" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">further from the art teachings of the time without decidedly opposing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1860" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1860"></td>
        <td id="LC1860" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">them. He retained the Byzantine pattern, but loosened the lines of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1861" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1861"></td>
        <td id="LC1861" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">drapery somewhat, turned the head to one side, infused the figure with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1862" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1862"></td>
        <td id="LC1862" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a little appearance of life. His contemporaries elsewhere in Italy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1863" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1863"></td>
        <td id="LC1863" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were doing the same thing, and none of them was any more than a link</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1864" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1864"></td>
        <td id="LC1864" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in the progressive chain.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1865" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1865"></td>
        <td id="LC1865" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1866" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1866"></td>
        <td id="LC1866" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cimabue&#39;s pupil, Giotto (1266?-1337), was a great improver on all his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1867" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1867"></td>
        <td id="LC1867" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">predecessors because he was a man of extraordinary genius. He would</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1868" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1868"></td>
        <td id="LC1868" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">have been great in any time, and yet he was not great enough to throw</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1869" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1869"></td>
        <td id="LC1869" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">off wholly the Byzantine traditions. He tried to do it. He studied</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1870" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1870"></td>
        <td id="LC1870" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature in a general way, changed the type of face somewhat by making</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1871" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1871"></td>
        <td id="LC1871" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the jaw squarer, and gave it expression and nobility. To the figure he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1872" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1872"></td>
        <td id="LC1872" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gave more motion, dramatic gesture, life. The drapery was cast in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1873" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1873"></td>
        <td id="LC1873" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">broader, simpler masses, with some regard for line, and the form and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1874" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1874"></td>
        <td id="LC1874" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">movement of the body were somewhat emphasized through it. In methods</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1875" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1875"></td>
        <td id="LC1875" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Giotto was more knowing, but not essentially different from his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1876" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1876"></td>
        <td id="LC1876" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">contemporaries; his subjects were from the common stock of religious</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1877" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1877"></td>
        <td id="LC1877" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">story; but his imaginative force and invention were his own. Bound by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1878" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1878"></td>
        <td id="LC1878" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the conventionalities of his time he could still create a work of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1879" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1879"></td>
        <td id="LC1879" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nobility and power. He came too early for the highest achievement. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1880" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1880"></td>
        <td id="LC1880" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had genius, feeling, fancy, almost everything except accurate</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1881" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1881"></td>
        <td id="LC1881" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">knowledge of the laws of nature and art. His art was the best of its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1882" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1882"></td>
        <td id="LC1882" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time, but it still lacked, nor did that of his immediate followers go</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1883" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1883"></td>
        <td id="LC1883" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">much beyond it technically.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1884" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1884"></td>
        <td id="LC1884" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1885" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1885"></td>
        <td id="LC1885" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Taddeo Gaddi (1300?-1366?) was Giotto&#39;s chief pupil, a painter of much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1886" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1886"></td>
        <td id="LC1886" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">feeling, but lacking in the large elements of construction and in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1887" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1887"></td>
        <td id="LC1887" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dramatic force of his master. Agnolo Gaddi (1333?-1396?), Antonio</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1888" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1888"></td>
        <td id="LC1888" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Veneziano (1312?-1388?), Giovanni da Milano (fl. 1366), Andrea da</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1889" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1889"></td>
        <td id="LC1889" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Firenze (fl. 1377), were all followers of the Giotto methods, and were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1890" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1890"></td>
        <td id="LC1890" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">so similar in their styles that their works are often confused and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1891" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1891"></td>
        <td id="LC1891" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">erroneously attributed. Giottino (1324?-1357?) was a supposed imitator</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1892" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1892"></td>
        <td id="LC1892" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of Giotto, of whom little is known. Orcagna (1329?-1376?) still</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1893" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1893"></td>
        <td id="LC1893" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">further advanced the Giottesque type and method. He gathered up and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1894" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1894"></td>
        <td id="LC1894" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">united in himself all the art teachings of his time. In working out</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1895" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1895"></td>
        <td id="LC1895" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">problems of form and in delicacy and charm of expression he went</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1896" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1896"></td>
        <td id="LC1896" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">beyond his predecessors. He was a many-sided genius, knowing not only</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1897" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1897"></td>
        <td id="LC1897" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in a matter of natural appearance, but in color problems, in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1898" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1898"></td>
        <td id="LC1898" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">perspective, shadows, and light. His art was further along toward the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1899" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1899"></td>
        <td id="LC1899" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Renaissance than that of any other Giottesque. He almost changed the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1900" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1900"></td>
        <td id="LC1900" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">character of painting, and yet did not live near enough to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1901" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1901"></td>
        <td id="LC1901" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fifteenth century to accomplish it completely. Spinello Aretino</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1902" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1902"></td>
        <td id="LC1902" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1332?-1410?) was the last of the great Giotto followers. He carried</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1903" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1903"></td>
        <td id="LC1903" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">out the teachings of the school in technical features, such as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1904" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1904"></td>
        <td id="LC1904" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition, drawing, and relief by color rather than by light, but he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1905" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1905"></td>
        <td id="LC1905" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lacked the creative power of Giotto. In fact, none of the Giottesque</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1906" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1906"></td>
        <td id="LC1906" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">can be said to have improved upon the master, taking him as a whole.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1907" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1907"></td>
        <td id="LC1907" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Toward the beginning of the fifteenth century the school rather</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1908" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1908"></td>
        <td id="LC1908" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">declined.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1909" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1909"></td>
        <td id="LC1909" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1910" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1910"></td>
        <td id="LC1910" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SIENNESE SCHOOL: The art teachings and traditions of the past seemed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1911" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1911"></td>
        <td id="LC1911" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">deeper rooted at Sienna than at Florence. Nor was there so much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1912" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1912"></td>
        <td id="LC1912" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">attempt to shake them off as at Florence. Giotto broke the immobility</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1913" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1913"></td>
        <td id="LC1913" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the Byzantine model by showing the draped figure in action. So also</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1914" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1914"></td>
        <td id="LC1914" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">did the Siennese to some extent, but they cared more for the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1915" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1915"></td>
        <td id="LC1915" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">expression of the spiritual than the beauty of the natural. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1916" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1916"></td>
        <td id="LC1916" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Florentines were robust, resolute, even a little coarse at times; the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1917" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1917"></td>
        <td id="LC1917" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Siennese were more refined and sentimental. Their fancy ran to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1918" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1918"></td>
        <td id="LC1918" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sweetness of face rather than to bodily vigor. Again, their art was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1919" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1919"></td>
        <td id="LC1919" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">more ornate, richer in costume, color, and detail than Florentine art;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1920" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1920"></td>
        <td id="LC1920" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but it was also more finical and narrow in scope.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1921" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1921"></td>
        <td id="LC1921" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1922" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1922"></td>
        <td id="LC1922" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 24.--A. LORENZETTI. PEACE (DETAIL). TOWN-HALL,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1923" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1923"></td>
        <td id="LC1923" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SIENNA.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1924" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1924"></td>
        <td id="LC1924" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1925" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1925"></td>
        <td id="LC1925" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">There was little advance upon Byzantinism in the work of Guido da</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1926" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1926"></td>
        <td id="LC1926" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sienna (fl. 1275). Even Duccio (1260?----?), the real founder of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1927" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1927"></td>
        <td id="LC1927" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Siennese school, retained Byzantine methods and adopted the school</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1928" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1928"></td>
        <td id="LC1928" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjects, but he perfected details of form, such as the hands and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1929" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1929"></td>
        <td id="LC1929" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">feet, and while retaining the long Byzantine face, gave it a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1930" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1930"></td>
        <td id="LC1930" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">melancholy tenderness of expression. He possessed no dramatic force,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1931" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1931"></td>
        <td id="LC1931" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but had a refined workmanship for his time--a workmanship perhaps</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1932" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1932"></td>
        <td id="LC1932" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">better, all told, than that of his Florentine contemporary, Cimabue.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1933" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1933"></td>
        <td id="LC1933" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Simone di Martino (1283?-1344?) changed the type somewhat by rounding</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1934" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1934"></td>
        <td id="LC1934" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the form. His drawing was not always correct, but in color he was good</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1935" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1935"></td>
        <td id="LC1935" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and in detail exact and minute. He probably profited somewhat by the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1936" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1936"></td>
        <td id="LC1936" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">example of Giotto.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1937" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1937"></td>
        <td id="LC1937" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1938" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1938"></td>
        <td id="LC1938" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The Siennese who came the nearest to Giotto&#39;s excellence were the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1939" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1939"></td>
        <td id="LC1939" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brothers Ambrogio (fl. 1342) and Pietro (fl. 1350) Lorenzetti. There</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1940" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1940"></td>
        <td id="LC1940" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">is little known about them except that they worked together in a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1941" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1941"></td>
        <td id="LC1941" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">similar manner. The most of their work has perished, but what remains</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1942" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1942"></td>
        <td id="LC1942" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shows an intellectual grasp equal to any of the age. The Sienna</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1943" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1943"></td>
        <td id="LC1943" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">frescos by Ambrogio Lorenzetti are strong in facial character, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1944" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1944"></td>
        <td id="LC1944" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">some of the figures, like that of the white-robed Peace, are beautiful</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1945" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1945"></td>
        <td id="LC1945" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in their flow of line. Lippo Memmi (?-1356), Bartolo di Fredi</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1946" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1946"></td>
        <td id="LC1946" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1330-1410), and Taddeo di Bartolo (1362-1422), were other painters of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1947" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1947"></td>
        <td id="LC1947" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the school. The late men rather carried detail to excess, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1948" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1948"></td>
        <td id="LC1948" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school grew conventional instead of advancing.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1949" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1949"></td>
        <td id="LC1949" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1950" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1950"></td>
        <td id="LC1950" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">TRANSITION PAINTERS: Several painters, Starnina (1354-1413), Gentile</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1951" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1951"></td>
        <td id="LC1951" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">da Fabriano (1360?-1440?), Fra Angelico (1387-1455), have been put</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1952" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1952"></td>
        <td id="LC1952" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">down in art history as the makers of the transition from Gothic to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1953" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1953"></td>
        <td id="LC1953" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Renaissance painting. They hardly deserve the title. There was no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1954" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1954"></td>
        <td id="LC1954" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">transition. The development went on, and these painters, coming late</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1955" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1955"></td>
        <td id="LC1955" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in the fourteenth century and living into the fifteenth, simply showed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1956" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1956"></td>
        <td id="LC1956" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the changing style, the advance in the study of nature and the technic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1957" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1957"></td>
        <td id="LC1957" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of art. Starnina&#39;s work gave strong evidence of the study of form, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1958" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1958"></td>
        <td id="LC1958" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it was no such work as Masaccio&#39;s. There is always a little of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1959" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1959"></td>
        <td id="LC1959" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">past in the present, and these painters showed traces of Byzantinism</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1960" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1960"></td>
        <td id="LC1960" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in details of the face and figure, in coloring, and in gold embossing.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1961" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1961"></td>
        <td id="LC1961" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1962" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1962"></td>
        <td id="LC1962" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gentile had all that nicety of finish and richness of detail and color</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1963" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1963"></td>
        <td id="LC1963" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">characteristic of the Siennese. Being closer to the Renaissance than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1964" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1964"></td>
        <td id="LC1964" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his predecessors he was more of a nature student. He was the first man</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1965" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1965"></td>
        <td id="LC1965" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to show the effect of sunlight in landscape, the first one to put a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1966" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1966"></td>
        <td id="LC1966" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gold sun in the sky. He never, however, outgrew Gothic methods and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1967" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1967"></td>
        <td id="LC1967" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">really belongs in the fourteenth century. This is true of Fra</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1968" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1968"></td>
        <td id="LC1968" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Angelico. Though he lived far into the Early Renaissance he did not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1969" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1969"></td>
        <td id="LC1969" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">change his style and manner of work in conformity with the work of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1970" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1970"></td>
        <td id="LC1970" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">others about him. He was the last inheritor of the Giottesque</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1971" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1971"></td>
        <td id="LC1971" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">traditions. Religious sentiment was the strong feature of his art. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1972" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1972"></td>
        <td id="LC1972" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was behind Giotto and Lorenzetti in power and in imagination, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1973" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1973"></td>
        <td id="LC1973" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">behind Orcagna as a painter. He knew little of light, shade,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1974" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1974"></td>
        <td id="LC1974" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">perspective, and color, and in characterization was feeble, except in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1975" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1975"></td>
        <td id="LC1975" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">some late work. One face or type answered him for all classes of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1976" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1976"></td>
        <td id="LC1976" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">people--a sweet, fair face, full of divine tenderness. His art had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1977" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1977"></td>
        <td id="LC1977" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">enough nature in it to express his meanings, but little more. He was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1978" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1978"></td>
        <td id="LC1978" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pre-eminently a devout painter, and really the last of the great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1979" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1979"></td>
        <td id="LC1979" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">religionists in painting.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1980" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1980"></td>
        <td id="LC1980" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1981" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1981"></td>
        <td id="LC1981" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 25.--FRA ANGELICO. ANGEL (DETAIL). UFFIZI.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1982" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1982"></td>
        <td id="LC1982" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1983" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1983"></td>
        <td id="LC1983" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The other regions of Italy had not at this time developed schools of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1984" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1984"></td>
        <td id="LC1984" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting of sufficient consequence to mention.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1985" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1985"></td>
        <td id="LC1985" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1986" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1986"></td>
        <td id="LC1986" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     PRINCIPAL WORKS: FLORENTINES--Cimabue, Madonnas S. M.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1987" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1987"></td>
        <td id="LC1987" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Novella and Acad. Florence, frescos Upper Church of Assisi</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1988" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1988"></td>
        <td id="LC1988" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     (?); Giotto, frescos Upper and Lower churches Assisi, best</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1989" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1989"></td>
        <td id="LC1989" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     work Arena chapel Padua, Bardi and Peruzzi chapels S. Croce,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1990" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1990"></td>
        <td id="LC1990" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     injured frescos Bargello Florence; Taddeo Gaddi, frescos</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L1991" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="1991"></td>

        <td id="L2066" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2066"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2067" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2067"></td>
        <td id="LC2067" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2068" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2068"></td>
        <td id="LC2068" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2069" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2069"></td>
        <td id="LC2069" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE ITALIAN MIND: There is no way of explaining the Italian fondness</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2070" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2070"></td>
        <td id="LC2070" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for form and color other than by considering the necessities of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2071" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2071"></td>
        <td id="LC2071" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">people and the artistic character of the Italian mind. Art in all its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2072" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2072"></td>
        <td id="LC2072" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">phases was not only an adornment but a necessity of Christian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2073" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2073"></td>
        <td id="LC2073" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">civilization. The Church taught people by sculpture, mosaic,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2074" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2074"></td>
        <td id="LC2074" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">miniature, and fresco. It was an object-teaching, a grasping of ideas</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2075" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2075"></td>
        <td id="LC2075" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by forms seen in the mind, not a presenting of abstract ideas as in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2076" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2076"></td>
        <td id="LC2076" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">literature. Printing was not known. There were few manuscripts, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2077" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2077"></td>
        <td id="LC2077" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the majority of people could not read. Ideas came to them for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2078" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2078"></td>
        <td id="LC2078" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">centuries through form and color, until at last the Italian mind took</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2079" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2079"></td>
        <td id="LC2079" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">on a plastic and pictorial character. It saw things in symbolic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2080" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2080"></td>
        <td id="LC2080" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figures, and when the Renaissance came and art took the lead as one of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2081" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2081"></td>
        <td id="LC2081" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">its strongest expressions, painting was but the color-thought and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2082" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2082"></td>
        <td id="LC2082" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form-language of the people.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2083" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2083"></td>
        <td id="LC2083" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2084" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2084"></td>
        <td id="LC2084" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 26.--FRA FILIPPO. MADONNA. UFFIZI.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2085" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2085"></td>
        <td id="LC2085" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2086" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2086"></td>
        <td id="LC2086" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">And these people, by reason of their peculiar education, were an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2087" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2087"></td>
        <td id="LC2087" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">exacting people, knowing what was good and demanding it from the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2088" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2088"></td>
        <td id="LC2088" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artists. Every Italian was, in a way, an art critic, because every</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2089" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2089"></td>
        <td id="LC2089" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">church in Italy was an art school. The artists may have led the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2090" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2090"></td>
        <td id="LC2090" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">people, but the people spurred on the artists, and so the Italian mind</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2091" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2091"></td>
        <td id="LC2091" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">went on developing and unfolding until at last it produced the great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2092" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2092"></td>
        <td id="LC2092" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art of the Renaissance.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2093" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2093"></td>
        <td id="LC2093" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2094" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2094"></td>
        <td id="LC2094" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE AWAKENING: The Italian civilization of the fourteenth century was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2095" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2095"></td>
        <td id="LC2095" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">made up of many impulses and inclinations, none of them very strongly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2096" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2096"></td>
        <td id="LC2096" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">defined. There was a feeling about in the dark, a groping toward the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2097" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2097"></td>
        <td id="LC2097" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light, but the leaders stumbled often on the road. There was good</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2098" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2098"></td>
        <td id="LC2098" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reason for it. The knowledge of the ancient world lay buried under the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2099" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2099"></td>
        <td id="LC2099" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ruins of Rome. The Italians had to learn it all over again, almost</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2100" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2100"></td>
        <td id="LC2100" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">without a precedent, almost without a preceptor. With the fifteenth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2101" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2101"></td>
        <td id="LC2101" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">century the horizon began to brighten. The Early Renaissance was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2102" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2102"></td>
        <td id="LC2102" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">begun. It was not a revolt, a reaction, or a starting out on a new</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2103" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2103"></td>
        <td id="LC2103" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">path. It was a development of the Gothic period; and the three</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2104" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2104"></td>
        <td id="LC2104" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">inclinations of the Gothic period--religion, the desire for classic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2105" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2105"></td>
        <td id="LC2105" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">knowledge, and the study of nature--were carried into the art of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2106" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2106"></td>
        <td id="LC2106" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time with greater realization.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2107" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2107"></td>
        <td id="LC2107" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2108" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2108"></td>
        <td id="LC2108" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The inference must not be made that because nature and the antique</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2109" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2109"></td>
        <td id="LC2109" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">came to be studied in Early Renaissance times that therefore religion</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2110" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2110"></td>
        <td id="LC2110" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was neglected. It was not. It still held strong, and though with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2111" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2111"></td>
        <td id="LC2111" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Renaissance there came about a strange mingling of crime and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2112" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2112"></td>
        <td id="LC2112" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">corruption, aestheticism and immorality, yet the Church was never</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2113" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2113"></td>
        <td id="LC2113" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">abandoned for an hour. When enlightenment came, people began to doubt</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2114" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2114"></td>
        <td id="LC2114" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the spiritual power of the Papacy. They did not cringe to it so</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2115" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2115"></td>
        <td id="LC2115" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">servilely as before. Religion was not violently embraced as in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2116" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2116"></td>
        <td id="LC2116" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Middle Ages, but there was no revolt. The Church held the power and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2117" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2117"></td>
        <td id="LC2117" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was still the patron of art. The painter&#39;s subjects extended over</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2118" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2118"></td>
        <td id="LC2118" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature, the antique, the fable, allegory, history, portraiture; but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2119" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2119"></td>
        <td id="LC2119" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the religious subject was not neglected. Fully three-quarters of all</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2120" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2120"></td>
        <td id="LC2120" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the fifteenth-century painting was done for the Church, at her</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2121" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2121"></td>
        <td id="LC2121" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">command, and for her purposes.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2122" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2122"></td>
        <td id="LC2122" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2123" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2123"></td>
        <td id="LC2123" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">But art was not so wholly pietistic as in the Gothic age. The study of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2124" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2124"></td>
        <td id="LC2124" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature and the antique materialized painting somewhat. The outside</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2125" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2125"></td>
        <td id="LC2125" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">world drew the painter&#39;s eyes, and the beauty of the religious subject</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2126" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2126"></td>
        <td id="LC2126" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and its sentiment were somewhat slurred for the beauty of natural</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2127" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2127"></td>
        <td id="LC2127" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">appearances. There was some loss of religious power, but religion had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2128" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2128"></td>
        <td id="LC2128" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">much to lose. In the fifteenth century it was still dominant.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2129" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2129"></td>
        <td id="LC2129" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2130" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2130"></td>
        <td id="LC2130" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 27.--BOTTICELLI. CORONATION OF MADONNA. UFFIZI.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2131" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2131"></td>
        <td id="LC2131" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2132" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2132"></td>
        <td id="LC2132" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">KNOWLEDGE OF THE ANTIQUE AND NATURE: The revival of antique learning</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2133" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2133"></td>
        <td id="LC2133" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">came about in real earnest during this period. The scholars set</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2134" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2134"></td>
        <td id="LC2134" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">themselves the task of restoring the polite learning of ancient</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2135" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2135"></td>
        <td id="LC2135" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Greece, studying coins and marbles, collecting manuscripts, founding</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2136" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2136"></td>
        <td id="LC2136" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">libraries and schools of philosophy. The wealthy nobles, Palla</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2137" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2137"></td>
        <td id="LC2137" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Strozzi, the Albizzi, the Medici, and the Dukes of Urbino, encouraged</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2138" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2138"></td>
        <td id="LC2138" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it. In 1440 the Greek was taught in five cities. Immediately</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2139" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2139"></td>
        <td id="LC2139" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">afterward, with Constantinople falling into the hands of the Turks,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2140" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2140"></td>
        <td id="LC2140" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">came an influx of Greek scholars into Italy. Then followed the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2141" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2141"></td>
        <td id="LC2141" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">invention of printing and the age of discovery on land and sea. Not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2142" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2142"></td>
        <td id="LC2142" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the antique alone but the natural were being pried into by the spirit</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2143" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2143"></td>
        <td id="LC2143" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of inquiry. Botany, geology, astronomy, chemistry, medicine, anatomy,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2144" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2144"></td>
        <td id="LC2144" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">law, literature--nothing seemed to escape the keen eye of the time.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2145" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2145"></td>
        <td id="LC2145" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Knowledge was being accumulated from every source, and the arts were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2146" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2146"></td>
        <td id="LC2146" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all reflecting it.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2147" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2147"></td>
        <td id="LC2147" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2148" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2148"></td>
        <td id="LC2148" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The influence of the newly discovered classic marbles upon painting</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2149" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2149"></td>
        <td id="LC2149" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was not so great as is usually supposed. The painters studied them,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2150" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2150"></td>
        <td id="LC2150" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but did not imitate them. Occasionally in such men as Botticelli and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2151" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2151"></td>
        <td id="LC2151" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Mantegna we see a following of sculpturesque example--a taking of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2152" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2152"></td>
        <td id="LC2152" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">details and even of whole figures--but the general effect of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2153" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2153"></td>
        <td id="LC2153" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">antique marbles was to impress the painters with the idea that nature</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2154" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2154"></td>
        <td id="LC2154" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was at the bottom of it all. They turned to the earth not only to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2155" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2155"></td>
        <td id="LC2155" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">study form and feature, but to learn perspective, light, shadow,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2156" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2156"></td>
        <td id="LC2156" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color--in short, the technical features of art. True, religion was the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
