        <td id="L2157" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2157"></td>
        <td id="LC2157" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">chief subject, but nature and the antique were used to give it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2158" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2158"></td>
        <td id="LC2158" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">setting. All the fifteenth-century painting shows nature study, force,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2159" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2159"></td>
        <td id="LC2159" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">character, sincerity; but it does not show elegance, grace, or the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2160" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2160"></td>
        <td id="LC2160" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">full complement of color. The Early Renaissance was the promise of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2161" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2161"></td>
        <td id="LC2161" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great things; the High Renaissance was the fulfilment.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2162" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2162"></td>
        <td id="LC2162" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2163" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2163"></td>
        <td id="LC2163" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">FLORENTINE SCHOOL: The Florentines were draughtsmen more than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2164" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2164"></td>
        <td id="LC2164" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">colorists. The chief medium was fresco on the walls of buildings, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2165" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2165"></td>
        <td id="LC2165" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">architectural necessities often dictated the form of compositions.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2166" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2166"></td>
        <td id="LC2166" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Distemper in easel pictures was likewise used, and oil-painting,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2167" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2167"></td>
        <td id="LC2167" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though known, was not extensively employed until the last quarter of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2168" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2168"></td>
        <td id="LC2168" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the century. In technical knowledge and intellectual grasp Florence</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2169" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2169"></td>
        <td id="LC2169" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was at this time the leader and drew to her many artists from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2170" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2170"></td>
        <td id="LC2170" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">neighboring schools. Masaccio (1401?-1428?) was the first great nature</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2171" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2171"></td>
        <td id="LC2171" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">student of the Early Renaissance, though his master, Masolino</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2172" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2172"></td>
        <td id="LC2172" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1383-1447), had given proof positive of severe nature study in bits</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2173" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2173"></td>
        <td id="LC2173" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of modelling, in drapery, and in portrait heads. Masaccio, however,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2174" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2174"></td>
        <td id="LC2174" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seems the first to have gone into it thoroughly and to have grasped</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2175" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2175"></td>
        <td id="LC2175" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature as a whole. His mastery of form, his plastic composition, his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2176" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2176"></td>
        <td id="LC2176" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">free, broad folds of drapery, and his knowledge of light and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2177" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2177"></td>
        <td id="LC2177" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">perspective, all placed him in the front rank of fifteenth-century</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2178" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2178"></td>
        <td id="LC2178" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters. Though an exact student he was not a literalist. He had a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2179" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2179"></td>
        <td id="LC2179" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">large artistic sense, a breadth of view, and a comprehension of nature</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2180" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2180"></td>
        <td id="LC2180" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as a mass that Michael Angelo and Raphael did not disdain to follow.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2181" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2181"></td>
        <td id="LC2181" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He was not a pietist, and there was no great religious feeling in his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2182" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2182"></td>
        <td id="LC2182" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work. Dignified truthful appearance was his creed, and in this he was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2183" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2183"></td>
        <td id="LC2183" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">possibly influenced by Donatello the sculptor.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2184" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2184"></td>
        <td id="LC2184" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2185" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2185"></td>
        <td id="LC2185" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 28.--GHIRLANDAJO. THE VISITATION. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2186" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2186"></td>
        <td id="LC2186" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2187" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2187"></td>
        <td id="LC2187" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He came early in the century and died early, but his contemporaries</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2188" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2188"></td>
        <td id="LC2188" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">did not continue the advance from where he carried it. There was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2189" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2189"></td>
        <td id="LC2189" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">wavering all along the line. Some from lack of genius could not equal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2190" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2190"></td>
        <td id="LC2190" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">him, others took up nature with indecision, and others clung fondly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2191" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2191"></td>
        <td id="LC2191" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to the gold-embossed ornaments and gilded halos of the past. Paolo</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2192" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2192"></td>
        <td id="LC2192" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Uccello (1397?-1475), Andrea Castagno (1390-1457), Benozzo Gozzoli</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2193" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2193"></td>
        <td id="LC2193" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1420?-1497?), Baldovinetti (1427-1499), Antonio del Pollajuolo</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2194" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2194"></td>
        <td id="LC2194" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1426-1498), Cosimo Rosselli (1439-1507), can hardly be looked upon as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2195" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2195"></td>
        <td id="LC2195" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">improvements upon the young leader. The first real successor of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2196" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2196"></td>
        <td id="LC2196" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Masaccio was his contemporary, and possibly his pupil, the monk Fra</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2197" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2197"></td>
        <td id="LC2197" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Filippo Lippi (1406-1469). He was a master of color and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2198" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2198"></td>
        <td id="LC2198" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light-and-shade for his time, though in composition and command of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2199" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2199"></td>
        <td id="LC2199" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">line he did not reach up to Masaccio. He was among the first of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2200" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2200"></td>
        <td id="LC2200" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters to take the individual faces of those about him as models for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2201" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2201"></td>
        <td id="LC2201" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his sacred characters, and clothe them in contemporary costume. Piety</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2202" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2202"></td>
        <td id="LC2202" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">is not very pronounced in any of his works, though he is not without</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2203" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2203"></td>
        <td id="LC2203" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">imagination and feeling, and there is in his women a charm of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2204" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2204"></td>
        <td id="LC2204" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sweetness. His tendency was to materialize the sacred characters.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2205" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2205"></td>
        <td id="LC2205" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2206" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2206"></td>
        <td id="LC2206" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">With Filippino (1457?-1504), Botticelli (1446-1510), and Ghirlandajo</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2207" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2207"></td>
        <td id="LC2207" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1449-1494) we find a degree of imagination, culture, and independence</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2208" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2208"></td>
        <td id="LC2208" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not surpassed by any of the Early Florentines. Filippino modelled his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2209" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2209"></td>
        <td id="LC2209" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art upon that of his father, Fra Filippo, and was influenced by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2210" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2210"></td>
        <td id="LC2210" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Botticelli. He was the weakest of the trio, without being by any means</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2211" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2211"></td>
        <td id="LC2211" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a weak man. On the contrary, he was an artist of fine ability, much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2212" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2212"></td>
        <td id="LC2212" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">charm and tenderness, and considerable style, but not a great deal of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2213" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2213"></td>
        <td id="LC2213" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">original force, though occasionally doing forceful things. Purity in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2214" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2214"></td>
        <td id="LC2214" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his type and graceful sentiment in pose and feature seem more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2215" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2215"></td>
        <td id="LC2215" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">characteristic of his work. Botticelli, even, was not so remarkable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2216" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2216"></td>
        <td id="LC2216" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for his strength as for his culture, and an individual way of looking</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2217" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2217"></td>
        <td id="LC2217" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at things. He was a pupil of Fra Filippo, a man imbued with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2218" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2218"></td>
        <td id="LC2218" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">religious feeling of Dante and Savonarola, a learned student of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2219" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2219"></td>
        <td id="LC2219" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">antique and one of the first to take subjects from it, a severe nature</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2220" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2220"></td>
        <td id="LC2220" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">student, and a painter of much technical skill. Religion, classicism,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2221" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2221"></td>
        <td id="LC2221" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and nature all met in his work, but the mingling was not perfect.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2222" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2222"></td>
        <td id="LC2222" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Religious feeling and melancholy warped it. His willowy figures,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2223" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2223"></td>
        <td id="LC2223" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">delicate and refined in drawing, are more passionate than powerful,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2224" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2224"></td>
        <td id="LC2224" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">more individual than comprehensive, but they are nevertheless very</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2225" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2225"></td>
        <td id="LC2225" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">attractive in their tenderness and grace.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2226" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2226"></td>
        <td id="LC2226" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2227" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2227"></td>
        <td id="LC2227" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Without being so original or so attractive an artist as Botticelli,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2228" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2228"></td>
        <td id="LC2228" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his contemporary, Ghirlandajo, was a stronger one. His strength came</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2229" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2229"></td>
        <td id="LC2229" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">more from assimilation than from invention. He combined in his work</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2230" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2230"></td>
        <td id="LC2230" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all the art learning of his time. He drew well, handled drapery simply</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2231" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2231"></td>
        <td id="LC2231" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and beautifully, was a good composer, and, for Florence, a good</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2232" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2232"></td>
        <td id="LC2232" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">colorist. In addition, his temperament was robust, his style</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2233" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2233"></td>
        <td id="LC2233" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dignified, even grand, and his execution wonderfully free. He was the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2234" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2234"></td>
        <td id="LC2234" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">most important of the fifteenth-century technicians, without having</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2235" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2235"></td>
        <td id="LC2235" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">any peculiar distinction or originality, and in spite of being rather</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2236" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2236"></td>
        <td id="LC2236" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">prosaic at times.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2237" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2237"></td>
        <td id="LC2237" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2238" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2238"></td>
        <td id="LC2238" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 29.--FRANCESCA. DUKE OF URBINO. UFFIZI.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2239" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2239"></td>
        <td id="LC2239" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2240" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2240"></td>
        <td id="LC2240" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Verrocchio (1435-1488) was more of a sculptor than a painter, but in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2241" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2241"></td>
        <td id="LC2241" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his studio were three celebrated pupils--Perugino, Leonardo da Vinci,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2242" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2242"></td>
        <td id="LC2242" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and Lorenzo di Credi--who were half-way between the Early and the High</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2243" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2243"></td>
        <td id="LC2243" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Renaissance. Only one of them, Leonardo, can be classed among the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2244" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2244"></td>
        <td id="LC2244" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">High Renaissance men. Perugino belongs to the Umbrian school, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2245" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2245"></td>
        <td id="LC2245" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Lorenzo di Credi (1450-1537), though Florentine, never outgrew the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2246" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2246"></td>
        <td id="LC2246" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fifteenth century. He was a pure painter, with much feeling, but weak</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2247" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2247"></td>
        <td id="LC2247" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at times. His drawing was good, but his painting lacked force, and he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2248" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2248"></td>
        <td id="LC2248" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was too pallid in flesh color. There is much detail, study, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2249" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2249"></td>
        <td id="LC2249" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">considerable grace about his work, but little of strength. Piero di</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2250" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2250"></td>
        <td id="LC2250" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cosimo (1462-1521) was fond of mythological and classical studies, was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2251" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2251"></td>
        <td id="LC2251" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">somewhat fantastic in composition, pleasant in color, and rather</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2252" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2252"></td>
        <td id="LC2252" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">distinguished in landscape backgrounds. His work strikes one as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2253" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2253"></td>
        <td id="LC2253" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">eccentric, and eccentricity was the strong characteristic of the man.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2254" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2254"></td>
        <td id="LC2254" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2255" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2255"></td>
        <td id="LC2255" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">UMBRIAN AND PERUGIAN SCHOOLS: At the beginning of the fifteenth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2256" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2256"></td>
        <td id="LC2256" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">century the old Siennese school founded by Duccio and the Lorenzetti</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2257" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2257"></td>
        <td id="LC2257" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was in a state of decline. It had been remarkable for intense</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2258" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2258"></td>
        <td id="LC2258" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentiment, and just what effect this sentiment of the old Siennese</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2259" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2259"></td>
        <td id="LC2259" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school had upon the painters of the neighboring Umbrian school of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2260" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2260"></td>
        <td id="LC2260" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early fifteenth century is a matter of speculation with historians. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2261" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2261"></td>
        <td id="LC2261" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">must have had some, though the early painters, like Ottaviano Nelli,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2262" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2262"></td>
        <td id="LC2262" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">do not show it. That which afterward became known as the Umbrian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2263" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2263"></td>
        <td id="LC2263" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentiment probably first appeared in the work of Niccolo da Foligno</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2264" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2264"></td>
        <td id="LC2264" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1430?-1502), who was probably a pupil of Benozzo Gozzoli, who was, in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2265" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2265"></td>
        <td id="LC2265" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">turn, a pupil of Fra Angelico. That would indicate Florentine</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2266" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2266"></td>
        <td id="LC2266" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence, but there were many influences at work in this upper-valley</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2267" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2267"></td>
        <td id="LC2267" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">country. Sentiment had been prevalent enough all through Central</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2268" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2268"></td>
        <td id="LC2268" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italian painting during the Gothic age--more so at Sienna than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2269" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2269"></td>
        <td id="LC2269" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">elsewhere. With the Renaissance Florence rather forsook sentiment for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2270" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2270"></td>
        <td id="LC2270" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">precision of forms and equilibrium of groups; but the Umbrian towns</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2271" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2271"></td>
        <td id="LC2271" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">being more provincial, held fast to their sentiment, their detail, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2272" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2272"></td>
        <td id="LC2272" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">their gold ornamentation. Their influence upon Florence was slight,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2273" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2273"></td>
        <td id="LC2273" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but the influence of Florence upon them was considerable. The larger</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2274" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2274"></td>
        <td id="LC2274" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">city drew the provincials its way to learn the new methods. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2275" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2275"></td>
        <td id="LC2275" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">result was a group of Umbro-Florentine painters, combining some</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2276" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2276"></td>
        <td id="LC2276" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">up-country sentiment with Florentine technic. Gentile da Fabriano,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2277" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2277"></td>
        <td id="LC2277" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Niccolo da Foligno, Bonfiglio (1425?-1496?), and Fiorenzo di Lorenzo</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2278" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2278"></td>
        <td id="LC2278" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1444?-1520) were of this mixed character.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2279" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2279"></td>
        <td id="LC2279" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2280" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2280"></td>
        <td id="LC2280" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 30.--SIGNORELLI. THE CURSE (DETAIL). ORVIETO.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2281" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2281"></td>
        <td id="LC2281" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2282" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2282"></td>
        <td id="LC2282" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The most positive in methods among the early men was Piero della</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2283" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2283"></td>
        <td id="LC2283" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Francesca (1420?-1492). Umbrian born, but Florentine trained, he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2284" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2284"></td>
        <td id="LC2284" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">became more scientific than sentimental, and excelled as a craftsman.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2285" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2285"></td>
        <td id="LC2285" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He knew drawing, perspective, atmosphere, light-and-shade in a way</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2286" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2286"></td>
        <td id="LC2286" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that rather foreshadowed Leonardo da Vinci. From working in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2287" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2287"></td>
        <td id="LC2287" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Umbrian country his influence upon his fellow-Umbrians was large. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2288" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2288"></td>
        <td id="LC2288" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">showed directly in Signorelli (1441?-1523), whose master he was, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2289" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2289"></td>
        <td id="LC2289" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">whose style he probably formed. Signorelli was Umbrian born, like</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2290" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2290"></td>
        <td id="LC2290" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Piero, but there was not much of the Umbrian sentiment about him. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2291" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2291"></td>
        <td id="LC2291" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was a draughtsman and threw his strength in line, producing athletic,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2292" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2292"></td>
        <td id="LC2292" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">square-shouldered figures in violent action, with complicated</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2293" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2293"></td>
        <td id="LC2293" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">foreshortenings quite astonishing. The most daring man of his time, he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2294" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2294"></td>
        <td id="LC2294" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was a master in anatomy, composition, motion. There was nothing select</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2295" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2295"></td>
        <td id="LC2295" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">about his type, and nothing charming about his painting. His color was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2296" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2296"></td>
        <td id="LC2296" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hot and coarse, his lights lurid, his shadows brick red. He was,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2297" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2297"></td>
        <td id="LC2297" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">however, a master-draughtsman, and a man of large conceptions and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2298" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2298"></td>
        <td id="LC2298" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great strength. Melozzo da Forli (1438-1494), of whom little is known,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2299" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2299"></td>
        <td id="LC2299" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was another pupil of Piero, and Giovanni Santi (1435?-1494), the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2300" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2300"></td>
        <td id="LC2300" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">father of Raphael, was probably influenced by both of these last</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2301" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2301"></td>
        <td id="LC2301" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">named.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2302" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2302"></td>
        <td id="LC2302" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2303" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2303"></td>
        <td id="LC2303" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The true descent of the Umbrian sentiment was through Foligno and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2304" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2304"></td>
        <td id="LC2304" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Bonfiglio to Perugino (1446-1524). Signorelli and Perugino seem</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2305" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2305"></td>
        <td id="LC2305" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">opposed to each other in their art. The first was the forerunner of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2306" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2306"></td>
        <td id="LC2306" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Michael Angelo, the second was the master of Raphael; and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2307" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2307"></td>
        <td id="LC2307" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">difference between Michael Angelo and Raphael was, in a less varied</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2308" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2308"></td>
        <td id="LC2308" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">degree, the difference between Signorelli and Perugino. The one showed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2309" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2309"></td>
        <td id="LC2309" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Florentine line, the other Umbrian sentiment and color. It is in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2310" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2310"></td>
        <td id="LC2310" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Perugino that we find the old religious feeling. Fervor, tenderness,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2311" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2311"></td>
        <td id="LC2311" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and devotion, with soft eyes, delicate features, and pathetic looks</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2312" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2312"></td>
        <td id="LC2312" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">characterized his art. The figure was slight, graceful, and in pose</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2313" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2313"></td>
        <td id="LC2313" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentimentally inclined to one side. The head was almost affectedly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2314" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2314"></td>
        <td id="LC2314" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">placed on the shoulders, and the round olive face was full of wistful</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2315" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2315"></td>
        <td id="LC2315" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">tenderness. This Perugino type, used in all his paintings, is well</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2316" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2316"></td>
        <td id="LC2316" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">described by Taine as a &quot;body belonging to the Renaissance containing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2317" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2317"></td>
        <td id="LC2317" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a soul that belonged to the Middle Ages.&quot; The sentiment was more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2318" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2318"></td>
        <td id="LC2318" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">purely human, however, than in such a painter, for instance, as Fra</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2319" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2319"></td>
        <td id="LC2319" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Angelico. Religion still held with Perugino and the Umbrians, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2320" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2320"></td>
        <td id="LC2320" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">even with them it was becoming materialized by the beauty of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2321" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2321"></td>
        <td id="LC2321" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">world about them.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2322" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2322"></td>
        <td id="LC2322" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2323" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2323"></td>
        <td id="LC2323" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 31.--PERUGINO. MADONNA, SAINTS, AND ANGELS.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2324" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2324"></td>
        <td id="LC2324" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2325" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2325"></td>
        <td id="LC2325" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2326" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2326"></td>
        <td id="LC2326" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">As a technician Perugino was excellent. There was no dramatic fire and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2327" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2327"></td>
        <td id="LC2327" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fury about him. The composition was simple, with graceful figures in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2328" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2328"></td>
        <td id="LC2328" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">repose. The coloring was rich, and there were many brilliant effects</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2329" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2329"></td>
        <td id="LC2329" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">obtained by the use of oils. He was among the first of his school to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2330" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2330"></td>
        <td id="LC2330" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">use that medium. His friend and fellow-worker, Pinturricchio</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2331" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2331"></td>
        <td id="LC2331" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1454-1513), did not use oils, but was a superior man in fresco. In</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2332" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2332"></td>
        <td id="LC2332" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">type and sentiment he was rather like Perugino, in composition a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2333" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2333"></td>
        <td id="LC2333" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">little extravagant and huddled, in landscape backgrounds quite</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2334" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2334"></td>
        <td id="LC2334" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">original and inventive. He never was a serious rival of Perugino,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2335" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2335"></td>
        <td id="LC2335" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though a more varied and interesting painter. Perugino&#39;s best pupil,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2336" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2336"></td>
        <td id="LC2336" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">after Raphael, was Lo Spagna (?-1530?), who followed his master&#39;s</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2337" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2337"></td>
        <td id="LC2337" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">style until the High Renaissance, when he became a follower of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2338" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2338"></td>
        <td id="LC2338" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Raphael.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2339" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2339"></td>
        <td id="LC2339" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2340" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2340"></td>
        <td id="LC2340" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SCHOOLS OF FERRARA AND BOLOGNA: The painters of Ferrara, in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2341" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2341"></td>
        <td id="LC2341" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fifteenth century, seemed to have relied upon Padua for their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2342" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2342"></td>
        <td id="LC2342" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">teaching. The best of the early men was Cosimo Tura (1430-1495), who</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2343" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2343"></td>
        <td id="LC2343" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">showed the Paduan influence of Squarcione in anatomical insistences,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2344" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2344"></td>
        <td id="LC2344" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">coarse joints, infinite detail, and fantastic ornamentation. He was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2345" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2345"></td>
        <td id="LC2345" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">probably the founder of the school in which Francesco Cossa (fl.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2346" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2346"></td>
        <td id="LC2346" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">1435-1480), a _naif_ and strong, if somewhat morbid painter, Ercole di</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2347" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2347"></td>
        <td id="LC2347" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Giulio Grandi (fl. 1465-1535), and Lorenzo Costa (1460?-1535) were the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2348" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2348"></td>
        <td id="LC2348" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">principal masters. Cossa and Grandi, it seems, afterward removed to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2349" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2349"></td>
        <td id="LC2349" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Bologna, and it was probably their move that induced Lorenzo Costa to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2350" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2350"></td>
        <td id="LC2350" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">follow them. In that way the Ferrarese school became somewhat</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2351" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2351"></td>
        <td id="LC2351" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">complicated with the Bolognese school, and is confused in its history</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2352" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2352"></td>
        <td id="LC2352" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to this day. Costa was not unlikely the real founder, or, at the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2353" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2353"></td>
        <td id="LC2353" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">least, the strongest influencer of the Bolognese school. He was a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2354" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2354"></td>
        <td id="LC2354" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter of a rugged, manly type, afterward tempered by Southern</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2355" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2355"></td>
        <td id="LC2355" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influences to softness and sentiment. This was the result of Paduan</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2356" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2356"></td>
        <td id="LC2356" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">methods meeting at Bologna with Umbrian sentiment.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2357" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2357"></td>
        <td id="LC2357" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2358" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2358"></td>
        <td id="LC2358" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The Perugino type and influence had found its way to Bologna, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2359" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2359"></td>
        <td id="LC2359" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">showed in the work of Francia (1450-1518), a contemporary and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2360" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2360"></td>
        <td id="LC2360" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fellow-worker with Costa. Though trained as a goldsmith, and learning</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2361" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2361"></td>
        <td id="LC2361" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting in a different school, Francia, as regards his sentiment,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2362" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2362"></td>
        <td id="LC2362" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">belongs in the same category with Perugino. Even his subjects, types,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2363" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2363"></td>
        <td id="LC2363" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and treatment were, at times, more Umbrian than Bolognese. He was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2364" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2364"></td>
        <td id="LC2364" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">so profound in feeling as Perugino, but at times he appeared loftier</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2365" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2365"></td>
        <td id="LC2365" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in conception. His color was usually rich, his drawing a little sharp</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2366" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2366"></td>
        <td id="LC2366" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at first, as showing the goldsmith&#39;s hand, the surfaces smooth, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2367" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2367"></td>
        <td id="LC2367" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">detail elaborate. Later on, his work had a Raphaelesque tinge,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2368" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2368"></td>
        <td id="LC2368" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">showing perhaps the influence of that rising master. It is probable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2369" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2369"></td>
        <td id="LC2369" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that Francia at first was influenced by Costa&#39;s methods, and it is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2370" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2370"></td>
        <td id="LC2370" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">quite certain that he in turn influenced Costa in the matter of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2371" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2371"></td>
        <td id="LC2371" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">refined drawing and sentiment, though Costa always adhered to a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2372" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2372"></td>
        <td id="LC2372" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">certain detail and ornament coming from the north, and a landscape</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2373" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2373"></td>
        <td id="LC2373" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">background that is peculiar to himself, and yet reminds one of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2374" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2374"></td>
        <td id="LC2374" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Pinturricchio&#39;s landscapes. These two men, Francia and Costa, were the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2375" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2375"></td>
        <td id="LC2375" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Perugino and Pinturricchio of the Ferrara-Bolognese school, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2376" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2376"></td>
        <td id="LC2376" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">most important painters in that school.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2377" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2377"></td>
        <td id="LC2377" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2378" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2378"></td>
        <td id="LC2378" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 32.--SCHOOL OF FRANCIA. MADONNA AND CHILD.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2379" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2379"></td>
        <td id="LC2379" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2380" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2380"></td>
        <td id="LC2380" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2381" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2381"></td>
        <td id="LC2381" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE LOMBARD SCHOOL: The designation of the Lombard school is rather a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2382" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2382"></td>
        <td id="LC2382" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">vague one in the history of painting, and is used by historians to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2383" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2383"></td>
        <td id="LC2383" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">cover a number of isolated schools or men in the Lombardy region. In</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2384" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2384"></td>
        <td id="LC2384" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the fifteenth century these schools counted for little either in men</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2385" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2385"></td>
        <td id="LC2385" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">or in works. The principal activity was about Milan, which drew</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2386" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2386"></td>
        <td id="LC2386" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters from Brescia, Vincenza, and elsewhere to form what is known</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2387" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2387"></td>
        <td id="LC2387" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as the Milanese school. Vincenzo Foppa (fl. 1455-1492), of Brescia,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2388" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2388"></td>
        <td id="LC2388" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and afterward at Milan, was probably the founder of this Milanese</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2389" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2389"></td>
        <td id="LC2389" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school. His painting is of rather a harsh, exacting nature, and points</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2390" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2390"></td>
        <td id="LC2390" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to the influence of Padua, at which place he perhaps got his early art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2391" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2391"></td>
        <td id="LC2391" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">training. Borgognone (1450-1523) is set down as his pupil, a painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2392" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2392"></td>
        <td id="LC2392" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of much sentiment and spiritual feeling. The school was afterward</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2393" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2393"></td>
        <td id="LC2393" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">greatly influenced by the example of Leonardo da Vinci, as will be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2394" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2394"></td>
        <td id="LC2394" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shown further on.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2395" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2395"></td>
        <td id="LC2395" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2396" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2396"></td>
        <td id="LC2396" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     PRINCIPAL WORKS: FLORENTINES--Masaccio, frescos in Brancacci</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>

      <tr>
        <td id="L2440" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2440"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2441" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2441"></td>
        <td id="LC2441" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Crucifixion S. M. Maddalena Florence, Sala del Cambio</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2442" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2442"></td>
        <td id="LC2442" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Perugia, altar-pieces Pitti, Fano, Cremona, many pictures in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2443" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2443"></td>
        <td id="LC2443" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     European galleries; Pinturricchio, frescos S. M. del Popolo,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2444" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2444"></td>
        <td id="LC2444" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Appartamento Borgo Vatican, Bufolini Chapel Aracoeli Rome,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2445" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2445"></td>
        <td id="LC2445" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Duomo Library Sienna, altar-pieces Perugia and Sienna</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2446" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2446"></td>
        <td id="LC2446" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Acads., Pitti, Louvre; Lo Spagna, Madonna Lower Church</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2447" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2447"></td>
        <td id="LC2447" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Assisi, frescos at Spoleto, Turin, Perugia, Assisi.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2448" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2448"></td>
        <td id="LC2448" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2449" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2449"></td>
        <td id="LC2449" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     FERRARESE AND BOLOGNESE--Cosimo Tura, altar-pieces Berlin</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2450" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2450"></td>
        <td id="LC2450" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Mus., Bergamo, Museo Correr Venice, Nat. Gal. Lon.;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2451" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2451"></td>
        <td id="LC2451" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Francesco Cossa, altar-pieces S. Petronio and Acad. Bologna,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2452" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2452"></td>
        <td id="LC2452" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Dresden Gal.; Grandi, St. George Corsini Pal. Rome, several</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2453" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2453"></td>
        <td id="LC2453" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     canvases Constabili Collection Ferrara; Lorenzo Costa,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2454" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2454"></td>
        <td id="LC2454" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     frescos S. Giacomo Maggiore, altar-pieces S. Petronio, S.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2455" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2455"></td>
        <td id="LC2455" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Giovanni in Monte and Acad. Bologna, also Louvre, Berlin,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2456" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2456"></td>
        <td id="LC2456" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     and Nat. Gal. Lon.; Francia, altar-pieces S. Giacomo</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2457" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2457"></td>
        <td id="LC2457" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Maggiore, S. Martino Maggiore, and many altar-pieces in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2458" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2458"></td>
        <td id="LC2458" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Acad. Bologna, Annunciation Brera Milan, Rose Garden Munich,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2459" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2459"></td>
        <td id="LC2459" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Pieta Nat. Gal. Lon., Scappi Portrait Uffizi, Baptism</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2460" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2460"></td>
        <td id="LC2460" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Dresden.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2461" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2461"></td>
        <td id="LC2461" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2462" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2462"></td>
        <td id="LC2462" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     LOMBARDS--Foppa, altar-pieces S. Maria di Castello Savona,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2463" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2463"></td>
        <td id="LC2463" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Borromeo Col. Milan, Carmine Brescia, panels Brera Milan;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2464" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2464"></td>
