      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2465" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2465"></td>
        <td id="LC2465" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Melegnano, S. Ambrogio, Ambrosian Lib., Brera Milan, Nat.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2466" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2466"></td>
        <td id="LC2466" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Gal. Lon.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2467" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2467"></td>
        <td id="LC2467" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2468" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2468"></td>
        <td id="LC2468" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2469" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2469"></td>
        <td id="LC2469" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2470" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2470"></td>
        <td id="LC2470" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2471" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2471"></td>
        <td id="LC2471" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHAPTER VII.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2472" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2472"></td>
        <td id="LC2472" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2473" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2473"></td>
        <td id="LC2473" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ITALIAN PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2474" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2474"></td>
        <td id="LC2474" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2475" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2475"></td>
        <td id="LC2475" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">EARLY RENAISSANCE--1400-1500--CONTINUED.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2476" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2476"></td>
        <td id="LC2476" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2477" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2477"></td>
        <td id="LC2477" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: Those on Italian art before mentioned;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2478" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2478"></td>
        <td id="LC2478" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     also consult the General Bibliography (page xv.)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2479" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2479"></td>
        <td id="LC2479" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2480" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2480"></td>
        <td id="LC2480" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2481" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2481"></td>
        <td id="LC2481" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PADUAN SCHOOL: It was at Padua in the north that the influence of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2482" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2482"></td>
        <td id="LC2482" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classic marbles made itself strongly apparent. Umbria remained true to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2483" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2483"></td>
        <td id="LC2483" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the religious sentiment, Florence engaged itself largely with nature</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2484" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2484"></td>
        <td id="LC2484" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">study and technical problems, introducing here and there draperies and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2485" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2485"></td>
        <td id="LC2485" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">poses that showed knowledge of ancient sculpture, but at Padua much of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2486" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2486"></td>
        <td id="LC2486" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the classic in drapery, figures, and architecture seems to have been</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2487" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2487"></td>
        <td id="LC2487" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">taken directly from the rediscovered antique or the modern bronze.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2488" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2488"></td>
        <td id="LC2488" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2489" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2489"></td>
        <td id="LC2489" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The early men of the school were hardly great enough to call for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2490" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2490"></td>
        <td id="LC2490" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mention. During the fourteenth century there was some Giotto influence</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2491" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2491"></td>
        <td id="LC2491" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">felt--that painter having been at Padua working in the Arena Chapel.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2492" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2492"></td>
        <td id="LC2492" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Later on there was a slight influence from Gentile da Fabriano and his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2493" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2493"></td>
        <td id="LC2493" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fellow-worker Vittore Pisano, of Verona. But these influences seem to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2494" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2494"></td>
        <td id="LC2494" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">have died out and the real direction of the school in the early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2495" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2495"></td>
        <td id="LC2495" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fifteenth century was given by Francesco Squarcione (1394-1474). He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2496" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2496"></td>
        <td id="LC2496" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was an enlightened man, a student, a collector and an admirer of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2497" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2497"></td>
        <td id="LC2497" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ancient sculpture, and though no great painter himself he taught an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2498" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2498"></td>
        <td id="LC2498" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">anatomical statuesque art, based on ancient marbles and nature, to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2499" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2499"></td>
        <td id="LC2499" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">many pupils.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2500" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2500"></td>
        <td id="LC2500" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2501" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2501"></td>
        <td id="LC2501" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Squarcione&#39;s work has perished, but his teaching was reflected in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2502" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2502"></td>
        <td id="LC2502" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work of his great pupil Andrea Mantegna (1431-1506). Yet Mantegna</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2503" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2503"></td>
        <td id="LC2503" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">never received the full complement of his knowledge from Squarcione.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2504" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2504"></td>
        <td id="LC2504" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He was of an observing nature and probably studied Paolo Uccello and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2505" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2505"></td>
        <td id="LC2505" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Fra Filippo, some of whose works were then in Paduan edifices. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2506" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2506"></td>
        <td id="LC2506" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gained color knowledge from the Venetian Bellinis, who lived at Padua</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2507" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2507"></td>
        <td id="LC2507" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at one time and who were connected with Mantegna by marriage. But the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2508" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2508"></td>
        <td id="LC2508" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sculpturesque side of his art came from Squarcione, from a study of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2509" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2509"></td>
        <td id="LC2509" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the antique, and from a deeper study of Donatello, whose bronzes to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2510" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2510"></td>
        <td id="LC2510" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this day are to be seen within and without the Paduan Duomo of S.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2511" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2511"></td>
        <td id="LC2511" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Antonio.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2512" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2512"></td>
        <td id="LC2512" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2513" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2513"></td>
        <td id="LC2513" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 33.--MANTEGNA. GONZAGA FAMILY GROUP (DETAIL).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2514" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2514"></td>
        <td id="LC2514" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">MANTUA.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2515" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2515"></td>
        <td id="LC2515" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2516" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2516"></td>
        <td id="LC2516" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The sculpturesque is characteristic of Mantegna&#39;s work. His people are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2517" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2517"></td>
        <td id="LC2517" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hard, rigid at times, immovable human beings, not so much turned to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2518" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2518"></td>
        <td id="LC2518" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">stone as turned to bronze--the bronze of Donatello. There is little</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2519" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2519"></td>
        <td id="LC2519" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sense of motion about them. The figure is sharp and harsh, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2520" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2520"></td>
        <td id="LC2520" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">drapery, evidently studied from sculpture, is &quot;liney,&quot; and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2521" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2521"></td>
        <td id="LC2521" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">archaeology is often more scientific than artistic. Mantegna was not,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2522" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2522"></td>
        <td id="LC2522" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">however, entirely devoted to the sculpturesque. He was one of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2523" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2523"></td>
        <td id="LC2523" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">severest nature students of the Early Renaissance, knew about nature,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2524" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2524"></td>
        <td id="LC2524" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and carried it out in more exacting detail than was perhaps well for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2525" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2525"></td>
        <td id="LC2525" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his art. In addition he was a master of light-and-shade, understood</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2526" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2526"></td>
        <td id="LC2526" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition, space, color, atmosphere, and was as scientific in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2527" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2527"></td>
        <td id="LC2527" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">perspective as Piero della Francesca. There is stiffness in his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2528" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2528"></td>
        <td id="LC2528" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figures but nevertheless great truth and character. The forms are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2529" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2529"></td>
        <td id="LC2529" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">noble, even grand, and for invention and imagination they were never,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2530" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2530"></td>
        <td id="LC2530" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in his time, carried further or higher. He was little of a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2531" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2531"></td>
        <td id="LC2531" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentimentalist or an emotionalist, not much of a brush man or a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2532" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2532"></td>
        <td id="LC2532" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">colorist, but as a draughtsman, a creator of noble forms, a man of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2533" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2533"></td>
        <td id="LC2533" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">power, he stood second to none in the century.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2534" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2534"></td>
        <td id="LC2534" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2535" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2535"></td>
        <td id="LC2535" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Of Squarcione&#39;s other pupils Pizzolo (fl. 1470) was the most</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2536" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2536"></td>
        <td id="LC2536" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">promising, but died early. Marco Zoppo (1440-1498) seems to have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2537" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2537"></td>
        <td id="LC2537" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">followed the Paduan formula of hardness, dryness, and exacting detail.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2538" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2538"></td>
        <td id="LC2538" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He was possibly influenced by Cosimo Tura, and in turn influenced</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2539" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2539"></td>
        <td id="LC2539" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">somewhat the Ferrara-Bolognese school. Mantegna, however, was the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2540" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2540"></td>
        <td id="LC2540" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">greatest of the school, and his influence was far-reaching. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2541" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2541"></td>
        <td id="LC2541" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">affected the school of Venice in matters of drawing, beside</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2542" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2542"></td>
        <td id="LC2542" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influencing the Lombard and Veronese schools in their beginnings.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2543" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2543"></td>
        <td id="LC2543" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2544" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2544"></td>
        <td id="LC2544" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SCHOOLS OF VERONA AND VICENZA: Artistically Verona belonged with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2545" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2545"></td>
        <td id="LC2545" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Venetian provinces, because it was largely an echo of Venice except at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2546" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2546"></td>
        <td id="LC2546" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the very start. Vittore Pisano (1380-1456), called Pisanello, was the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2547" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2547"></td>
        <td id="LC2547" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">earliest painter of note, but he was not distinctly Veronese in his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2548" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2548"></td>
        <td id="LC2548" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art. He was medallist and painter both, worked with Gentile da</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2549" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2549"></td>
        <td id="LC2549" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Fabriano in the Ducal Palace at Venice and elsewhere, and his art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2550" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2550"></td>
        <td id="LC2550" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seems to have an affinity with that of his companion.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2551" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2551"></td>
        <td id="LC2551" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2552" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2552"></td>
        <td id="LC2552" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Liberale da Verona (1451-1536?) was at first a miniaturist, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2553" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2553"></td>
        <td id="LC2553" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">afterward developed a larger style based on a following of Mantegna&#39;s</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2554" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2554"></td>
        <td id="LC2554" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work, with some Venetian influences showing in the coloring and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2555" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2555"></td>
        <td id="LC2555" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">backgrounds. Francesco Bonsignori (1455-1519) was of the Verona</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2556" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2556"></td>
        <td id="LC2556" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school, but established himself later at Mantua and was under the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2557" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2557"></td>
        <td id="LC2557" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Mantegna influence. His style at first was rather severe, but he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2558" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2558"></td>
        <td id="LC2558" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">afterward developed much ability in portraiture, historical work,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2559" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2559"></td>
        <td id="LC2559" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">animals, and architectural features. Francesco Caroto (1470-1546), a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2560" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2560"></td>
        <td id="LC2560" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pupil of Liberale, really belongs to the next century--the High</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2561" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2561"></td>
        <td id="LC2561" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Renaissance--but his early works show his education in Veronese and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2562" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2562"></td>
        <td id="LC2562" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Paduan methods.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2563" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2563"></td>
        <td id="LC2563" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2564" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2564"></td>
        <td id="LC2564" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 34.--B. VIVARINI. MADONNA AND CHILD. TURIN.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2565" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2565"></td>
        <td id="LC2565" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2566" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2566"></td>
        <td id="LC2566" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In the school of Vicenza the only master of much note in this Early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2567" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2567"></td>
        <td id="LC2567" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Renaissance time was Bartolommeo Montagna (1450?-1523), a painter in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2568" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2568"></td>
        <td id="LC2568" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">both oil and fresco of much severity and at times grandeur of style.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2569" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2569"></td>
        <td id="LC2569" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In drawing he was influenced by Mantegna, in composition and coloring</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2570" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2570"></td>
        <td id="LC2570" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he showed a study of Giovanni Bellini and Carpaccio.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2571" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2571"></td>
        <td id="LC2571" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2572" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2572"></td>
        <td id="LC2572" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">VENETIAN LIFE AND ART: The conditions of art production in Venice</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2573" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2573"></td>
        <td id="LC2573" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">during the Early Renaissance were quite different from those in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2574" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2574"></td>
        <td id="LC2574" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Florence or Umbria. By the disposition of her people Venice was not a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2575" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2575"></td>
        <td id="LC2575" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">learned or devout city. Religion, though the chief subject, was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2576" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2576"></td>
        <td id="LC2576" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the chief spirit of Venetian art. Christianity was accepted by the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2577" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2577"></td>
        <td id="LC2577" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Venetians, but with no fevered enthusiasm. The Church was strong</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2578" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2578"></td>
        <td id="LC2578" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">enough there to defy the Papacy at one time, and yet religion with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2579" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2579"></td>
        <td id="LC2579" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">people was perhaps more of a civic function or a duty than a spiritual</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2580" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2580"></td>
        <td id="LC2580" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">worship. It was sincere in its way, and the early painters painted its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2581" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2581"></td>
        <td id="LC2581" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjects with honesty, but the Venetians were much too proud and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2582" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2582"></td>
        <td id="LC2582" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">worldly minded to take anything very seriously except their own</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2583" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2583"></td>
        <td id="LC2583" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">splendor and their own power.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2584" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2584"></td>
        <td id="LC2584" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2585" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2585"></td>
        <td id="LC2585" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Again, the Venetians were not humanists or students of the revived</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2586" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2586"></td>
        <td id="LC2586" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classic. They housed manuscripts, harbored exiled humanists, received</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2587" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2587"></td>
        <td id="LC2587" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the influx of Greek scholars after the fall of Constantinople, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2588" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2588"></td>
        <td id="LC2588" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">later the celebrated Aldine press was established in Venice; but, for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2589" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2589"></td>
        <td id="LC2589" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all that, classic learning was not the fancy of the Venetians. They</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2590" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2590"></td>
        <td id="LC2590" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">made no quarrel over the relative merits of Plato and Aristotle, dug</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2591" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2591"></td>
        <td id="LC2591" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">up no classic marbles, had no revival of learning in a Florentine</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2592" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2592"></td>
        <td id="LC2592" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sense. They were merchant princes, winning wealth by commerce and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2593" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2593"></td>
        <td id="LC2593" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">expending it lavishly in beautifying their island home. Not to attain</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2594" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2594"></td>
        <td id="LC2594" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great learning, but to revel in great splendor, seems to have been</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2595" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2595"></td>
        <td id="LC2595" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">their aim. Life in the sovereign city of the sea was a worthy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2596" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2596"></td>
        <td id="LC2596" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">existence in itself. And her geographical and political position aided</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2597" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2597"></td>
        <td id="LC2597" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">her prosperity. Unlike Florence she was not torn by contending princes</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2598" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2598"></td>
        <td id="LC2598" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">within and foreign foes without--at least not to her harm. She had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2599" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2599"></td>
        <td id="LC2599" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">her wars, but they were generally on distant seas. Popery, Paganism,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2600" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2600"></td>
        <td id="LC2600" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Despotism, all the convulsions of Renaissance life threatened but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2601" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2601"></td>
        <td id="LC2601" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">harmed her not. Free and independent, her kingdom was the sea, and her</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2602" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2602"></td>
        <td id="LC2602" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">livelihood commerce, not agriculture.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2603" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2603"></td>
        <td id="LC2603" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2604" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2604"></td>
        <td id="LC2604" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The worldly spirit of the Venetian people brought about a worldly and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2605" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2605"></td>
        <td id="LC2605" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">luxurious art. Nothing in the disposition or education of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2606" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2606"></td>
        <td id="LC2606" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Venetians called for the severe or the intellectual. The demand was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2607" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2607"></td>
        <td id="LC2607" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for rich decoration that would please the senses without stimulating</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2608" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2608"></td>
        <td id="LC2608" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the intellect or firing the imagination to any great extent. Line and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2609" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2609"></td>
        <td id="LC2609" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form were not so well suited to them as color--the most sensuous of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2610" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2610"></td>
        <td id="LC2610" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all mediums. Color prevailed through Venetian art from the very</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2611" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2611"></td>
        <td id="LC2611" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">beginning, and was its distinctive characteristic.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2612" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2612"></td>
        <td id="LC2612" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2613" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2613"></td>
        <td id="LC2613" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 35.--GIOVANNI BELLINI. MADONNA OF SS. GEORGE AND</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2614" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2614"></td>
        <td id="LC2614" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PAUL. VENICE ACAD.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2615" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2615"></td>
        <td id="LC2615" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2616" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2616"></td>
        <td id="LC2616" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Where this love of color came from is matter of speculation. Some say</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2617" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2617"></td>
        <td id="LC2617" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">out of Venetian skies and waters, and, doubtless, these had something</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2618" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2618"></td>
        <td id="LC2618" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to do with the Venetian color-sense; but Venice in its color was also</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2619" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2619"></td>
        <td id="LC2619" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">an example of the effect of commerce on art. She was a trader with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2620" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2620"></td>
        <td id="LC2620" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">East from her infancy--not Constantinople and the Byzantine East</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2621" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2621"></td>
        <td id="LC2621" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">alone, but back of these the old Mohammedan East, which for a thousand</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2622" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2622"></td>
        <td id="LC2622" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">years has cast its art in colors rather than in forms. It was Eastern</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2623" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2623"></td>
        <td id="LC2623" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ornament in mosaics, stuffs, porcelains, variegated marbles, brought</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2624" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2624"></td>
        <td id="LC2624" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by ship to Venice and located in S. Marco, in Murano, and in Torcello,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2625" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2625"></td>
        <td id="LC2625" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that first gave the color-impulse to the Venetians. If Florence was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2626" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2626"></td>
        <td id="LC2626" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the heir of Rome and its austere classicism, Venice was the heir of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2627" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2627"></td>
        <td id="LC2627" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Constantinople and its color-charm. The two great color spots in Italy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2628" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2628"></td>
        <td id="LC2628" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at this day are Venice and Ravenna, commercial footholds of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2629" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2629"></td>
        <td id="LC2629" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Byzantines in Mediaeval and Renaissance days. It may be concluded</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2630" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2630"></td>
        <td id="LC2630" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">without error that Venice derived her color-sense and much of her</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2631" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2631"></td>
        <td id="LC2631" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">luxurious and material view of life from the East.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2632" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2632"></td>
        <td id="LC2632" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2633" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2633"></td>
        <td id="LC2633" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE EARLY VENETIAN PAINTERS: Painting began at Venice with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2634" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2634"></td>
        <td id="LC2634" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fabrication of mosaics and ornamental altar-pieces of rich gold</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2635" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2635"></td>
        <td id="LC2635" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">stucco-work. The &quot;Greek manner&quot;--that is, the Byzantine--was practised</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2636" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2636"></td>
        <td id="LC2636" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early in the fifteenth century by Jacobello del Fiore and Semitecolo,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2637" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2637"></td>
        <td id="LC2637" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but it did not last long. Instead of lingering for a hundred years, as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2638" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2638"></td>
        <td id="LC2638" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at Florence, it died a natural death in the first half of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2639" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2639"></td>
        <td id="LC2639" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fifteenth century. Gentile da Fabriano, who was at Venice about 1420,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2640" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2640"></td>
        <td id="LC2640" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting in the Ducal Palace with Pisano as his assistant, may have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2641" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2641"></td>
        <td id="LC2641" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brought this about. He taught there in Venice, was the master of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2642" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2642"></td>
        <td id="LC2642" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Jacopo Bellini, and if not the teacher then the influencer of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2643" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2643"></td>
        <td id="LC2643" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Vivarinis of Murano. There were two of the Vivarinis in the early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2644" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2644"></td>
        <td id="LC2644" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">times, so far as can be made out, Antonio Vivarini (?-1470) and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2645" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2645"></td>
        <td id="LC2645" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Bartolommeo Vivarini (fl. 1450-1499), who worked with Johannes</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2646" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2646"></td>
        <td id="LC2646" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Alemannus, a painter of supposed German birth and training. They all</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2647" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2647"></td>
        <td id="LC2647" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">signed themselves from Murano (an outlying Venetian island), where</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2648" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2648"></td>
        <td id="LC2648" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">they were producing church altars and ornaments with some Paduan</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2649" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2649"></td>
        <td id="LC2649" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence showing in their work. They made up the Muranese school,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2650" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2650"></td>
        <td id="LC2650" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though this school was not strongly marked apart either in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2651" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2651"></td>
        <td id="LC2651" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">characteristics or subjects from the Venetian school, of which it was,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2652" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2652"></td>
        <td id="LC2652" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in fact, a part.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2653" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2653"></td>
        <td id="LC2653" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2654" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2654"></td>
        <td id="LC2654" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 36.--CARPACCIO. PRESENTATION (DETAIL). VENICE</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2655" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2655"></td>
        <td id="LC2655" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ACAD.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2656" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2656"></td>
        <td id="LC2656" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2657" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2657"></td>
        <td id="LC2657" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Bartolommeo was the best of the group, and contended long time in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2658" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2658"></td>
        <td id="LC2658" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rivalry with the Bellinis at Venice, but toward 1470 he fell away and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2659" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2659"></td>
        <td id="LC2659" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">died comparatively forgotten. Luigi Vivarini (fl. 1461-1503) was the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2660" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2660"></td>
        <td id="LC2660" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">latest of this family, and with his death the history of the Muranese</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2661" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2661"></td>
        <td id="LC2661" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">merges into the Venetian school proper, except as it continues to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2662" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2662"></td>
        <td id="LC2662" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">appear in some pupils and followers. Of these latter Carlo Crivelli</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2663" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2663"></td>
        <td id="LC2663" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1430?1493?) was the only one of much mark. He apparently gathered</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2664" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2664"></td>
        <td id="LC2664" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his art from many sources--ornament and color from the Vivarini, a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2665" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2665"></td>
        <td id="LC2665" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lean and withered type from the early Paduans under Squarcione,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2666" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2666"></td>
        <td id="LC2666" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">architecture from Mantegna, and a rather repulsive sentiment from the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2667" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2667"></td>
        <td id="LC2667" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">same school. His faces were contorted and sulky, his hands and feet</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2668" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2668"></td>
        <td id="LC2668" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">stringy, his drawing rather bad; but he had a transparent color,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2669" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2669"></td>
        <td id="LC2669" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">beautiful ornamentation and not a little tragic power.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2670" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2670"></td>
        <td id="LC2670" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2671" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2671"></td>
        <td id="LC2671" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Venetian art practically dates from the Bellinis. They did not begin</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2672" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2672"></td>
        <td id="LC2672" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">where the Vivarini left off. The two families of painters seem to have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2673" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2673"></td>
        <td id="LC2673" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">started about the same time, worked along together from like</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2674" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2674"></td>
        <td id="LC2674" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">inspirations, and in somewhat of a similar manner as regards the early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2675" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2675"></td>
        <td id="LC2675" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">men. Jacopo Bellini (1400?-1464?) was the pupil of Gentile da</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2676" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2676"></td>
        <td id="LC2676" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Fabriano, and a painter of considerable rank. His son, Gentile Bellini</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2677" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2677"></td>
        <td id="LC2677" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1426?-1507), was likewise a painter of ability, and an extremely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2678" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2678"></td>
        <td id="LC2678" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">interesting one on account of his Venetian subjects painted with much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2679" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2679"></td>
        <td id="LC2679" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">open-air effect and knowledge of light and atmosphere. The younger</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2680" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2680"></td>
        <td id="LC2680" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">son, Giovanni Bellini (1428?-1516), was the greatest of the family and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2681" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2681"></td>
        <td id="LC2681" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the true founder of the Venetian school.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2682" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2682"></td>
        <td id="LC2682" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2683" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2683"></td>
        <td id="LC2683" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">About the middle of the fifteenth century the Bellini family lived at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2684" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2684"></td>
        <td id="LC2684" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Padua and came in contact with the classic-realistic art of Mantegna.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2685" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2685"></td>
        <td id="LC2685" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In fact, Mantegna married Giovanni Bellini&#39;s sister, and there was a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2686" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2686"></td>
        <td id="LC2686" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mingling of family as well as of art. There was an influence upon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2687" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2687"></td>
        <td id="LC2687" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Mantegna of Venetian color, and upon the Bellinis of Paduan line. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2688" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2688"></td>
        <td id="LC2688" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">latter showed in Giovanni Bellini&#39;s early work, which was rather hard,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2689" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2689"></td>
        <td id="LC2689" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">angular in drapery, and anatomical in the joints, hands, and feet; but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2690" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2690"></td>
        <td id="LC2690" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as the century drew to a close this melted away into the growing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2691" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2691"></td>
        <td id="LC2691" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">splendor of Venetian color. Giovanni Bellini lived into the sixteenth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2692" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2692"></td>
        <td id="LC2692" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">century, but never quite attained the rank of a High Renaissance</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2693" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2693"></td>
        <td id="LC2693" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter. He had religious feeling, earnestness, honesty, simplicity,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2694" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2694"></td>
        <td id="LC2694" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">character, force, knowledge; but not the full complement of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2695" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2695"></td>
        <td id="LC2695" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brilliancy and painter&#39;s power. He went beyond all his contemporaries</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2696" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2696"></td>
        <td id="LC2696" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in technical strength and color-harmony, and was in fact the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2697" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2697"></td>
        <td id="LC2697" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">epoch-making man of early Venice. Some of his pictures, like the S.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2698" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2698"></td>
        <td id="LC2698" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Zaccaria Madonna, will compare favorably with any work of any age, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2699" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2699"></td>
        <td id="LC2699" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his landscape backgrounds (see the St. Peter Martyr in the National</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2700" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2700"></td>
        <td id="LC2700" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gallery, London) were rather wonderful for the period in which they</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2701" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2701"></td>
        <td id="LC2701" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were produced.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2702" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2702"></td>
        <td id="LC2702" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2703" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2703"></td>
        <td id="LC2703" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Of Bellini&#39;s contemporaries and followers there were many, and as a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2704" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2704"></td>
        <td id="LC2704" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school there was a similarity of style, subject, and color-treatment</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2705" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2705"></td>
        <td id="LC2705" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">carrying through them all, with individual peculiarities in each</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2706" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2706"></td>
        <td id="LC2706" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter. After Giovanni Bellini comes Carpaccio (?-1522?), a younger</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2707" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2707"></td>
        <td id="LC2707" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">contemporary, about whose history little is known. He worked with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2708" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2708"></td>
        <td id="LC2708" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gentile Bellini, and was undoubtedly influenced by Giovanni Bellini.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2709" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2709"></td>
        <td id="LC2709" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In subject he was more romantic and chivalric than religious, though</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2710" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2710"></td>
        <td id="LC2710" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting a number of altar-pieces. The legend was his delight, and his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2711" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2711"></td>
        <td id="LC2711" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great success, as the St. Ursula and St. George pictures in Venice</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2712" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2712"></td>
        <td id="LC2712" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">still indicate. He was remarkable for his knowledge of architecture,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2713" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2713"></td>
        <td id="LC2713" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">costumes, and Oriental settings, put forth in a realistic way, with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2714" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2714"></td>
        <td id="LC2714" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">much invention and technical ability in the handling of landscape,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2715" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2715"></td>
        <td id="LC2715" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">perspective, light, and color. There is a truthfulness of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2716" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2716"></td>
        <td id="LC2716" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">appearance--an out-of-doors feeling--about his work that is quite</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2717" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2717"></td>
        <td id="LC2717" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">captivating. In addition, the spirit of his art was earnestness,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2718" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2718"></td>
        <td id="LC2718" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">honesty, and sincerity, and even the awkward bits of drawing which</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2719" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2719"></td>
        <td id="LC2719" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">occasionally appeared in his work served to add to the general naive</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2720" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2720"></td>
        <td id="LC2720" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">effect of the whole.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2721" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2721"></td>
        <td id="LC2721" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2722" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2722"></td>
        <td id="LC2722" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 37.--ANTONELLO DA MESSINA. UNKNOWN MAN. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2723" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2723"></td>
        <td id="LC2723" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2724" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2724"></td>
        <td id="LC2724" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cima da Conegliano (1460?-1517?) was probably a pupil of Giovanni</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2725" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2725"></td>
        <td id="LC2725" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Bellini, with some Carpaccio influence about him. He was the best of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2726" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2726"></td>
        <td id="LC2726" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the immediate followers, none of whom came up to the master. They were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2727" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2727"></td>
        <td id="LC2727" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">trammelled somewhat by being educated in distemper work, and then</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2728" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2728"></td>
        <td id="LC2728" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">midway in their careers changing to the oil medium, that medium</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2729" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2729"></td>
        <td id="LC2729" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">having been introduced into Venice by Antonello da Messina in 1473.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2730" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2730"></td>
        <td id="LC2730" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cima&#39;s subjects were largely half-length madonnas, given with strong</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2731" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2731"></td>
        <td id="LC2731" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">qualities of light-and-shade and color. He was not a great originator,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2732" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2732"></td>
        <td id="LC2732" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though a man of ability. Catena (?-1531) had a wide reputation in his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2733" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2733"></td>
        <td id="LC2733" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">day, but it came more from a smooth finish and pretty accessories than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2734" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2734"></td>
        <td id="LC2734" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">from creative power. He imitated Bellini&#39;s style so well that a number</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2735" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2735"></td>
        <td id="LC2735" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of his pictures pass for works by the master even to this day. Later</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2736" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2736"></td>
        <td id="LC2736" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he followed Giorgione and Carpaccio. A man possessed of knowledge, he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2737" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2737"></td>
        <td id="LC2737" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seemed to have no original propelling purpose behind him. That was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2738" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2738"></td>
        <td id="LC2738" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">largely the make-up of the other men of the school, Basaiti</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2739" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2739"></td>
        <td id="LC2739" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1490-1521?), Previtali (1470?-1525?), Bissolo (14641528), Rondinelli</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2740" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2740"></td>
        <td id="LC2740" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1440?-1500?), Diana (?-1500?), Mansueti (fl. 1500).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2741" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2741"></td>
        <td id="LC2741" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2742" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2742"></td>
        <td id="LC2742" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Antonello da Messina (1444?-1493), though Sicilian born, is properly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2743" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2743"></td>
        <td id="LC2743" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classed with the Venetian school. He obtained a knowledge of Flemish</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2744" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2744"></td>
        <td id="LC2744" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">methods probably from Flemish painters or pictures in Italy (he never</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2745" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2745"></td>
        <td id="LC2745" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was a pupil of Jan van Eyck, as Vasari relates, and probably never saw</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2746" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2746"></td>
        <td id="LC2746" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Flanders), and introduced the use of oil as a medium in the Venetian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2747" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2747"></td>
        <td id="LC2747" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school. His early work was Flemish in character, and was very accurate</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2748" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2748"></td>
        <td id="LC2748" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and minute. His late work showed the influence of the Bellinis. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2749" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2749"></td>
        <td id="LC2749" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">counter-influence upon Venetian portraiture has never been quite</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2750" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2750"></td>
        <td id="LC2750" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">justly estimated. That fine, exact, yet powerful work, of which the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2751" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2751"></td>
        <td id="LC2751" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Doge Loredano by Bellini, in the National Gallery, London, is a type,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2752" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2752"></td>
        <td id="LC2752" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was perhaps brought about by an amalgamation of Flemish and Venetian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2753" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2753"></td>
        <td id="LC2753" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">methods, and Antonello was perhaps the means of bringing it about. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2754" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2754"></td>
        <td id="LC2754" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was an excellent, if precise, portrait-painter.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2755" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2755"></td>
        <td id="LC2755" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2756" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2756"></td>
        <td id="LC2756" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     PRINCIPAL WORKS: PADUANS--Andrea Mantegna, Eremitani Padua,</td>
