        <td id="L2800" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2800"></td>
        <td id="LC2800" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Family (No. 6) Louvre (attributed to Giovanni Bellini);</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2801" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2801"></td>
        <td id="LC2801" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Diana, Altar-pieces Venice Acad.; Mansueti, large pictures</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2802" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2802"></td>
        <td id="LC2802" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Venice Acad.; Antonella da Messina, Portraits Louvre, Berlin</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2803" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2803"></td>
        <td id="LC2803" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     and Nat. Gal. Lon., Crucifixion Antwerp Mus.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2804" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2804"></td>
        <td id="LC2804" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2805" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2805"></td>
        <td id="LC2805" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2806" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2806"></td>
        <td id="LC2806" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2807" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2807"></td>
        <td id="LC2807" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2808" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2808"></td>
        <td id="LC2808" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHAPTER VIII.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2809" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2809"></td>
        <td id="LC2809" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2810" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2810"></td>
        <td id="LC2810" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ITALIAN PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2811" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2811"></td>
        <td id="LC2811" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2812" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2812"></td>
        <td id="LC2812" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE HIGH RENAISSANCE--1500-1600.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2813" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2813"></td>
        <td id="LC2813" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2814" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2814"></td>
        <td id="LC2814" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: Those on Italian art before mentioned,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2815" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2815"></td>
        <td id="LC2815" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     and also, Berenson, _Lorenzo Lotto_; Clement, _Michel Ange,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2816" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2816"></td>
        <td id="LC2816" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     L. da Vinci, Raphael_; Crowe and Cavalcaselle, _Titian_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2817" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2817"></td>
        <td id="LC2817" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     same authors, _Raphael_; Grimm, _Michael Angelo_; Gronau,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2818" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2818"></td>
        <td id="LC2818" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Titian_; Holroyd, _Michael Angelo_; Meyer, _Correggio_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2819" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2819"></td>
        <td id="LC2819" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Moore, _Correggio_; Muntz, _Leonardo da Vinci_; Passavant,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2820" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2820"></td>
        <td id="LC2820" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Raphael_; Pater, _Studies in History of Renaissance_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2821" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2821"></td>
        <td id="LC2821" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Phillips, _Titian_; Reumont, _Andrea del Sarto_; Ricci,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2822" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2822"></td>
        <td id="LC2822" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Correggio_; Richter, _Leonardo di Vinci_; Ridolfi, _Vita di</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2823" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2823"></td>
        <td id="LC2823" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Paolo Cagliari Veronese_; Springer, _Rafael und Michel</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2824" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2824"></td>
        <td id="LC2824" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Angelo_; Symonds, _Michael Angelo_; Taine, _Italy--Florence</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2825" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2825"></td>
        <td id="LC2825" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     and Venice_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2826" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2826"></td>
        <td id="LC2826" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2827" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2827"></td>
        <td id="LC2827" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2828" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2828"></td>
        <td id="LC2828" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE HIGHEST DEVELOPMENT: The word &quot;Renaissance&quot; has a broader meaning</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2829" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2829"></td>
        <td id="LC2829" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">than its strict etymology would imply. It was a &quot;new birth,&quot; but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2830" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2830"></td>
        <td id="LC2830" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">something more than the revival of Greek learning and the study of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2831" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2831"></td>
        <td id="LC2831" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature entered into it. It was the grand consummation of Italian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2832" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2832"></td>
        <td id="LC2832" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">intelligence in many departments--the arrival at maturity of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2833" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2833"></td>
        <td id="LC2833" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Christian trained mind tempered by the philosophy of Greece, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2834" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2834"></td>
        <td id="LC2834" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">knowledge of the actual world. Fully aroused at last, the Italian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2835" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2835"></td>
        <td id="LC2835" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">intellect became inquisitive, inventive, scientific, skeptical--yes,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2836" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2836"></td>
        <td id="LC2836" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">treacherous, immoral, polluted. It questioned all things, doubted</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2837" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2837"></td>
        <td id="LC2837" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">where it pleased, saturated itself with crime, corruption, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2838" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2838"></td>
        <td id="LC2838" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sensuality, yet bowed at the shrine of the beautiful and knelt at the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2839" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2839"></td>
        <td id="LC2839" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">altar of Christianity. It is an illustration of the contradictions</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2840" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2840"></td>
        <td id="LC2840" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that may exist when the intellectual, the religious, and the moral</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2841" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2841"></td>
        <td id="LC2841" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">are brought together, with the intellectual in predominance.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2842" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2842"></td>
        <td id="LC2842" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2843" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2843"></td>
        <td id="LC2843" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 38.--FRA BARTOLOMMEO. DESCENT FROM CROSS. PITTI.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2844" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2844"></td>
        <td id="LC2844" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2845" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2845"></td>
        <td id="LC2845" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">And that keen Renaissance intellect made swift progress. It remodelled</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2846" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2846"></td>
        <td id="LC2846" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the philosophy of Greece, and used its literature as a mould for its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2847" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2847"></td>
        <td id="LC2847" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">own. It developed Roman law and introduced modern science. The world</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2848" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2848"></td>
        <td id="LC2848" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">without and the world within were rediscovered. Land and sea, starry</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2849" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2849"></td>
        <td id="LC2849" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sky and planetary system, were fixed upon the chart. Man himself, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2850" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2850"></td>
        <td id="LC2850" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">animals, the planets, organic and inorganic life, the small things of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2851" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2851"></td>
        <td id="LC2851" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the earth gave up their secrets. Inventions utilized all classes of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2852" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2852"></td>
        <td id="LC2852" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">products, commerce flourished, free cities were builded, universities</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2853" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2853"></td>
        <td id="LC2853" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">arose, learning spread itself on the pages of newly invented books of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2854" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2854"></td>
        <td id="LC2854" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">print, and, perhaps, greatest of all, the arts arose on strong wings</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2855" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2855"></td>
        <td id="LC2855" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of life to the very highest altitude.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2856" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2856"></td>
        <td id="LC2856" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2857" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2857"></td>
        <td id="LC2857" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">For the moral side of the Renaissance intellect it had its tastes and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2858" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2858"></td>
        <td id="LC2858" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">refinements, as shown in its high quality of art; but it also had its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2859" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2859"></td>
        <td id="LC2859" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">polluting and degrading features, as shown in its political and social</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2860" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2860"></td>
        <td id="LC2860" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">life. Religion was visibly weakening though the ecclesiastical still</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2861" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2861"></td>
        <td id="LC2861" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">held strong. People were forgetting the faith of the early days, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2862" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2862"></td>
        <td id="LC2862" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">taking up with the material things about them. They were glorifying</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2863" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2863"></td>
        <td id="LC2863" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the human and exalting the natural. The story of Greece was being</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2864" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2864"></td>
        <td id="LC2864" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">repeated in Italy. And out of this new worship came jewels of rarity</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2865" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2865"></td>
        <td id="LC2865" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and beauty, but out of it also came faithlessness, corruption, vice.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2866" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2866"></td>
        <td id="LC2866" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2867" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2867"></td>
        <td id="LC2867" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Strictly speaking, the Renaissance had been accomplished before the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2868" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2868"></td>
        <td id="LC2868" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">year 1500, but so great was its impetus that, in the arts at least, it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2869" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2869"></td>
        <td id="LC2869" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">extended half-way through the sixteenth century. Then it began to fail</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2870" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2870"></td>
        <td id="LC2870" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">through exhaustion.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2871" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2871"></td>
        <td id="LC2871" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2872" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2872"></td>
        <td id="LC2872" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">MOTIVES AND METHODS: The religious subject still held with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2873" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2873"></td>
        <td id="LC2873" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters, but this subject in High-Renaissance days did not carry with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2874" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2874"></td>
        <td id="LC2874" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it the religious feeling as in Gothic days. Art had grown to be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2875" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2875"></td>
        <td id="LC2875" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">something else than a teacher of the Bible. In the painter&#39;s hands it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2876" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2876"></td>
        <td id="LC2876" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had come to mean beauty for its own sake--a picture beautiful for its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2877" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2877"></td>
        <td id="LC2877" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form and color, regardless of its theme. This was the teaching of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2878" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2878"></td>
        <td id="LC2878" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">antique art, and the study of nature but increased the belief. A new</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2879" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2879"></td>
        <td id="LC2879" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">love had arisen in the outer and visible world, and when the Church</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2880" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2880"></td>
        <td id="LC2880" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">called for altar-pieces the painters painted their new love,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2881" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2881"></td>
        <td id="LC2881" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">christened it with a religious title, and handed it forth in the name</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2882" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2882"></td>
        <td id="LC2882" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the old. Thus art began to free itself from Church domination and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2883" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2883"></td>
        <td id="LC2883" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to live as an independent beauty. The general motive, then, of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2884" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2884"></td>
        <td id="LC2884" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting during the High Renaissance, though apparently religious from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2885" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2885"></td>
        <td id="LC2885" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the subject, and in many cases still religious in feeling, was largely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2886" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2886"></td>
        <td id="LC2886" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to show the beauty of form or color, in which religion, the antique,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2887" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2887"></td>
        <td id="LC2887" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and the natural came in as modifying elements.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2888" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2888"></td>
        <td id="LC2888" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2889" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2889"></td>
        <td id="LC2889" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In technical methods, though extensive work was still done in fresco,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2890" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2890"></td>
        <td id="LC2890" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">especially at Florence and Rome, yet the bulk of High-Renaissance</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2891" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2891"></td>
        <td id="LC2891" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting was in oils upon panel and canvas. At Venice even the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2892" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2892"></td>
        <td id="LC2892" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decorative wall paintings were upon canvas, afterward inserted in wall</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2893" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2893"></td>
        <td id="LC2893" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">or ceiling.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2894" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2894"></td>
        <td id="LC2894" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2895" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2895"></td>
        <td id="LC2895" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 39.--ANDREA DEL SARTO. MADONNA OF ST. FRANCIS.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2896" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2896"></td>
        <td id="LC2896" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">UFFIZI.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2897" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2897"></td>
        <td id="LC2897" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2898" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2898"></td>
        <td id="LC2898" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE FLORENTINES AND ROMANS: There was a severity and austerity about</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2899" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2899"></td>
        <td id="LC2899" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Florentine art, even at its climax. It was never too sensuous and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2900" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2900"></td>
        <td id="LC2900" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">luxurious, but rather exact and intellectual. The Florentines were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2901" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2901"></td>
        <td id="LC2901" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fond of lustreless fresco, architectural composition, towering or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2902" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2902"></td>
        <td id="LC2902" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sweeping lines, rather sharp color as compared with the Venetians, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2903" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2903"></td>
        <td id="LC2903" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">theological, classical, even literary and allegorical subjects.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2904" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2904"></td>
        <td id="LC2904" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Probably this was largely due to the classic bias of the painters and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2905" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2905"></td>
        <td id="LC2905" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the intellectual and social influences of Florence and Rome. Line and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2906" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2906"></td>
        <td id="LC2906" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition were means of expressing abstract thought better than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2907" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2907"></td>
        <td id="LC2907" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color, though some of the Florentines employed both line and color</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2908" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2908"></td>
        <td id="LC2908" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">knowingly.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2909" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2909"></td>
        <td id="LC2909" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2910" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2910"></td>
        <td id="LC2910" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">This was the case with Fra Bartolommeo (1475-1517), a monk of San</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2911" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2911"></td>
        <td id="LC2911" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Marco, who was a transition painter from the fifteenth to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2912" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2912"></td>
        <td id="LC2912" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sixteenth century. He was a religionist, a follower of Savonarola, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2913" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2913"></td>
        <td id="LC2913" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a man of soul who thought to do work of a religious character and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2914" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2914"></td>
        <td id="LC2914" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">feeling; but he was also a fine painter, excelling in composition,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2915" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2915"></td>
        <td id="LC2915" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">drawing, drapery, color. The painter&#39;s element in his work, its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2916" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2916"></td>
        <td id="LC2916" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">material and earthly beauty, rather detracted from its spiritual</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2917" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2917"></td>
        <td id="LC2917" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">significance. He opposed the sensuous and the nude, and yet about the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2918" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2918"></td>
        <td id="LC2918" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">only nude he ever painted--a St. Sebastian for San Marco--had so much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2919" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2919"></td>
        <td id="LC2919" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the earthly about it that people forgot the suffering saint in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2920" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2920"></td>
        <td id="LC2920" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">admiring the fine body, and the picture had to be removed from the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2921" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2921"></td>
        <td id="LC2921" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">convent. In such ways religion in art was gradually undermined, not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2922" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2922"></td>
        <td id="LC2922" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">alone by naturalism and classicism but by art itself. Painting brought</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2923" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2923"></td>
        <td id="LC2923" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">into life by religion no sooner reached maturity than it led people</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2924" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2924"></td>
        <td id="LC2924" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">away from religion by pointing out sensuous beauties in the type</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2925" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2925"></td>
        <td id="LC2925" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rather than religious beauties in the symbol.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2926" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2926"></td>
        <td id="LC2926" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2927" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2927"></td>
        <td id="LC2927" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Fra Bartolommeo was among the last of the pietists in art. He had no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2928" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2928"></td>
        <td id="LC2928" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great imagination, but some feeling and a fine color-sense for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2929" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2929"></td>
        <td id="LC2929" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Florence. Naturally he was influenced somewhat by the great ones about</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2930" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2930"></td>
        <td id="LC2930" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">him, learning perspective from Raphael, grandeur from Michael Angelo,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2931" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2931"></td>
        <td id="LC2931" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and contours from Leonardo da Vinci. He worked in collaboration with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2932" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2932"></td>
        <td id="LC2932" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Albertinelli (1474-1515), a skilled artist and a fellow-pupil with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2933" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2933"></td>
        <td id="LC2933" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Bartolommeo in the workshop of Cosimo Rosselli. Their work is so much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2934" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2934"></td>
        <td id="LC2934" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">alike that it is often difficult to distinguish the painters apart.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2935" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2935"></td>
        <td id="LC2935" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Albertinelli was not so devout as his companion, but he painted the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2936" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2936"></td>
        <td id="LC2936" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">religious subject with feeling, as his Visitation in the Uffizi</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2937" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2937"></td>
        <td id="LC2937" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">indicates. Among the followers of Bartolommeo and Albertinelli were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2938" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2938"></td>
        <td id="LC2938" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Fra Paolino (14901547), Bugiardini (1475-1554), Granacci (1477-1543),</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2939" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2939"></td>
        <td id="LC2939" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">who showed many influences, and Ridolfo Ghirlandajo (1483-1561).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2940" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2940"></td>
        <td id="LC2940" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2941" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2941"></td>
        <td id="LC2941" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 40.--MICHAEL ANGELO. ATHLETE. SISTINE, ROME.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2942" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2942"></td>
        <td id="LC2942" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2943" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2943"></td>
        <td id="LC2943" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Andrea del Sarto (1486-1531) was a Florentine pure and simple--a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2944" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2944"></td>
        <td id="LC2944" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter for the Church producing many madonnas and altar-pieces, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2945" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2945"></td>
        <td id="LC2945" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">yet possessed of little religious feeling or depth. He was a painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2946" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2946"></td>
        <td id="LC2946" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">more than a pietist, and was called by his townsmen &quot;the faultless</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2947" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2947"></td>
        <td id="LC2947" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter.&quot; So he was as regards the technical features of his art. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2948" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2948"></td>
        <td id="LC2948" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was the best brushman and colorist of the Florentine school. Dealing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2949" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2949"></td>
        <td id="LC2949" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">largely with the material side his craftsmanship was excellent and his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2950" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2950"></td>
        <td id="LC2950" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictures exuberant with life and color, but his madonnas and saints</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2951" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2951"></td>
        <td id="LC2951" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were decidedly of the earth--handsome Florentine models garbed as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2952" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2952"></td>
        <td id="LC2952" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sacred characters--well-drawn and easily painted, with little</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2953" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2953"></td>
        <td id="LC2953" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">devotional feeling about them. He was influenced by other painters to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2954" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2954"></td>
        <td id="LC2954" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">some extent. Masaccio, Ghirlandajo, and Michael Angelo were his models</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2955" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2955"></td>
        <td id="LC2955" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in drawing; Leonardo and Bartolommeo in contours; while in warmth of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2956" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2956"></td>
        <td id="LC2956" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color, brush-work, atmospheric and landscape effects he was quite by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2957" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2957"></td>
        <td id="LC2957" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">himself. He had a large number of pupils and followers, but most of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2958" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2958"></td>
        <td id="LC2958" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">them deserted him later on to follow Michael Angelo. Pontormo</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2959" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2959"></td>
        <td id="LC2959" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1493-1558) and Franciabigio (1482-1525) were among the best of them.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2960" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2960"></td>
        <td id="LC2960" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2961" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2961"></td>
        <td id="LC2961" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Michael Angelo (1474-1564) has been called the &quot;Prophet of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2962" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2962"></td>
        <td id="LC2962" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Renaissance,&quot; and perhaps deserves the title, since he was more of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2963" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2963"></td>
        <td id="LC2963" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Old Testament than the New--more of the austere and imperious than the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2964" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2964"></td>
        <td id="LC2964" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">loving or the forgiving. There was no sentimental feature about his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2965" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2965"></td>
        <td id="LC2965" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art. His conception was intellectual, highly imaginative, mysterious,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2966" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2966"></td>
        <td id="LC2966" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at times disordered and turbulent in its strength. He came the nearest</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2967" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2967"></td>
        <td id="LC2967" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to the sublime of any painter in history through the sole attribute of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2968" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2968"></td>
        <td id="LC2968" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">power. He had no tenderness nor any winning charm. He did not win, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2969" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2969"></td>
        <td id="LC2969" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rather commanded. Everything he saw or felt was studied for the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2970" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2970"></td>
        <td id="LC2970" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strength that was in it. Religion, Old-Testament history, the antique,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2971" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2971"></td>
        <td id="LC2971" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">humanity, all turned in his hands into symbolic forms of power, put</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2972" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2972"></td>
        <td id="LC2972" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">forth apparently in the white heat of passion, and at times in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2973" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2973"></td>
        <td id="LC2973" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">defiance of every rule and tradition of art. Personal feeling was very</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2974" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2974"></td>
        <td id="LC2974" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">apparent in his work, and in this he was as far removed as possible</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2975" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2975"></td>
        <td id="LC2975" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">from the Greeks, and nearer to what one would call to-day a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2976" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2976"></td>
        <td id="LC2976" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romanticist. There was little of the objective about him. He was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2977" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2977"></td>
        <td id="LC2977" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">an imitator of facts but a creator of forms and ideas. His art was a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2978" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2978"></td>
        <td id="LC2978" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reflection of himself--a self-sufficient man, positive, creative,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2979" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2979"></td>
        <td id="LC2979" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">standing alone, a law unto himself.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2980" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2980"></td>
        <td id="LC2980" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2981" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2981"></td>
        <td id="LC2981" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Technically he was more of a sculptor than a painter. He said so</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2982" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2982"></td>
        <td id="LC2982" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">himself when Julius commanded him to paint the Sistine ceiling, and he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2983" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2983"></td>
        <td id="LC2983" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">told the truth. He was a magnificent draughtsman, and drew magnificent</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2984" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2984"></td>
        <td id="LC2984" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sculpturesque figures on the Sistine vault. That was about all his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2985" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2985"></td>
        <td id="LC2985" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">achievement with the brush. In color, light, air, perspective--in all</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2986" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2986"></td>
        <td id="LC2986" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">those features peculiar to the painter--he was behind his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2987" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2987"></td>
        <td id="LC2987" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">contemporaries. Composition he knew a great deal about, and in drawing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2988" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2988"></td>
        <td id="LC2988" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he had the most positive, far-reaching command of line of any painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2989" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2989"></td>
        <td id="LC2989" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of any time. It was in drawing that he showed his power. Even this is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2990" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2990"></td>
        <td id="LC2990" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">severe and harsh at times, and then again filled with a grace that is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2991" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2991"></td>
        <td id="LC2991" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">majestic and in scope universal, as witness the Creation of Adam in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2992" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2992"></td>
        <td id="LC2992" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Sistine.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2993" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2993"></td>
        <td id="LC2993" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2994" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2994"></td>
        <td id="LC2994" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 41.--RAPHAEL. LA BELLE JARDINIERE. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2995" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2995"></td>
        <td id="LC2995" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2996" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2996"></td>
        <td id="LC2996" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He came out of Florence, a pupil of Ghirlandajo, with a school feeling</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2997" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2997"></td>
        <td id="LC2997" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for line, stimulated by the frescos of Masaccio and Signorelli. At an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2998" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2998"></td>
        <td id="LC2998" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early age he declared himself, and hewed a path of his own through</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L2999" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="2999"></td>
        <td id="LC2999" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art, sweeping along with him many of the slighter painters of his age.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3000" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3000"></td>
        <td id="LC3000" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Long-lived he saw his contemporaries die about him and Humanism end in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3001" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3001"></td>
        <td id="LC3001" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bloodshed with the coming of the Jesuits; but alone, gloomy, resolute,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3002" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3002"></td>
        <td id="LC3002" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">steadfast to his belief, he held his way, the last great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3003" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3003"></td>
        <td id="LC3003" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">representative of Florentine art, the first great representative of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3004" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3004"></td>
        <td id="LC3004" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">individualism in art. With him and after him came many followers who</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3005" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3005"></td>
        <td id="LC3005" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strove to imitate his &quot;terrible style,&quot; but they did not succeed any</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3006" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3006"></td>
        <td id="LC3006" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">too well.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3007" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3007"></td>
        <td id="LC3007" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3008" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3008"></td>
        <td id="LC3008" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The most of these followers find classification under the Mannerists</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3009" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3009"></td>
        <td id="LC3009" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the Decadence. Of those who were immediate pupils of Michael</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3010" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3010"></td>
        <td id="LC3010" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Angelo, or carried out his designs, Daniele da Volterra (1509-1566)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3011" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3011"></td>
        <td id="LC3011" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was one of the most satisfactory. His chief work, the Descent from the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3012" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3012"></td>
        <td id="LC3012" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cross, was considered by Poussin as one of the three great pictures of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3013" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3013"></td>
        <td id="LC3013" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the world. It is sometimes said to have been designed by Michael</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3014" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3014"></td>
        <td id="LC3014" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Angelo, but that is only a conjecture. It has much action and life in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3015" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3015"></td>
        <td id="LC3015" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it, but is somewhat affected in pose and gesture, and Volterra&#39;s work</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3016" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3016"></td>
        <td id="LC3016" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">generally was deficient in real energy of conception and execution.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3017" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3017"></td>
        <td id="LC3017" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Marcello Venusti (1515-1585?) painted directly from Michael Angelo&#39;s</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3018" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3018"></td>
        <td id="LC3018" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">designs in a delicate and precise way, probably imbibed from his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3019" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3019"></td>
        <td id="LC3019" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">master, Perino del Vaga, and from association with Venetians like</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3020" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3020"></td>
        <td id="LC3020" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sebastiano del Piombo (1485-1547). This last-named painter was born in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3021" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3021"></td>
        <td id="LC3021" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Venice and trained under Bellini and Giorgione, inheriting the color</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3022" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3022"></td>
        <td id="LC3022" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and light-and-shade qualities of the Venetians; but later on he went</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3023" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3023"></td>
        <td id="LC3023" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to Rome and came under the influence of Michael Angelo and Raphael. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3024" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3024"></td>
        <td id="LC3024" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">tried, under Michael Angelo&#39;s inspiration it is said, to unite the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3025" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3025"></td>
        <td id="LC3025" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Florentine grandeur of line with the Venetian coloring, and thus outdo</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3026" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3026"></td>
        <td id="LC3026" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Raphael. It was not wholly successful, though resulting in an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3027" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3027"></td>
        <td id="LC3027" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">excellent quality of art. As a portrait-painter he was above reproach.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3028" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3028"></td>
        <td id="LC3028" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">His early works were rather free in impasto, the late ones smooth and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3029" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3029"></td>
        <td id="LC3029" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shiny, in imitation of Raphael.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3030" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3030"></td>
        <td id="LC3030" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3031" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3031"></td>
        <td id="LC3031" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Raphael Sanzio (1483-1520) was more Greek in method than any of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3032" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3032"></td>
        <td id="LC3032" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great Renaissance painters. In subject he was not more classic than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3033" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3033"></td>
        <td id="LC3033" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">others of his time; he painted all subjects. In thought he was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3034" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3034"></td>
        <td id="LC3034" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">particularly classic; he was chiefly intellectual, with a leaning</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3035" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3035"></td>
        <td id="LC3035" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">toward the sensuous that was half-pagan. It was in method and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3036" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3036"></td>
        <td id="LC3036" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">expression more than elsewhere that he showed the Greek spirit. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3037" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3037"></td>
        <td id="LC3037" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">aimed at the ideal and the universal, independent, so far as possible,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3038" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3038"></td>
        <td id="LC3038" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the individual, and sought by a union of all elements to produce</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3039" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3039"></td>
        <td id="LC3039" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">perfect harmony. The Harmonist of the Renaissance is his title. And</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3040" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3040"></td>
        <td id="LC3040" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this harmony extended to a blending of thought, form, and expression,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3041" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3041"></td>
        <td id="LC3041" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">heightening or modifying every element until they ran together with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3042" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3042"></td>
        <td id="LC3042" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">such rhythm that it could not be seen where one left off and another</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3043" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3043"></td>
        <td id="LC3043" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">began. He was the very opposite of Michael Angelo. The art of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3044" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3044"></td>
        <td id="LC3044" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">latter was an expression of individual power and was purely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3045" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3045"></td>
        <td id="LC3045" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjective. Raphael&#39;s art was largely a unity of objective beauties,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3046" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3046"></td>
        <td id="LC3046" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with the personal element as much in abeyance as was possible for his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3047" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3047"></td>
        <td id="LC3047" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3048" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3048"></td>
        <td id="LC3048" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3049" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3049"></td>
        <td id="LC3049" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">His education was a cultivation of every grace of mind and hand. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3050" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3050"></td>
        <td id="LC3050" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">assimilated freely whatever he found to be good in the art about him.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3051" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3051"></td>
        <td id="LC3051" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">A pupil of Perugino originally, he levied upon features of excellence</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3052" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3052"></td>
        <td id="LC3052" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in Masaccio, Fra Bartolommeo, Leonardo, Michael Angelo. From the first</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3053" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3053"></td>
        <td id="LC3053" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he got tenderness, from the second drawing, from the third color and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3054" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3054"></td>
        <td id="LC3054" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition, from the fourth charm, from the fifth force. Like an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3055" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3055"></td>
        <td id="LC3055" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">eclectic Greek he drew from all sources, and then blended and united</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3056" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3056"></td>
        <td id="LC3056" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">these features in a peculiar style of his own and stamped them with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3057" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3057"></td>
        <td id="LC3057" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his peculiar Raphaelesque stamp.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3058" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3058"></td>
        <td id="LC3058" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3059" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3059"></td>
        <td id="LC3059" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In subject Raphael was religious and mythological, but he was imbued</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3060" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3060"></td>
        <td id="LC3060" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with neither of these so far as the initial spirit was concerned. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3061" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3061"></td>
        <td id="LC3061" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">looked at all subjects in a calm, intellectual, artistic way. Even the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3062" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3062"></td>
        <td id="LC3062" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">celebrated Sistine Madonna is more intellectual than pietistic, a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3063" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3063"></td>
        <td id="LC3063" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Christian Minerva ruling rather than helping to save the world. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3064" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3064"></td>
        <td id="LC3064" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">same spirit ruled him in classic and theological themes. He did not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3065" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3065"></td>
        <td id="LC3065" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">feel them keenly or execute them passionately--at least there is no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3066" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3066"></td>
        <td id="LC3066" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">indication of it in his work. The doing so would have destroyed unity,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3067" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3067"></td>
        <td id="LC3067" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">symmetry, repose. The theme was ever held in check by a regard for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3068" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3068"></td>
        <td id="LC3068" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">proportion and rhythm. To keep all artistic elements in perfect</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3069" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3069"></td>
        <td id="LC3069" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">equilibrium, allowing no one to predominate, seemed the mainspring of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3070" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3070"></td>
        <td id="LC3070" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his action, and in doing this he created that harmony which his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3071" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3071"></td>
        <td id="LC3071" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">admirers sometimes refer to as pure beauty.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3072" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3072"></td>
        <td id="LC3072" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3073" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3073"></td>
        <td id="LC3073" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">For his period and school he was rather remarkable technically. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3074" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3074"></td>
        <td id="LC3074" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">excelled in everything except brush-work, which was never brought to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3075" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3075"></td>
        <td id="LC3075" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">maturity in either Florence or Rome. Even in color he was fine for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3076" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3076"></td>
        <td id="LC3076" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Florence, though not equal to the Venetians. In composition,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3077" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3077"></td>
        <td id="LC3077" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">modelling, line, even in texture painting (see his portraits) he was a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3078" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3078"></td>
        <td id="LC3078" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">man of accomplishment; while in grace, purity, serenity, loftiness he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3079" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3079"></td>
        <td id="LC3079" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was the Florentine leader easily first.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3080" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3080"></td>
        <td id="LC3080" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3081" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3081"></td>
        <td id="LC3081" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 42.--GIULIO ROMANO. APOLLO AND MUSES. PITTI.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3082" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3082"></td>
        <td id="LC3082" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3083" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3083"></td>
        <td id="LC3083" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The influence of Raphael&#39;s example was largely felt throughout Central</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3084" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3084"></td>
        <td id="LC3084" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy, and even at the north, resulting in many imitators and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3085" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3085"></td>
        <td id="LC3085" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">followers, who tried to produce Raphaelesque effects. Their efforts</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3086" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3086"></td>
        <td id="LC3086" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were usually successful in precipitating charm into sweetness and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3087" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3087"></td>
        <td id="LC3087" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentiment into sentimentality. Francesco Penni (1488?-1528) seems to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3088" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3088"></td>
        <td id="LC3088" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">have been content to work under Raphael with some ability. Giulio</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3089" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3089"></td>
        <td id="LC3089" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Romano (1492-1546) was the strongest of the pupils, and became the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3090" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3090"></td>
        <td id="LC3090" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">founder and leader of the Roman school, which had considerable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3091" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3091"></td>
        <td id="LC3091" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence upon the painters of the Decadence. He adopted the classic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3092" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3092"></td>
        <td id="LC3092" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subject and tried to adopt Raphael&#39;s style, but he was not completely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3093" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3093"></td>
        <td id="LC3093" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">successful. Raphael&#39;s refinement in Giulio&#39;s hands became exaggerated</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3094" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3094"></td>
        <td id="LC3094" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">coarseness. He was a good draughtsman, but rather hot as a colorist,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3095" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3095"></td>
        <td id="LC3095" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and a composer of violent, restless, and, at times, contorted groups.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3096" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3096"></td>
        <td id="LC3096" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He was a prolific painter, but his work tended toward the baroque</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3097" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3097"></td>
        <td id="LC3097" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">style, and had a bad influence on the succeeding schools.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3098" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3098"></td>
        <td id="LC3098" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3099" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3099"></td>
        <td id="LC3099" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Primaticcio (1504-1570) was one of his followers, and had much to do</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3100" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3100"></td>
        <td id="LC3100" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with the founding of the school of Fontainebleau in France. Giovanni</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3101" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3101"></td>
        <td id="LC3101" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">da Udine (1487-1564), a Venetian trained painter, became a follower of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3102" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3102"></td>
        <td id="LC3102" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Raphael, his only originality showing in decorative designs. Perino</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3103" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3103"></td>
        <td id="LC3103" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">del Vaga (1500-1547) was of the same cast of mind. Andrea Sabbatini</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3104" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3104"></td>
        <td id="LC3104" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1480?-1545) carried Raphael&#39;s types and methods to the south of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3105" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3105"></td>
        <td id="LC3105" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy, and some artists at Bologna, and in Umbria, like Innocenza da</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3106" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3106"></td>
        <td id="LC3106" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Imola (1494-1550?), and Timoteo di Viti (1467-1523), adopted the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3107" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3107"></td>
        <td id="LC3107" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Raphael type and method to the detriment of what native talent they</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3108" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3108"></td>
        <td id="LC3108" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">may have possessed, though about Timoteo there is some doubt whether</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3109" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3109"></td>
        <td id="LC3109" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he adopted Raphael&#39;s type, or Raphael his type.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3110" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3110"></td>
        <td id="LC3110" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
