      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3162" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3162"></td>
        <td id="LC3162" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3163" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3163"></td>
        <td id="LC3163" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3164" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3164"></td>
        <td id="LC3164" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHAPTER IX.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3165" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3165"></td>
        <td id="LC3165" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3166" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3166"></td>
        <td id="LC3166" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ITALIAN PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3167" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3167"></td>
        <td id="LC3167" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3168" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3168"></td>
        <td id="LC3168" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE HIGH RENAISSANCE, 1500-1600.--CONTINUED.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3169" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3169"></td>
        <td id="LC3169" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3170" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3170"></td>
        <td id="LC3170" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: The works on Italian art before mentioned</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3171" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3171"></td>
        <td id="LC3171" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     and consult also the General Bibliography (p. xv.)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3172" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3172"></td>
        <td id="LC3172" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3173" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3173"></td>
        <td id="LC3173" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3174" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3174"></td>
        <td id="LC3174" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">LEONARDO DA VINCI AND THE MILANESE: The third person in the great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3175" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3175"></td>
        <td id="LC3175" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Florentine trinity of painters was Leonardo da Vinci (1452-1519), the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3176" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3176"></td>
        <td id="LC3176" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">other two being Michael Angelo and Raphael. He greatly influenced the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3177" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3177"></td>
        <td id="LC3177" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school of Milan, and has usually been classed with the Milanese, yet</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3178" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3178"></td>
        <td id="LC3178" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he was educated in Florence, in the workshop of Verrocchio, and was so</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3179" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3179"></td>
        <td id="LC3179" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">universal in thought and methods that he hardly belongs to any school.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3180" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3180"></td>
        <td id="LC3180" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3181" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3181"></td>
        <td id="LC3181" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He has been named a realist, an idealist, a magician, a wizard, a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3182" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3182"></td>
        <td id="LC3182" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dreamer, and finally a scientist, by different writers, yet he was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3183" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3183"></td>
        <td id="LC3183" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">none of these things while being all of them--a full-rounded,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3184" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3184"></td>
        <td id="LC3184" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">universal man, learned in many departments and excelling in whatever</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3185" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3185"></td>
        <td id="LC3185" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he undertook. He had the scientific and experimental way of looking at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3186" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3186"></td>
        <td id="LC3186" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">things. That is perhaps to be regretted, since it resulted in his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3187" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3187"></td>
        <td id="LC3187" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">experimenting with everything and completing little of anything. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3188" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3188"></td>
        <td id="LC3188" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">different tastes and pursuits pulled him different ways, and his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3189" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3189"></td>
        <td id="LC3189" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">knowledge made him sceptical of his own powers. He pondered and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3190" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3190"></td>
        <td id="LC3190" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">thought how to reach up higher, how to penetrate deeper, how to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3191" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3191"></td>
        <td id="LC3191" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">realize more comprehensively, and in the end he gave up in despair. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3192" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3192"></td>
        <td id="LC3192" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">could not fulfil his ideal of the head of Christ nor the head of Mona</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3193" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3193"></td>
        <td id="LC3193" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Lisa, and after years of labor he left them unfinished. The problem</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3194" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3194"></td>
        <td id="LC3194" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of human life, the spirit, the world engrossed him, and all his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3195" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3195"></td>
        <td id="LC3195" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">creations seem impregnated with the psychological, the mystical, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3196" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3196"></td>
        <td id="LC3196" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unattainable, the hidden.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3197" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3197"></td>
        <td id="LC3197" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3198" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3198"></td>
        <td id="LC3198" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 43.--LEONARDO DA VINCI. MONA LISA. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3199" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3199"></td>
        <td id="LC3199" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3200" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3200"></td>
        <td id="LC3200" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He was no religionist, though painting the religious subject with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3201" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3201"></td>
        <td id="LC3201" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">feeling; he was not in any sense a classicist, nor had he any care for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3202" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3202"></td>
        <td id="LC3202" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the antique marbles, which he considered a study of nature at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3203" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3203"></td>
        <td id="LC3203" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">second-hand. He was more in love with physical life without being an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3204" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3204"></td>
        <td id="LC3204" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">enthusiast over it. His regard for contours, rhythm of line, blend of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3205" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3205"></td>
        <td id="LC3205" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light with shade, study of atmosphere, perspective, trees, animals,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3206" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3206"></td>
        <td id="LC3206" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">humanity, show that though he examined nature scientifically, he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3207" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3207"></td>
        <td id="LC3207" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictured it aesthetically. In his types there is much sweetness of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3208" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3208"></td>
        <td id="LC3208" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">soul, charm of disposition, dignity of mien, even grandeur and majesty</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3209" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3209"></td>
        <td id="LC3209" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of presence. His people we would like to know better. They are full of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3210" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3210"></td>
        <td id="LC3210" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">life, intelligence, sympathy; they have fascination of manner,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3211" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3211"></td>
        <td id="LC3211" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">winsomeness of mood, grace of bearing. We see this in his best-known</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3212" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3212"></td>
        <td id="LC3212" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work--the Mona Lisa of the Louvre. It has much allurement of personal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3213" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3213"></td>
        <td id="LC3213" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">presence, with a depth and abundance of soul altogether charming.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3214" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3214"></td>
        <td id="LC3214" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3215" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3215"></td>
        <td id="LC3215" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Technically, Leonardo was not a handler of the brush superior in any</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3216" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3216"></td>
        <td id="LC3216" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">way to his Florentine contemporaries. He knew all the methods and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3217" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3217"></td>
        <td id="LC3217" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mediums of the time, and did much to establish oil-painting among the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3218" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3218"></td>
        <td id="LC3218" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Florentines, but he was never a painter like Titian, or even Correggio</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3219" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3219"></td>
        <td id="LC3219" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">or Andrea del Sarto. A splendid draughtsman, a man of invention,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3220" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3220"></td>
        <td id="LC3220" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">imagination, grace, elegance, and power, he nevertheless carried more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3221" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3221"></td>
        <td id="LC3221" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by mental penetration and aesthetic sense than by his technical skill.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3222" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3222"></td>
        <td id="LC3222" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He was one of the great men of the Renaissance, and deservedly holds a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3223" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3223"></td>
        <td id="LC3223" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">place in the front rank.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3224" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3224"></td>
        <td id="LC3224" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3225" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3225"></td>
        <td id="LC3225" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Though Leonardo&#39;s accomplishment seems slight because of the little</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3226" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3226"></td>
        <td id="LC3226" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that is left to us, yet he had a great following not only among the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3227" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3227"></td>
        <td id="LC3227" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Florentines but at Milan, where Vincenza Foppa had started a school in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3228" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3228"></td>
        <td id="LC3228" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Early Renaissance time. Leonardo was there for fourteen years, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3229" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3229"></td>
        <td id="LC3229" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his artistic personality influenced many painters to adopt his type</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3230" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3230"></td>
        <td id="LC3230" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and methods. Bernardino Luini (1475?-1532?) was the most prominent of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3231" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3231"></td>
        <td id="LC3231" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the disciples. He cultivated Leonardo&#39;s sentiment, style, subjects,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3232" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3232"></td>
        <td id="LC3232" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and composition in his middle period, but later on developed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3233" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3233"></td>
        <td id="LC3233" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">independence and originality. He came at a period of art when that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3234" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3234"></td>
        <td id="LC3234" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">earnestness of characterization which marked the early men was giving</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3235" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3235"></td>
        <td id="LC3235" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">way to gracefulness of recitation, and that was the chief feature of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3236" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3236"></td>
        <td id="LC3236" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his art. For that matter gracefulness and pathetic sweetness of mood,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3237" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3237"></td>
        <td id="LC3237" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with purity of line and warmth of color characterized all the Milanese</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3238" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3238"></td>
        <td id="LC3238" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3239" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3239"></td>
        <td id="LC3239" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3240" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3240"></td>
        <td id="LC3240" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 44.--LUINI. DAUGHTER OF HERODIAS WITH HEAD OF JOHN</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3241" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3241"></td>
        <td id="LC3241" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE BAPTIST. UFFIZI.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3242" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3242"></td>
        <td id="LC3242" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3243" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3243"></td>
        <td id="LC3243" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The more prominent lights of the school were Salaino (fl. 1495-1518),</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3244" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3244"></td>
        <td id="LC3244" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of whose work nothing authentic exists, Boltraffio (1467-1516), a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3245" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3245"></td>
        <td id="LC3245" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter of limitations but of much refinement and purity, and Marco da</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3246" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3246"></td>
        <td id="LC3246" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Oggiono (1470?-1530) a close follower of Leonardo. Solario</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3247" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3247"></td>
        <td id="LC3247" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1458?-1515?) probably became acquainted early with the Flemish mode</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3248" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3248"></td>
        <td id="LC3248" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of working practised by Antonello da Messina, but he afterward came</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3249" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3249"></td>
        <td id="LC3249" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">under Leonardo&#39;s spell at Milan. He was a careful, refined painter,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3250" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3250"></td>
        <td id="LC3250" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">possessed of feeling and tenderness, producing pictures with enamelled</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3251" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3251"></td>
        <td id="LC3251" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">surfaces and much detail. Gianpietrino (fl. 1520-1540) and Cesare da</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3252" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3252"></td>
        <td id="LC3252" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sesto (1477-1523?) were also of the Milanese school, the latter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3253" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3253"></td>
        <td id="LC3253" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">afterward falling under the Raphael influence. Gaudenzio Ferrara</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3254" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3254"></td>
        <td id="LC3254" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1481?-1547?), an exceptionally brilliant colorist and a painter of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3255" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3255"></td>
        <td id="LC3255" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">much distinction, was under Leonardo&#39;s influence at one time, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3256" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3256"></td>
        <td id="LC3256" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with the teachings of that master he mingled a little of Raphael in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3257" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3257"></td>
        <td id="LC3257" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the type of face. He was an uneven painter, often excessive in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3258" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3258"></td>
        <td id="LC3258" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentiment, but at his best one of the most charming of the northern</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3259" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3259"></td>
        <td id="LC3259" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3260" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3260"></td>
        <td id="LC3260" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3261" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3261"></td>
        <td id="LC3261" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SODOMA AND THE SIENNESE: Sienna, alive in the fourteenth century to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3262" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3262"></td>
        <td id="LC3262" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all that was stirring in art, in the fifteenth century was in complete</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3263" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3263"></td>
        <td id="LC3263" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">eclipse, no painters of consequence emanating from there or being</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3264" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3264"></td>
        <td id="LC3264" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">established there. In the sixteenth century there was a revival of art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3265" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3265"></td>
        <td id="LC3265" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">because of a northern painter settling there and building up a new</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3266" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3266"></td>
        <td id="LC3266" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school. This painter was Sodoma (1477?-1549). He was one of the best</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3267" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3267"></td>
        <td id="LC3267" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pupils of Leonardo da Vinci, a master of the human figure, handling it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3268" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3268"></td>
        <td id="LC3268" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with much grace and charm of expression, but not so successful with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3269" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3269"></td>
        <td id="LC3269" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">groups or studied compositions, wherein he was inclined to huddle and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3270" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3270"></td>
        <td id="LC3270" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">over-crowd space. He was afterward led off by the brilliant success of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3271" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3271"></td>
        <td id="LC3271" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Raphael, and adopted something of that master&#39;s style. His best work</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3272" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3272"></td>
        <td id="LC3272" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was done in fresco, though he did some easel pictures that have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3273" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3273"></td>
        <td id="LC3273" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">darkened very much through time. He was a friend of Raphael, and his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3274" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3274"></td>
        <td id="LC3274" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portrait appears beside Raphael&#39;s in the latter painter&#39;s celebrated</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3275" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3275"></td>
        <td id="LC3275" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">School of Athens. The pupils and followers of the Siennese School were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3276" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3276"></td>
        <td id="LC3276" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not men of great strength. Pacchiarotta (1474-1540?), Girolamo della</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3277" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3277"></td>
        <td id="LC3277" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Pacchia (1477-1535), Peruzzi (1481-1536), a half-Lombard half-Umbrian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3278" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3278"></td>
        <td id="LC3278" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter of ability, and Beccafumi (1486-1551) were the principal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3279" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3279"></td>
        <td id="LC3279" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lights. The influence of the school was slight.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3280" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3280"></td>
        <td id="LC3280" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3281" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3281"></td>
        <td id="LC3281" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 45.--SODOMA. ECSTASY OF ST. CATHERINE. SIENNA.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3282" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3282"></td>
        <td id="LC3282" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3283" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3283"></td>
        <td id="LC3283" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">FERRARA AND BOLOGNESE SCHOOLS: The painters of these schools during</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3284" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3284"></td>
        <td id="LC3284" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the sixteenth century have usually been classed among the followers</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3285" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3285"></td>
        <td id="LC3285" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and imitators of Raphael, but not without some injustice. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3286" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3286"></td>
        <td id="LC3286" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence of Raphael was great throughout Central Italy, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3287" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3287"></td>
        <td id="LC3287" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Ferrarese and Bolognese felt it, but not to the extinction of their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3288" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3288"></td>
        <td id="LC3288" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">native thought and methods. Moreover, there was some influence in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3289" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3289"></td>
        <td id="LC3289" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color coming from the Venetian school, but again not to the entire</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3290" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3290"></td>
        <td id="LC3290" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">extinction of Ferrarese individuality. Dosso Dossi (1479?-1541), at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3291" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3291"></td>
        <td id="LC3291" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Ferrara, a pupil of Lorenzo Costa, was the chief painter of the time,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3292" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3292"></td>
        <td id="LC3292" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and he showed more of Giorgione in color and light-and-shade than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3293" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3293"></td>
        <td id="LC3293" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">anyone else, yet he never abandoned the yellows, greens, and reds</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3294" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3294"></td>
        <td id="LC3294" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">peculiar to Ferrara, and both he and Garofolo were strikingly original</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3295" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3295"></td>
        <td id="LC3295" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in their background landscapes. Garofolo (1481-1559) was a pupil of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3296" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3296"></td>
        <td id="LC3296" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Panetti and Costa, who made several visits to Rome and there fell in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3297" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3297"></td>
        <td id="LC3297" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">love with Raphael&#39;s work, which showed in a fondness for the sweep and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3298" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3298"></td>
        <td id="LC3298" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">flow of line, in the type of face adopted, and in the calmness of his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3299" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3299"></td>
        <td id="LC3299" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">many easel pictures. He was not so dramatic a painter as Dosso, and in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3300" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3300"></td>
        <td id="LC3300" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">addition he had certain mannerisms or earmarks, such as sootiness in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3301" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3301"></td>
        <td id="LC3301" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his flesh tints and brightness in his yellows and greens, with dulness</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3302" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3302"></td>
        <td id="LC3302" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in his reds. He was always Ferrarese in his landscapes and in the main</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3303" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3303"></td>
        <td id="LC3303" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">characteristics of his technic. Mazzolino (1478?-1528?) was another of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3304" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3304"></td>
        <td id="LC3304" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the school, probably a pupil of Panetti. He was an elaborate painter,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3305" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3305"></td>
        <td id="LC3305" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fond of architectural backgrounds and glowing colors enlivened with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3306" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3306"></td>
        <td id="LC3306" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gold in the high lights. Bagnacavallo (1484-1542) was a pupil of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3307" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3307"></td>
        <td id="LC3307" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Francia at Bologna, but with much of Dosso and Ferrara about him. He,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3308" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3308"></td>
        <td id="LC3308" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in common with Imola, already mentioned, was indebted to the art of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3309" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3309"></td>
        <td id="LC3309" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Raphael.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3310" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3310"></td>
        <td id="LC3310" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3311" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3311"></td>
        <td id="LC3311" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CORREGGIO AT PARMA: In Correggio (1494?-1534) all the Boccaccio nature</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3312" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3312"></td>
        <td id="LC3312" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the Renaissance came to the surface. It was indicated in Andrea del</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3313" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3313"></td>
        <td id="LC3313" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sarto--this nature-worship--but Correggio was the consummation. He was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3314" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3314"></td>
        <td id="LC3314" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Faun of the Renaissance, the painter with whom the beauty of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3315" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3315"></td>
        <td id="LC3315" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">human as distinguished from the religious and the classic showed at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3316" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3316"></td>
        <td id="LC3316" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">its very strongest. Free animal spirits, laughing madonnas, raving</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3317" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3317"></td>
        <td id="LC3317" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nymphs, excited children of the wood, and angels of the sky pass and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3318" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3318"></td>
        <td id="LC3318" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">repass through his pictures in an atmosphere of pure sensuousness.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3319" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3319"></td>
        <td id="LC3319" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">They appeal to us not religiously, not historically, not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3320" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3320"></td>
        <td id="LC3320" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">intellectually, but sensuously and artistically through their rhythmic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3321" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3321"></td>
        <td id="LC3321" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lines, their palpitating flesh, their beauty of color, and in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3322" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3322"></td>
        <td id="LC3322" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light and atmosphere that surround them. He was less of a religionist</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3323" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3323"></td>
        <td id="LC3323" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">than Andrea del Sarto. Religion in art was losing ground in his day,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3324" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3324"></td>
        <td id="LC3324" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and the liberality and worldliness of its teachers appeared clearly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3325" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3325"></td>
        <td id="LC3325" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">enough in the decorations of the Convent of St. Paul at Parma, where</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3326" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3326"></td>
        <td id="LC3326" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Correggio was allowed to paint mythological Dianas and Cupids in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3327" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3327"></td>
        <td id="LC3327" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">place of saints and madonnas. True enough, he painted the religious</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3328" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3328"></td>
        <td id="LC3328" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subject very often, but with the same spirit of life and joyousness as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3329" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3329"></td>
        <td id="LC3329" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">profane subjects.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3330" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3330"></td>
        <td id="LC3330" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3331" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3331"></td>
        <td id="LC3331" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 46--CORREGGIO. MARRIAGE OF ST. CATHERINE AND</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3332" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3332"></td>
        <td id="LC3332" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHRIST. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3333" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3333"></td>
        <td id="LC3333" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3334" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3334"></td>
        <td id="LC3334" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The classic subject seemed more appropriate to his spirit, and yet he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3335" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3335"></td>
        <td id="LC3335" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">knew and probably cared less about it than the religious subject. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3336" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3336"></td>
        <td id="LC3336" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Dianas and Ledas are only so in name. They have little of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3337" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3337"></td>
        <td id="LC3337" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Hellenic spirit about them, and for the sterner, heroic phases of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3338" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3338"></td>
        <td id="LC3338" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classicism--the lofty, the grand--Correggio never essayed them. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3339" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3339"></td>
        <td id="LC3339" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">things of this earth and the sweetness thereof seemed ever his aim.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3340" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3340"></td>
        <td id="LC3340" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Women and children were beautiful to him in the same way that flowers</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3341" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3341"></td>
        <td id="LC3341" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and trees and skies and sunsets were beautiful. They were revelations</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3342" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3342"></td>
        <td id="LC3342" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of grace, charm, tenderness, light, shade, color. Simply to exist and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3343" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3343"></td>
        <td id="LC3343" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">be glad in the sunlight was sweetness to Correggio. He would have no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3344" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3344"></td>
        <td id="LC3344" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sibylesque mystery, no prophetic austerity, no solemnity, no great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3345" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3345"></td>
        <td id="LC3345" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">intellectuality. He was no leader of a tragic chorus. The dramatic,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3346" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3346"></td>
        <td id="LC3346" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the forceful, the powerful, were foreign to his mood. He was a singer</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3347" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3347"></td>
        <td id="LC3347" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of lyrics and pastorals, a lover of the material beauty about him, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3348" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3348"></td>
        <td id="LC3348" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it is because he passed by the pietistic, the classic, the literary,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3349" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3349"></td>
        <td id="LC3349" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and showed the beauty of physical life as an art motive that he is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3350" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3350"></td>
        <td id="LC3350" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">called the Faun of the Renaissance. The appellation is not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3351" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3351"></td>
        <td id="LC3351" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">inappropriate.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3352" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3352"></td>
        <td id="LC3352" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3353" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3353"></td>
        <td id="LC3353" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">How or why he came to take this course would be hard to determine. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3354" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3354"></td>
        <td id="LC3354" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was reflective of the times; but Correggio, so far as history tells</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3355" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3355"></td>
        <td id="LC3355" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">us, had little to do with the movements and people of his age. He was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3356" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3356"></td>
        <td id="LC3356" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">born and lived and died near Parma, and is sometimes classed among the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3357" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3357"></td>
        <td id="LC3357" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Bologna-Ferrara painters, but the reasons for the classification are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3358" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3358"></td>
        <td id="LC3358" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not too strong. His education, masters, and influences are all shadowy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3359" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3359"></td>
        <td id="LC3359" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and indefinite. He seems, from his drawing and composition, to have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3360" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3360"></td>
        <td id="LC3360" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">known something of Mantegna at Mantua; from his coloring something of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3361" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3361"></td>
        <td id="LC3361" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Dosso and Garofolo, especially in his straw-yellows; from his early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3362" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3362"></td>
        <td id="LC3362" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">types and faces something of Costa and Francia, and his contours and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3363" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3363"></td>
        <td id="LC3363" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light-and-shade indicate a knowledge of Leonardo&#39;s work. But there is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3364" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3364"></td>
        <td id="LC3364" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">no positive certainty that he saw the work of any of these men.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3365" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3365"></td>
        <td id="LC3365" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3366" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3366"></td>
        <td id="LC3366" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">His drawing was faulty at times, but not obtrusively so; his color and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3367" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3367"></td>
        <td id="LC3367" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brush-work rich, vivacious, spirited; his light brilliant, warm,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3368" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3368"></td>
        <td id="LC3368" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">penetrating; his contours melting, graceful; his atmosphere</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3369" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3369"></td>
        <td id="LC3369" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">omnipresent, enveloping. In composition he rather pushed aside line in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3370" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3370"></td>
        <td id="LC3370" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">favor of light and color. It was his technical peculiarity that he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3371" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3371"></td>
        <td id="LC3371" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">centralized his light and surrounded it by darks as a foil. And in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3372" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3372"></td>
        <td id="LC3372" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this very feature he was one of the first men in Renaissance Italy to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3373" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3373"></td>
        <td id="LC3373" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">paint a picture for the purpose of weaving a scheme of lights and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3374" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3374"></td>
        <td id="LC3374" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">darks through a tapestry of rich colors. That is art for art&#39;s sake,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3375" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3375"></td>
        <td id="LC3375" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and that, as will be seen further on, was the picture motive of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3376" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3376"></td>
        <td id="LC3376" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great Venetians.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3377" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3377"></td>
        <td id="LC3377" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3378" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3378"></td>
        <td id="LC3378" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Correggio&#39;s immediate pupils and followers, like those of Raphael and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3379" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3379"></td>
        <td id="LC3379" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Andrea del Sarto, did him small honor. As was usually the case in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3380" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3380"></td>
        <td id="LC3380" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Renaissance art-history they caught at the method and lost the spirit</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3381" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3381"></td>
        <td id="LC3381" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the master. His son, Pomponio Allegri (1521-1593?), was a painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3382" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3382"></td>
        <td id="LC3382" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of some mark without being in the front rank. Michelangelo Anselmi</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3383" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3383"></td>
        <td id="LC3383" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1491-1554?), though not a pupil, was an indifferent imitator of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3384" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3384"></td>
        <td id="LC3384" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Correggio. Parmigianino (1504-1540), a mannered painter of some</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3385" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3385"></td>
        <td id="LC3385" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brilliancy, and of excellence in portraits, was perhaps the best of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3386" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3386"></td>
        <td id="LC3386" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the immediate followers. It was not until after Correggio&#39;s death, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3387" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3387"></td>
        <td id="LC3387" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with the painters of the Decadence, that his work was seriously taken</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3388" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3388"></td>
        <td id="LC3388" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">up and followed.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3389" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3389"></td>
        <td id="LC3389" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3390" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3390"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L3431" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3431"></td>
        <td id="LC3431" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3432" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3432"></td>
        <td id="LC3432" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     PARMESE--Correggio, frescos Convent of S. Paolo, S. Giovanni</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3433" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3433"></td>
        <td id="LC3433" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Evangelista, Duomo Parma, altar-pieces Dresden (4), Parma</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3434" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3434"></td>
        <td id="LC3434" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Gals., Louvre, mythological pictures Antiope Louvre, Danae</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3435" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3435"></td>
        <td id="LC3435" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Borghese, Leda Jupiter and Io Berlin, Venus Mercury and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3436" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3436"></td>
        <td id="LC3436" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Cupid Nat. Gal. Lon., Ganymede Vienna Gal.; Pomponio</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3437" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3437"></td>
        <td id="LC3437" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Allegri, frescos Capella del Popolo Parma; Anselmi, frescos</td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L3438" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3438"></td>
        <td id="LC3438" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     S. Giovanni Evangelista, altar-pieces Madonna della</td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L3439" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3439"></td>
        <td id="LC3439" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Steccata, Duomo, Gal. Parma, Louvre; Parmigianino, frescos</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3440" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3440"></td>
        <td id="LC3440" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Moses Steccata, S. Giovanni Parma, altar-pieces Santa</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3441" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3441"></td>
        <td id="LC3441" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Margherita, Bologna Gal., Madonna Pitti, portraits Uffizi,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3442" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3442"></td>
        <td id="LC3442" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Vienna, Naples Mus., other works Dresden, Vienna, and Nat.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3443" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3443"></td>
        <td id="LC3443" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Gal. Lon.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3444" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3444"></td>
