      <tr>
        <td id="L3445" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3445"></td>
        <td id="LC3445" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3446" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3446"></td>
        <td id="LC3446" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3447" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3447"></td>
        <td id="LC3447" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3448" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3448"></td>
        <td id="LC3448" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHAPTER X.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3449" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3449"></td>
        <td id="LC3449" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3450" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3450"></td>
        <td id="LC3450" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ITALIAN PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3451" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3451"></td>
        <td id="LC3451" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3452" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3452"></td>
        <td id="LC3452" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE HIGH RENAISSANCE. 1500-1600. (_Continued._)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3453" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3453"></td>
        <td id="LC3453" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3454" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3454"></td>
        <td id="LC3454" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: The works on Italian art before mentioned</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3455" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3455"></td>
        <td id="LC3455" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     and also consult General Bibliography, (page xv.).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3456" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3456"></td>
        <td id="LC3456" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3457" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3457"></td>
        <td id="LC3457" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3458" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3458"></td>
        <td id="LC3458" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE VENETIAN SCHOOL: It was at Venice and with the Venetian painters</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3459" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3459"></td>
        <td id="LC3459" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the sixteenth century that a new art-motive was finally and fully</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3460" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3460"></td>
        <td id="LC3460" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">adopted. This art-motive was not religion. For though the religious</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3461" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3461"></td>
        <td id="LC3461" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subject was still largely used, the religious or pietistic belief was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3462" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3462"></td>
        <td id="LC3462" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not with the Venetians any more than with Correggio. It was not a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3463" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3463"></td>
        <td id="LC3463" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classic, antique, realistic, or naturalistic motive. The Venetians</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3464" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3464"></td>
        <td id="LC3464" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were interested in all phases of nature, and they were students of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3465" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3465"></td>
        <td id="LC3465" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature, but not students of truth for truth&#39;s sake.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3466" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3466"></td>
        <td id="LC3466" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3467" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3467"></td>
        <td id="LC3467" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">What they sought, primarily, was the light and shade on a nude</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3468" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3468"></td>
        <td id="LC3468" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shoulder, the delicate contours of a form, the flow and fall of silk</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3469" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3469"></td>
        <td id="LC3469" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">or brocade, the richness of a robe, a scheme of color or of light, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3470" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3470"></td>
        <td id="LC3470" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">character of a face, the majesty of a figure. They were seeking</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3471" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3471"></td>
        <td id="LC3471" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">effects of line, light, color--mere sensuous and pictorial effects, in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3472" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3472"></td>
        <td id="LC3472" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">which religion and classicism played secondary parts. They believed in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3473" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3473"></td>
        <td id="LC3473" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art for art&#39;s sake; that painting was a creation, not an illustration;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3474" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3474"></td>
        <td id="LC3474" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that it should exist by its pictorial beauties, not by its subject or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3475" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3475"></td>
        <td id="LC3475" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">story. No matter what their subjects, they invariably painted them so</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3476" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3476"></td>
        <td id="LC3476" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as to show the beauties they prized the highest. The Venetian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3477" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3477"></td>
        <td id="LC3477" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">conception was less austere, grand, intellectual, than pictorial,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3478" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3478"></td>
        <td id="LC3478" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sensuous, concerning the beautiful as it appealed to the eye. And this</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3479" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3479"></td>
        <td id="LC3479" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was not a slight or unworthy conception. True it dealt with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3480" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3480"></td>
        <td id="LC3480" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fulness of material life, but regarded as it was by the Venetians--a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3481" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3481"></td>
        <td id="LC3481" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">thing full-rounded, complete, harmonious, splendid--it became a great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3482" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3482"></td>
        <td id="LC3482" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ideal of existence.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3483" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3483"></td>
        <td id="LC3483" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3484" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3484"></td>
        <td id="LC3484" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 47.--GIORGIONE(?). ORDEAL OF MOSES. UFFIZI.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3485" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3485"></td>
        <td id="LC3485" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3486" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3486"></td>
        <td id="LC3486" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In technical expression color was the note of all the school, with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3487" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3487"></td>
        <td id="LC3487" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hardly an exception. This in itself would seem to imply a lightness of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3488" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3488"></td>
        <td id="LC3488" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spirit, for color is somehow associated in the popular mind with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3489" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3489"></td>
        <td id="LC3489" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decorative gayety; but nothing could be further removed from the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3490" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3490"></td>
        <td id="LC3490" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Venetian school than triviality. Color was taken up with the greatest</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3491" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3491"></td>
        <td id="LC3491" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seriousness, and handled in such masses and with such dignified power</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3492" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3492"></td>
        <td id="LC3492" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that while it pleased it also awed the spectator. Without having quite</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3493" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3493"></td>
        <td id="LC3493" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the severity of line, some of the Venetian chromatic schemes rise in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3494" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3494"></td>
        <td id="LC3494" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sublimity almost to the Sistine modellings of Michael Angelo. We do</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3495" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3495"></td>
        <td id="LC3495" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not feel this so much in Giovanni Bellini, fine in color as he was. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3496" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3496"></td>
        <td id="LC3496" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">came too early for the full splendor, but he left many pupils who</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3497" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3497"></td>
        <td id="LC3497" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">completed what he had inaugurated.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3498" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3498"></td>
        <td id="LC3498" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3499" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3499"></td>
        <td id="LC3499" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE GREAT VENETIANS: The most positive in influence upon his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3500" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3500"></td>
        <td id="LC3500" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">contemporaries of all the great Venetians was Giorgione (1477?-1511).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3501" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3501"></td>
        <td id="LC3501" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He died young, and what few pictures by him are left to us have been</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3502" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3502"></td>
        <td id="LC3502" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">so torn to pieces by historical criticism that at times one begins to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3503" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3503"></td>
        <td id="LC3503" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">doubt if there ever was such a painter. His different styles have been</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3504" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3504"></td>
        <td id="LC3504" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">confused, and his pictures in consequence thereof attributed to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3505" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3505"></td>
        <td id="LC3505" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">followers instead of to the master. Painters change their styles, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3506" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3506"></td>
        <td id="LC3506" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seldom their original bent of mind. With Giorgione there was a lyric</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3507" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3507"></td>
        <td id="LC3507" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">feeling as shown in music. The voluptuous swell of line, the melting</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3508" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3508"></td>
        <td id="LC3508" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">tone of color, the sharp dash of light, the undercurrent of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3509" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3509"></td>
        <td id="LC3509" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">atmosphere, all mingled for him into radiant melody. He sought pure</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3510" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3510"></td>
        <td id="LC3510" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictorial beauty and found it in everything of nature. He had little</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3511" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3511"></td>
        <td id="LC3511" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">grasp of the purely intellectual, and the religious was something he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3512" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3512"></td>
        <td id="LC3512" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dealt with in no strong devotional way. The fete, the concert, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3513" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3513"></td>
        <td id="LC3513" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fable, the legend, with a landscape setting, made a stronger appeal to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3514" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3514"></td>
        <td id="LC3514" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">him. More of a recorder than a thinker he was not the less a leader</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3515" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3515"></td>
        <td id="LC3515" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">showing the way into that new Arcadian grove of pleasure whose</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3516" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3516"></td>
        <td id="LC3516" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">inhabitants thought not of creeds and faiths and histories and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3517" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3517"></td>
        <td id="LC3517" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">literatures, but were content to lead the life that was sweet in its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3518" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3518"></td>
        <td id="LC3518" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">glow and warmth of color, its light, its shadows, its bending trees,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3519" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3519"></td>
        <td id="LC3519" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and arching skies. A strong full-blooded race, sober-minded,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3520" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3520"></td>
        <td id="LC3520" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dignified, rationally happy with their lot, Giorgione portrayed them</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3521" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3521"></td>
        <td id="LC3521" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with an art infinite in variety and consummate in skill. Their least</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3522" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3522"></td>
        <td id="LC3522" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">features under his brush seemed to glow like jewels. The sheen of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3523" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3523"></td>
        <td id="LC3523" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">armor and rich robe, a bare forearm, a nude back, or loosened</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3524" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3524"></td>
        <td id="LC3524" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hair--mere morsels of color and light--all took on a new beauty. Even</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3525" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3525"></td>
        <td id="LC3525" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">landscape with him became more significant. His master, Bellini, had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3526" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3526"></td>
        <td id="LC3526" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">been realistic enough in the details of trees and hills, but Giorgione</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3527" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3527"></td>
        <td id="LC3527" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">grasped the meaning of landscape as an entirety, and rendered it with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3528" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3528"></td>
        <td id="LC3528" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">poetic breadth.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3529" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3529"></td>
        <td id="LC3529" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3530" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3530"></td>
        <td id="LC3530" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Technically he adopted the oil medium brought to Venice by Antonello</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3531" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3531"></td>
        <td id="LC3531" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">da Messina, introducing scumbling and glazing to obtain brilliancy and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3532" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3532"></td>
        <td id="LC3532" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">depth of color. Of light-and-shade he was a master, and in atmosphere</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3533" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3533"></td>
        <td id="LC3533" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">excellent. He, in common with all the Venetians, is sometimes said to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3534" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3534"></td>
        <td id="LC3534" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">be lacking in drawing, but that is the result of a misunderstanding.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3535" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3535"></td>
        <td id="LC3535" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The Venetians never cared to accent line, choosing rather to model in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3536" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3536"></td>
        <td id="LC3536" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">masses of light and shadow and color. Giorgione was a superior man</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3537" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3537"></td>
        <td id="LC3537" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with the brush, but not quite up to his contemporary Titian.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3538" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3538"></td>
        <td id="LC3538" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3539" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3539"></td>
        <td id="LC3539" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 48.--TITIAN. VENUS EQUIPPING CUPID. BORGHESE PAL.,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3540" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3540"></td>
        <td id="LC3540" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ROME.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3541" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3541"></td>
        <td id="LC3541" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3542" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3542"></td>
        <td id="LC3542" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">That is not surprising, for Titian (1477-1576) was the painter easily</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3543" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3543"></td>
        <td id="LC3543" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">first in the whole range of Italian art. He was the first man in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3544" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3544"></td>
        <td id="LC3544" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">history of painting to handle a brush with freedom, vigor, and gusto.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3545" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3545"></td>
        <td id="LC3545" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">And Titian&#39;s brush-work was probably the least part of his genius.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3546" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3546"></td>
        <td id="LC3546" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Calm in mood, dignified, and often majestic in conception, learned</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3547" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3547"></td>
        <td id="LC3547" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">beyond all others in his craft, he mingled thought, feeling, color,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3548" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3548"></td>
        <td id="LC3548" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brush-work into one grand and glowing whole. He emphasized nothing,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3549" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3549"></td>
        <td id="LC3549" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">yet elevated everything. In pure intellectual thought he was not so</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3550" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3550"></td>
        <td id="LC3550" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strong as Raphael. He never sought to make painting a vehicle for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3551" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3551"></td>
        <td id="LC3551" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">theological, literary, or classical ideas. His tale was largely of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3552" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3552"></td>
        <td id="LC3552" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">humanity under a religious or classical name, but a noble, majestic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3553" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3553"></td>
        <td id="LC3553" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">humanity. In his art dignified senators, stern doges, and solemn</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3554" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3554"></td>
        <td id="LC3554" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ecclesiastics mingle with open-eyed madonnas, winning Ariadnes, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3555" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3555"></td>
        <td id="LC3555" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">youthful Bacchuses. Men and women they are truly, but the very noblest</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3556" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3556"></td>
        <td id="LC3556" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the Italian race, the mountain race of the Cadore country--proud,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3557" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3557"></td>
        <td id="LC3557" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">active, glowing with life; the sea race of Venice--worldly wise, full</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3558" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3558"></td>
        <td id="LC3558" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of character, luxurious in power.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3559" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3559"></td>
        <td id="LC3559" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3560" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3560"></td>
        <td id="LC3560" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In himself he was an epitome of all the excellences of painting. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3561" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3561"></td>
        <td id="LC3561" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was everything, the sum of Venetian skill, the crowning genius of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3562" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3562"></td>
        <td id="LC3562" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Renaissance art. He had force, power, invention, imagination, point of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3563" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3563"></td>
        <td id="LC3563" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">view; he had the infinite knowledge of nature and the infinite mastery</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3564" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3564"></td>
        <td id="LC3564" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of art. In addition, Fortune smiled upon him as upon a favorite child.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3565" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3565"></td>
        <td id="LC3565" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Trained in mind and hand he lived for ninety-nine years and worked</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3566" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3566"></td>
        <td id="LC3566" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unceasingly up to a few months of his death. His genius was great and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3567" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3567"></td>
        <td id="LC3567" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his accomplishment equally so. He was celebrated and independent at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3568" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3568"></td>
        <td id="LC3568" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">thirty-five, though before that he showed something of the influence</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3569" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3569"></td>
        <td id="LC3569" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of Giorgione. After the death of Giorgione and his master, Bellini,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3570" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3570"></td>
        <td id="LC3570" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Titian was the leader in Venice to the end of his long life, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3571" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3571"></td>
        <td id="LC3571" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though having few scholars of importance his influence was spread</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3572" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3572"></td>
        <td id="LC3572" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">through all North Italian painting.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3573" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3573"></td>
        <td id="LC3573" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3574" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3574"></td>
        <td id="LC3574" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Taking him for all in all, perhaps it is not too much to say that he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3575" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3575"></td>
        <td id="LC3575" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was the greatest painter known to history. If it were possible to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3576" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3576"></td>
        <td id="LC3576" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">describe that greatness in one word, that word would be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3577" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3577"></td>
        <td id="LC3577" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">&quot;universality.&quot; He saw and painted that which was universal in its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3578" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3578"></td>
        <td id="LC3578" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">truth. The local and particular, the small and the accidental, were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3579" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3579"></td>
        <td id="LC3579" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">passed over for those great truths which belong to all the world of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3580" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3580"></td>
        <td id="LC3580" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">life. In this respect he was a veritable Shakespeare, with all the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3581" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3581"></td>
        <td id="LC3581" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">calmness and repose of one who overlooked the world from a lofty</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3582" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3582"></td>
        <td id="LC3582" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">height.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3583" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3583"></td>
        <td id="LC3583" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3584" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3584"></td>
        <td id="LC3584" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 49.--TINTORETTO. MERCURY AND GRACES. DUCAL PAL.,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3585" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3585"></td>
        <td id="LC3585" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">VENICE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3586" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3586"></td>
        <td id="LC3586" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3587" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3587"></td>
        <td id="LC3587" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The restfulness and easy strength of Titian were not characteristics</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3588" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3588"></td>
        <td id="LC3588" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of his follower Tintoretto (1518-1592). He was violent, headlong,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3589" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3589"></td>
        <td id="LC3589" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">impulsive, more impetuous than Michael Angelo, and in some respects a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3590" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3590"></td>
        <td id="LC3590" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strong reminder of him. He had not Michael Angelo&#39;s austerity, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3591" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3591"></td>
        <td id="LC3591" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">there was more clash and tumult and fire about him, but he had a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3592" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3592"></td>
        <td id="LC3592" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">command of line like the Florentine, and a way of hurling things, as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3593" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3593"></td>
        <td id="LC3593" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seen in the Fall of the Damned, that reminds one of the Last Judgment</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3594" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3594"></td>
        <td id="LC3594" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the Sistine. It was his aim to combine the line of Michael Angelo</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3595" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3595"></td>
        <td id="LC3595" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and the color of Titian; but without reaching up to either of his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3596" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3596"></td>
        <td id="LC3596" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">models he produced a powerful amalgam of his own.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3597" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3597"></td>
        <td id="LC3597" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3598" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3598"></td>
        <td id="LC3598" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He was one of the very great artists of the world, and the most rapid</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3599" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3599"></td>
        <td id="LC3599" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">workman in the whole Renaissance period. There are to-day, after</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3600" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3600"></td>
        <td id="LC3600" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">centuries of decay, fire, theft, and repainting, yards upon yards of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3601" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3601"></td>
        <td id="LC3601" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Tintoretto&#39;s canvases rotting upon the walls of the Venetian churches.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3602" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3602"></td>
        <td id="LC3602" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He produced an enormous amount of work, and, what is to be regretted,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3603" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3603"></td>
        <td id="LC3603" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">much of it was contract work or experimental sketching. This has given</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3604" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3604"></td>
        <td id="LC3604" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his art a rather bad name, but judged by his best works in the Ducal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3605" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3605"></td>
        <td id="LC3605" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Palace and the Academy at Venice, he will not be found lacking. Even</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3606" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3606"></td>
        <td id="LC3606" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in his masterpiece (The Miracle of the Slave) he is &quot;Il Furioso,&quot; as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3607" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3607"></td>
        <td id="LC3607" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">they used to call him; but his thunderbolt style is held in check by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3608" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3608"></td>
        <td id="LC3608" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">wonderful grace, strength of modelling, superb contrasts of light with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3609" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3609"></td>
        <td id="LC3609" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shade, and a coloring of flesh and robes not unworthy of the very</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3610" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3610"></td>
        <td id="LC3610" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">greatest. He was a man who worked in the white heat of passion, with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3611" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3611"></td>
        <td id="LC3611" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">much imagination and invention. As a technician he sought difficulties</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3612" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3612"></td>
        <td id="LC3612" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rather than avoided them. There is some antagonism between form and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3613" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3613"></td>
        <td id="LC3613" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color, but Tintoretto tried to reconcile them. The result was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3614" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3614"></td>
        <td id="LC3614" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sometimes clashing, but no one could have done better with them than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3615" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3615"></td>
        <td id="LC3615" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he did. He was a fine draughtsman, a good colorist, and a master of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3616" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3616"></td>
        <td id="LC3616" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light. As a brushman he was a superior man, but not equal to Titian.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3617" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3617"></td>
        <td id="LC3617" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3618" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3618"></td>
        <td id="LC3618" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Paolo Veronese (1528-1588), the fourth great Venetian, did not follow</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3619" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3619"></td>
        <td id="LC3619" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the line direction set by Tintoretto, but carried out the original</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3620" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3620"></td>
        <td id="LC3620" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color-leaning of the school. He came a little later than Tintoretto,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3621" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3621"></td>
        <td id="LC3621" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and his art was a reflection of the advancing Renaissance, wherein</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3622" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3622"></td>
        <td id="LC3622" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">simplicity was destined to lose itself in complexity, grandeur, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3623" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3623"></td>
        <td id="LC3623" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">display. Paolo came on the very crest of the Renaissance wave, when</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3624" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3624"></td>
        <td id="LC3624" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art, risen to its greatest height, was gleaming in that transparent</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3625" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3625"></td>
        <td id="LC3625" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">splendor that precedes the fall.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3626" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3626"></td>
        <td id="LC3626" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3627" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3627"></td>
        <td id="LC3627" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 50.--P. VERONESE. VENICE ENTHRONED. DUCAL PAL.,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3628" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3628"></td>
        <td id="LC3628" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">VENICE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3629" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3629"></td>
        <td id="LC3629" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3630" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3630"></td>
        <td id="LC3630" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The great bulk of his work had a large decorative motive behind it.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3631" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3631"></td>
        <td id="LC3631" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Almost all of the late Venetian work was of that character. Hence it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3632" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3632"></td>
        <td id="LC3632" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was brilliant in color, elaborate in subject, and grand in scale.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3633" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3633"></td>
        <td id="LC3633" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Splendid robes, hangings, furniture, architecture, jewels, armor,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3634" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3634"></td>
        <td id="LC3634" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">appeared everywhere, and not in flat, lustreless hues, but with that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3635" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3635"></td>
        <td id="LC3635" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brilliancy which they possess in nature. Drapery gave way to clothing,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3636" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3636"></td>
        <td id="LC3636" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and texture-painting was introduced even in the largest canvases.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3637" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3637"></td>
        <td id="LC3637" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Scenes from Scripture and legend turned into grand pageants of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3638" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3638"></td>
        <td id="LC3638" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Venetian glory, and the facial expression of the characters rather</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3639" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3639"></td>
        <td id="LC3639" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">passed out in favor of telling masses of color to be seen at a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3640" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3640"></td>
        <td id="LC3640" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">distance upon wall or ceiling. It was pomp and glory carried to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3641" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3641"></td>
        <td id="LC3641" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">highest pitch, but with all seriousness of mood and truthfulness in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3642" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3642"></td>
        <td id="LC3642" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art. It was beyond Titian in variety, richness, ornament, facility;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3643" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3643"></td>
        <td id="LC3643" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but it was perhaps below Titian in sentiment, sobriety, and depth of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3644" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3644"></td>
        <td id="LC3644" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">insight. Titian, with all his sensuous beauty, did appeal to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3645" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3645"></td>
        <td id="LC3645" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">higher intelligence, while Paolo and his companions appealed more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3646" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3646"></td>
        <td id="LC3646" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">positively to the eye by luxurious color-setting and magnificence of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3647" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3647"></td>
        <td id="LC3647" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">invention. The decadence came after Paolo, but not with him. His art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3648" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3648"></td>
        <td id="LC3648" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was the most gorgeous of the Venetian school, and by many is ranked</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3649" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3649"></td>
        <td id="LC3649" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the highest of all, but perhaps it is better to say it was the height.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3650" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3650"></td>
        <td id="LC3650" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Those who came after brought about the decline by striving to imitate</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3651" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3651"></td>
        <td id="LC3651" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his splendor, and thereby falling into extravagance.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3652" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3652"></td>
        <td id="LC3652" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3653" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3653"></td>
        <td id="LC3653" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">These are the four great Venetians--the men of first rank. Beside them</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3654" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3654"></td>
        <td id="LC3654" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and around them were many other painters, placed in the second rank,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3655" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3655"></td>
        <td id="LC3655" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">who in any other time or city would have held first place. Palma il</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3656" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3656"></td>
        <td id="LC3656" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Vecchio (1480?-1528) was so excellent in many ways that it seems</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3657" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3657"></td>
        <td id="LC3657" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unjust to speak of him as a secondary painter. He was not, however, a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3658" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3658"></td>
        <td id="LC3658" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great original mind, though in many respects a perfect painter. He was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3659" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3659"></td>
        <td id="LC3659" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influenced by Bellini at first, and then by Giorgione. In subject</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3660" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3660"></td>
        <td id="LC3660" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">there was nothing dramatic about him, and he carries chiefly by his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3661" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3661"></td>
        <td id="LC3661" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portrayal of quiet, dignified, and beautiful Venetians under the names</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3662" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3662"></td>
        <td id="LC3662" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of saints and holy families. The St. Barbara is an example of this,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3663" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3663"></td>
        <td id="LC3663" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and one of the most majestic figures in all painting.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3664" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3664"></td>
        <td id="LC3664" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3665" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3665"></td>
        <td id="LC3665" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 51.--LOTTO. THREE AGES. PITTI.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3666" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3666"></td>
        <td id="LC3666" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3667" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3667"></td>
        <td id="LC3667" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Palma&#39;s friend and fellow-worker, Lorenzo Lotto (1480?-1556?) came</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3668" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3668"></td>
        <td id="LC3668" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">from the school of the Bellini, and at different times was under the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3669" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3669"></td>
        <td id="LC3669" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence of several Venetian painters--Palma, Giorgione,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3670" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3670"></td>
        <td id="LC3670" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Titian--without obliterating a sensitive individuality of his own. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3671" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3671"></td>
        <td id="LC3671" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was a somewhat mannered but very charming painter, and in portraits</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3672" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3672"></td>
        <td id="LC3672" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">can hardly be classed below Titian. Rocco Marconi (fl. 1505-1520) was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3673" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3673"></td>
        <td id="LC3673" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">another Bellini-educated painter, showing the influence of Palma and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3674" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3674"></td>
        <td id="LC3674" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">even of Paris Bordone. In color and landscape he was excellent.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3675" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3675"></td>
        <td id="LC3675" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Pordenone (1483-1540) rather followed after Giorgione, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3676" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3676"></td>
        <td id="LC3676" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unsuccessfully competed with Titian. He was inclined to exaggeration</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3677" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3677"></td>
        <td id="LC3677" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in dramatic composition, but was a painter of undeniable power.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3678" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3678"></td>
        <td id="LC3678" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cariani (1480-1541) was another Giorgione follower. Bonifazio Pitati</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3679" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3679"></td>
        <td id="LC3679" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">probably came from a Veronese family. He showed the influence of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3680" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3680"></td>
        <td id="LC3680" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Palma, and was rather deficient in drawing, though exceedingly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3681" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3681"></td>
        <td id="LC3681" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brilliant and rich in coloring. This latter may be said for Paris</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3682" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3682"></td>
        <td id="LC3682" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Bordone (1495-1570), a painter of Titian&#39;s school, gorgeous in color,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3683" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3683"></td>
        <td id="LC3683" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but often lacking in truth of form. His portraits are very fine.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3684" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3684"></td>
        <td id="LC3684" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Another painter family, the Bassani--there were six of them, of whom</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3685" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3685"></td>
        <td id="LC3685" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Jacopo Bassano (1510-1592) and his son Francesco Bassano (1550-1591),</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3686" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3686"></td>
        <td id="LC3686" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were the most noted--formed themselves after Venetian masters, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3687" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3687"></td>
        <td id="LC3687" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were rather remarkable for violent contrasts of light and dark,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3688" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3688"></td>
        <td id="LC3688" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">_genre_ treatment of sacred subjects, and still-life and animal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3689" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3689"></td>
        <td id="LC3689" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3690" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3690"></td>
        <td id="LC3690" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3691" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3691"></td>
        <td id="LC3691" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PAINTING IN VENETIAN TERRITORIES: Venetian painting was not confined to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3692" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3692"></td>
        <td id="LC3692" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Venice, but extended through all the Venetian territories in Renaissance</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3693" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3693"></td>
        <td id="LC3693" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">times, and those who lived away from the city were, in their art,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3694" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3694"></td>
        <td id="LC3694" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decidedly Venetian, though possessing local characteristics.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3695" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3695"></td>
        <td id="LC3695" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3696" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3696"></td>
        <td id="LC3696" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">At Brescia Savoldo (1480?-1548), a rather superficial painter, fond of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3697" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3697"></td>
        <td id="LC3697" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">weird lights and sheeny draperies, and Romanino (1485?-1566), a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3698" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3698"></td>
        <td id="LC3698" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">follower of Giorgione, good in composition but unequal and careless in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3699" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3699"></td>
        <td id="LC3699" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">execution, were the earliest of the High Renaissance men. Moretto</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3700" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3700"></td>
        <td id="LC3700" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1498?-1555) was the strongest and most original, a man of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3701" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3701"></td>
        <td id="LC3701" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">individuality and power, remarkable technically for his delicacy and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3702" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3702"></td>
        <td id="LC3702" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unity of color under a veil of &quot;silvery tone.&quot; In composition he was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3703" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3703"></td>
        <td id="LC3703" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dignified and noble, and in brush-work simple and direct. One of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3704" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3704"></td>
        <td id="LC3704" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great painters of the time, he seemed to stand more apart from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3705" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3705"></td>
        <td id="LC3705" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Venetian influence than any other on Venetian territory. He left one</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3706" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3706"></td>
        <td id="LC3706" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">remarkable pupil, Moroni (fl. 1549-1578) whose portraits are to-day</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3707" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3707"></td>
        <td id="LC3707" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the gems of several galleries, and greatly admired for their modern</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3708" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3708"></td>
        <td id="LC3708" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spirit and treatment.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3709" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3709"></td>
        <td id="LC3709" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3710" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3710"></td>
        <td id="LC3710" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">At Verona Caroto and Girolamo dai Libri (1474-1555), though living</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3711" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3711"></td>
        <td id="LC3711" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">into the sixteenth century were more allied to the art of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3712" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3712"></td>
        <td id="LC3712" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fifteenth century. Torbido (1486?-1546?) was a vacillating painter,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3713" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3713"></td>
        <td id="LC3713" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influenced by Liberale da Verona, Giorgione, Bonifazio Veronese, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3714" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3714"></td>
        <td id="LC3714" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">later, even by Giulio Romano. Cavazzola (1486-1522) was more original,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3715" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3715"></td>
        <td id="LC3715" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and a man of talent. There were numbers of other painters scattered</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3716" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3716"></td>
        <td id="LC3716" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all through the Venetian provinces at this time, but they were not of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3717" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3717"></td>
        <td id="LC3717" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the first, or even the second rank, and hence call for no mention</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3718" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3718"></td>
        <td id="LC3718" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">here.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3719" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3719"></td>
        <td id="LC3719" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
