        <td id="L3785" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3785"></td>
        <td id="LC3785" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3786" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3786"></td>
        <td id="LC3786" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE DECLINE: An art movement in history seems like a wave that rises</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3787" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3787"></td>
        <td id="LC3787" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to a height, then breaks, falls, and parts of it are caught up from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3788" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3788"></td>
        <td id="LC3788" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">beneath to help form the strength of a new advance. In Italy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3789" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3789"></td>
        <td id="LC3789" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Christianity was the propelling force of the wave. In the Early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3790" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3790"></td>
        <td id="LC3790" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Renaissance, the antique, and the study of nature came in as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3791" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3791"></td>
        <td id="LC3791" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">additions. At Venice in the High Renaissance the art-for-art&#39;s-sake</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3792" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3792"></td>
        <td id="LC3792" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">motive made the crest of light and color. The highest point was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3793" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3793"></td>
        <td id="LC3793" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reached then, and there was nothing that could follow but the breaking</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3794" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3794"></td>
        <td id="LC3794" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and the scattering of the wave. This took place in Central Italy after</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3795" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3795"></td>
        <td id="LC3795" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">1540, in Venice after 1590.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3796" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3796"></td>
        <td id="LC3796" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3797" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3797"></td>
        <td id="LC3797" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Art had typified in form, thought, and expression everything of which</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3798" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3798"></td>
        <td id="LC3798" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Italian race was capable. It had perfected all the graces and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3799" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3799"></td>
        <td id="LC3799" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">elegancies of line and color, and adorned them with a superlative</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3800" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3800"></td>
        <td id="LC3800" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">splendor. There was nothing more to do. The idea was completed, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3801" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3801"></td>
        <td id="LC3801" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">motive power had served its purpose, and that store of race-impulse</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3802" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3802"></td>
        <td id="LC3802" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">which seems necessary to the making of every great art was exhausted.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3803" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3803"></td>
        <td id="LC3803" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">For the men that came after Michael Angelo and Tintoretto there was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3804" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3804"></td>
        <td id="LC3804" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nothing. All that they could do was to repeat what others had said, or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3805" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3805"></td>
        <td id="LC3805" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to recombine the old thoughts and forms. This led inevitably to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3806" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3806"></td>
        <td id="LC3806" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">imitation, over-refinement of style, and conscious study of beauty,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3807" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3807"></td>
        <td id="LC3807" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">resulting in mannerism and affectation. Such qualities marked the art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3808" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3808"></td>
        <td id="LC3808" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of those painters who came in the latter part of the sixteenth century</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3809" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3809"></td>
        <td id="LC3809" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and the first of the seventeenth. They were unfortunate men in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3810" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3810"></td>
        <td id="LC3810" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time of their birth. No painter could have been great in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3811" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3811"></td>
        <td id="LC3811" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seventeenth century of Italy. Art lay prone upon its face under Jesuit</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3812" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3812"></td>
        <td id="LC3812" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rule, and the late men were left upon the barren sands by the receding</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3813" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3813"></td>
        <td id="LC3813" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">wave of the Renaissance.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3814" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3814"></td>
        <td id="LC3814" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3815" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3815"></td>
        <td id="LC3815" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 52.--BRONZINO. CHRIST IN LIMBO. UFFIZI.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3816" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3816"></td>
        <td id="LC3816" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3817" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3817"></td>
        <td id="LC3817" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ART MOTIVES AND SUBJECTS: As before, the chief subject of the art of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3818" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3818"></td>
        <td id="LC3818" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Decadence was religion, with many heads and busts of the Madonna,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3819" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3819"></td>
        <td id="LC3819" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though nature and the classic still played their parts. After the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3820" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3820"></td>
        <td id="LC3820" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Reformation at the North the Church in Italy started the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3821" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3821"></td>
        <td id="LC3821" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Counter-Reformation. One of the chief means employed by this Catholic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3822" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3822"></td>
        <td id="LC3822" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reaction was the embellishment of church worship, and painting on a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3823" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3823"></td>
        <td id="LC3823" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">large scale, on panel rather than in fresco, was demanded for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3824" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3824"></td>
        <td id="LC3824" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decorative purposes. But the religious motive had passed out, though</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3825" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3825"></td>
        <td id="LC3825" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">its subject was retained, and the pictorial motive had reached its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3826" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3826"></td>
        <td id="LC3826" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">climax at Venice. The faith of the one and the taste and skill of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3827" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3827"></td>
        <td id="LC3827" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">other were not attainable by the late men, and, while consciously</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3828" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3828"></td>
        <td id="LC3828" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">striving to achieve them, they fell into exaggerated sentiment and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3829" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3829"></td>
        <td id="LC3829" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">technical weakness. It seems perfectly apparent in their works that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3830" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3830"></td>
        <td id="LC3830" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">they had nothing of their own to say, and that they were trying to say</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3831" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3831"></td>
        <td id="LC3831" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">over again what Michael Angelo, Correggio, and Titian had said before</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3832" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3832"></td>
        <td id="LC3832" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">them much better. There were earnest men and good painters among them,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3833" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3833"></td>
        <td id="LC3833" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but they could produce only the empty form of art. The spirit had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3834" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3834"></td>
        <td id="LC3834" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fled.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3835" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3835"></td>
        <td id="LC3835" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3836" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3836"></td>
        <td id="LC3836" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE MANNERISTS: Immediately after the High Renaissance leaders of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3837" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3837"></td>
        <td id="LC3837" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Florence and Rome came the imitators and exaggerators of their styles.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3838" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3838"></td>
        <td id="LC3838" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">They produced large, crowded compositions, with a hasty facility of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3839" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3839"></td>
        <td id="LC3839" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the brush and striking effects of light. Seeking the grand they</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3840" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3840"></td>
        <td id="LC3840" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">overshot the temperate. Their elegance was affected, their sentiment</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3841" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3841"></td>
        <td id="LC3841" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">forced, their brilliancy superficial glitter. When they thought to be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3842" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3842"></td>
        <td id="LC3842" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ideal they lost themselves in incomprehensible allegories; when they</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3843" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3843"></td>
        <td id="LC3843" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">thought to be real they grew prosaic in detail. These men are known in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3844" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3844"></td>
        <td id="LC3844" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art history as the Mannerists, and the men whose works they imitated</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3845" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3845"></td>
        <td id="LC3845" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were chiefly Raphael, Michael Angelo, and Correggio. There were many</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3846" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3846"></td>
        <td id="LC3846" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of them, and some of them have already been spoken of as the followers</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3847" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3847"></td>
        <td id="LC3847" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of Michael Angelo.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3848" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3848"></td>
        <td id="LC3848" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3849" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3849"></td>
        <td id="LC3849" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Agnolo Bronzino (1502?-1572) was a pupil of Pontormo, and an imitator</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3850" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3850"></td>
        <td id="LC3850" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of Michael Angelo, painting in rather heavy colors with a thin brush.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3851" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3851"></td>
        <td id="LC3851" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">His characters were large, but never quite free from weakness, except</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3852" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3852"></td>
        <td id="LC3852" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in portraiture, where he appeared at his best. Vasari (1511-1574)--the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3853" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3853"></td>
        <td id="LC3853" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">same Vasari who wrote the lives of the painters--had versatility and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3854" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3854"></td>
        <td id="LC3854" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">facility, but his superficial imitations of Michael Angelo were too</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3855" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3855"></td>
        <td id="LC3855" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">grandiose in conception and too palpably false in modelling. Salviati</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3856" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3856"></td>
        <td id="LC3856" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1510-1563) was a friend of Vasari, a painter of about the same cast</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3857" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3857"></td>
        <td id="LC3857" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of mind and hand as Vasari, and Federigo Zucchero (1543-1609) belongs</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3858" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3858"></td>
        <td id="LC3858" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with him in producing things muscularly big but intellectually small.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3859" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3859"></td>
        <td id="LC3859" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Baroccio (1528-1612), though classed among the Mannerists as an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3860" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3860"></td>
        <td id="LC3860" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">imitator of Correggio and Raphael, was really one of the strong men of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3861" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3861"></td>
        <td id="LC3861" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the late times. There was affectation and sentimentality about his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3862" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3862"></td>
        <td id="LC3862" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work, a prettiness of face, rosy flesh tints, and a general lightness</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3863" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3863"></td>
        <td id="LC3863" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of color, but he was a superior brushman, a good colorist, and, at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3864" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3864"></td>
        <td id="LC3864" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">times, a man of earnestness and power.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3865" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3865"></td>
        <td id="LC3865" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3866" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3866"></td>
        <td id="LC3866" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 53.--BAROCCIO. ANNUNCIATION.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3867" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3867"></td>
        <td id="LC3867" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3868" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3868"></td>
        <td id="LC3868" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE ECLECTICS: After the Mannerists came the Eclectics of Bologna, led</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3869" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3869"></td>
        <td id="LC3869" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by the Caracci, who, about 1585, sought to &quot;revive&quot; art. They started</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3870" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3870"></td>
        <td id="LC3870" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">out to correct the faults of the Mannerists, and yet their own art was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3871" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3871"></td>
        <td id="LC3871" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">based more on the art of their great predecessors than on nature. They</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3872" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3872"></td>
        <td id="LC3872" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">thought to make a union of Renaissance excellences by combining</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3873" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3873"></td>
        <td id="LC3873" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Michael Angelo&#39;s line, Titian&#39;s color, Correggio&#39;s light-and-shade and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3874" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3874"></td>
        <td id="LC3874" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Raphael&#39;s symmetry and grace. The attempt was praiseworthy for the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3875" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3875"></td>
        <td id="LC3875" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time, but hardly successful. They caught the lines and lights and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3876" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3876"></td>
        <td id="LC3876" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">colors of the great men, but they overlooked the fact that the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3877" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3877"></td>
        <td id="LC3877" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">excellence of the imitated lay largely in their inimitable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3878" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3878"></td>
        <td id="LC3878" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">individualities, which could not be combined. The Eclectic work was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3879" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3879"></td>
        <td id="LC3879" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">done with intelligence, but their system was against them and their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3880" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3880"></td>
        <td id="LC3880" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">baroque age was against them. Midway in their career the Caracci</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3881" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3881"></td>
        <td id="LC3881" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">themselves modified their eclecticism and placed more reliance upon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3882" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3882"></td>
        <td id="LC3882" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature. But their pupils paid little heed to the modification.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3883" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3883"></td>
        <td id="LC3883" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3884" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3884"></td>
        <td id="LC3884" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">There were five of the Caracci, but three of them--Ludovico</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3885" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3885"></td>
        <td id="LC3885" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1555-1619), Agostino (1557-1602), and Annibale (1560-1609)--led the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3886" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3886"></td>
        <td id="LC3886" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school, and of these Annibale was the most distinguished. They had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3887" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3887"></td>
        <td id="LC3887" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">many pupils, and their influence was widely spread over Italy. In Sir</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3888" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3888"></td>
        <td id="LC3888" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Joshua Reynolds&#39;s day they were ranked with Raphael, but at the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3889" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3889"></td>
        <td id="LC3889" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">present time criticism places them where they belong--painters of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3890" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3890"></td>
        <td id="LC3890" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Decadence with little originality or spontaneity in their art, though</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3891" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3891"></td>
        <td id="LC3891" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">much technical skill. Domenichino (1581-1641) was the strongest of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3892" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3892"></td>
        <td id="LC3892" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pupils. His St. Jerome was rated by Poussin as one of the three great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3893" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3893"></td>
        <td id="LC3893" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">paintings of the world, but it never deserved such rank. It is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3894" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3894"></td>
        <td id="LC3894" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">powerfully composed, but poor in coloring and handling. The painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3895" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3895"></td>
        <td id="LC3895" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had great repute in his time, and was one of the best of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3896" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3896"></td>
        <td id="LC3896" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seventeenth century men. Guido Reni (1575-1642) was a painter of many</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3897" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3897"></td>
        <td id="LC3897" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gifts and accomplishments, combined with many weaknesses. His works</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3898" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3898"></td>
        <td id="LC3898" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">are well composed and painted, but excessive in sentiment and overdone</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3899" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3899"></td>
        <td id="LC3899" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in pathos. Albani (1578-1660) ran to elegance and a porcelain-like</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3900" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3900"></td>
        <td id="LC3900" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">prettiness. Guercino (1591-1666) was originally of the Eclectic School</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3901" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3901"></td>
        <td id="LC3901" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at Bologna, but later took up with the methods of the Naturalists at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3902" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3902"></td>
        <td id="LC3902" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Naples. He was a painter of far more than the average ability.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3903" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3903"></td>
        <td id="LC3903" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sassoferrato (1605-1685) and Carlo Dolci (1616-1686) were so</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3904" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3904"></td>
        <td id="LC3904" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">super-saturated with sentimentality that often their skill as painters</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3905" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3905"></td>
        <td id="LC3905" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">is overlooked or forgotten. In spirit they were about the weakest of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3906" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3906"></td>
        <td id="LC3906" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the century. There were other eclectic schools started throughout</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3907" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3907"></td>
        <td id="LC3907" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy--at Milan, Cremona, Ferrara--but they produced little worth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3908" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3908"></td>
        <td id="LC3908" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">recording. At Rome certain painters like Cristofano Allori</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3909" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3909"></td>
        <td id="LC3909" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1577-1621), an exceptionally strong man for the time, Berrettini</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3910" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3910"></td>
        <td id="LC3910" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1596-1669), and Maratta (1625-1713), manufactured a facile kind of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3911" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3911"></td>
        <td id="LC3911" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting from what was attractive in the various schools, but it was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3912" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3912"></td>
        <td id="LC3912" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">never other than meretricious work.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3913" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3913"></td>
        <td id="LC3913" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3914" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3914"></td>
        <td id="LC3914" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 54.--ANNIBALE CARACCI. ENTOMBMENT OF CHRIST.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3915" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3915"></td>
        <td id="LC3915" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3916" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3916"></td>
        <td id="LC3916" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3917" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3917"></td>
        <td id="LC3917" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE NATURALISTS: Contemporary with the Eclectics sprang up the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3918" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3918"></td>
        <td id="LC3918" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Neapolitan school of the Naturalists, led by Caravaggio (1569-1609)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3919" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3919"></td>
        <td id="LC3919" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and his pupils. These schools opposed each other, and yet influenced</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3920" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3920"></td>
        <td id="LC3920" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">each other. Especially was this true with the later men, who took what</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3921" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3921"></td>
        <td id="LC3921" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was best in both schools. The Naturalists were, perhaps, more firmly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3922" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3922"></td>
        <td id="LC3922" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">based upon nature than the Bolognese Eclectics. Their aim was to take</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3923" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3923"></td>
        <td id="LC3923" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature as they found it, and yet, in conformity with the extravagance</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3924" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3924"></td>
        <td id="LC3924" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the age, they depicted extravagant nature. Caravaggio thought to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3925" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3925"></td>
        <td id="LC3925" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">represent sacred scenes more truthfully by taking his models from the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3926" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3926"></td>
        <td id="LC3926" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">harsh street life about him and giving types of saints and apostles</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3927" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3927"></td>
        <td id="LC3927" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">from Neapolitan brawlers and bandits. It was a brutal, coarse</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3928" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3928"></td>
        <td id="LC3928" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">representation, rather fierce in mood and impetuous in action, yet not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3929" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3929"></td>
        <td id="LC3929" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">without a good deal of tragic power. His subjects were rather dismal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3930" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3930"></td>
        <td id="LC3930" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">or morose, but there was knowledge in the drawing of them, some good</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3931" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3931"></td>
        <td id="LC3931" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color and brush-work and a peculiar darkness of shadow masses</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3932" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3932"></td>
        <td id="LC3932" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(originally gained from Giorgione), that stood as an ear-mark of his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3933" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3933"></td>
        <td id="LC3933" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">whole school. From the continuous use of black shadows the school got</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3934" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3934"></td>
        <td id="LC3934" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the name of the &quot;Darklings,&quot; by which they are still known. Giordano</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3935" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3935"></td>
        <td id="LC3935" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1632-1705), a painter of prodigious facility and invention, Salvator</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3936" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3936"></td>
        <td id="LC3936" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Rosa (1615-1673), best known as one of the early painters of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3937" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3937"></td>
        <td id="LC3937" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">landscape, and Ribera, a Spanish painter, were the principal pupils.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3938" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3938"></td>
        <td id="LC3938" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3939" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3939"></td>
        <td id="LC3939" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE LATE VENETIANS: The Decadence at Venice, like the Renaissance,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3940" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3940"></td>
        <td id="LC3940" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">came later than at Florence, but after the death of Tintoretto</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3941" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3941"></td>
        <td id="LC3941" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mannerisms and the imitation of the great men did away with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3942" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3942"></td>
        <td id="LC3942" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">originality. There was still much color left, and fine ceiling</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3943" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3943"></td>
        <td id="LC3943" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decorations were done, but the nobility and calm splendor of Titian&#39;s</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3944" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3944"></td>
        <td id="LC3944" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">days had passed. Palma il Giovine (1544-1628) with a hasty brush</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3945" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3945"></td>
        <td id="LC3945" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">produced imitations of Tintoretto with some grace and force, and in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3946" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3946"></td>
        <td id="LC3946" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">remarkable quantity. He and Tintoretto were the most rapid and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3947" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3947"></td>
        <td id="LC3947" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">productive painters of the century; but Palma&#39;s was not good in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3948" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3948"></td>
        <td id="LC3948" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spirit, though quite dashing in technic. Padovanino (1590-1650) was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3949" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3949"></td>
        <td id="LC3949" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">more of a Titian follower, but, like all the other painters of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3950" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3950"></td>
        <td id="LC3950" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time, he was proficient with the brush and lacking in the stronger</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3951" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3951"></td>
        <td id="LC3951" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mental elements. The last great Italian painter was Tiepolo</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3952" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3952"></td>
        <td id="LC3952" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1696-1770), and he was really great beyond his age. With an art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3953" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3953"></td>
        <td id="LC3953" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">founded on Paolo Veronese, he produced decorative ceilings and panels</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3954" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3954"></td>
        <td id="LC3954" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of high quality, with wonderful invention, a limpid brush, and a light</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3955" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3955"></td>
        <td id="LC3955" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">flaky color peculiarly appropriate to the walls of churches and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3956" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3956"></td>
        <td id="LC3956" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">palaces. He was, especially in easel pictures, a brilliant, vivacious</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3957" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3957"></td>
        <td id="LC3957" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brushman, full of dash and spirit, tempered by a large knowledge of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3958" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3958"></td>
        <td id="LC3958" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">what was true and pictorial. Some of his best pictures are still in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3959" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3959"></td>
        <td id="LC3959" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Venice, and modern painters are unstinted in their praise of them. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3960" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3960"></td>
        <td id="LC3960" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">left a son, Domenico Tiepolo (1726-1795), who followed his methods. In</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3961" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3961"></td>
        <td id="LC3961" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the late days of Venetian painting, Canaletto (1697-1768) and Guardi</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3962" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3962"></td>
        <td id="LC3962" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1712-1793) achieved reputation by painting Venetian canals and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3963" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3963"></td>
        <td id="LC3963" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">architecture with much color effect.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3964" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3964"></td>
        <td id="LC3964" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3965" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3965"></td>
        <td id="LC3965" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 55.--CARAVAGGIO. THE CARD PLAYERS. DRESDEN.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3966" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3966"></td>
        <td id="LC3966" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3967" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3967"></td>
        <td id="LC3967" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">NINETEENTH-CENTURY PAINTING IN ITALY: There is little in the art of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3968" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3968"></td>
        <td id="LC3968" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy during the present century that shows a positive national</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3969" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3969"></td>
        <td id="LC3969" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spirit. It has been leaning on the rest of Europe for many years, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3970" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3970"></td>
        <td id="LC3970" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the best that the living painters show is largely an echo of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3971" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3971"></td>
        <td id="LC3971" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Dusseldorf, Munich, or Paris. The revived classicism of David in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3972" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3972"></td>
        <td id="LC3972" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">France affected nineteenth-century painting in Italy somewhat. Then it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3973" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3973"></td>
        <td id="LC3973" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was swayed by Cornelius and Overbeck from Germany. Morelli (1826-[2])</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3974" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3974"></td>
        <td id="LC3974" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shows this latter influence, though one of the most important of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3975" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3975"></td>
        <td id="LC3975" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">living men.[3] In the 1860&#39;s Mariano Fortuny, a Spaniard at Rome, led</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3976" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3976"></td>
        <td id="LC3976" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the younger element in the glittering and the sparkling, and this</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3977" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3977"></td>
        <td id="LC3977" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">style mingled with much that is more strikingly Parisian than Italian,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3978" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3978"></td>
        <td id="LC3978" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">may be found in the works of painters like Michetti, De Nittis</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3979" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3979"></td>
        <td id="LC3979" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1846-1884), Favretto, Tito, Nono, Simonetti, and others.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3980" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3980"></td>
        <td id="LC3980" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3981" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3981"></td>
        <td id="LC3981" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 2: Died, 1901.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3982" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3982"></td>
        <td id="LC3982" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3983" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3983"></td>
        <td id="LC3983" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 3: See _Scribner&#39;s Magazine_, Neapolitan Art, Dec., 1890,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3984" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3984"></td>
        <td id="LC3984" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Feb., 1891.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3985" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3985"></td>
        <td id="LC3985" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3986" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3986"></td>
        <td id="LC3986" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Of recent days the impressionistic view of light and color has had its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3987" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3987"></td>
        <td id="LC3987" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence; but the Italian work at its best is below that of France.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3988" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3988"></td>
        <td id="LC3988" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Segantini[4] was one of the most promising of the younger men in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3989" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3989"></td>
        <td id="LC3989" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjects that have an archaic air about them. Boldini, though Italian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3990" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3990"></td>
        <td id="LC3990" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">born and originally following Fortuny&#39;s example, is really more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3991" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3991"></td>
        <td id="LC3991" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Parisian than anything else. He is an artist of much power and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3992" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3992"></td>
        <td id="LC3992" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">technical strength in _genre_ subjects and portraits. The newer men</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3993" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3993"></td>
        <td id="LC3993" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">are Fragiocomo, Fattori, Mancini, Marchetti.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3994" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3994"></td>
        <td id="LC3994" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L3995" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="3995"></td>
        <td id="LC3995" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 4: Died, 1899.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
