        <td id="LC4062" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Peintres des fetes galantes, Watteau, Boucher, et al._;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4063" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4063"></td>
        <td id="LC4063" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Curmer, _L&#39;OEuvre de Jean Fouquet_; Delaborde, _Etudes sur</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4064" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4064"></td>
        <td id="LC4064" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     les Beaux Arts en France et en Italie_; Didot, _Etudes sur</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4065" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4065"></td>
        <td id="LC4065" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Jean Cousin_; Dimier, _French Painting in XVI Century_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4066" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4066"></td>
        <td id="LC4066" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Dumont, _Antoine Watteau_; Dussieux, _Nouvelles Recherches</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4067" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4067"></td>
        <td id="LC4067" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     sur la Vie de E. Lesueur_; Genevay, _Le Style Louis XIV.,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4068" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4068"></td>
        <td id="LC4068" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Charles Le Brun_; Goncourt, _L&#39;Art du XVIII^{me} Siecle_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4069" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4069"></td>
        <td id="LC4069" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Guibel, _Eloge de Nicolas Poussin_; Guiffrey, _La Famille de</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4070" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4070"></td>
        <td id="LC4070" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Jean Cousin_; Laborde, _La Renaissance des Arts a la Cour de</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4071" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4071"></td>
        <td id="LC4071" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     France_; Lagrange, _J. Vernet et la Peinture au XVIII^{me}</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4072" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4072"></td>
        <td id="LC4072" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Siecle_; Lecoy de la Marche, _Le Roi Rene_; Mantz, _Francois</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4073" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4073"></td>
        <td id="LC4073" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Boucher_; Michiels, _Etudes sur l&#39;Art Flamand dans l&#39;est et</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4074" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4074"></td>
        <td id="LC4074" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     le midi de la France_; Muntz, _La Renaissance en Italie et</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4075" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4075"></td>
        <td id="LC4075" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     en France_; Palustre, _La Renaissance en France_; Pattison,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4076" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4076"></td>
        <td id="LC4076" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Renaissance of Art in France_; Pattison, _Claude Lorrain_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4077" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4077"></td>
        <td id="LC4077" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Poillon, _Nicolas Poussin_; Stranahan, _History of French</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4078" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4078"></td>
        <td id="LC4078" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Painting_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4079" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4079"></td>
        <td id="LC4079" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4080" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4080"></td>
        <td id="LC4080" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4081" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4081"></td>
        <td id="LC4081" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">EARLY FRENCH ART: Painting in France did not, as in Italy, spring</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4082" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4082"></td>
        <td id="LC4082" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">directly from Christianity, though it dealt with the religious</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4083" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4083"></td>
        <td id="LC4083" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subject. From the beginning a decorative motive--the strong feature of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4084" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4084"></td>
        <td id="LC4084" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">French art--appears as the chief motive of painting. This showed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4085" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4085"></td>
        <td id="LC4085" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">itself largely in church ornament, garments, tapestries, miniatures,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4086" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4086"></td>
        <td id="LC4086" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and illuminations. Mural paintings were produced during the fifth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4087" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4087"></td>
        <td id="LC4087" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">century, probably in imitation of Italian or Roman example. Under</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4088" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4088"></td>
        <td id="LC4088" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Charlemagne, in the eighth century, Byzantine influences were at work.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4089" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4089"></td>
        <td id="LC4089" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In the eleventh, twelfth, and thirteenth centuries much stained-glass</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4090" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4090"></td>
        <td id="LC4090" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work appeared, and also many missal paintings and furniture</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4091" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4091"></td>
        <td id="LC4091" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decorations.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4092" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4092"></td>
        <td id="LC4092" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4093" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4093"></td>
        <td id="LC4093" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: Fig. 56.--POUSSIN. ET IN ARCADIA EGO. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4094" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4094"></td>
        <td id="LC4094" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4095" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4095"></td>
        <td id="LC4095" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In the fifteenth century Rene of Anjou (1408-1480), king and painter,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4096" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4096"></td>
        <td id="LC4096" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gave an impetus to art which he perhaps originally received from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4097" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4097"></td>
        <td id="LC4097" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy. His work showed some Italian influence mingled with a great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4098" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4098"></td>
        <td id="LC4098" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">deal of Flemish precision, and corresponded for France to the early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4099" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4099"></td>
        <td id="LC4099" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Renaissance work of Italy, though by no means so advanced.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4100" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4100"></td>
        <td id="LC4100" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Contemporary with Rene was Jean Fouquet (1415?-1480?) an illuminator</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4101" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4101"></td>
        <td id="LC4101" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and portrait-painter, one of the earliest in French history. He was an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4102" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4102"></td>
        <td id="LC4102" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artist of some original characteristics and produced an art detailed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4103" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4103"></td>
        <td id="LC4103" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and exact in its realism. Jean Pereal (?-1528?) and Jean Bourdichon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4104" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4104"></td>
        <td id="LC4104" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1457?-1521?) with Fouquet&#39;s pupils and sons, formed a school at Tours</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4105" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4105"></td>
        <td id="LC4105" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">which afterward came to show some Italian influence. The native</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4106" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4106"></td>
        <td id="LC4106" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">workmen at Paris--they sprang up from illuminators to painters in all</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4107" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4107"></td>
        <td id="LC4107" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">probability--showed more of the Flemish influence. Neither of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4108" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4108"></td>
        <td id="LC4108" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">schools of the fifteenth century reflected much life or thought, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4109" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4109"></td>
        <td id="LC4109" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">what there was of it was native to the soil, though their methods were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4110" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4110"></td>
        <td id="LC4110" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influenced from without.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4111" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4111"></td>
        <td id="LC4111" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4112" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4112"></td>
        <td id="LC4112" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SIXTEENTH-CENTURY PAINTING: During this century Francis I., at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4113" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4113"></td>
        <td id="LC4113" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Fontainebleau, seems to have encouraged two schools of painting, one</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4114" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4114"></td>
        <td id="LC4114" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the native French and the other an imported Italian, which afterward</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4115" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4115"></td>
        <td id="LC4115" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">took to itself the name of the &quot;School of Fontainebleau.&quot; Of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4116" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4116"></td>
        <td id="LC4116" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">native artists the Clouets were the most conspicuous. They were of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4117" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4117"></td>
        <td id="LC4117" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Flemish origin, and followed Flemish methods both in technic and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4118" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4118"></td>
        <td id="LC4118" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mediums. There were four of them, of whom Jean (1485?-1541?) and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4119" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4119"></td>
        <td id="LC4119" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Francois (1500?-1572?) were the most noteworthy. They painted many</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4120" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4120"></td>
        <td id="LC4120" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portraits, and Francois&#39; work, bearing some resemblance to that of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4121" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4121"></td>
        <td id="LC4121" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Holbein, it has been doubtfully said that he was a pupil of that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4122" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4122"></td>
        <td id="LC4122" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter. All of their work was remarkable for detail and closely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4123" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4123"></td>
        <td id="LC4123" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">followed facts.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4124" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4124"></td>
        <td id="LC4124" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4125" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4125"></td>
        <td id="LC4125" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The Italian importation came about largely through the travels of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4126" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4126"></td>
        <td id="LC4126" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Francis I. in Italy. He invited to Fontainebleau Leonardo da Vinci,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4127" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4127"></td>
        <td id="LC4127" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Andrea del Sarto, Il Rosso, Primaticcio, and Niccolo dell&#39; Abbate.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4128" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4128"></td>
        <td id="LC4128" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">These painters rather superseded and greatly influenced the French</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4129" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4129"></td>
        <td id="LC4129" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters. The result was an Italianized school of French art which</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4130" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4130"></td>
        <td id="LC4130" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ruled in France for many years. Primaticcio was probably the greatest</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4131" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4131"></td>
        <td id="LC4131" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the influencers, remaining as he did for thirty years in France.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4132" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4132"></td>
        <td id="LC4132" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The native painters, Jean Cousin (1500?-1589) and Toussaint du Breuil</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4133" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4133"></td>
        <td id="LC4133" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1561-1602) followed his style, and in the next century the painters</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4134" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4134"></td>
        <td id="LC4134" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were even more servile imitators of Italy--imitating not the best</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4135" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4135"></td>
        <td id="LC4135" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">models either, but the Mannerists, the Eclectics, and the Roman</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4136" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4136"></td>
        <td id="LC4136" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters of the Decadence.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4137" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4137"></td>
        <td id="LC4137" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4138" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4138"></td>
        <td id="LC4138" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 57.--CLAUDE LORRAIN. FLIGHT INTO EGYPT. DRESDEN.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4139" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4139"></td>
        <td id="LC4139" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4140" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4140"></td>
        <td id="LC4140" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SEVENTEENTH-CENTURY PAINTING: This was a century of great development</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4141" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4141"></td>
        <td id="LC4141" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and production in France, the time of the founding of the French</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4142" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4142"></td>
        <td id="LC4142" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Academy of Painting and Sculpture, and the formation of many picture</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4143" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4143"></td>
        <td id="LC4143" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">collections. In the first part of the century the Flemish and native</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4144" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4144"></td>
        <td id="LC4144" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">tendencies existed, but they were overawed, outnumbered by the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4145" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4145"></td>
        <td id="LC4145" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italian. Not even Rubens&#39;s painting for Marie de&#39; Medici, in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4146" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4146"></td>
        <td id="LC4146" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">palace of the Luxembourg, could stem the tide of Italy. The French</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4147" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4147"></td>
        <td id="LC4147" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters flocked to Rome to study the art of their great predecessors</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4148" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4148"></td>
        <td id="LC4148" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and were led astray by the flashy elegance of the late Italians. Among</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4149" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4149"></td>
        <td id="LC4149" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the earliest of this century was Freminet (1567-1619). He was first</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4150" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4150"></td>
        <td id="LC4150" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">taught by his father and Jean Cousin, but afterward spent fifteen</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4151" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4151"></td>
        <td id="LC4151" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">years in Italy studying Parmigianino and Michael Angelo. His work had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4152" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4152"></td>
        <td id="LC4152" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">something of the Mannerist style about it and was overwrought and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4153" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4153"></td>
        <td id="LC4153" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">exaggerated. In shadows he seemed to have borrowed from Caravaggio.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4154" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4154"></td>
        <td id="LC4154" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Vouet (1590-1649) was a student in Italy of Veronese&#39;s painting and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4155" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4155"></td>
        <td id="LC4155" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">afterward of Guido Reni and Caravaggio. He was a mediocre artist, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4156" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4156"></td>
        <td id="LC4156" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had a great vogue in France and left many celebrated pupils.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4157" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4157"></td>
        <td id="LC4157" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4158" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4158"></td>
        <td id="LC4158" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">By all odds the best painter of this time was Nicolas Poussin</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4159" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4159"></td>
        <td id="LC4159" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1593-1665). He lived almost all of his life in Italy, and might be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4160" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4160"></td>
        <td id="LC4160" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">put down as an Italian of the Decadence. He was well versed in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4161" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4161"></td>
        <td id="LC4161" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classical archaeology, and had much of the classic taste and feeling</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4162" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4162"></td>
        <td id="LC4162" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">prevalent at that time in the Roman school of Giulio Romano. His work</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4163" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4163"></td>
        <td id="LC4163" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">showed great intelligence and had an elevated grandiloquent style</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4164" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4164"></td>
        <td id="LC4164" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">about it that was impressive. It reflected nothing French, and had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4165" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4165"></td>
        <td id="LC4165" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">little more root in present human sympathy than any of the other</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4166" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4166"></td>
        <td id="LC4166" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting of the time, but it was better done. The drawing was correct</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4167" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4167"></td>
        <td id="LC4167" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">if severe, the composition agreeable if formal, the coloring</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4168" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4168"></td>
        <td id="LC4168" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">variegated if violent. Many of his pictures have now changed for the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4169" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4169"></td>
        <td id="LC4169" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">worse in coloring owing to the dissipation of surface pigments. He was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4170" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4170"></td>
        <td id="LC4170" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the founder of the classic and academic in French art, and in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4171" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4171"></td>
        <td id="LC4171" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence was the most important man of the century. He was especially</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4172" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4172"></td>
        <td id="LC4172" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strong in the heroic landscape, and in this branch helped form the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4173" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4173"></td>
        <td id="LC4173" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">style of his brother-in-law, Gaspard (Dughet) Poussin (1613-1675).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4174" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4174"></td>
        <td id="LC4174" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4175" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4175"></td>
        <td id="LC4175" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The landscape painter of the period, however, was Claude Lorrain</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4176" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4176"></td>
        <td id="LC4176" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1600-1682). He differed from Poussin in making his pictures depend</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4177" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4177"></td>
        <td id="LC4177" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">more strictly upon landscape than upon figures. With both painters,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4178" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4178"></td>
        <td id="LC4178" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the trees, mountains, valleys, buildings, figures, were of the grand</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4179" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4179"></td>
        <td id="LC4179" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classic variety. Hills and plains, sylvan groves, flowing streams,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4180" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4180"></td>
        <td id="LC4180" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">peopled harbors, Ionic and Corinthian temples, Roman aqueducts,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4181" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4181"></td>
        <td id="LC4181" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mythological groups, were the materials used, and the object of their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4182" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4182"></td>
        <td id="LC4182" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">use was to show the ideal dwelling-place of man--the former Garden of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4183" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4183"></td>
        <td id="LC4183" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Gods. Panoramic and slightly theatrical at times, Claude&#39;s work</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4184" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4184"></td>
        <td id="LC4184" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was not without its poetic side, shrewd knowledge, and skilful</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4185" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4185"></td>
        <td id="LC4185" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">execution. He was a leader in landscape, the man who first painted</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4186" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4186"></td>
        <td id="LC4186" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">real golden sunlight and shed its light upon earth. There is a soft</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4187" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4187"></td>
        <td id="LC4187" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">summer&#39;s-day drowsiness, a golden haze of atmosphere, a feeling of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4188" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4188"></td>
        <td id="LC4188" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composure and restfulness about his pictures that are attractive. Like</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4189" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4189"></td>
        <td id="LC4189" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Poussin he depended much upon long sweeping lines in composition, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4190" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4190"></td>
        <td id="LC4190" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">upon effects of linear perspective.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4191" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4191"></td>
        <td id="LC4191" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4192" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4192"></td>
        <td id="LC4192" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 58--WATTEAU. GILLES. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4193" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4193"></td>
        <td id="LC4193" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4194" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4194"></td>
        <td id="LC4194" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">COURT PAINTING: When Louis XIV. came to the throne painting took on a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4195" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4195"></td>
        <td id="LC4195" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decided character, but it was hardly national or race character. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4196" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4196"></td>
        <td id="LC4196" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">popular idea, if the people had an idea, did not obtain. There was no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4197" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4197"></td>
        <td id="LC4197" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">motive springing from the French except an inclination to follow</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4198" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4198"></td>
        <td id="LC4198" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy; and in Italy all the great art-motives were dead. In method</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4199" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4199"></td>
        <td id="LC4199" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the French painters followed the late Italians, and imitated an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4200" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4200"></td>
        <td id="LC4200" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">imitation; in matter they bowed to the dictates of the court and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4201" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4201"></td>
        <td id="LC4201" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reflected the king&#39;s mock-heroic spirit. Echoing the fashion of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4202" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4202"></td>
        <td id="LC4202" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">day, painting became pompous, theatrical, grandiloquent--a mass of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4203" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4203"></td>
        <td id="LC4203" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">vapid vanity utterly lacking in sincerity and truth. Lebrun</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4204" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4204"></td>
        <td id="LC4204" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1619-1690), painter in ordinary to the king, directed substantially</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4205" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4205"></td>
        <td id="LC4205" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all the painting of the reign. He aimed at pleasing royalty with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4206" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4206"></td>
        <td id="LC4206" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">flattering allusions to Caesarism and extravagant personifications of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4207" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4207"></td>
        <td id="LC4207" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the king as a classic conqueror. His art had neither truth, nor</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4208" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4208"></td>
        <td id="LC4208" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">genius, nor great skill, and so sought to startle by subject or size.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4209" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4209"></td>
        <td id="LC4209" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Enormous canvases of Alexander&#39;s triumphs, in allusion to those of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4210" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4210"></td>
        <td id="LC4210" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great Louis, were turned out to order, and Versailles to this day is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4211" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4211"></td>
        <td id="LC4211" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">tapestried with battle-pieces in which Louis is always victor.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4212" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4212"></td>
        <td id="LC4212" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Considering the amount of work done, Lebrun showed great fecundity and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4213" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4213"></td>
        <td id="LC4213" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">industry, but none of it has much more than a mechanical ingenuity</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4214" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4214"></td>
        <td id="LC4214" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">about it. It was rather original in composition, but poor in drawing,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4215" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4215"></td>
        <td id="LC4215" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lighting, and coloring; and its example upon the painters of the time</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4216" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4216"></td>
        <td id="LC4216" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was pernicious.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4217" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4217"></td>
        <td id="LC4217" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4218" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4218"></td>
        <td id="LC4218" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">His contemporary, Le Sueur (1616-1655), was a more sympathetic and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4219" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4219"></td>
        <td id="LC4219" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sincere painter, if not a much better technician. Both were pupils of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4220" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4220"></td>
        <td id="LC4220" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Vouet, but Le Sueur&#39;s art was religious in subject, while Lebrun&#39;s was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4221" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4221"></td>
        <td id="LC4221" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">military and monarchical. Le Sueur had a feeling for his theme, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4222" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4222"></td>
        <td id="LC4222" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was a weak painter, inclined to the sentimental, thin in coloring, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4223" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4223"></td>
        <td id="LC4223" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not at all certain in his drawing. French allusions to him as &quot;the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4224" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4224"></td>
        <td id="LC4224" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">French Raphael&quot; show more national complacency than correctness.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4225" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4225"></td>
        <td id="LC4225" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sebastian Bourdon (1616-1671) was another painter of history, but a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4226" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4226"></td>
        <td id="LC4226" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">little out of the Lebrun circle. He was not, however, free from the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4227" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4227"></td>
        <td id="LC4227" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence of Italy, where he spent three years studying color more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4228" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4228"></td>
        <td id="LC4228" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">than drawing. This shows in his works, most of which are lacking in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4229" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4229"></td>
        <td id="LC4229" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4230" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4230"></td>
        <td id="LC4230" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4231" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4231"></td>
        <td id="LC4231" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Contemporary with these men was a group of portrait-painters who</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4232" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4232"></td>
        <td id="LC4232" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gained celebrity perhaps as much by their subjects as by their own</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4233" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4233"></td>
        <td id="LC4233" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">powers. They were facile flatterers given over to the pomps of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4234" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4234"></td>
        <td id="LC4234" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reign and mirroring all its absurdities of fashion. Their work has a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4235" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4235"></td>
        <td id="LC4235" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">graceful, smooth appearance, and, for its time, it was undoubtedly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4236" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4236"></td>
        <td id="LC4236" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">excellent portraiture. Even to this day it has qualities of drawing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4237" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4237"></td>
        <td id="LC4237" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and coloring to commend it, and at times one meets with exceptionally</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4238" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4238"></td>
        <td id="LC4238" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">good work. The leaders among these portrait-painters were Philip de</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4239" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4239"></td>
        <td id="LC4239" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Champaigne (1602-1674), the best of his time; Pierre Mignard</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4240" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4240"></td>
        <td id="LC4240" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1610?-1695), a pupil of Vouet, who studied in Rome and afterward</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4241" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4241"></td>
        <td id="LC4241" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">returned to France to become the successful rival of Lebrun;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4242" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4242"></td>
        <td id="LC4242" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Largilliere (1656-1746) and Rigaud (1659-1743).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4243" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4243"></td>
        <td id="LC4243" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4244" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4244"></td>
        <td id="LC4244" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">EIGHTEENTH-CENTURY PAINTING: The painting of Louis XIV.&#39;s time was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4245" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4245"></td>
        <td id="LC4245" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">continued into the eighteenth century for some fifteen years or more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4246" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4246"></td>
        <td id="LC4246" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with little change. With the advent of Louis XV. art took upon itself</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4247" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4247"></td>
        <td id="LC4247" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">another character, and one that reflected perfectly the moral, social,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4248" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4248"></td>
        <td id="LC4248" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and political France of the eighteenth century. The first Louis</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4249" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4249"></td>
        <td id="LC4249" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">clamored for glory, the second Louis revelled in gayety, frivolity,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4250" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4250"></td>
        <td id="LC4250" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and sensuality. This was the difference between both monarchs and both</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4251" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4251"></td>
        <td id="LC4251" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">arts. The gay and the coquettish in painting had already been</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4252" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4252"></td>
        <td id="LC4252" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">introduced by the Regent, himself a dilettante in art, and when Louis</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4253" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4253"></td>
        <td id="LC4253" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">XV. came to the throne it passed from the gay to the insipid, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4254" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4254"></td>
        <td id="LC4254" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">flippant, even the erotic. Shepherds and shepherdesses dressed in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4255" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4255"></td>
        <td id="LC4255" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">court silks and satins with cottony sheep beside them posed in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4256" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4256"></td>
        <td id="LC4256" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">stage-set Arcadias, pretty gods and goddesses reclined indolently upon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4257" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4257"></td>
        <td id="LC4257" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gossamer clouds, and court gallants lounged under artificial trees by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4258" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4258"></td>
        <td id="LC4258" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artificial ponds making love to pretty soubrettes from the theatre.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4259" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4259"></td>
        <td id="LC4259" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4260" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4260"></td>
        <td id="LC4260" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Yet, in spite of the lack of moral and intellectual elevation, in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4261" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4261"></td>
        <td id="LC4261" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spite of frivolity and make-believe, this art was infinitely better</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4262" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4262"></td>
        <td id="LC4262" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">than the pompous imitation of foreign example set up by Louis XIV. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4263" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4263"></td>
        <td id="LC4263" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was more spontaneous, more original, more French. The influence of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4264" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4264"></td>
        <td id="LC4264" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy began to fail, and the painters began to mirror French life. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4265" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4265"></td>
        <td id="LC4265" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was largely court life, lively, vivacious, licentious, but in that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4266" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4266"></td>
        <td id="LC4266" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">very respect characteristic of the time. Moreover, there was another</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4267" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4267"></td>
        <td id="LC4267" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">quality about it that showed French taste at its best--the decorative</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4268" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4268"></td>
        <td id="LC4268" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">quality. It can hardly be supposed that the fairy creations of the age</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4269" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4269"></td>
        <td id="LC4269" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were intended to represent actual nature. They were designed to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4270" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4270"></td>
        <td id="LC4270" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ornament hall and boudoir, and in pure decorative delicacy of design,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4271" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4271"></td>
        <td id="LC4271" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lightness of touch, color charm, they have never been excelled. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4272" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4272"></td>
        <td id="LC4272" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">serious spirit was lacking, but the gayety of line and color was well</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4273" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4273"></td>
        <td id="LC4273" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">given.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4274" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4274"></td>
        <td id="LC4274" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4275" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4275"></td>
        <td id="LC4275" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 59.--BOUCHER. PASTORAL. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4276" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4276"></td>
        <td id="LC4276" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4277" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4277"></td>
        <td id="LC4277" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Watteau (1684-1721) was the one chiefly responsible for the coquette</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4278" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4278"></td>
        <td id="LC4278" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and soubrette of French art, and Watteau was, practically speaking,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4279" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4279"></td>
        <td id="LC4279" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the first French painter. His subjects were trifling bits of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4280" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4280"></td>
        <td id="LC4280" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fashionable love-making, scenes from the opera, fetes, balls, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4281" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4281"></td>
        <td id="LC4281" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">like. All his characters played at life in parks and groves that never</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4282" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4282"></td>
        <td id="LC4282" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">grew, and most of his color was beautifully unreal; but for all that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4283" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4283"></td>
        <td id="LC4283" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the work was original, decorative, and charming. Moreover, Watteau was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4284" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4284"></td>
        <td id="LC4284" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a brushman, and introduced not only a new spirit and new subject into</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4285" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4285"></td>
        <td id="LC4285" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art, but a new method. The epic treatment of the Italians was laid</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4286" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4286"></td>
        <td id="LC4286" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">aside in favor of a genre treatment, and instead of line and flat</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4287" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4287"></td>
        <td id="LC4287" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">surface Watteau introduced color and cleverly laid pigment. He was a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4288" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4288"></td>
        <td id="LC4288" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brilliant painter; not a great man in thought or imagination, but one</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4289" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4289"></td>
        <td id="LC4289" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of fancy, delicacy, and skill. Unfortunately he set a bad example by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4290" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4290"></td>
        <td id="LC4290" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his gay subjects, and those who came after him carried his gayety and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4291" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4291"></td>
        <td id="LC4291" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lightness of spirit into exaggeration. Watteau&#39;s best pupils were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4292" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4292"></td>
        <td id="LC4292" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Lancret (1690-1743) and Pater (1695-1736), who painted in his style</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4293" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4293"></td>
        <td id="LC4293" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with fair results.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4294" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4294"></td>
        <td id="LC4294" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4295" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4295"></td>
        <td id="LC4295" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">After these men came Van Loo (1705-1765) and Boucher (1703-1770), who</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4296" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4296"></td>
        <td id="LC4296" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">turned Watteau&#39;s charming fetes, showing the costumes and manners of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4297" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4297"></td>
        <td id="LC4297" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Regency, into flippant extravagance. Not only was the moral tone</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4298" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4298"></td>
        <td id="LC4298" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and intellectual stamina of their art far below that of Watteau, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4299" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4299"></td>
        <td id="LC4299" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">their workmanship grew defective. Both men possessed a remarkable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4300" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4300"></td>
        <td id="LC4300" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">facility of the hand and a keen decorative color-sense; but after a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4301" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4301"></td>
        <td id="LC4301" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time both became stereotyped and mannered. Drawing and modelling were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4302" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4302"></td>
        <td id="LC4302" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">neglected, light was wholly conventional, and landscape turned into a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4303" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4303"></td>
        <td id="LC4303" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">piece of embroidered background with a Dresden china-tapestry effect</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4304" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4304"></td>
        <td id="LC4304" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">about it. As decoration the general effect was often excellent, as a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4305" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4305"></td>
        <td id="LC4305" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">serious expression of life it was very weak, as an intellectual or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4306" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4306"></td>
        <td id="LC4306" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">moral force it was worse than worthless. Fragonard (1732-1806)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4307" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4307"></td>
        <td id="LC4307" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">followed in a similar style, but was a more knowing man, clever in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4308" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4308"></td>
        <td id="LC4308" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color, and a much freer and better brushman.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4309" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4309"></td>
        <td id="LC4309" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4310" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4310"></td>
        <td id="LC4310" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">A few painters in the time of Louis XV. remained apparently</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4311" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4311"></td>
        <td id="LC4311" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unaffected by the court influence, and stand in conspicuous isolation.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4312" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4312"></td>
        <td id="LC4312" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Claude Joseph Vernet (1712-1789) was a landscape and marine painter of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4313" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4313"></td>
        <td id="LC4313" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">some repute in his time. He had a sense of the pictorial, but not a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4314" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4314"></td>
        <td id="LC4314" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">remarkable sense of the truthful in nature. Chardin (1699-1779) and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4315" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4315"></td>
        <td id="LC4315" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Greuze (1725-1805), clung to portrayals of humble life and sought to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4316" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4316"></td>
        <td id="LC4316" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">popularize the _genre_ subject. Chardin was not appreciated by the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4317" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4317"></td>
        <td id="LC4317" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">masses. His frank realism, his absolute sincerity of purpose, his play</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4318" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4318"></td>
        <td id="LC4318" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of light and its effect upon color, and his charming handling of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4319" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4319"></td>
        <td id="LC4319" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">textures were comparatively unnoticed. Yet as a colorist he may be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4320" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4320"></td>
        <td id="LC4320" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ranked second to none in French art, and in freshness of handling his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4321" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4321"></td>
        <td id="LC4321" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work is a model for present-day painters. Diderot early recognized</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4322" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4322"></td>
        <td id="LC4322" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Chardin&#39;s excellence, and many artists since his day have admired his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4323" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4323"></td>
        <td id="LC4323" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictures; but he is not now a well-known or popular painter. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4324" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4324"></td>
        <td id="LC4324" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">populace fancies Greuze and his sentimental heads of young girls. They</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4325" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4325"></td>
        <td id="LC4325" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">have a prettiness about them that is attractive, but as art they lack</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4326" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4326"></td>
        <td id="LC4326" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in force, and in workmanship they are too smooth, finical, and thin in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4327" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4327"></td>
        <td id="LC4327" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">handling.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4328" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4328"></td>
        <td id="LC4328" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4329" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4329"></td>
        <td id="LC4329" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     PRINCIPAL WORKS: All of these French painters are best</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4330" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4330"></td>
        <td id="LC4330" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     represented in the collections of the Louvre. Some of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4331" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4331"></td>
        <td id="LC4331" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     other galleries, like the Dresden, Berlin, and National at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4332" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4332"></td>
        <td id="LC4332" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     London, have examples of their work; but the masterpieces</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4333" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4333"></td>
        <td id="LC4333" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     are with the French people in the Louvre and in the other</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4334" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4334"></td>
        <td id="LC4334" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     municipal galleries of France.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4335" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4335"></td>
        <td id="LC4335" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4336" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4336"></td>
        <td id="LC4336" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4337" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4337"></td>
        <td id="LC4337" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>

        <td id="L4338" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4338"></td>
        <td id="LC4338" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>

        <td id="L4339" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4339"></td>

      </tr>

        <td id="L4346" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4346"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L4356" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4356"></td>

        <td id="L4363" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4363"></td>

        <td id="L4364" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4364"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L4365" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4365"></td>
        <td id="LC4365" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _L&#39; OEuvre complet d&#39;Eugene Delacroix_; Sensier, _Theodore</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4366" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4366"></td>
        <td id="LC4366" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Rousseau_; Sensier, _Life and Works of J. F. Millet_;</td>

        <td id="L4367" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4367"></td>
        <td id="LC4367" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Silvestre, _Histoire des Artistes vivants et etrangers_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4368" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4368"></td>
        <td id="LC4368" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Strahan, _Modern French Art_; Thore, _L&#39;Art Contemporain_;</td>

        <td id="L4369" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4369"></td>
        <td id="LC4369" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Theuriet, _Jules Bastien-Lepage_; Van Dyke, _Modern French</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4370" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4370"></td>
        <td id="LC4370" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Masters_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4371" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4371"></td>
        <td id="LC4371" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4372" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4372"></td>
        <td id="LC4372" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4373" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4373"></td>
        <td id="LC4373" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE REVOLUTIONARY TIME: In considering this century&#39;s art in Europe,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4374" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4374"></td>
        <td id="LC4374" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it must be remembered that a great social and intellectual change has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4375" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4375"></td>
        <td id="LC4375" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">taken place since the days of the Medici. The power so long pent up in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4376" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4376"></td>
        <td id="LC4376" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy during the Renaissance finally broke and scattered itself upon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4377" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4377"></td>
        <td id="LC4377" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the western nations; societies and states were torn down and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4378" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4378"></td>
        <td id="LC4378" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rebuilded, political, social, and religious ideas shifted into new</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4379" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4379"></td>
        <td id="LC4379" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">garbs; the old order passed away.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4380" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4380"></td>
        <td id="LC4380" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4381" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4381"></td>
        <td id="LC4381" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 60.--DAVID. THE SABINES. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4382" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4382"></td>
        <td id="LC4382" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4383" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4383"></td>
        <td id="LC4383" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Religion as an art-motive, or even as an art-subject, ceased to obtain</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4384" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4384"></td>
        <td id="LC4384" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">anywhere. The Church failed as an art-patron, and the walls of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4385" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4385"></td>
        <td id="LC4385" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">cloister and cathedral furnished no new Bible readings to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4386" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4386"></td>
        <td id="LC4386" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unlettered. Painting, from being a necessity of life, passed into a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4387" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4387"></td>
        <td id="LC4387" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">luxury, and the king, the state, or the private collector became the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4388" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4388"></td>
        <td id="LC4388" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">patron. Nature and actual life were about the only sources left from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4389" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4389"></td>
        <td id="LC4389" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">which original art could draw its materials. These have been freely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4390" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4390"></td>
        <td id="LC4390" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">used, but not so much in a national as in an individual manner. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4391" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4391"></td>
        <td id="LC4391" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">tendency to-day is not to put forth a universal conception but an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4392" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4392"></td>
        <td id="LC4392" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">individual belief. Individualism--the same quality that appeared so</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4393" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4393"></td>
        <td id="LC4393" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strongly in Michael Angelo&#39;s art--has become a keynote in modern work.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4394" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4394"></td>
        <td id="LC4394" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">It is not the only kind of art that has been shown in this century,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4395" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4395"></td>
        <td id="LC4395" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nor is nature the only theme from which art has been derived. We must</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4396" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4396"></td>
        <td id="LC4396" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">remember and consider the influence of the past upon modern men, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4397" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4397"></td>
        <td id="LC4397" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the attempts to restore the classic beauty of the Greek, Roman, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4398" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4398"></td>
        <td id="LC4398" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italian, which practically ruled French painting in the first part of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4399" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4399"></td>
        <td id="LC4399" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this century.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4400" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4400"></td>
        <td id="LC4400" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4401" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4401"></td>
        <td id="LC4401" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">FRENCH CLASSICISM OF DAVID: This was a revival of Greek form in art,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4402" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4402"></td>
        <td id="LC4402" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">founded on the belief expressed by Winckelmann, that beauty lay in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4403" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4403"></td>
        <td id="LC4403" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form, and was best shown by the ancient Greeks. It was the objective</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4404" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4404"></td>
        <td id="LC4404" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">view of art which saw beauty in the external and tolerated no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4405" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4405"></td>
        <td id="LC4405" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">individuality in the artist except that which was shown in technical</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4406" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4406"></td>
        <td id="LC4406" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">skill. It was little more than an imitation of the Greek and Roman</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4407" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4407"></td>
        <td id="LC4407" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">marbles as types, with insistence upon perfect form, correct drawing,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4408" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4408"></td>
        <td id="LC4408" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and balanced composition. In theme and spirit it was pseudo-heroic,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4409" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4409"></td>
        <td id="LC4409" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the incidents of Greek and Roman history forming the chief subjects,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4410" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4410"></td>
        <td id="LC4410" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and in method it rather despised color, light-and-shade, and natural</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4411" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4411"></td>
        <td id="LC4411" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">surroundings. It was elevated, lofty, ideal in aspiration, but coldly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4412" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4412"></td>
        <td id="LC4412" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unsympathetic because lacking in contemporary interest; and, though</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4413" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4413"></td>
        <td id="LC4413" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">correct enough in classic form, was lacking in the classic spirit.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4414" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4414"></td>
