        <td id="LC4414" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Like all reanimated art, it was derivative as regards its forms and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4415" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4415"></td>
        <td id="LC4415" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lacking in spontaneity. The reason for the existence of Greek art died</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4416" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4416"></td>
        <td id="LC4416" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with its civilization, and those, like the French classicists, who</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4417" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4417"></td>
        <td id="LC4417" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sought to revive it, brought a copy of the past into the present,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4418" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4418"></td>
        <td id="LC4418" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">expecting the world to accept it.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4419" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4419"></td>
        <td id="LC4419" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4420" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4420"></td>
        <td id="LC4420" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">There was some social, and perhaps artistic, reason, however, for the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4421" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4421"></td>
        <td id="LC4421" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">revival of the classic in the French art of the late eighteenth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4422" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4422"></td>
        <td id="LC4422" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">century. It was a revolt, and at that time revolts were popular. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4423" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4423"></td>
        <td id="LC4423" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art of Boucher and Van Loo had become quite unbearable. It was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4424" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4424"></td>
        <td id="LC4424" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">flippant, careless, licentious. It had no seriousness or dignity about</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4425" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4425"></td>
        <td id="LC4425" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it. Moreover, it smacked of the Bourbon monarchy, which people had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4426" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4426"></td>
        <td id="LC4426" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">come to hate. Classicism was severe, elevated, respectable at least,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4427" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4427"></td>
        <td id="LC4427" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and had the air of the heroic republic about it. It was a return to a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4428" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4428"></td>
        <td id="LC4428" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sterner view of life, with the martial spirit behind it as an impetus,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4429" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4429"></td>
        <td id="LC4429" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and it had a great vogue. For many years during the Revolution, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4430" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4430"></td>
        <td id="LC4430" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Consulate, and the Empire, classicism was accepted by the sovereigns</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4431" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4431"></td>
        <td id="LC4431" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and the Institute of France, and to this day it lives in a modified</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4432" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4432"></td>
        <td id="LC4432" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form in that semi-classic work known as academic art.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4433" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4433"></td>
        <td id="LC4433" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4434" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4434"></td>
        <td id="LC4434" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE CLASSIC SCHOOL: Vien (1716-1809) was the first painter to protest</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4435" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4435"></td>
        <td id="LC4435" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">against the art of Boucher and Van Loo by advocating more nobility of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4436" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4436"></td>
        <td id="LC4436" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form and a closer study of nature. He was, however, more devoted to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4437" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4437"></td>
        <td id="LC4437" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the antique forms he had studied in Rome than to nature. In subject</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4438" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4438"></td>
        <td id="LC4438" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and line his tendency was classic, with a leaning toward the Italians</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4439" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4439"></td>
        <td id="LC4439" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the Decadence. He lacked the force to carry out a complete reform</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4440" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4440"></td>
        <td id="LC4440" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in painting, but his pupil David (1748-1825) accomplished what he had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4441" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4441"></td>
        <td id="LC4441" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">begun. It was David who established the reign of classicism, and by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4442" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4442"></td>
        <td id="LC4442" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">native power became the leader. The time was appropriate, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4443" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4443"></td>
        <td id="LC4443" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Revolution called for pictures of Romulus, Brutus and Achilles, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4444" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4444"></td>
        <td id="LC4444" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Napoleon encouraged the military theme. David had studied the marbles</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4445" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4445"></td>
        <td id="LC4445" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at Rome, and he used them largely for models, reproducing scenes from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4446" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4446"></td>
        <td id="LC4446" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Greek and Roman life in an elevated and sculpturesque style, with much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4447" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4447"></td>
        <td id="LC4447" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">archaeological knowledge and a great deal of skill. In color, relief,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4448" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4448"></td>
        <td id="LC4448" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentiment, individuality, his painting was lacking. He despised all</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4449" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4449"></td>
        <td id="LC4449" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that. The rhythm of line, the sweep of composed groups, the heroic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4450" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4450"></td>
        <td id="LC4450" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subject and the heroic treatment, made up his art. It was thoroughly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4451" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4451"></td>
        <td id="LC4451" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">objective, and what contemporary interest it possessed lay largely in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4452" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4452"></td>
        <td id="LC4452" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the martial spirit then prevalent. Of course it was upheld by the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4453" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4453"></td>
        <td id="LC4453" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Institute, and it really set the pace for French painting for nearly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4454" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4454"></td>
        <td id="LC4454" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">half a century. When David was called upon to paint Napoleonic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4455" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4455"></td>
        <td id="LC4455" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictures he painted them under protest, and yet these, with his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4456" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4456"></td>
        <td id="LC4456" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portraits, constitute his best work. In portraiture he was uncommonly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4457" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4457"></td>
        <td id="LC4457" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strong at times.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4458" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4458"></td>
        <td id="LC4458" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4459" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4459"></td>
        <td id="LC4459" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 61.--INGRES. OEDIPUS AND SPHINX. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4460" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4460"></td>
        <td id="LC4460" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4461" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4461"></td>
        <td id="LC4461" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">After the Restoration David, who had been a revolutionist, and then an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4462" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4462"></td>
        <td id="LC4462" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">adherent of Napoleon, was sent into exile; but the influence he had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4463" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4463"></td>
        <td id="LC4463" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">left and the school he had established were carried on by his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4464" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4464"></td>
        <td id="LC4464" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">contemporaries and pupils. Of the former Regnault (1754-1829), Vincent</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4465" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4465"></td>
        <td id="LC4465" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1746-1816), and Prudhon (1758-1823) were the most conspicuous. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4466" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4466"></td>
        <td id="LC4466" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">last one was considered as out of the classic circle, but so far as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4467" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4467"></td>
        <td id="LC4467" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">making his art depend upon drawing and composition, he was a genuine</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4468" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4468"></td>
        <td id="LC4468" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classicist. His subjects, instead of being heroic, inclined to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4469" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4469"></td>
        <td id="LC4469" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mythological and the allegorical. In Italy he had been a student of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4470" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4470"></td>
        <td id="LC4470" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Renaissance painters, and from them borrowed a method of shadow</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4471" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4471"></td>
        <td id="LC4471" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gradation that rendered his figures misty and phantom-like. They</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4472" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4472"></td>
        <td id="LC4472" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">possessed an ease of movement sometimes called &quot;Prudhonesque grace,&quot;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4473" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4473"></td>
        <td id="LC4473" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and in composition were well placed and effective.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4474" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4474"></td>
        <td id="LC4474" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4475" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4475"></td>
        <td id="LC4475" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Of David&#39;s pupils there were many. Only a few of them, however, had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4476" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4476"></td>
        <td id="LC4476" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pronounced ability, and even these carried David&#39;s methods into the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4477" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4477"></td>
        <td id="LC4477" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">theatrical. Girodet (1766-1824) was a draughtsman of considerable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4478" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4478"></td>
        <td id="LC4478" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">power, but with poor taste in color and little repose in composition.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4479" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4479"></td>
        <td id="LC4479" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Most of his work was exaggeration and strained effect. Lethiere</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4480" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4480"></td>
        <td id="LC4480" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1760-1832) and Guerin (1774-1833), pupils of Regnault, were painters</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4481" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4481"></td>
        <td id="LC4481" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">akin to Girodet, but inferior to him. Gerard (1770-1837) was a weak</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4482" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4482"></td>
        <td id="LC4482" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">David follower, who gained some celebrity by painting portraits of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4483" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4483"></td>
        <td id="LC4483" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">celebrated men and women. The two pupils of David who brought him the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4484" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4484"></td>
        <td id="LC4484" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">most credit were Ingres (1780-1867) and Gros (1771-1835). Ingres was a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4485" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4485"></td>
        <td id="LC4485" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">cold, persevering man, whose principles had been well settled by David</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4486" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4486"></td>
        <td id="LC4486" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early in life, and were adhered to with conviction by the pupil to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4487" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4487"></td>
        <td id="LC4487" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">last. He modified the classic subject somewhat, studied Raphael and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4488" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4488"></td>
        <td id="LC4488" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Italians, and reintroduced the single figure into art (the Source,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4489" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4489"></td>
        <td id="LC4489" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and the Odalisque, for example). For color he had no fancy. &quot;In nature</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4490" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4490"></td>
        <td id="LC4490" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all is form,&quot; he used to say. Painting he thought not an independent</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4491" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4491"></td>
        <td id="LC4491" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art, but &quot;a development of sculpture.&quot; To consider emotion, color, or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4492" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4492"></td>
        <td id="LC4492" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light as the equal of form was monstrous, and to compare Rembrandt</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4493" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4493"></td>
        <td id="LC4493" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with Raphael was blasphemy. To this belief he clung to the end,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4494" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4494"></td>
        <td id="LC4494" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">faithfully reproducing the human figure, and it is not to be wondered</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4495" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4495"></td>
        <td id="LC4495" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at that eventually he became a learned draughtsman. His single figures</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4496" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4496"></td>
        <td id="LC4496" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and his portraits show him to the best advantage. He had a strong</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4497" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4497"></td>
        <td id="LC4497" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">grasp of modelling and an artistic sense of the beauty and dignity of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4498" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4498"></td>
        <td id="LC4498" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">line not excelled by any artist of this century. And to him more than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4499" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4499"></td>
        <td id="LC4499" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">any other painter is due the cultured draughtsmanship which is to-day</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4500" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4500"></td>
        <td id="LC4500" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the just pride of the French school.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4501" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4501"></td>
        <td id="LC4501" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4502" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4502"></td>
        <td id="LC4502" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gros was a more vacillating man, and by reason of forsaking the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4503" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4503"></td>
        <td id="LC4503" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classic subject for Napoleonic battle-pieces, he unconsciously led the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4504" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4504"></td>
        <td id="LC4504" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">way toward romanticism. He excelled as a draughtsman, but when he came</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4505" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4505"></td>
        <td id="LC4505" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to paint the Field of Eylau and the Pest of Jaffa he mingled color,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4506" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4506"></td>
        <td id="LC4506" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light, air, movement, action, sacrificing classic composition and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4507" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4507"></td>
        <td id="LC4507" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">repose to reality. This was heresy from the Davidian point of view,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4508" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4508"></td>
        <td id="LC4508" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and David eventually convinced him of it. Gros returned to the classic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4509" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4509"></td>
        <td id="LC4509" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">theme and treatment, but soon after was so reviled by the changing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4510" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4510"></td>
        <td id="LC4510" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">criticism of the time that he committed suicide in the Seine. His art,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4511" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4511"></td>
        <td id="LC4511" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">however, was the beginning of romanticism.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4512" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4512"></td>
        <td id="LC4512" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4513" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4513"></td>
        <td id="LC4513" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The landscape painting of this time was rather academic and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4514" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4514"></td>
        <td id="LC4514" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unsympathetic. It was a continuation of the Claude-Poussin tradition,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4515" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4515"></td>
        <td id="LC4515" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and in its insistence upon line, grandeur of space, and imposing trees</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4516" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4516"></td>
        <td id="LC4516" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and mountains, was a fit companion to the classic figure-piece. It had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4517" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4517"></td>
        <td id="LC4517" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">little basis in nature, and little in color or feeling to commend it.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4518" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4518"></td>
        <td id="LC4518" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Watelet (1780-1866), Bertin (1775-1842), Michallon (1796-1822), and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4519" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4519"></td>
        <td id="LC4519" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Aligny (1798-1871), were its exponents.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4520" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4520"></td>
        <td id="LC4520" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4521" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4521"></td>
        <td id="LC4521" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">A few painters seemed to stand apart from the contemporary influences.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4522" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4522"></td>
        <td id="LC4522" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Madame Vigee-Lebrun (1755-1842), a successful portrait-painter of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4523" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4523"></td>
        <td id="LC4523" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nobility, and Horace Vernet (1789-1863), a popular battle-painter,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4524" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4524"></td>
        <td id="LC4524" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">many of whose works are to be seen at Versailles, were of this class.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4525" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4525"></td>
        <td id="LC4525" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4526" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4526"></td>
        <td id="LC4526" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ROMANTICISM: The movement in French painting which began about 1822 and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4527" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4527"></td>
        <td id="LC4527" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">took the name of Romanticism was but a part of the &quot;storm-and-stress&quot;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4528" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4528"></td>
        <td id="LC4528" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">feeling that swept Germany, England, and France at the beginning of this</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4529" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4529"></td>
        <td id="LC4529" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">century, appearing first in literature and afterward in art. It had its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4530" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4530"></td>
        <td id="LC4530" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">origin in a discontent with the present, a passionate yearning for the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4531" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4531"></td>
        <td id="LC4531" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unattainable, an intensity of sentiment, gloomy melancholy imaginings,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4532" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4532"></td>
        <td id="LC4532" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and a desire to express the inexpressible. It was emphatically</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4533" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4533"></td>
        <td id="LC4533" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjective, self-conscious, a mood of mind or feeling. In this respect</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4534" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4534"></td>
        <td id="LC4534" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it was diametrically opposed to the academic and the classic. In French</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4535" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4535"></td>
        <td id="LC4535" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting it came forward in opposition to the classicism of David.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4536" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4536"></td>
        <td id="LC4536" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">People had begun to weary of Greek and Roman heroes and their deeds, of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4537" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4537"></td>
        <td id="LC4537" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">impersonal line-bounded statuesque art. There was a demand for something</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4538" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4538"></td>
        <td id="LC4538" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">more representative, spontaneous, expressive of the intense feeling of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4539" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4539"></td>
        <td id="LC4539" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the time. The very gist of romanticism was passion. Freedom to express</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4540" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4540"></td>
        <td id="LC4540" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">itself in what form it would was a condition of its existence.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4541" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4541"></td>
        <td id="LC4541" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4542" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4542"></td>
        <td id="LC4542" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 62.--DELACROIX. MASSACRE OF SCIO. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4543" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4543"></td>
        <td id="LC4543" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4544" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4544"></td>
        <td id="LC4544" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The classic subject was abandoned by the romanticists for dramatic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4545" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4545"></td>
        <td id="LC4545" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">scenes of mediaeval and modern times. The romantic hero and heroine in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4546" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4546"></td>
        <td id="LC4546" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">scenes of horror, perils by land and sea, flame and fury, love and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4547" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4547"></td>
        <td id="LC4547" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">anguish, came upon the boards. Much of this was illustration of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4548" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4548"></td>
        <td id="LC4548" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">history, the novel, and poetry, especially the poetry of Goethe,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4549" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4549"></td>
        <td id="LC4549" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Byron, and Scott. Line was slurred in favor of color, symmetrical</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4550" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4550"></td>
        <td id="LC4550" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition gave way to wild disordered groups in headlong action, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4551" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4551"></td>
        <td id="LC4551" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">atmospheres, skies, and lights were twisted and distorted to convey</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4552" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4552"></td>
        <td id="LC4552" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the sentiment of the story. It was thus, more by suggestion than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4553" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4553"></td>
        <td id="LC4553" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">realization, that romanticism sought to give the poetic sentiment of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4554" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4554"></td>
        <td id="LC4554" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">life. Its position toward classicism was antagonistic, a rebound, a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4555" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4555"></td>
        <td id="LC4555" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">flying to the other extreme. One virtually said that beauty was in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4556" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4556"></td>
        <td id="LC4556" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Greek form, the other that it was in the painter&#39;s emotional nature.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4557" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4557"></td>
        <td id="LC4557" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The disagreement was violent, and out of it grew the so-called</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4558" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4558"></td>
        <td id="LC4558" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romantic quarrel of the 1820&#39;s.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4559" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4559"></td>
        <td id="LC4559" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4560" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4560"></td>
        <td id="LC4560" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">LEADERS OF ROMANTICISM: Symptoms of the coming movement were apparent</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4561" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4561"></td>
        <td id="LC4561" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">long before any open revolt. Gros had made innovations on the classic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4562" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4562"></td>
        <td id="LC4562" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in his battle-pieces, but the first positive dissent from classic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4563" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4563"></td>
        <td id="LC4563" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">teachings was made in the Salon of 1819 by Gericault (1791-1824) with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4564" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4564"></td>
        <td id="LC4564" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his Raft of the Medusa. It represented the starving, the dead, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4565" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4565"></td>
        <td id="LC4565" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dying of the Medusa&#39;s crew on a raft in mid-ocean. The subject was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4566" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4566"></td>
        <td id="LC4566" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">classic. It was literary, romantic, dramatic, almost theatric in its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4567" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4567"></td>
        <td id="LC4567" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seizing of the critical moment. Its theme was restless, harrowing,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4568" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4568"></td>
        <td id="LC4568" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">horrible. It met with instant opposition from the old men and applause</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4569" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4569"></td>
        <td id="LC4569" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">from the young men. It was the trumpet-note of the revolt, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4570" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4570"></td>
        <td id="LC4570" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gericault did not live long enough to become the leader of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4571" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4571"></td>
        <td id="LC4571" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romanticism. That position fell to his contemporary and fellow-pupil,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4572" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4572"></td>
        <td id="LC4572" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Delacroix (1799-1863). It was in 1822 that Delacroix&#39;s first Salon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4573" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4573"></td>
        <td id="LC4573" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">picture (the Dante and Virgil) appeared. A strange, ghost-like scene</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4574" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4574"></td>
        <td id="LC4574" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">from Dante&#39;s _Inferno_, the black atmosphere of the nether world,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4575" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4575"></td>
        <td id="LC4575" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">weird faces, weird colors, weird flames, and a modelling of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4576" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4576"></td>
        <td id="LC4576" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figures by patches of color almost savage as compared to the tinted</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4577" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4577"></td>
        <td id="LC4577" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">drawing of classicism. Delacroix&#39;s youth saved the picture from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4578" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4578"></td>
        <td id="LC4578" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">condemnation, but it was different with his Massacre of Scio two</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4579" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4579"></td>
        <td id="LC4579" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">years later. This was decried by the classicists, and even Gros called</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4580" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4580"></td>
        <td id="LC4580" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it &quot;the massacre of art.&quot; The painter was accused of establishing the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4581" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4581"></td>
        <td id="LC4581" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">worship of the ugly, he was no draughtsman, had no selection, no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4582" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4582"></td>
        <td id="LC4582" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">severity, nothing but brutality. But Delacroix was as obstinate as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4583" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4583"></td>
        <td id="LC4583" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Ingres, and declared that the whole world could not prevent him from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4584" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4584"></td>
        <td id="LC4584" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seeing and painting things in his own way. It was thus the quarrel</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4585" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4585"></td>
        <td id="LC4585" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">started, the young men siding with Delacroix, the older men following</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4586" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4586"></td>
        <td id="LC4586" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">David and Ingres.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4587" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4587"></td>
        <td id="LC4587" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4588" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4588"></td>
        <td id="LC4588" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In himself Delacroix embodied all that was best and strongest in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4589" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4589"></td>
        <td id="LC4589" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romantic movement. His painting was intended to convey a romantic mood</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4590" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4590"></td>
        <td id="LC4590" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of mind by combinations of color, light, air, and the like. In subject</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4591" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4591"></td>
        <td id="LC4591" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it was tragic and passionate, like the poetry of Hugo, Byron, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4592" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4592"></td>
        <td id="LC4592" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Scott. The figures were usually given with anguish-wrung brows, wild</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4593" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4593"></td>
        <td id="LC4593" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">eyes, dishevelled hair, and impetuous, contorted action. The painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4594" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4594"></td>
        <td id="LC4594" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">never cared for technical details, seeking always to gain the effect</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4595" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4595"></td>
        <td id="LC4595" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the whole rather than the exactness of the part. He purposely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4596" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4596"></td>
        <td id="LC4596" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">slurred drawing at times, and was opposed to formal composition. In</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4597" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4597"></td>
        <td id="LC4597" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color he was superior, though somewhat violent at times, and in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4598" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4598"></td>
        <td id="LC4598" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brush-work he was often labored and patchy. His strength lay in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4599" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4599"></td>
        <td id="LC4599" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">imagination displayed in color and in action.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4600" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4600"></td>
        <td id="LC4600" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4601" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4601"></td>
        <td id="LC4601" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The quarrel between classicism and romanticism lasted some years, with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4602" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4602"></td>
        <td id="LC4602" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">neither side victorious. Delacroix won recognition for his view of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4603" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4603"></td>
        <td id="LC4603" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art, but did not crush the belief in form which was to come to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4604" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4604"></td>
        <td id="LC4604" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">surface again. He fought almost alone. Many painters rallied around</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4605" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4605"></td>
        <td id="LC4605" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">him, but they added little strength to the new movement. Deveria</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4606" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4606"></td>
        <td id="LC4606" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1805-1865) and Champmartin (1797-1883) were highly thought of at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4607" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4607"></td>
        <td id="LC4607" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">first, but they rapidly degenerated. Sigalon (1788-1837), Cogniet</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4608" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4608"></td>
        <td id="LC4608" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1794-1880), Robert-Fleury (1797-), and Boulanger (1806-1867), were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4609" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4609"></td>
        <td id="LC4609" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romanticists, but achieved more as teachers than as painters.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4610" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4610"></td>
        <td id="LC4610" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Delaroche (1797-1856) was an eclectic--in fact, founded a school of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4611" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4611"></td>
        <td id="LC4611" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that name--thinking to take what was best from both parties.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4612" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4612"></td>
        <td id="LC4612" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Inventing nothing, he profited by all invented. He employed the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4613" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4613"></td>
        <td id="LC4613" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romantic subject and color, but adhered to classic drawing. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4614" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4614"></td>
        <td id="LC4614" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition was good, his costume careful in detail, his brush-work</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4615" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4615"></td>
        <td id="LC4615" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">smooth, and his story-telling capacity excellent. All these qualities</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4616" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4616"></td>
        <td id="LC4616" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">made him a popular painter, but not an original or powerful one. Ary</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4617" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4617"></td>
        <td id="LC4617" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Scheffer (1797-1858) was an illustrator of Goethe and Byron, frail in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4618" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4618"></td>
        <td id="LC4618" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">both sentiment and color, a painter who started as a romanticist, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4619" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4619"></td>
        <td id="LC4619" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">afterward developed line under Ingres.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4620" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4620"></td>
        <td id="LC4620" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4621" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4621"></td>
        <td id="LC4621" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 63.--GEROME. POLLICE VERSO.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4622" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4622"></td>
        <td id="LC4622" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4623" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4623"></td>
        <td id="LC4623" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE ORIENTALISTS: In both literature and painting one phase of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4624" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4624"></td>
        <td id="LC4624" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romanticism showed itself in a love for the life, the light, the color</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4625" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4625"></td>
        <td id="LC4625" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the Orient. From Paris Decamps (1803-1860) was the first painter to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4626" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4626"></td>
        <td id="LC4626" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">visit the East and paint Eastern life. He was a _genre_ painter more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4627" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4627"></td>
        <td id="LC4627" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">than a figure painter, giving naturalistic street scenes in Turkey and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4628" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4628"></td>
        <td id="LC4628" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Asia Minor, courts, and interiors, with great feeling for air, warmth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4629" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4629"></td>
        <td id="LC4629" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of color, and light. At about the same time Marilhat (1811-1847) was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4630" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4630"></td>
        <td id="LC4630" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in Egypt picturing the life of that country in a similar manner; and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4631" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4631"></td>
        <td id="LC4631" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">later, Fromentin (1820-1876), painter and writer, following Delacroix,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4632" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4632"></td>
        <td id="LC4632" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">went to Algiers and portrayed there Arab life with fast-flying horses,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4633" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4633"></td>
        <td id="LC4633" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the desert air, sky, light, and color. Theodore Frere and Ziem belong</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4634" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4634"></td>
        <td id="LC4634" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">further on in the century, but were no less exponents of romanticism</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4635" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4635"></td>
        <td id="LC4635" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in the East.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4636" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4636"></td>
        <td id="LC4636" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4637" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4637"></td>
        <td id="LC4637" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Fifteen years after the starting of romanticism the movement had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4638" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4638"></td>
        <td id="LC4638" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">materially subsided. It had never been a school in the sense of having</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4639" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4639"></td>
        <td id="LC4639" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rules and laws of art. Liberty of thought and perfect freedom for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4640" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4640"></td>
        <td id="LC4640" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">individual expression were all it advocated. As a result there was no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4641" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4641"></td>
        <td id="LC4641" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unity, for there was nothing to unite upon; and with every painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4642" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4642"></td>
        <td id="LC4642" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting as he pleased, regardless of law, extravagance was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4643" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4643"></td>
        <td id="LC4643" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">inevitable. This was the case, and when the next generation came in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4644" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4644"></td>
        <td id="LC4644" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romanticism began to be ridiculed for its excesses. A reaction started</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4645" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4645"></td>
        <td id="LC4645" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in favor of more line and academic training. This was first shown by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4646" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4646"></td>
        <td id="LC4646" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the students of Delaroche, though there were a number of movements at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4647" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4647"></td>
        <td id="LC4647" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the time, all of them leading away from romanticism. A recoil from too</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4648" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4648"></td>
        <td id="LC4648" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">much color in favor of more form was inevitable, but romanticism was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4649" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4649"></td>
        <td id="LC4649" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not to perish entirely. Its influence was to go on, and to appear in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4650" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4650"></td>
        <td id="LC4650" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the work of later men.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4651" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4651"></td>
        <td id="LC4651" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4652" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4652"></td>
        <td id="LC4652" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ECLECTICS AND TRANSITIONAL PAINTERS: After Ingres his follower</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4653" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4653"></td>
        <td id="LC4653" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Flandrin (1809-1864) was the most considerable draughtsman of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4654" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4654"></td>
        <td id="LC4654" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time. He was not classic but religious in subject, and is sometimes</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4655" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4655"></td>
        <td id="LC4655" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">called &quot;the religious painter of France.&quot; He had a delicate beauty of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4656" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4656"></td>
        <td id="LC4656" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">line and a fine feeling for form, but never was strong in color,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4657" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4657"></td>
        <td id="LC4657" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brush-work, or sentiment. His best work appears in his very fine</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4658" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4658"></td>
        <td id="LC4658" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portraits. Gleyre (1806-1874) was a man of classic methods, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4659" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4659"></td>
        <td id="LC4659" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romantic tastes, who modified the heroic into the idyllic and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4660" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4660"></td>
        <td id="LC4660" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mythologic. He was a sentimental day-dreamer, with a touch of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4661" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4661"></td>
        <td id="LC4661" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">melancholy about the vanished past, appearing in Arcadian fancies,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4662" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4662"></td>
        <td id="LC4662" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pretty nymphs, and idealized memories of youth. In execution he was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4663" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4663"></td>
        <td id="LC4663" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not at all romantic. His color was pale, his drawing delicate, and his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4664" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4664"></td>
        <td id="LC4664" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lighting misty and uncertain. It was the etherealized classic method,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4665" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4665"></td>
        <td id="LC4665" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and this method he transmitted to a little band of painters called the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4666" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4666"></td>
        <td id="LC4666" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4667" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4667"></td>
        <td id="LC4667" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">NEW-GREEKS, who, in point of time, belong much further along in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4668" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4668"></td>
        <td id="LC4668" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">century, but in their art are with Gleyre. Their work never rose above</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4669" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4669"></td>
        <td id="LC4669" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the idyllic and the graceful, and calls for no special mention. Hamon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4670" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4670"></td>
        <td id="LC4670" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1821-1874) and Aubert (1824-) belonged to the band, and Gerome</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4671" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4671"></td>
        <td id="LC4671" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1824-[6]) was at one time its leader, but he afterward emerged from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4672" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4672"></td>
        <td id="LC4672" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it to a higher place in French art, where he will find mention</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4673" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4673"></td>
        <td id="LC4673" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hereafter.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4674" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4674"></td>
        <td id="LC4674" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4675" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4675"></td>
        <td id="LC4675" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 6: Died, 1904.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4676" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4676"></td>
        <td id="LC4676" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4677" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4677"></td>
        <td id="LC4677" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Couture (1815-1879) stood quite by himself, a mingling of several</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4678" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4678"></td>
        <td id="LC4678" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influences. His chief picture, The Romans of the Decadence, is classic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4679" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4679"></td>
        <td id="LC4679" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in subject, romantic in sentiment (and this very largely expressed by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4680" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4680"></td>
        <td id="LC4680" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">warmth of color), and rather realistic in natural appearance. He was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4681" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4681"></td>
        <td id="LC4681" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">an eclectic in a way, and yet seems to stand as the forerunner of a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4682" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4682"></td>
        <td id="LC4682" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">large body of artists who find classification hereafter under the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4683" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4683"></td>
        <td id="LC4683" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">title of the Semi-Classicists.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4684" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4684"></td>
        <td id="LC4684" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4685" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4685"></td>
        <td id="LC4685" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     PRINCIPAL WORKS: All the painters mentioned in this chapter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4686" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4686"></td>
        <td id="LC4686" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     are best represented in the Louvre at Paris, at Versailles,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4687" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4687"></td>
        <td id="LC4687" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     and in the museums of the chief French cities. Some works of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4688" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4688"></td>
        <td id="LC4688" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     the late or living men may be found in the Luxembourg, where</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4689" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4689"></td>
        <td id="LC4689" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     pictures bought by the state are kept for ten years after</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4690" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4690"></td>
        <td id="LC4690" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     the painter&#39;s death, and then are either sent to the Louvre</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4691" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4691"></td>
        <td id="LC4691" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     or to the other municipal galleries of France. Some pictures</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4692" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4692"></td>
        <td id="LC4692" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     by these men are also to be seen in the Metropolitan Museum,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4693" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4693"></td>
        <td id="LC4693" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     New York, the Boston Museum, and the Chicago Art Institute.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4694" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4694"></td>
        <td id="LC4694" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4695" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4695"></td>
        <td id="LC4695" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4696" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4696"></td>
        <td id="LC4696" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4697" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4697"></td>
        <td id="LC4697" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4698" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4698"></td>
        <td id="LC4698" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHAPTER XIV.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4699" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4699"></td>
        <td id="LC4699" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4700" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4700"></td>
        <td id="LC4700" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">FRENCH PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4701" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4701"></td>
        <td id="LC4701" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4702" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4702"></td>
        <td id="LC4702" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE NINETEENTH CENTURY (_Continued_).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4703" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4703"></td>
        <td id="LC4703" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4704" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4704"></td>
        <td id="LC4704" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: The books before mentioned, consult also</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4705" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4705"></td>
        <td id="LC4705" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     General Bibliography, (page xv.)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4706" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4706"></td>
        <td id="LC4706" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4707" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4707"></td>
        <td id="LC4707" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4708" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4708"></td>
        <td id="LC4708" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE LANDSCAPE PAINTERS: The influence of either the classic or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4709" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4709"></td>
        <td id="LC4709" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romantic example may be traced in almost all of the French painting of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4710" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4710"></td>
        <td id="LC4710" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this century. The opposed teachings find representatives in new men,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4711" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4711"></td>
        <td id="LC4711" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and under different names the modified dispute goes on--the dispute of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4712" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4712"></td>
        <td id="LC4712" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the academic _versus_ the individual, the art of form and line</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4713" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4713"></td>
        <td id="LC4713" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">_versus_ the art of sentiment and color.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4714" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4714"></td>
        <td id="LC4714" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4715" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4715"></td>
        <td id="LC4715" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">With the classicism of David not only the figure but the landscape</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4716" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4716"></td>
        <td id="LC4716" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">setting of it, took on an ideal heroic character. Trees and hills and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4717" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4717"></td>
        <td id="LC4717" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rivers became supernaturally grand and impressive. Everything was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4718" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4718"></td>
        <td id="LC4718" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">elevated by method to produce an imaginary Arcadia fit for the deities</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4719" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4719"></td>
        <td id="LC4719" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the classic world. The result was that nature and the humanity of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4720" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4720"></td>
        <td id="LC4720" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the painter passed out in favor of school formula and academic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4721" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4721"></td>
        <td id="LC4721" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">traditions. When romanticism came in this was changed, but nature</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4722" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4722"></td>
        <td id="LC4722" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">falsified in another direction. Landscape was given an interest in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4723" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4723"></td>
        <td id="LC4723" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">human affairs, and made to look gay or sad, peaceful or turbulent, as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4724" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4724"></td>
        <td id="LC4724" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the day went well or ill with the hero of the story portrayed. It was,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4725" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4725"></td>
        <td id="LC4725" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">however, truer to the actual than the classic, more studied in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4726" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4726"></td>
        <td id="LC4726" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">parts, more united in the whole. About the year 1830 the influence of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4727" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4727"></td>
        <td id="LC4727" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romanticism began to show in a new landscape art. That is to say, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4728" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4728"></td>
        <td id="LC4728" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">emotional impulse springing from romanticism combined with the study</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4729" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4729"></td>
        <td id="LC4729" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the old Dutch landscapists, and the English contemporary painters,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4730" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4730"></td>
        <td id="LC4730" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Constable and Bonington, set a large number of painters to the close</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4731" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4731"></td>
        <td id="LC4731" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">study of nature and ultimately developed what has been vaguely called</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4732" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4732"></td>
        <td id="LC4732" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4733" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4733"></td>
        <td id="LC4733" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4734" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4734"></td>
        <td id="LC4734" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">FONTAINEBLEAU-BARBIZON SCHOOL: This whole school was primarily devoted</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4735" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4735"></td>
        <td id="LC4735" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to showing the sentiment of color and light. It took nature just as it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4736" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4736"></td>
        <td id="LC4736" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">found it in the forest of Fontainebleau, on the plain of Barbizon, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4737" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4737"></td>
        <td id="LC4737" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">elsewhere, and treated it with a poetic feeling for light, shadow,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4738" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4738"></td>
        <td id="LC4738" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">atmosphere, color, that resulted in the best landscape painting yet</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4739" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4739"></td>
        <td id="LC4739" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">known to us.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4740" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4740"></td>
        <td id="LC4740" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4741" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4741"></td>
        <td id="LC4741" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 64.--COROT. LANDSCAPE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4742" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4742"></td>
        <td id="LC4742" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
