        <td id="L4743" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4743"></td>
        <td id="LC4743" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Corot (1796-1875) though classically trained under Bertin, and though</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4744" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4744"></td>
        <td id="LC4744" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">somewhat apart from the other men in his life, belongs with this</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4745" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4745"></td>
        <td id="LC4745" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">group. He was a man whose artistic life was filled with the beauty of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4746" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4746"></td>
        <td id="LC4746" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light and air. These he painted with great singleness of aim and great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4747" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4747"></td>
        <td id="LC4747" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">poetic charm. Most of his work is in a light silvery key of color,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4748" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4748"></td>
        <td id="LC4748" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">usually slight in composition, simple in masses of light and dark,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4749" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4749"></td>
        <td id="LC4749" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and very broadly but knowingly handled with the brush. He began</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4750" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4750"></td>
        <td id="LC4750" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting by using the minute brush, but changed it later on for a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4751" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4751"></td>
        <td id="LC4751" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">freer style which recorded only the great omnipresent truths and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4752" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4752"></td>
        <td id="LC4752" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">suppressed the small ones. He has never had a superior in producing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4753" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4753"></td>
        <td id="LC4753" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the permeating light of morning and evening. For this alone, if for no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4754" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4754"></td>
        <td id="LC4754" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">other excellence, he deservedly holds high rank.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4755" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4755"></td>
        <td id="LC4755" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4756" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4756"></td>
        <td id="LC4756" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Rousseau (1812-1867) was one of the foremost of the recognized</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4757" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4757"></td>
        <td id="LC4757" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">leaders, and probably the most learned landscapist of this century. A</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4758" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4758"></td>
        <td id="LC4758" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">man of many moods and methods he produced in variety with rare</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4759" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4759"></td>
        <td id="LC4759" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">versatility. Much of his work was experimental, but at his best he had</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4760" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4760"></td>
        <td id="LC4760" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a majestic conception of nature, a sense of its power and permanence,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4761" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4761"></td>
        <td id="LC4761" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">its volume and mass, that often resulted in the highest quality of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4762" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4762"></td>
        <td id="LC4762" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictorial poetry. In color he was rich and usually warm, in technic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4763" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4763"></td>
        <td id="LC4763" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">firm and individual, in sentiment at times quite sublime. At first he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4764" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4764"></td>
        <td id="LC4764" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painted broadly and won friends among the artists and sneers from the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4765" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4765"></td>
        <td id="LC4765" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">public; then in his middle style he painted in detail, and had a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4766" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4766"></td>
        <td id="LC4766" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">period of popular success; in his late style he went back to the broad</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4767" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4767"></td>
        <td id="LC4767" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">manner, and died amid quarrels and vexations of spirits. His long-time</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4768" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4768"></td>
        <td id="LC4768" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">friend and companion, Jules Dupre (1812-1889), hardly reached up to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4769" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4769"></td>
        <td id="LC4769" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">him, though a strong painter in landscape and marine. He was a good</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4770" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4770"></td>
        <td id="LC4770" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but not great colorist, and, technically, his brush was broad enough</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4771" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4771"></td>
        <td id="LC4771" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but sometimes heavy. His late work is inferior in sentiment and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4772" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4772"></td>
        <td id="LC4772" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">labored in handling. Diaz (1808-1876) was allied to Rousseau in aim</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4773" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4773"></td>
        <td id="LC4773" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and method, though not so sure nor so powerful a painter. He had fancy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4774" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4774"></td>
        <td id="LC4774" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and variety in creation that sometimes ran to license, and in color he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4775" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4775"></td>
        <td id="LC4775" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was clear and brilliant. Never very well trained, his drawing is often</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4776" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4776"></td>
        <td id="LC4776" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">indifferent and his light distorted, but these are more than atoned</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4777" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4777"></td>
        <td id="LC4777" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for by delicacy and poetic charm. At times he painted with much power.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4778" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4778"></td>
        <td id="LC4778" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Daubigny (1817-1878) seemed more like Corot in his charm of style and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4779" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4779"></td>
        <td id="LC4779" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">love of atmosphere and light than any of the others. He was fond of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4780" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4780"></td>
        <td id="LC4780" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the banks of the Seine and the Marne at twilight, with evening</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4781" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4781"></td>
        <td id="LC4781" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">atmospheres and dark trees standing in silent ranks against the warm</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4782" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4782"></td>
        <td id="LC4782" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sky. He was also fond of the gray day along the coast, and even the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4783" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4783"></td>
        <td id="LC4783" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sea attracted him not a little. He was a painter of high abilities,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4784" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4784"></td>
        <td id="LC4784" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and in treatment strongly individual, even distinguished, by his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4785" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4785"></td>
        <td id="LC4785" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">simplicity and directness. Unity of the whole, grasp of the mass</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4786" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4786"></td>
        <td id="LC4786" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">entire, was his technical aim, and this he sought to get not so much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4787" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4787"></td>
        <td id="LC4787" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by line as by color-tones of varying value. In this respect he seemed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4788" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4788"></td>
        <td id="LC4788" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a connecting link between Corot and the present-day impressionists.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4789" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4789"></td>
        <td id="LC4789" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Michel (1763-1842), Huet (1804-1869), Chintreuil (1814-1873), and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4790" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4790"></td>
        <td id="LC4790" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Francais (1814-) were all allied in point of view with this group of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4791" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4791"></td>
        <td id="LC4791" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">landscape painters, and among the late men who have carried out their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4792" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4792"></td>
        <td id="LC4792" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">beliefs are Cazin,[7] Yon,[8] Damoye, Pointelin, Harpignies and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4793" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4793"></td>
        <td id="LC4793" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Pelouse[9] seem a little more inclined to the realistic than the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4794" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4794"></td>
        <td id="LC4794" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">poetic view, though producing work of much virility and intelligence.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4795" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4795"></td>
        <td id="LC4795" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4796" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4796"></td>
        <td id="LC4796" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 7: Died, 1901.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4797" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4797"></td>
        <td id="LC4797" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4798" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4798"></td>
        <td id="LC4798" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 8: Died, 1897.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4799" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4799"></td>
        <td id="LC4799" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4800" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4800"></td>
        <td id="LC4800" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 9: Died, 1890.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4801" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4801"></td>
        <td id="LC4801" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4802" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4802"></td>
        <td id="LC4802" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Contemporary and associated with the Fontainebleau painters were a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4803" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4803"></td>
        <td id="LC4803" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">number of men who won high distinction as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4804" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4804"></td>
        <td id="LC4804" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4805" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4805"></td>
        <td id="LC4805" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PAINTERS OF ANIMALS: Troyon (1810-1865) was the most prominent among</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4806" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4806"></td>
        <td id="LC4806" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">them. His work shows the same sentiment of light and color as the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4807" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4807"></td>
        <td id="LC4807" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Fontainebleau landscapists, and with it there is much keen insight</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4808" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4808"></td>
        <td id="LC4808" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">into animal life. As a technician he was rather hard at first, and he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4809" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4809"></td>
        <td id="LC4809" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">never was a correct draughtsman, but he had a way of giving the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4810" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4810"></td>
        <td id="LC4810" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">character of the objects he portrayed which is the very essence of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4811" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4811"></td>
        <td id="LC4811" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">truth. He did many landscapes with and without cattle. His best pupil</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4812" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4812"></td>
        <td id="LC4812" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was Van Marcke (1827-1890), who followed his methods but never</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4813" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4813"></td>
        <td id="LC4813" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">possessed the feeling of his master. Jacque (1813-[10]) is also of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4814" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4814"></td>
        <td id="LC4814" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Fontainebleau-Barbizon group, and is justly celebrated for his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4815" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4815"></td>
        <td id="LC4815" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">paintings and etchings of sheep. The poetry of the school is his, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4816" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4816"></td>
        <td id="LC4816" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">technically he is fine in color at times, if often rather dark in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4817" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4817"></td>
        <td id="LC4817" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">illumination. Like Troyon he knows his subject well, and can show the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4818" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4818"></td>
        <td id="LC4818" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nature of sheep with true feeling. Rosa Bonheur (1822-[11]) and her</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4819" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4819"></td>
        <td id="LC4819" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brother, Auguste Bonheur (1824-1884), have both dealt with animal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4820" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4820"></td>
        <td id="LC4820" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">life, but never with that fine artistic feeling which would warrant</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4821" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4821"></td>
        <td id="LC4821" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">their popularity. Their work is correct enough, but prosaic and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4822" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4822"></td>
        <td id="LC4822" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">commonplace in spirit. They do not belong in the same group with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4823" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4823"></td>
        <td id="LC4823" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Troyon and Rousseau.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4824" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4824"></td>
        <td id="LC4824" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4825" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4825"></td>
        <td id="LC4825" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 10: Died, 1894.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4826" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4826"></td>
        <td id="LC4826" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4827" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4827"></td>
        <td id="LC4827" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 11: Died, 1899.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4828" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4828"></td>
        <td id="LC4828" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4829" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4829"></td>
        <td id="LC4829" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 65.--ROUSSEAU, CHARCOAL BURNERS&#39; HUT. FULLER</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4830" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4830"></td>
        <td id="LC4830" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">COLLECTION.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4831" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4831"></td>
        <td id="LC4831" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4832" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4832"></td>
        <td id="LC4832" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE PEASANT PAINTERS: Allied again in feeling and sentiment with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4833" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4833"></td>
        <td id="LC4833" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Fontainebleau landscapists were some celebrated painters of peasant</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4834" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4834"></td>
        <td id="LC4834" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">life, chief among whom stood Millet (1814-1875), of Barbizon. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4835" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4835"></td>
        <td id="LC4835" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictorial inclination of Millet was early grounded by a study of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4836" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4836"></td>
        <td id="LC4836" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Delacroix, the master romanticist, and his work is an expression of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4837" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4837"></td>
        <td id="LC4837" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romanticism modified by an individual study of nature and applied to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4838" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4838"></td>
        <td id="LC4838" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">peasant life. He was peasant born, living and dying at Barbizon,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4839" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4839"></td>
        <td id="LC4839" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sympathizing with his class, and painting them with great poetic force</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4840" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4840"></td>
        <td id="LC4840" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and simplicity. His sentiment sometimes has a literary bias, as in his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4841" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4841"></td>
        <td id="LC4841" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">far-famed but indifferent Angelus, but usually it is strictly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4842" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4842"></td>
        <td id="LC4842" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictorial and has to do with the beauty of light, air, color, motion,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4843" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4843"></td>
        <td id="LC4843" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">life, as shown in The Sower or The Gleaners. Technically he was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4844" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4844"></td>
        <td id="LC4844" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strong as a draughtsman or a brushman, but he had a large feeling for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4845" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4845"></td>
        <td id="LC4845" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form, great simplicity in line, keen perception of the relations of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4846" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4846"></td>
        <td id="LC4846" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light and dark, and at times an excellent color-sense. He was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4847" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4847"></td>
        <td id="LC4847" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">virtually the discoverer of the peasant as an art subject, and for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4848" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4848"></td>
        <td id="LC4848" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this, as for his original point of view and artistic feeling, he is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4849" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4849"></td>
        <td id="LC4849" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ranked as one of the foremost artists of the century.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4850" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4850"></td>
        <td id="LC4850" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4851" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4851"></td>
        <td id="LC4851" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Jules Breton (1827-), though painting little besides the peasantry, is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4852" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4852"></td>
        <td id="LC4852" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">no Millet follower, for he started painting peasant scenes at about</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4853" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4853"></td>
        <td id="LC4853" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the same time as Millet. His affinities were with the New-Greeks early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4854" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4854"></td>
        <td id="LC4854" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in life, and ever since he has inclined toward the academic in style,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4855" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4855"></td>
        <td id="LC4855" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though handling the rustic subject. He is a good technician, except in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4856" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4856"></td>
        <td id="LC4856" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his late work; but as an original thinker, as a pictorial poet, he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4857" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4857"></td>
        <td id="LC4857" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">does not show the intensity or profundity of Millet. The followers of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4858" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4858"></td>
        <td id="LC4858" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Millet-Breton tradition are many. The blue-frocked and sabot-shod</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4859" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4859"></td>
        <td id="LC4859" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">peasantry have appeared in salon and gallery for twenty years and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4860" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4860"></td>
        <td id="LC4860" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">more, but with not very good results. The imitators, as usual, have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4861" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4861"></td>
        <td id="LC4861" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">caught at the subject and missed the spirit. Billet and Legros,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4862" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4862"></td>
        <td id="LC4862" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">contemporaries of Millet, still living, and Lerolle, a man of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4863" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4863"></td>
        <td id="LC4863" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">present-day note, are perhaps the most considerable of the painters of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4864" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4864"></td>
        <td id="LC4864" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rural subjects to-day.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4865" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4865"></td>
        <td id="LC4865" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4866" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4866"></td>
        <td id="LC4866" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE SEMI-CLASSICISTS: It must not be inferred that the classic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4867" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4867"></td>
        <td id="LC4867" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influence of David and Ingres disappeared from view with the coming of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4868" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4868"></td>
        <td id="LC4868" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the romanticists, the Fontainebleau landscapists, and the Barbizon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4869" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4869"></td>
        <td id="LC4869" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters. On the contrary, side by side with these men, and opposed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4870" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4870"></td>
        <td id="LC4870" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to them, were the believers in line and academic formulas of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4871" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4871"></td>
        <td id="LC4871" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">beautiful. The whole tendency of academic art in France was against</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4872" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4872"></td>
        <td id="LC4872" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Delacroix, Rousseau, and Millet. During their lives they were regarded</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4873" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4873"></td>
        <td id="LC4873" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as heretics in art and without the pale of the Academy. Their art,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4874" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4874"></td>
        <td id="LC4874" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">however, combined with nature study and the realism of Courbet,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4875" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4875"></td>
        <td id="LC4875" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">succeeded in modifying the severe classicism of Ingres into what has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4876" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4876"></td>
        <td id="LC4876" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">been called semi-classicism. It consists in the elevated, heroic, or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4877" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4877"></td>
        <td id="LC4877" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">historical theme, academic form well drawn, some show of bright</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4878" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4878"></td>
        <td id="LC4878" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">colors, smoothness of brush-work, and precision and nicety of detail.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4879" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4879"></td>
        <td id="LC4879" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In treatment it attempts the realistic, but in spirit it is usually</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4880" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4880"></td>
        <td id="LC4880" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">stilted, cold, unsympathetic.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4881" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4881"></td>
        <td id="LC4881" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4882" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4882"></td>
        <td id="LC4882" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cabanel (1823-1889) and Bouguereau (1825-1905) have both represented</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4883" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4883"></td>
        <td id="LC4883" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">semi-classic art well. They are justly ranked as famous draughtsmen</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4884" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4884"></td>
        <td id="LC4884" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and good portrait-painters, but their work always has about it the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4885" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4885"></td>
        <td id="LC4885" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">stamp of the academy machine, a something done to order, knowing and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4886" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4886"></td>
        <td id="LC4886" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">exact, but lacking in the personal element. It is a weakness of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4887" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4887"></td>
        <td id="LC4887" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">academic method that it virtually banishes the individuality of eye</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4888" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4888"></td>
        <td id="LC4888" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and hand in favor of school formulas. Cabanel and Bouguereau have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4889" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4889"></td>
        <td id="LC4889" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painted many incidents of classic and historic story, but with never a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4890" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4890"></td>
        <td id="LC4890" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dash of enthusiasm or a suggestion of the great qualities of painting.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4891" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4891"></td>
        <td id="LC4891" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Their drawing has been as thorough as could be asked for, but their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4892" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4892"></td>
        <td id="LC4892" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">colorings have been harsh and their brushes cold and thin.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4893" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4893"></td>
        <td id="LC4893" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4894" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4894"></td>
        <td id="LC4894" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gerome (1824-[12]) is a man of classic training and inclination, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4895" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4895"></td>
        <td id="LC4895" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his versatility hardly allows him to be classified anywhere. He was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4896" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4896"></td>
        <td id="LC4896" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">first a leader of the New-Greeks, painting delicate mythological</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4897" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4897"></td>
        <td id="LC4897" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjects; then a historical painter, showing deaths of Caesar and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4898" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4898"></td>
        <td id="LC4898" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">like; then an Orientalist, giving scenes from Cairo and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4899" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4899"></td>
        <td id="LC4899" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Constantinople; then a _genre_ painter, depicting contemporary</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4900" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4900"></td>
        <td id="LC4900" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjects in the many lands through which he has travelled. Whatever he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4901" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4901"></td>
        <td id="LC4901" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">has done shows semi-classic drawing, ethnological and archaeological</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4902" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4902"></td>
        <td id="LC4902" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">knowledge, Parisian technic, and exact detail. His travels have not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4903" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4903"></td>
        <td id="LC4903" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">changed his precise scientific point of view. He is a true academician</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4904" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4904"></td>
        <td id="LC4904" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at bottom, but a more versatile and cultured painter than either</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4905" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4905"></td>
        <td id="LC4905" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cabanel or Bouguereau. He draws well, sometimes uses color well, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4906" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4906"></td>
        <td id="LC4906" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">is an excellent painter of textures. A man of great learning in many</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4907" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4907"></td>
        <td id="LC4907" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">departments he is no painter to be sneered at, and yet not a painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4908" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4908"></td>
        <td id="LC4908" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to make the pulse beat faster or to arouse the aesthetic emotions. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4909" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4909"></td>
        <td id="LC4909" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work is impersonal, objective fact, showing a brilliant exterior but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4910" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4910"></td>
        <td id="LC4910" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">inwardly devoid of feeling.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4911" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4911"></td>
        <td id="LC4911" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4912" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4912"></td>
        <td id="LC4912" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 12: Died, 1904.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4913" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4913"></td>
        <td id="LC4913" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4914" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4914"></td>
        <td id="LC4914" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 66.--MILLET. THE GLEANERS. LOUVRE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4915" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4915"></td>
        <td id="LC4915" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4916" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4916"></td>
        <td id="LC4916" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Paul Baudry (1828-1886), though a disciple of line, was not precisely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4917" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4917"></td>
        <td id="LC4917" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a semi-classicist, and perhaps for that reason was superior to any of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4918" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4918"></td>
        <td id="LC4918" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the academic painters of his time. He was a follower of the old</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4919" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4919"></td>
        <td id="LC4919" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">masters in Rome more than the _Ecole des Beaux Arts_. His subjects,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4920" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4920"></td>
        <td id="LC4920" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">aside from many splendid portraits, were almost all classical,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4921" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4921"></td>
        <td id="LC4921" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">allegorical, or mythological. He was a fine draughtsman, and, what is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4922" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4922"></td>
        <td id="LC4922" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">more remarkable in conjunction therewith, a fine colorist. He was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4923" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4923"></td>
        <td id="LC4923" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hardly a great originator, and had not passion, dramatic force, or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4924" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4924"></td>
        <td id="LC4924" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">much sentiment, except such as may be found in his delicate coloring</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4925" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4925"></td>
        <td id="LC4925" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and rhythm of line. Nevertheless he was an artist to be admired for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4926" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4926"></td>
        <td id="LC4926" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his purity of purpose and breadth of accomplishment. His chief work is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4927" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4927"></td>
        <td id="LC4927" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to be seen in the Opera at Paris. Puvis de Chavannes (1824-[13]) is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4928" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4928"></td>
        <td id="LC4928" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">quite a different style of painter, and is remarkable for fine</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4929" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4929"></td>
        <td id="LC4929" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">delicate tones of color which hold their place well on wall or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4930" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4930"></td>
        <td id="LC4930" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ceiling, and for a certain grandeur of composition. In his desire to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4931" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4931"></td>
        <td id="LC4931" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">revive the monumental painting of the Renaissance he has met with much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4932" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4932"></td>
        <td id="LC4932" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">praise and much blame. He is an artist of sincerity and learning, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4933" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4933"></td>
        <td id="LC4933" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as a wall-painter has no superior in contemporary France.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4934" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4934"></td>
        <td id="LC4934" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4935" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4935"></td>
        <td id="LC4935" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 13: Died, 1898.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4936" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4936"></td>
        <td id="LC4936" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4937" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4937"></td>
        <td id="LC4937" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Hebert (1817-1908), an early painter of academic tendencies, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4938" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4938"></td>
        <td id="LC4938" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Henner (1829-), fond of form and yet a brushman with an idyllic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4939" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4939"></td>
        <td id="LC4939" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">feeling for light and color in dark surroundings, are painters who may</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4940" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4940"></td>
        <td id="LC4940" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">come under the semi-classic grouping. Lefebvre (1834-) is probably the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4941" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4941"></td>
        <td id="LC4941" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">most pronounced in academic methods among the present men, a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4942" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4942"></td>
        <td id="LC4942" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">draughtsman of ability.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4943" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4943"></td>
        <td id="LC4943" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4944" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4944"></td>
        <td id="LC4944" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PORTRAIT AND FIGURE PAINTERS: Under this heading may be included those</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4945" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4945"></td>
        <td id="LC4945" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters who stand by themselves, showing no positive preference for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4946" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4946"></td>
        <td id="LC4946" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">either the classic or romantic followings. Bonnat (1833-) has painted</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4947" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4947"></td>
        <td id="LC4947" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all kinds of subjects--_genre_, figure, and historical pieces--but is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4948" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4948"></td>
        <td id="LC4948" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">perhaps best known as a portrait-painter. He has done forcible work.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4949" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4949"></td>
        <td id="LC4949" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Some of it indeed is astonishing in its realistic modelling--the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4950" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4950"></td>
        <td id="LC4950" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">accentuation of light and shadow often causing the figures to advance</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4951" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4951"></td>
        <td id="LC4951" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unnaturally. From this feature and from his detail he has been known for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4952" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4952"></td>
        <td id="LC4952" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">years as a &quot;realist.&quot; His anatomical Christ on the Cross and mural</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4953" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4953"></td>
        <td id="LC4953" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">paintings in the Pantheon are examples. As a portrait-painter he is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4954" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4954"></td>
        <td id="LC4954" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">acceptable, if at times a little raw in color. Another portrait-painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4955" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4955"></td>
        <td id="LC4955" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of celebrity is Carolus-Duran (1837-). He is rather startling at times</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4956" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4956"></td>
        <td id="LC4956" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in his portrayal of robes and draperies, has a facility of the brush</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4957" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4957"></td>
        <td id="LC4957" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that is frequently deceptive, and in color is sometimes vivid. He has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4958" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4958"></td>
        <td id="LC4958" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had great success as a teacher, and is, all told, a painter of high</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4959" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4959"></td>
        <td id="LC4959" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rank. Delaunay (1828-1892) in late years painted little besides</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4960" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4960"></td>
        <td id="LC4960" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portraits, and was one of the conservatives of French art. Laurens</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4961" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4961"></td>
        <td id="LC4961" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1838-) has been more of a historical painter than the others, and has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4962" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4962"></td>
        <td id="LC4962" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dealt largely with death scenes. He is often spoken of as &quot;the painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4963" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4963"></td>
        <td id="LC4963" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the dead,&quot; a man of sound training and excellent technical power.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4964" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4964"></td>
        <td id="LC4964" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Regnault (1843-1871) was a figure and _genre_ painter with much feeling</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4965" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4965"></td>
        <td id="LC4965" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for oriental light and color, who unfortunately was killed in battle at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4966" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4966"></td>
        <td id="LC4966" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">twenty-seven years of age. He was an artist of promise, and has left</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4967" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4967"></td>
        <td id="LC4967" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">several notable canvases. Among the younger men who portray the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4968" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4968"></td>
        <td id="LC4968" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">historical subject in an elevated style mention should be made of Cormon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4969" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4969"></td>
        <td id="LC4969" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1845-), Benjamin-Constant (1845-[14]), and Rochegrosse. As painters of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4970" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4970"></td>
        <td id="LC4970" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portraits Aman-Jean and Carriere[15] have long held rank, and each</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4971" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4971"></td>
        <td id="LC4971" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">succeeding Salon brings new portraitists to the front.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4972" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4972"></td>
        <td id="LC4972" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4973" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4973"></td>
        <td id="LC4973" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 14: Died, 1902.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4974" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4974"></td>
        <td id="LC4974" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4975" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4975"></td>
        <td id="LC4975" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 15: Died, 1906.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4976" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4976"></td>
        <td id="LC4976" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4977" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4977"></td>
        <td id="LC4977" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE REALISTS: About the time of the appearance of Millet, say 1848,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4978" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4978"></td>
        <td id="LC4978" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">there also came to the front a man who scorned both classicism and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4979" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4979"></td>
        <td id="LC4979" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romanticism, and maintained that the only model and subject of art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4980" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4980"></td>
        <td id="LC4980" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">should be nature. This man, Courbet (1819-1878), really gave a third</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4981" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4981"></td>
        <td id="LC4981" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">tendency to the art of this century in France, and his influence</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4982" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4982"></td>
        <td id="LC4982" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">undoubtedly had much to do with modifying both the classic and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4983" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4983"></td>
        <td id="LC4983" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romantic tendencies. Courbet was a man of arrogant, dogmatic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4984" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4984"></td>
        <td id="LC4984" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">disposition, and was quite heartily detested during his life, but that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4985" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4985"></td>
        <td id="LC4985" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he was a painter of great ability few will deny. His theory was the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4986" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4986"></td>
        <td id="LC4986" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">abolition of both sentiment and academic law, and the taking of nature</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4987" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4987"></td>
        <td id="LC4987" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">just as it was, with all its beauties and all its deformities. This,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4988" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4988"></td>
        <td id="LC4988" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">too, was his practice to a certain extent. His art is material, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4989" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4989"></td>
        <td id="LC4989" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">yet at times lofty in conception even to the sublime. And while he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4990" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4990"></td>
        <td id="LC4990" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">believed in realism he did not believe in petty detail, but rather in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4991" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4991"></td>
        <td id="LC4991" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the great truths of nature. These he saw with a discerning eye and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4992" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4992"></td>
        <td id="LC4992" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portrayed with a masterful brush. He believed in what he saw only, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4993" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4993"></td>
        <td id="LC4993" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had more the observing than the reflective or emotional disposition.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4994" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4994"></td>
        <td id="LC4994" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">As a technician he was coarse but superbly strong, handling sky,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4995" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4995"></td>
        <td id="LC4995" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">earth, air, with the ease and power of one well trained in his craft.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4996" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4996"></td>
        <td id="LC4996" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">His subjects were many--the peasantry of France, landscape, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4997" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4997"></td>
        <td id="LC4997" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sea holding prominent places--and his influence, though not direct</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4998" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4998"></td>
        <td id="LC4998" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">because he had no pupils of consequence, has been most potent with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L4999" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="4999"></td>
        <td id="LC4999" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">late men.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5000" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5000"></td>
        <td id="LC5000" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5001" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5001"></td>
        <td id="LC5001" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 67.--CABANEL. PHAEDRA.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5002" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5002"></td>
        <td id="LC5002" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5003" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5003"></td>
        <td id="LC5003" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The young painter of to-day who does things in a &quot;realistic&quot; way is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5004" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5004"></td>
        <td id="LC5004" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">frequently met with in French art. L&#39;hermitte (1844-), Julien Dupre</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5005" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5005"></td>
        <td id="LC5005" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1851-), and others have handled the peasant subject with skill, after</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5006" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5006"></td>
        <td id="LC5006" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Millet-Courbet initiative; and Bastien-Lepage (1848-1884) excited</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5007" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5007"></td>
        <td id="LC5007" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a good deal of admiration in his lifetime for the truth and evident</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5008" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5008"></td>
        <td id="LC5008" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sincerity of his art. Bastien&#39;s point of view was realistic enough,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5009" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5009"></td>
        <td id="LC5009" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but somewhat material. He never handled the large composition with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5010" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5010"></td>
        <td id="LC5010" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">success, but in small pieces and in portraits he was quite above</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5011" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5011"></td>
        <td id="LC5011" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">criticism. His following among the young men was considerable, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5012" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5012"></td>
        <td id="LC5012" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">so-called impressionists have ranked him among their disciples or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5013" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5013"></td>
        <td id="LC5013" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">leaders.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5014" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5014"></td>
        <td id="LC5014" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5015" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5015"></td>
        <td id="LC5015" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PAINTERS OF MILITARY SCENES, GENRE, ETC.: The art of Meissonier</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5016" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5016"></td>
        <td id="LC5016" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1815-1891), while extremely realistic in modern detail, probably</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5017" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5017"></td>
        <td id="LC5017" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">originated from a study of the seventeenth-century Dutchmen like</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5018" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5018"></td>
        <td id="LC5018" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Terburg and Metsu. It does not portray low life, but rather the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5019" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5019"></td>
        <td id="LC5019" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">half-aristocratic--the scholar, the cavalier, the gentleman of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5020" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5020"></td>
        <td id="LC5020" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">leisure. This is done on a small scale with microscopic nicety, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5021" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5021"></td>
        <td id="LC5021" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">really more in the historical than the _genre_ spirit. Single figures</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5022" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5022"></td>
        <td id="LC5022" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and interiors were his preference, but he also painted a cycle of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5023" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5023"></td>
        <td id="LC5023" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Napoleonic battle-pictures with much force. There is little or no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5024" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5024"></td>
        <td id="LC5024" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentiment about his work--little more than in that of Gerome. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5025" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5025"></td>
        <td id="LC5025" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">success lay in exact technical accomplishment. He drew well, painted</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5026" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5026"></td>
        <td id="LC5026" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">well, and at times was a superior colorist. His art is more admired by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5027" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5027"></td>
        <td id="LC5027" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the public than by the painters; but even the latter do not fail to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5028" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5028"></td>
        <td id="LC5028" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">praise his skill of hand. He was a great craftsman in the infinitely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5029" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5029"></td>
        <td id="LC5029" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">little. As a great artist his rank is still open to question.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5030" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5030"></td>
        <td id="LC5030" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5031" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5031"></td>
        <td id="LC5031" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The _genre_ painting of fashionable life has been carried out by many</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5032" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5032"></td>
        <td id="LC5032" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">followers of Meissonier, whose names need not be mentioned since they</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5033" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5033"></td>
        <td id="LC5033" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">have not improved upon their forerunner. Toulmouche (1829-), Leloir</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5034" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5034"></td>
        <td id="LC5034" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1843-1884), Vibert (1840-), Bargue (?-1883), and others, though</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5035" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5035"></td>
        <td id="LC5035" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">somewhat different from Meissonier, belong among those painters of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5036" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5036"></td>
        <td id="LC5036" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">_genre_ who love detail, costumes, stories, and pretty faces. Among</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5037" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5037"></td>
        <td id="LC5037" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the painters of military _genre_ mention should be made of De Neuville</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5038" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5038"></td>
        <td id="LC5038" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1836-1885), Berne-Bellecour (1838-), Detaille (1848-), and Aime-Morot</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5039" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5039"></td>
        <td id="LC5039" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1850-), all of them painters of merit.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5040" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5040"></td>
        <td id="LC5040" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5041" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5041"></td>
        <td id="LC5041" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Quite a different style of painting--half figure-piece half</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5042" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5042"></td>
        <td id="LC5042" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">_genre_--is to be found in the work of Ribot (1823-), a strong</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5043" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5043"></td>
        <td id="LC5043" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter, remarkable for his apposition of high flesh lights with deep</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5044" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5044"></td>
        <td id="LC5044" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shadows, after the manner of Ribera, the Spanish painter. Roybet</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5045" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5045"></td>
        <td id="LC5045" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1840-) is fond of rich stuffs and tapestries with velvet-clad</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5046" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5046"></td>
        <td id="LC5046" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">characters in interiors, out of which he makes good color effects.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5047" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5047"></td>
        <td id="LC5047" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Bonvin (1817-1887) and Mettling have painted the interior with small</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5048" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5048"></td>
        <td id="LC5048" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figures, copper-kettles, and other still-life that have given</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5049" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5049"></td>
        <td id="LC5049" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brilliancy to their pictures. As a still-life painter Vollon (1833-)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5050" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5050"></td>
        <td id="LC5050" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">has never had a superior. His fruits, flowers, armors, even his small</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5051" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5051"></td>
        <td id="LC5051" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">marines and harbor pieces, are painted with one of the surest brushes</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5052" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5052"></td>
        <td id="LC5052" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of this century. He is called the &quot;painter&#39;s painter,&quot; and is a man of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5053" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5053"></td>
        <td id="LC5053" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great force in handling color, and in large realistic effect. Dantan</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5054" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5054"></td>
        <td id="LC5054" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and Friant have both produced canvases showing figures in interiors.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5055" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5055"></td>
        <td id="LC5055" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5056" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5056"></td>
        <td id="LC5056" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">A number of excellent _genre_ painters have been claimed by the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5057" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5057"></td>
        <td id="LC5057" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">impressionists as belonging to their brotherhood. There is little to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5058" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5058"></td>
        <td id="LC5058" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">warrant the claim, except the adoption to some extent of the modern</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5059" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5059"></td>
        <td id="LC5059" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ideas of illumination and flat painting. Dagnan-Bouveret (1852-) is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5060" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5060"></td>
        <td id="LC5060" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">one of these men, a good draughtsman, and a finished clean painter who</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5061" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5061"></td>
        <td id="LC5061" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by his recent use of high color finds himself occasionally looked upon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5062" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5062"></td>
        <td id="LC5062" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as an impressionist. As a matter of fact he is one of the most</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5063" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5063"></td>
        <td id="LC5063" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">conservative of the moderns--a man of feeling and imagination, and a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5064" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5064"></td>
        <td id="LC5064" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fine technician. Fantin-Latour (1836-1904) is half romantic, half</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5065" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5065"></td>
        <td id="LC5065" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">allegorical in subject, and in treatment oftentimes designedly vague</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5066" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5066"></td>
        <td id="LC5066" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and shadowy, more suggestive than realistic. Duez (1843-) and Gervex</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5067" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5067"></td>
        <td id="LC5067" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1848-) are perhaps nearer to impressionism in their works than the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5068" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5068"></td>
        <td id="LC5068" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">others, but they are not at all advance advocates of this latest phase</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5069" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5069"></td>
        <td id="LC5069" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of art. In addition there are Cottet and Henri Martin.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5070" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5070"></td>
