        <td id="LC5421" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjects that he chose, but in coarse strength of line, heaviness of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5422" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5422"></td>
        <td id="LC5422" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shadows, harsh handling of the brush, he was a true Neapolitan</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5423" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5423"></td>
        <td id="LC5423" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Darkling. A pronounced mannerist he was no less a man of strength, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5424" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5424"></td>
        <td id="LC5424" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">even in his shadow-saturated colors a painter with the color instinct.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5425" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5425"></td>
        <td id="LC5425" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In Italy his influence in the time of the Decadence was wide-spread,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5426" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5426"></td>
        <td id="LC5426" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and in Spain his Italian pupil, Giordano, introduced his methods for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5427" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5427"></td>
        <td id="LC5427" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">late imitation. There were no other men of much rank in the Valencian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5428" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5428"></td>
        <td id="LC5428" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school, and, as has been said, the school was eventually merged in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5429" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5429"></td>
        <td id="LC5429" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Andalusian painting.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5430" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5430"></td>
        <td id="LC5430" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5431" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5431"></td>
        <td id="LC5431" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">EIGHTEENTH AND NINETEENTH-CENTURY PAINTING IN SPAIN: Almost directly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5432" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5432"></td>
        <td id="LC5432" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">after the passing of Velasquez and Murillo Spanish art failed. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5433" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5433"></td>
        <td id="LC5433" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">eighteenth-century, as in Italy, was quite barren of any considerable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5434" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5434"></td>
        <td id="LC5434" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art until near its close. Then Goya (1746-1828) seems to have made a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5435" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5435"></td>
        <td id="LC5435" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">partial restoration of painting. He was a man of peculiarly Spanish</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5436" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5436"></td>
        <td id="LC5436" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">turn of mind, fond of the brutal and the bloody, picturing inquisition</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5437" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5437"></td>
        <td id="LC5437" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">scenes, bull-fights, battle pieces, and revelling in caricature,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5438" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5438"></td>
        <td id="LC5438" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sarcasm, and ridicule. His imagination was grotesque and horrible, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5439" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5439"></td>
        <td id="LC5439" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as a painter his art was based on the natural, and was exceedingly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5440" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5440"></td>
        <td id="LC5440" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strong. In brush-work he followed Velasquez; in a peculiar forcing of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5441" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5441"></td>
        <td id="LC5441" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">contrasts in light and dark he was apparently quite himself, though</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5442" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5442"></td>
        <td id="LC5442" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">possibly influenced by Ribera&#39;s work. His best work shows in his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5443" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5443"></td>
        <td id="LC5443" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portraits and etchings.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5444" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5444"></td>
        <td id="LC5444" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5445" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5445"></td>
        <td id="LC5445" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">After Goya&#39;s death Spanish art, such as it was, rather followed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5446" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5446"></td>
        <td id="LC5446" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">France, with the extravagant classicism of David as a model. What was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5447" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5447"></td>
        <td id="LC5447" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">produced may be seen to this day in the Madrid Museum. It does not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5448" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5448"></td>
        <td id="LC5448" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">call for mention here. About the beginning of the 1860&#39;s Spanish</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5449" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5449"></td>
        <td id="LC5449" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting made a new advance with Mariano Fortuny (1838-1874). In his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5450" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5450"></td>
        <td id="LC5450" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early years he worked at historical painting, but later on he went to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5451" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5451"></td>
        <td id="LC5451" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Algiers and Rome, finding his true vent in a bright sparkling painting</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5452" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5452"></td>
        <td id="LC5452" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of _genre_ subjects, oriental scenes, streets, interiors, single</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5453" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5453"></td>
        <td id="LC5453" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figures, and the like. He excelled in color, sunlight effects, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5454" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5454"></td>
        <td id="LC5454" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">particularly in a vivacious facile handling of the brush. His work is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5455" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5455"></td>
        <td id="LC5455" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brilliant, and in his late productions often spotty from excessive</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5456" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5456"></td>
        <td id="LC5456" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">use of points of light in high color. He was a technician of much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5457" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5457"></td>
        <td id="LC5457" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brilliancy and originality, his work exciting great admiration in his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5458" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5458"></td>
        <td id="LC5458" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">day, and leading the younger painters of Spain into that ornate</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5459" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5459"></td>
        <td id="LC5459" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">handling visible in their works at the present time. Many of these</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5460" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5460"></td>
        <td id="LC5460" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">latter, from association with art and artists in Paris, have adopted</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5461" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5461"></td>
        <td id="LC5461" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">French methods, and hardly show such a thing as Spanish nationality.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5462" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5462"></td>
        <td id="LC5462" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Fortuny&#39;s brother-in-law, Madrazo (1841-), is an example of a Spanish</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5463" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5463"></td>
        <td id="LC5463" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter turned French in his methods--a facile and brilliant</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5464" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5464"></td>
        <td id="LC5464" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portrait-painter. Zamacois (1842-1871) died early, but with a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5465" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5465"></td>
        <td id="LC5465" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reputation as a successful portrayer of seventeenth-century subjects a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5466" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5466"></td>
        <td id="LC5466" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">little after the style of Meissonier and not unlike Gerome. He was a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5467" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5467"></td>
        <td id="LC5467" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">good colorist and an excellent painter of textures.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5468" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5468"></td>
        <td id="LC5468" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5469" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5469"></td>
        <td id="LC5469" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 73.--MADRAZO, UNMASKED.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5470" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5470"></td>
        <td id="LC5470" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5471" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5471"></td>
        <td id="LC5471" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The historical scene of Mediaeval or Renaissance times, pageants and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5472" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5472"></td>
        <td id="LC5472" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fetes with rich costume, fine architecture and vivid effects of color,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5473" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5473"></td>
        <td id="LC5473" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">are characteristic of a number of the modern Spaniards--Villegas,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5474" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5474"></td>
        <td id="LC5474" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Pradilla, Alvarez. As a general thing their canvases are a little</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5475" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5475"></td>
        <td id="LC5475" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">flashy, likely to please at first sight but grow wearisome after a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5476" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5476"></td>
        <td id="LC5476" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time. Palmaroli has a style that resembles a mixture of Fortuny and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5477" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5477"></td>
        <td id="LC5477" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Meissonier; and some other painters, like Luis Jiminez Aranda,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5478" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5478"></td>
        <td id="LC5478" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sorolla, Zuloaga, Anglada, Garcia y Remos, Vierge, Roman Ribera, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5479" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5479"></td>
        <td id="LC5479" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Domingo, have done excellent work. In landscape and Venetian scenes</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5480" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5480"></td>
        <td id="LC5480" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Rico leads among the Spaniards with a vivacity and brightness not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5481" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5481"></td>
        <td id="LC5481" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">always seen to good advantage in his late canvases.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5482" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5482"></td>
        <td id="LC5482" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5483" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5483"></td>
        <td id="LC5483" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     PRINCIPAL WORKS: Generally speaking, Spanish art cannot be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5484" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5484"></td>
        <td id="LC5484" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     seen to advantage outside of Spain. Both its ancient and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5485" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5485"></td>
        <td id="LC5485" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     modern masterpieces are at Madrid, Seville, Toledo, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5486" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5486"></td>
        <td id="LC5486" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     elsewhere. The Royal Gallery at Madrid has the most and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5487" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5487"></td>
        <td id="LC5487" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     best examples.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5488" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5488"></td>
        <td id="LC5488" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5489" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5489"></td>
        <td id="LC5489" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     CASTILIAN SCHOOL--Rincon, altar-piece church of Robleda de</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5490" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5490"></td>
        <td id="LC5490" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Chavilla; Berruguete, altar-pieces Saragossa, Valladolid,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5491" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5491"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L5495" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5495"></td>

        <td id="L5500" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5500"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5501" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5501"></td>
        <td id="LC5501" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     ANDALUSIAN SCHOOL--Vargas, Seville Cathedral; Cespedes,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5502" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5502"></td>

      <tr>

      <tr>
        <td id="L5505" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5505"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L5506" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5506"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5507" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5507"></td>
        <td id="LC5507" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Dresden, Munich; Murillo, best pictures in Madrid Mus. and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5508" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5508"></td>
        <td id="LC5508" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Acad. of S. Fernando Madrid, Seville Mus. Hospital and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5509" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5509"></td>
        <td id="LC5509" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Capuchin Church, Louvre, Nat. Gal. Lon., Dresden, Munich,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5510" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5510"></td>
        <td id="LC5510" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Hermitage.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5511" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5511"></td>
        <td id="LC5511" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5512" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5512"></td>
        <td id="LC5512" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     VALENCIAN SCHOOL--Juan de Joanes, Madrid Mus., Cathedral</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5513" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5513"></td>
        <td id="LC5513" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Valencia, Hermitage; Ribalta, Madrid and Valencian Mus.,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5514" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5514"></td>
        <td id="LC5514" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Hermitage; Ribera, Louvre, Nat. Gal. Lon., Dresden, Naples,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5515" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5515"></td>
        <td id="LC5515" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Hermitage, and other European museums, chief works at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5516" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5516"></td>
        <td id="LC5516" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Madrid.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5517" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5517"></td>
        <td id="LC5517" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5518" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5518"></td>
        <td id="LC5518" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     MODERN MEN AND THEIR WORKS--Goya, Madrid Mus., Acad. of S.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5519" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5519"></td>
        <td id="LC5519" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Fernando, Valencian Cathedral and Mus., two portraits in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5520" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5520"></td>
        <td id="LC5520" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Louvre. The works of the contemporary painters are largely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5521" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5521"></td>
        <td id="LC5521" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     in private hands where reference to them is of little use to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5522" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5522"></td>
        <td id="LC5522" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     the average student. Thirty Fortunys are in the collection</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5523" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5523"></td>
        <td id="LC5523" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     of William H. Stewart in Paris. His best work, The Spanish</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5524" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5524"></td>
        <td id="LC5524" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Marriage, belongs to Madame de Cassin, in Paris. Examples of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5525" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5525"></td>
        <td id="LC5525" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Villegas, Madrazo, Rico, Domingo, and others, in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5526" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5526"></td>
        <td id="LC5526" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Vanderbilt Gallery, Metropolitan Mus., New York; Boston,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5527" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5527"></td>
        <td id="LC5527" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Chicago, and Philadelphia Mus.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5528" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5528"></td>
        <td id="LC5528" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5529" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5529"></td>
        <td id="LC5529" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5530" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5530"></td>
        <td id="LC5530" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5531" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5531"></td>
        <td id="LC5531" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5532" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5532"></td>
        <td id="LC5532" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">CHAPTER XVI.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5533" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5533"></td>
        <td id="LC5533" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5534" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5534"></td>
        <td id="LC5534" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">FLEMISH PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5535" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5535"></td>
        <td id="LC5535" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5536" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5536"></td>
        <td id="LC5536" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     BOOKS RECOMMENDED: Busscher, _Recherches sur les Peintres</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5537" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5537"></td>
        <td id="LC5537" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Gantois_; Crowe and Cavalcaselle, _Early Flemish Painters_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5538" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5538"></td>
        <td id="LC5538" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Cust, _Van Dyck_; Dehaisnes, _L&#39;Art dans la Flandre_; Du</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5539" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5539"></td>
        <td id="LC5539" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Jardin, _L&#39;art Flamand_; Eisenmann, _The Brothers Van Eyck_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5540" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5540"></td>
        <td id="LC5540" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Fetis, _Les Artistes Belges a l&#39;Etranger_; Fromentin, _Old</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5541" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5541"></td>
        <td id="LC5541" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Masters of Belgium and Holland_; Gerrits, _Rubens zyn Tyd,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5542" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5542"></td>
        <td id="LC5542" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     etc._; Guiffrey, _Van Dyck_; Hasselt, _Histoire de Rubens_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5543" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5543"></td>
        <td id="LC5543" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     (Waagen&#39;s) Kuegler, _Handbook of Painting--German, Flemish,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5544" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5544"></td>
        <td id="LC5544" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     and Dutch Schools_; Lemonnier, _Histoire des Arts en</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5545" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5545"></td>
        <td id="LC5545" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Belgique_; Mantz, _Adrien Brouwer_; Michel, _Rubens_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5546" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5546"></td>
        <td id="LC5546" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Michiels, _Rubens en l&#39;Ecole d&#39;Anvers_; Michiels, _Histoire</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5547" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5547"></td>
        <td id="LC5547" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     de la Peinture Flamande_; Stevenson, _Rubens_; Van den</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5548" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5548"></td>
        <td id="LC5548" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Branden, _Geschiedenis der Antwerpsche Schilderschool_; Van</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5549" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5549"></td>
        <td id="LC5549" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Mander, _Le Livre des Peintres_; Waagen, _Uber Hubert und</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5550" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5550"></td>
        <td id="LC5550" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Jan Van Eyck_; Waagen, _Peter Paul Rubens_; Wauters, _Rogier</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5551" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5551"></td>
        <td id="LC5551" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     van der Weyden_; Wauters, _La Peinture Flamande_; Weale,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5552" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5552"></td>
        <td id="LC5552" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Hans Memling_ (_Arundel Soc._); Weale, _Notes sur Jean Van</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5553" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5553"></td>
        <td id="LC5553" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Eyck_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5554" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5554"></td>
        <td id="LC5554" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5555" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5555"></td>
        <td id="LC5555" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5556" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5556"></td>
        <td id="LC5556" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE FLEMISH PEOPLE: Individually and nationally the Flemings were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5557" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5557"></td>
        <td id="LC5557" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">strugglers against adverse circumstances from the beginning. A</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5558" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5558"></td>
        <td id="LC5558" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">realistic race with practical ideas, a people rather warm of impulse</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5559" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5559"></td>
        <td id="LC5559" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and free in habits, they combined some German sentiment with French</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5560" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5560"></td>
        <td id="LC5560" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">liveliness and gayety. The solidarity of the nation was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5561" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5561"></td>
        <td id="LC5561" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">accomplished until after 1385, when the Dukes of Burgundy began to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5562" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5562"></td>
        <td id="LC5562" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">extend their power over the Low Countries. Then the Flemish people</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5563" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5563"></td>
        <td id="LC5563" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">became strong enough to defy both Germany and France, and wealthy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5564" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5564"></td>
        <td id="LC5564" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">enough, through their commerce with Spain, Italy, and France to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5565" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5565"></td>
        <td id="LC5565" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">encourage art not only at the Ducal court but in the churches, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5566" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5566"></td>
        <td id="LC5566" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">among the citizens of the various towns.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5567" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5567"></td>
        <td id="LC5567" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5568" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5568"></td>
        <td id="LC5568" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 74.--VAN EYCKS. ST. BAVON ALTAR-PIECE (WING).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5569" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5569"></td>
        <td id="LC5569" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">BERLIN.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5570" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5570"></td>
        <td id="LC5570" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5571" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5571"></td>
        <td id="LC5571" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">FLEMISH SUBJECTS AND METHODS: As in all the countries of Europe, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5572" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5572"></td>
        <td id="LC5572" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early Flemish painting pictured Christian subjects primarily. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5573" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5573"></td>
        <td id="LC5573" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great bulk of it was church altar-pieces, though side by side with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5574" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5574"></td>
        <td id="LC5574" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this was an admirable portraiture, some knowledge of landscape, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5575" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5575"></td>
        <td id="LC5575" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">some exposition of allegorical subjects. In means and methods it was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5576" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5576"></td>
        <td id="LC5576" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">quite original. The early history is lost, but if Flemish painting was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5577" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5577"></td>
        <td id="LC5577" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">beholden to the painting of any other nation, it was to the miniature</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5578" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5578"></td>
        <td id="LC5578" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting of France. There is, however, no positive record of this. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5579" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5579"></td>
        <td id="LC5579" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Flemings seem to have begun by themselves, and pictured the life about</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5580" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5580"></td>
        <td id="LC5580" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">them in their own way. They were apparently not influenced at first by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5581" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5581"></td>
        <td id="LC5581" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy. There were no antique influences, no excavated marbles to copy,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5582" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5582"></td>
        <td id="LC5582" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">no Byzantine traditions left to follow. At first their art was exact</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5583" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5583"></td>
        <td id="LC5583" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and minute in detail, but not well grasped in the mass. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5584" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5584"></td>
        <td id="LC5584" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">compositions were huddled, the landscapes pure but finical, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5585" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5585"></td>
        <td id="LC5585" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figures inclined to slimness, awkwardness, and angularity in the lines</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5586" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5586"></td>
        <td id="LC5586" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of form or drapery, and uncertain in action. To offset this there was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5587" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5587"></td>
        <td id="LC5587" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a positive realism in textures, perspective, color, tone, light, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5588" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5588"></td>
        <td id="LC5588" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">atmosphere. The effect of the whole was odd and strained, but the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5589" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5589"></td>
        <td id="LC5589" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">effect of the part was to convince one that the Flemish painters were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5590" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5590"></td>
        <td id="LC5590" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">excellent craftsmen in detail, skilled with the brush, and shrewd</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5591" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5591"></td>
        <td id="LC5591" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">observers of nature in a purely picturesque way.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5592" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5592"></td>
        <td id="LC5592" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5593" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5593"></td>
        <td id="LC5593" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">To the Flemish painters of the fifteenth century belongs, not the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5594" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5594"></td>
        <td id="LC5594" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">invention of oil-painting, for it was known before their time, but its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5595" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5595"></td>
        <td id="LC5595" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">acceptable application in picture-making. They applied oil with color</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5596" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5596"></td>
        <td id="LC5596" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to produce brilliancy and warmth of effect, to insure firmness and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5597" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5597"></td>
        <td id="LC5597" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">body in the work, and to carry out textural effects in stuffs,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5598" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5598"></td>
        <td id="LC5598" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">marbles, metals, and the like. So far as we know there never was much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5599" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5599"></td>
        <td id="LC5599" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">use of distemper, or fresco-work upon the walls of buildings. The oil</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5600" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5600"></td>
        <td id="LC5600" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">medium came into vogue when the miniatures and illuminations of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5601" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5601"></td>
        <td id="LC5601" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early days had expanded into panel pictures. The size of the miniature</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5602" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5602"></td>
        <td id="LC5602" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was increased, but the minute method of finishing was not laid aside.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5603" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5603"></td>
        <td id="LC5603" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Some time afterward painting with oil upon canvas was adopted.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5604" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5604"></td>
        <td id="LC5604" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5605" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5605"></td>
        <td id="LC5605" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SCHOOL OF BRUGES: Painting in Flanders starts abruptly with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5606" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5606"></td>
        <td id="LC5606" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fifteenth century. What there was before that time more than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5607" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5607"></td>
        <td id="LC5607" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">miniatures and illuminations is not known. Time and the Iconoclasts</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5608" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5608"></td>
        <td id="LC5608" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">have left no remains of consequence. Flemish art for us begins with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5609" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5609"></td>
        <td id="LC5609" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Hubert van Eyck (?-1426) and his younger brother Jan van Eyck</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5610" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5610"></td>
        <td id="LC5610" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(?-1440). The elder brother is supposed to have been the better</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5611" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5611"></td>
        <td id="LC5611" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter, because the most celebrated work of the brothers--the St.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5612" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5612"></td>
        <td id="LC5612" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Bavon altar-piece, parts of which are in Ghent, Brussels, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5613" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5613"></td>
        <td id="LC5613" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Berlin--bears the inscription that Hubert began it and Jan finished</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5614" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5614"></td>
        <td id="LC5614" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it. Hubert was no doubt an excellent painter, but his pictures are few</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5615" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5615"></td>
        <td id="LC5615" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and there is much discussion whether he or Jan painted them. For</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5616" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5616"></td>
        <td id="LC5616" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">historical purposes Flemish art was begun, and almost completed, by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5617" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5617"></td>
        <td id="LC5617" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Jan van Eyck. He had all the attributes of the early men, and was one</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5618" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5618"></td>
        <td id="LC5618" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the most perfect of Flemish painters. He painted real forms and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5619" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5619"></td>
        <td id="LC5619" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">real life, gave them a setting in true perspective and light, and put</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5620" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5620"></td>
        <td id="LC5620" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in background landscapes with a truthful if minute regard for the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5621" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5621"></td>
        <td id="LC5621" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">facts. His figures in action had some awkwardness, they were small of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5622" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5622"></td>
        <td id="LC5622" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">head, slim of body, and sometimes stumbled; but his modelling of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5623" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5623"></td>
        <td id="LC5623" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">faces, his rendering of textures in cloth, metal, stone, and the like,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5624" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5624"></td>
        <td id="LC5624" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his delicate yet firm _facture_ were all rather remarkable for his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5625" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5625"></td>
        <td id="LC5625" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time. None of this early Flemish art has the grandeur of Italian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5626" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5626"></td>
        <td id="LC5626" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition, but in realistic detail, in landscape, architecture,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5627" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5627"></td>
        <td id="LC5627" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figure, and dress, in pathos, sincerity, and sentiment it is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5628" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5628"></td>
        <td id="LC5628" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">unsurpassed by any fifteenth-century art.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5629" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5629"></td>
        <td id="LC5629" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5630" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5630"></td>
        <td id="LC5630" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 75.--MEMLING (?). ST. LAWRENCE (DETAIL). NAT.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5631" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5631"></td>
        <td id="LC5631" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">GAL., LONDON.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5632" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5632"></td>
        <td id="LC5632" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5633" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5633"></td>
        <td id="LC5633" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Little is known of the personal history of either of the Van Eycks.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5634" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5634"></td>
        <td id="LC5634" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">They left an influence and had many followers, but whether these were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5635" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5635"></td>
        <td id="LC5635" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">direct pupils or not is an open question. Peter Cristus (1400?-1472)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5636" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5636"></td>
        <td id="LC5636" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was perhaps a pupil of Jan, though more likely a follower of his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5637" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5637"></td>
        <td id="LC5637" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">methods in color and general technic. Roger van der Weyden</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5638" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5638"></td>
        <td id="LC5638" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1400?-1464), whether a pupil of the Van Eycks or a rival, produced a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5639" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5639"></td>
        <td id="LC5639" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">similar style of art. His first master was an obscure Robert Campin.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5640" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5640"></td>
        <td id="LC5640" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He was afterward at Bruges, and from there went to Brussels and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5641" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5641"></td>
        <td id="LC5641" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">founded a school of his own called the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5642" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5642"></td>
        <td id="LC5642" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5643" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5643"></td>
        <td id="LC5643" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SCHOOL OF BRABANT: He was more emotional and dramatic than Jan van</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5644" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5644"></td>
        <td id="LC5644" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Eyck, giving much excited action and pathetic expression to his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5645" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5645"></td>
        <td id="LC5645" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figures in scenes from the passion of Christ. He had not Van Eyck&#39;s</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5646" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5646"></td>
        <td id="LC5646" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">skill, nor his detail, nor his color. More of a draughtsman than a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5647" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5647"></td>
        <td id="LC5647" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">colorist, he was angular in figure and drapery, but had honesty,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5648" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5648"></td>
        <td id="LC5648" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pathos, and sincerity, and was very charming in bright background</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5649" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5649"></td>
        <td id="LC5649" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">landscapes. Though spending some time in Italy, he was never</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5650" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5650"></td>
        <td id="LC5650" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influenced by Italian art. He was always Flemish in type, subject, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5651" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5651"></td>
        <td id="LC5651" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">method, a trifle repulsive at first through angularity and emotional</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5652" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5652"></td>
        <td id="LC5652" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">exaggeration, but a man to be studied.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5653" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5653"></td>
        <td id="LC5653" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5654" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5654"></td>
        <td id="LC5654" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">By Van der Goes (1430?-1482) there are but few good examples, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5655" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5655"></td>
        <td id="LC5655" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">chief one being an altar-piece in the Uffizi at Florence. It is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5656" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5656"></td>
        <td id="LC5656" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">angular in drawing but full of character, and in beauty of detail and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5657" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5657"></td>
        <td id="LC5657" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ornamentation is a remarkable picture. He probably followed Van der</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5658" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5658"></td>
        <td id="LC5658" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Weyden, as did also Justus van Ghent (last half of fifteenth century).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5659" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5659"></td>
        <td id="LC5659" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Contemporary with these men Dierick Bouts (1410-1475) established a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5660" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5660"></td>
        <td id="LC5660" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school at Haarlem. He was Dutch by birth, but after 1450 settled in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5661" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5661"></td>
        <td id="LC5661" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Louvain, and in his art belongs to the Flemish school. He was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5662" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5662"></td>
        <td id="LC5662" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influenced by Van der Weyden, and shows it in his detail of hands and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5663" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5663"></td>
        <td id="LC5663" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">melancholy face, though he differed from him in dramatic action and in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5664" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5664"></td>
        <td id="LC5664" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">type. His figure was awkward, his color warm and rich, and in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5665" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5665"></td>
        <td id="LC5665" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">landscape backgrounds he greatly advanced the painting of the time.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5666" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5666"></td>
        <td id="LC5666" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5667" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5667"></td>
        <td id="LC5667" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Memling (1425?-1495?), one of the greatest of the school, is another</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5668" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5668"></td>
        <td id="LC5668" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">man about whose life little is known. He was probably associated with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5669" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5669"></td>
        <td id="LC5669" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Van der Weyden in some way. His art is founded on the Van Eyck school,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5670" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5670"></td>
        <td id="LC5670" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and is remarkable for sincerity, purity, and frankness of attitude. As</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5671" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5671"></td>
        <td id="LC5671" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a religious painter, he was perhaps beyond all his contemporaries in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5672" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5672"></td>
        <td id="LC5672" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">tenderness and pathos. In portraiture he was exceedingly strong in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5673" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5673"></td>
        <td id="LC5673" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">characterization, and in his figures very graceful. His flesh painting</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5674" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5674"></td>
        <td id="LC5674" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was excellent, but in textures or landscape work he was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5675" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5675"></td>
        <td id="LC5675" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">remarkable. His best followers were Van der Meire (1427?-1474?) and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5676" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5676"></td>
        <td id="LC5676" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gheeraert David (1450?-1523). The latter was famous for the fine,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5677" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5677"></td>
        <td id="LC5677" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">broad landscapes in the backgrounds of his pictures, said, however, by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5678" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5678"></td>
        <td id="LC5678" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">critics to have been painted by Joachim Patinir. He was realistically</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5679" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5679"></td>
        <td id="LC5679" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">horrible in many subjects, and though a close recorder of detail he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5680" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5680"></td>
        <td id="LC5680" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was much broader than any of his predecessors.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5681" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5681"></td>
        <td id="LC5681" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5682" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5682"></td>
        <td id="LC5682" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">FLEMISH SCHOOLS OF THE SIXTEENTH CENTURY: In this century Flemish</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5683" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5683"></td>
        <td id="LC5683" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting became rather widely diffused. The schools of Bruges and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5684" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5684"></td>
        <td id="LC5684" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Ghent gave place to the schools in the large commercial cities like</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5685" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5685"></td>
        <td id="LC5685" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Antwerp and Brussels, and the commercial relations between the Low</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5686" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5686"></td>
        <td id="LC5686" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Countries and Italy finally led to the dissipation of national</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5687" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5687"></td>
        <td id="LC5687" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">characteristics in art and the imitation of the Italian Renaissance</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5688" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5688"></td>
        <td id="LC5688" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters. There is no sharp line of demarcation between those painters</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5689" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5689"></td>
        <td id="LC5689" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">who clung to Flemish methods and those who adopted Italian methods.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5690" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5690"></td>
        <td id="LC5690" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The change was gradual.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5691" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5691"></td>
        <td id="LC5691" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5692" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5692"></td>
        <td id="LC5692" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 76.--MASSYS. HEAD OF VIRGIN. ANTWERP.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5693" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5693"></td>
        <td id="LC5693" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5694" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5694"></td>
        <td id="LC5694" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Quentin Massys (1460?-1530) and Mostert (1474-1556?), a Dutchman by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5695" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5695"></td>
        <td id="LC5695" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">birth, but, like Bouts, Flemish by influence, were among the last of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5696" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5696"></td>
        <td id="LC5696" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Gothic painters in Flanders, and yet they began the introduction</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5697" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5697"></td>
        <td id="LC5697" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of Italian features in their painting. Massys led in architectural</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5698" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5698"></td>
        <td id="LC5698" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">backgrounds, and from that the Italian example spread to subjects,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5699" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5699"></td>
        <td id="LC5699" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figures, methods, until the indigenous Flemish art became a thing of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5700" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5700"></td>
        <td id="LC5700" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the past. Massys was, at Antwerp, the most important painter of his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5701" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5701"></td>
        <td id="LC5701" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">day, following the old Flemish methods with many improvements. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5702" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5702"></td>
        <td id="LC5702" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work was detailed, and yet executed with a broader, freer brush than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5703" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5703"></td>
        <td id="LC5703" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">formerly, and with more variety in color, modelling, expression of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5704" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5704"></td>
        <td id="LC5704" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">character. He increased figures to almost life-size, giving them</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5705" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5705"></td>
        <td id="LC5705" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">greater importance than landscape or architecture. The type was still</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5706" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5706"></td>
        <td id="LC5706" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lean and angular, and often contorted with emotion. His Money-Changers</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5707" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5707"></td>
        <td id="LC5707" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and Misers (many of them painted by his son) were a _genre_ of his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5708" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5708"></td>
        <td id="LC5708" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">own. With him closed the Gothic school, and with him began the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5709" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5709"></td>
        <td id="LC5709" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5710" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5710"></td>
        <td id="LC5710" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ANTWERP SCHOOL, the pupils of which went to Italy, and eventually</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5711" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5711"></td>
        <td id="LC5711" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">became Italianized. Mabuse (1470?-1541) was the first to go. His early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5712" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5712"></td>
        <td id="LC5712" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work shows the influence of Massys and David. He was good in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5713" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5713"></td>
        <td id="LC5713" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition, color, and brush-work, but lacked in originality, as did</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5714" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5714"></td>
        <td id="LC5714" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all the imitators of Italy. Franz Floris (1518?-1570) was a man of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5715" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5715"></td>
        <td id="LC5715" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">talent, much admired in his time, because he brought back</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5716" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5716"></td>
        <td id="LC5716" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reminiscences of Michael Angelo to Antwerp. His influence was fatal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5717" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5717"></td>
        <td id="LC5717" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">upon his followers, of whom there were many, like the Franckens and De</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5718" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5718"></td>
        <td id="LC5718" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Vos. Italy and Roman methods, models, architecture, subjects, began to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5719" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5719"></td>
        <td id="LC5719" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rule everywhere.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5720" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5720"></td>
        <td id="LC5720" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5721" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5721"></td>
        <td id="LC5721" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">From Brussels Barent van Orley (1491?-1542) left early for Italy, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5722" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5722"></td>
        <td id="LC5722" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">became essentially Italian, though retaining some Flemish color. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5723" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5723"></td>
        <td id="LC5723" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painted in oil, tempera, and for glass, and is supposed to have gained</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5724" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5724"></td>
        <td id="LC5724" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his brilliant colors by using a gilt ground. His early works remind</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5725" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5725"></td>
        <td id="LC5725" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">one of David. Cocxie (1499-1592), the Flemish Raphael, was but an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5726" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5726"></td>
        <td id="LC5726" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">indifferent imitator of the Italian Raphael. At Liege the Romanists,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5727" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5727"></td>
        <td id="LC5727" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">so called, began with Lambert Lombard (1505-1566), of whose work</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5728" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5728"></td>
        <td id="LC5728" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nothing authentic remains except drawings. At Bruges Peeter Pourbus</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5729" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5729"></td>
        <td id="LC5729" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1510?-1584) was about the last one of the good portrait-painters of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5730" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5730"></td>
        <td id="LC5730" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the time. Another excellent portrait-painter, a pupil of Scorel, was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5731" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5731"></td>
        <td id="LC5731" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Antonio Moro (1512?-1578?). He had much dignity, force, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5732" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5732"></td>
        <td id="LC5732" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">elaborateness of costume, and stood quite by himself. There were other</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5733" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5733"></td>
        <td id="LC5733" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters of the time who were born or trained in Flanders, and yet</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5734" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5734"></td>
        <td id="LC5734" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">became so naturalized in other countries that in their work they do</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5735" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5735"></td>
        <td id="LC5735" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not belong to Flanders. Neuchatel (1527?-1590?), Geldorp (1553-1616?),</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5736" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5736"></td>
        <td id="LC5736" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Calvaert (1540?-1619), Spranger (1546-1627?), and others, were of this</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5737" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5737"></td>
        <td id="LC5737" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">group.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5738" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5738"></td>
        <td id="LC5738" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5739" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5739"></td>
        <td id="LC5739" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Among all the strugglers in Italian imitation only a few landscapists</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5740" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5740"></td>
        <td id="LC5740" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">held out for the Flemish view. Paul Bril (1554-1626) was the first of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5741" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5741"></td>
        <td id="LC5741" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">them. He went to Italy, but instead of following the methods taught</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5742" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5742"></td>
        <td id="LC5742" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">there, he taught Italians his own view of landscape. His work was a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5743" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5743"></td>
        <td id="LC5743" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">little dry and formal, but graceful in composition, and good in light</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5744" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5744"></td>
        <td id="LC5744" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and color. The Brueghels--there were three of them--also stood out for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5745" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5745"></td>
        <td id="LC5745" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Flemish landscape, introducing it nominally as a background for small</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5746" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5746"></td>
        <td id="LC5746" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figures, but in reality for the beauty of the landscape itself.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5747" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5747"></td>
        <td id="LC5747" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5748" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5748"></td>
        <td id="LC5748" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 77.--RUBENS. PORTRAIT OF YOUNG WOMAN. HERMITAGE,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5749" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5749"></td>
        <td id="LC5749" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ST. PETERSBURGH.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5750" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5750"></td>
        <td id="LC5750" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5751" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5751"></td>
        <td id="LC5751" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SEVENTEENTH-CENTURY PAINTING: This was the great century of Flemish</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5752" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5752"></td>
        <td id="LC5752" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting, though the painting was not entirely Flemish in method or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5753" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5753"></td>
        <td id="LC5753" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">thought. The influence of Italy had done away with the early simplicity,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5754" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5754"></td>
        <td id="LC5754" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">purity, and religious pathos of the Van Eycks. During the sixteenth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5755" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5755"></td>
        <td id="LC5755" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">century everything had run to bald imitation of Renaissance methods.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5756" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5756"></td>
        <td id="LC5756" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Then came a new master-genius, Rubens (1577-1640), who formed a new art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5757" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5757"></td>
        <td id="LC5757" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">founded in method upon Italy, yet distinctly northern in character.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5758" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5758"></td>
        <td id="LC5758" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Rubens chose all subjects for his brush, but the religious altar-piece</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5759" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5759"></td>
        <td id="LC5759" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">probably occupied him as much as any. To this he gave little of Gothic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5760" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5760"></td>
        <td id="LC5760" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentiment, but everything of Renaissance splendor. His art was more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5761" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5761"></td>
        <td id="LC5761" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">material than spiritual, more brilliant and startling in sensuous</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5762" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5762"></td>
        <td id="LC5762" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">qualities, such as line and color, than charming by facial expression or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L5763" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="5763"></td>
