        <td id="L6893" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6893"></td>
        <td id="LC6893" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nothing worthy of the name of original or genuine art. It is not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6894" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6894"></td>
        <td id="LC6894" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">probable that the Reformation had any more to do with this than with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6895" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6895"></td>
        <td id="LC6895" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the decline in Italy. It was a period of barrenness in both countries.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6896" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6896"></td>
        <td id="LC6896" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The Italian imitators in Germany were chiefly Rottenhammer</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6897" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6897"></td>
        <td id="LC6897" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1564-1623), and Elzheimer (1574?-1620). After them came the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6898" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6898"></td>
        <td id="LC6898" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">representative of the other extreme in Denner (1685-1749), who thought</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6899" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6899"></td>
        <td id="LC6899" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to be great in portraiture by the minute imitation of hair, freckles,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6900" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6900"></td>
        <td id="LC6900" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and three-days&#39;-old beard--a petty and unworthy realism which excited</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6901" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6901"></td>
        <td id="LC6901" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">some curiosity but never held rank as art. Mengs (1728-1779) sought</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6902" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6902"></td>
        <td id="LC6902" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for the sublime through eclecticism, but never reached it. His work,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6903" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6903"></td>
        <td id="LC6903" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though academic and correct, is lacking in spirit and originality.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6904" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6904"></td>
        <td id="LC6904" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Angelica Kauffman (1741-1807) succeeded in pleasing her inartistic age</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6905" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6905"></td>
        <td id="LC6905" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with the simply pretty, while Carstens (1754-1798) was a conscientious</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6906" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6906"></td>
        <td id="LC6906" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">if mistaken student of the great Italians--a man of some severity in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6907" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6907"></td>
        <td id="LC6907" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form and of academic inclinations.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6908" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6908"></td>
        <td id="LC6908" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6909" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6909"></td>
        <td id="LC6909" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">NINETEENTH CENTURY: In the first part of this century there started in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6910" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6910"></td>
        <td id="LC6910" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Germany a so-called &quot;revival of art&quot; led by Overbeck (1789-1869),</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6911" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6911"></td>
        <td id="LC6911" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cornelius (1783-1867), Veit (1793-1877), and Schadow (1789-1862), but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6912" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6912"></td>
        <td id="LC6912" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">like many another revival of art it did not amount to much. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6913" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6913"></td>
        <td id="LC6913" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">attempt to &quot;revive&quot; the past is usually a failure. The forms are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6914" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6914"></td>
        <td id="LC6914" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">caught, but the spirit is lost. The nineteenth-century attempt in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6915" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6915"></td>
        <td id="LC6915" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Germany was brought about by the study of monumental painting in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6916" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6916"></td>
        <td id="LC6916" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy, and the taking up of the religious spirit in a pre-Raphaelite</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6917" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6917"></td>
        <td id="LC6917" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">manner. Something also of German romanticism was its inspiration.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6918" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6918"></td>
        <td id="LC6918" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Overbeck remained in Rome, but the others, after some time in Italy,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6919" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6919"></td>
        <td id="LC6919" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">returned to Germany, diffused their teaching, and really formed a new</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6920" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6920"></td>
        <td id="LC6920" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">epoch in German painting. A modern art began with ambitions and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6921" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6921"></td>
        <td id="LC6921" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjects entirely disproportionate to its skill. The monumental, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6922" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6922"></td>
        <td id="LC6922" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ideal, the classic, the exalted, were spread over enormous spaces, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6923" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6923"></td>
        <td id="LC6923" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">there was no reason for such work in the contemporary German life, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6924" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6924"></td>
        <td id="LC6924" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nothing to warrant its appearance save that its better had appeared in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6925" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6925"></td>
        <td id="LC6925" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy during the Renaissance. Cornelius after his return became the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6926" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6926"></td>
        <td id="LC6926" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">head of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6927" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6927"></td>
        <td id="LC6927" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6928" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6928"></td>
        <td id="LC6928" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">MUNICH SCHOOL and painted pictures of the heroes of the classic and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6929" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6929"></td>
        <td id="LC6929" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Christian world upon a large scale. Nothing but their size and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6930" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6930"></td>
        <td id="LC6930" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">good intention ever brought them into notice, for their form and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6931" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6931"></td>
        <td id="LC6931" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">coloring were both commonplace. Schnorr (1794-1872) followed in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6932" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6932"></td>
        <td id="LC6932" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">same style with the Niebelungen Lied, Charlemagne, and Barbarossa for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6933" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6933"></td>
        <td id="LC6933" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjects. Kaulbach (1805-1874) was a pupil of Cornelius, and had some</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6934" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6934"></td>
        <td id="LC6934" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ability but little taste, and not enough originality to produce great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6935" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6935"></td>
        <td id="LC6935" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art. Piloty (1826-1886) was more realistic, more of a painter and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6936" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6936"></td>
        <td id="LC6936" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ranks as one of the best of the early Munich masters. After him Munich</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6937" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6937"></td>
        <td id="LC6937" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art became _genre_-like in subject, with greater attention given to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6938" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6938"></td>
        <td id="LC6938" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">truthful representation in light, color, texture. To-day there are a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6939" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6939"></td>
        <td id="LC6939" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">large number of painters in the school who are remarkable for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6940" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6940"></td>
        <td id="LC6940" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">realistic detail.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6941" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6941"></td>
        <td id="LC6941" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6942" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6942"></td>
        <td id="LC6942" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">DUSSELDORF SCHOOL: After 1826 this school came into prominence under</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6943" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6943"></td>
        <td id="LC6943" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the guidance of Schadow. It did not fancy monumental painting so much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6944" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6944"></td>
        <td id="LC6944" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as the common easel picture, with the sentimental, the dramatic, or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6945" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6945"></td>
        <td id="LC6945" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the romantic subject. It was no better in either form or color than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6946" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6946"></td>
        <td id="LC6946" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Munich school, in fact not so good, though there were painters who</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6947" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6947"></td>
        <td id="LC6947" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">emanated from it who had ability. At Berlin the inclination was to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6948" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6948"></td>
        <td id="LC6948" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">follow the methods and ideas held at Dusseldorf.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6949" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6949"></td>
        <td id="LC6949" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6950" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6950"></td>
        <td id="LC6950" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The whole academic tendency of modern painting in Germany and Austria</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6951" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6951"></td>
        <td id="LC6951" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for the past fifty years has not been favorable to the best kind of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6952" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6952"></td>
        <td id="LC6952" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictorial art. There is a disposition on the part of artists to tell</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6953" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6953"></td>
        <td id="LC6953" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">stories, to encroach upon the sentiment of literature, to paint with a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6954" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6954"></td>
        <td id="LC6954" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dry brush in harsh unsympathetic colors, to ignore relations of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6955" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6955"></td>
        <td id="LC6955" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light-and-shade, and to slur beauties of form. The subject seems to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6956" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6956"></td>
        <td id="LC6956" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">count for more than the truth of representation, or the individuality</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6957" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6957"></td>
        <td id="LC6957" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of view. From time to time artists of much ability have appeared, but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6958" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6958"></td>
        <td id="LC6958" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">these form an exception rather than a rule. The men to-day who are the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6959" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6959"></td>
        <td id="LC6959" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great artists of Germany are less followers of the German tradition</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6960" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6960"></td>
        <td id="LC6960" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">than individuals each working in a style peculiar to himself. A few</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6961" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6961"></td>
        <td id="LC6961" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">only of them call for mention. Menzel (1815-1905) is easily first, a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6962" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6962"></td>
        <td id="LC6962" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter of group pictures, a good colorist, and a powerful pen-and-ink</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6963" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6963"></td>
        <td id="LC6963" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">draughtsman; Lenbach (1836-1904), a forceful portraitist; Uhde</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6964" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6964"></td>
        <td id="LC6964" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1848-), a portrayer of scriptural scenes in modern costumes with much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6965" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6965"></td>
        <td id="LC6965" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sincerity, good color, and light; Leibl (1844-1900), an artist with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6966" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6966"></td>
        <td id="LC6966" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">something of the Holbein touch and realism; Thoma, a Frankfort painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L6967" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="6967"></td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L7035" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7035"></td>
        <td id="LC7035" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     has one work in the Metropolitan Mus., N. Y., as has also</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7036" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7036"></td>
        <td id="LC7036" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Munkacsy; other works by them and by Boecklin may be seen in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7037" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7037"></td>
        <td id="LC7037" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     the Nat. Gal. Berlin.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7038" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7038"></td>
        <td id="LC7038" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7039" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7039"></td>
        <td id="LC7039" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7040" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7040"></td>
        <td id="LC7040" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7041" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7041"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7042" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7042"></td>

      </tr>

        <td id="L7044" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7044"></td>
        <td id="LC7044" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">BRITISH PAINTING.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7045" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7045"></td>

      </tr>

        <td id="L7063" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7063"></td>

        <td id="L7064" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7064"></td>
        <td id="LC7064" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     and Drawings in the British Museum_; Swinburne, _William</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7065" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7065"></td>
        <td id="LC7065" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Blake_; Temple, _Painting in the Queen&#39;s Reign_; Van Dyke,</td>

      <tr>
        <td id="L7066" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7066"></td>
        <td id="LC7066" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Old English Masters_; Wedmore, _Studies in English Art_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7067" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7067"></td>
        <td id="LC7067" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Wilmot-Buxton, _English Painters_; Wright, _Life of Richard</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7068" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7068"></td>
        <td id="LC7068" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Wilson_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7069" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7069"></td>
        <td id="LC7069" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7070" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7070"></td>
        <td id="LC7070" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 94.--HOGARTH. SHORTLY AFTER MARRIAGE. NAT. GAL.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7071" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7071"></td>
        <td id="LC7071" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">LONDON.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7072" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7072"></td>
        <td id="LC7072" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7073" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7073"></td>
        <td id="LC7073" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7074" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7074"></td>
        <td id="LC7074" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">BRITISH PAINTING: It may be premised in a general way, that the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7075" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7075"></td>
        <td id="LC7075" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">British painters have never possessed the pictorial cast of mind in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7076" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7076"></td>
        <td id="LC7076" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the sense that the Italians, the French, or the Dutch have possessed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7077" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7077"></td>
        <td id="LC7077" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it. Painting, as a purely pictorial arrangement of line and color, has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7078" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7078"></td>
        <td id="LC7078" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">been somewhat foreign to their conception. Whether this failure to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7079" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7079"></td>
        <td id="LC7079" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">appreciate painting as painting is the result of geographical</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7080" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7080"></td>
        <td id="LC7080" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">position, isolation, race temperament, or mental disposition, would be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7081" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7081"></td>
        <td id="LC7081" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hard to determine. It is quite certain that from time immemorable the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7082" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7082"></td>
        <td id="LC7082" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">English people have not been lacking in the appreciation of beauty;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7083" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7083"></td>
        <td id="LC7083" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but beauty has appealed to them, not so much through the eye in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7084" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7084"></td>
        <td id="LC7084" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting and sculpture, as through the ear in poetry and literature.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7085" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7085"></td>
        <td id="LC7085" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">They have been thinkers, reasoners, moralists, rather than observers</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7086" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7086"></td>
        <td id="LC7086" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and artists in color. Images have been brought to their minds by words</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7087" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7087"></td>
        <td id="LC7087" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rather than by forms. English poetry has existed since the days of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7088" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7088"></td>
        <td id="LC7088" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Arthur and the Round Table, but English painting is of comparatively</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7089" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7089"></td>
        <td id="LC7089" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">modern origin, and it is not wonderful that the original leaning of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7090" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7090"></td>
        <td id="LC7090" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the people toward literature and its sentiment should find its way</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7091" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7091"></td>
        <td id="LC7091" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">into pictorial representation. As a result one may say in a very</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7092" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7092"></td>
        <td id="LC7092" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">general way that English painting is more illustrative than creative.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7093" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7093"></td>
        <td id="LC7093" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">It endeavors to record things that might be more pertinently and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7094" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7094"></td>
        <td id="LC7094" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">completely told in poetry, romance, or history. The conception of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7095" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7095"></td>
        <td id="LC7095" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">large art--creative work of the Rubens-Titian type--has not been given</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7096" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7096"></td>
        <td id="LC7096" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to the English painters, save in exceptional cases. Their success has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7097" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7097"></td>
        <td id="LC7097" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">been in portraiture and landscape, and this largely by reason of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7098" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7098"></td>
        <td id="LC7098" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">following the model.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7099" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7099"></td>
        <td id="LC7099" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7100" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7100"></td>
        <td id="LC7100" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">EARLY PAINTING: The earliest decorative art appeared in Ireland. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7101" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7101"></td>
        <td id="LC7101" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was probably first planted there by missionaries from Italy, and it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7102" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7102"></td>
        <td id="LC7102" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">reached its height in the seventh century. In the ninth and tenth</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7103" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7103"></td>
        <td id="LC7103" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">centuries missal illumination of a Byzantine cast, with local</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7104" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7104"></td>
        <td id="LC7104" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">modifications, began to show. This lasted, in a feeble way, until the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7105" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7105"></td>
        <td id="LC7105" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fifteenth century, when work of a Flemish and French nature took its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7106" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7106"></td>
        <td id="LC7106" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">place. In the Middle Ages there were wall paintings and church</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7107" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7107"></td>
        <td id="LC7107" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decorations in England, as elsewhere in Europe, but these have now</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7108" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7108"></td>
        <td id="LC7108" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">perished, except some fragments in Kempley Church, Gloucestershire,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7109" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7109"></td>
        <td id="LC7109" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and Chaldon Church, Surrey. These are supposed to date back to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7110" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7110"></td>
        <td id="LC7110" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">twelfth century, and there are some remains of painting in Westminster</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7111" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7111"></td>
        <td id="LC7111" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Abbey that are said to be of thirteenth and fourteenth-century origin.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7112" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7112"></td>
        <td id="LC7112" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">From the fifteenth to the eighteenth century the English people</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7113" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7113"></td>
        <td id="LC7113" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">depended largely upon foreign painters who came and lived in England.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7114" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7114"></td>
        <td id="LC7114" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Mabuse, Moro, Holbein, Rubens, Van Dyck, Lely, Kneller--all were there</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7115" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7115"></td>
        <td id="LC7115" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at different times, in the service of royalty, and influencing such</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7116" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7116"></td>
        <td id="LC7116" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">local English painters as then lived. The outcome of missal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7117" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7117"></td>
        <td id="LC7117" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">illumination and Holbein&#39;s example produced in the sixteenth and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7118" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7118"></td>
        <td id="LC7118" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seventeenth centuries a local school of miniature-painters of much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7119" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7119"></td>
        <td id="LC7119" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">interest, but painting proper did not begin to rise in England until</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7120" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7120"></td>
        <td id="LC7120" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the beginning of the eighteenth century--that century so dead in art</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7121" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7121"></td>
        <td id="LC7121" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">over all the rest of Europe.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7122" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7122"></td>
        <td id="LC7122" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7123" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7123"></td>
        <td id="LC7123" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">FIGURE AND PORTRAIT PAINTERS: Aside from a few inconsequential</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7124" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7124"></td>
        <td id="LC7124" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">precursors the first English artist of note was Hogarth (1697-1764).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7125" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7125"></td>
        <td id="LC7125" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He was an illustrator, a moralist, and a satirist as well as a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7126" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7126"></td>
        <td id="LC7126" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter. To point a moral upon canvas by depicting the vices of his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7127" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7127"></td>
        <td id="LC7127" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time was his avowed aim, but in doing so he did not lose sight of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7128" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7128"></td>
        <td id="LC7128" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictorial beauty. Charm of color, the painter&#39;s taste in arrangement,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7129" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7129"></td>
        <td id="LC7129" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light, air, setting, were his in a remarkable degree. He was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7130" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7130"></td>
        <td id="LC7130" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">successful in large compositions, but in small pictures like those of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7131" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7131"></td>
        <td id="LC7131" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Rake&#39;s Progress he was excellent. An early man, a rigid stickler</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7132" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7132"></td>
        <td id="LC7132" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for the representation, a keen observer of physiognomy, a satirist</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7133" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7133"></td>
        <td id="LC7133" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with a sense of the absurd, he was often warped in his art by the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7134" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7134"></td>
        <td id="LC7134" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">necessities of his subject and was sometimes hard and dry in method,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7135" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7135"></td>
        <td id="LC7135" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but in his best work he was quite a perfect painter. He was the first</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7136" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7136"></td>
        <td id="LC7136" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the English school, and perhaps the most original of that school.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7137" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7137"></td>
        <td id="LC7137" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">This is quite as true of his technic as of his point of view. Both</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7138" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7138"></td>
        <td id="LC7138" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were of his own creation. His subjects have been talked about a great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7139" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7139"></td>
        <td id="LC7139" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">deal in the past; but his painting is not to this day valued as it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7140" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7140"></td>
        <td id="LC7140" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">should be.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7141" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7141"></td>
        <td id="LC7141" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7142" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7142"></td>
        <td id="LC7142" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 95.--REYNOLDS. COUNTESS SPENCER AND LORD ALTHORP.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7143" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7143"></td>
        <td id="LC7143" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7144" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7144"></td>
        <td id="LC7144" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The next man to be mentioned, one of the most considerable of all the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7145" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7145"></td>
        <td id="LC7145" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">English school, is Sir Joshua Reynolds (1723-1792). He was a pupil of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7146" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7146"></td>
        <td id="LC7146" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Hudson, but owed his art to many sources. Besides the influence of Van</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7147" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7147"></td>
        <td id="LC7147" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Dyck he was for some years in Italy, a diligent student of the great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7148" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7148"></td>
        <td id="LC7148" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italians, especially the Venetians, Correggio, and the Bolognese</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7149" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7149"></td>
        <td id="LC7149" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Eclectics. Sir Joshua was inclined to be eclectic himself, and from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7150" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7150"></td>
        <td id="LC7150" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italy he brought back a formula of art which, modified by his own</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7151" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7151"></td>
        <td id="LC7151" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">individuality, answered him for the rest of his life. He was not a man</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7152" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7152"></td>
        <td id="LC7152" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of very lofty imagination or great invention. A few figure-pieces,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7153" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7153"></td>
        <td id="LC7153" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">after the Titian initiative, came from his studio, but his reputation</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7154" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7154"></td>
        <td id="LC7154" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rests upon his many portraits. In portraiture he was often beyond</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7155" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7155"></td>
        <td id="LC7155" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">criticism, giving the realistic representation with dignity, an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7156" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7156"></td>
        <td id="LC7156" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">elevated spirit, and a suave brush. Even here he was more impressive</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7157" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7157"></td>
        <td id="LC7157" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by his broad truth of facts than by his artistic feeling. He was not a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7158" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7158"></td>
        <td id="LC7158" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter who could do things enthusiastically or excite enthusiasm in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7159" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7159"></td>
        <td id="LC7159" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the spectator. There was too much of rule and precedent, too much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7160" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7160"></td>
        <td id="LC7160" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">regard for the traditions, for him to do anything strikingly original.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7161" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7161"></td>
        <td id="LC7161" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">His brush-work and composition were more learned than individual, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7162" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7162"></td>
        <td id="LC7162" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his color, though usually good, was oftentimes conventional in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7163" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7163"></td>
        <td id="LC7163" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">contrasts. Taking him for all in all he was a very cultivated painter,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7164" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7164"></td>
        <td id="LC7164" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a man to be respected and admired, but he had not quite the original</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7165" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7165"></td>
        <td id="LC7165" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spirit that we meet with in Gainsborough.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7166" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7166"></td>
        <td id="LC7166" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7167" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7167"></td>
        <td id="LC7167" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Reynolds was well-grounded in Venetian color, Bolognese composition,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7168" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7168"></td>
        <td id="LC7168" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Parmese light-and-shade, and paid them the homage of assimilation; but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7169" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7169"></td>
        <td id="LC7169" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">if Gainsborough (1727-1788) had such school knowledge he positively</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7170" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7170"></td>
        <td id="LC7170" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">disregarded it. He disliked all conventionalities and formulas. With a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7171" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7171"></td>
        <td id="LC7171" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">natural taste for form and color, and with a large decorative sense,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7172" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7172"></td>
        <td id="LC7172" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he went directly to nature, and took from her the materials which he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7173" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7173"></td>
        <td id="LC7173" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fashioned into art after his own peculiar manner. His celebrated Blue</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7174" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7174"></td>
        <td id="LC7174" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Boy was his protest against the conventional rule of Reynolds that a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7175" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7175"></td>
        <td id="LC7175" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition should be warm in color and light. All through his work we</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7176" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7176"></td>
        <td id="LC7176" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">meet with departures from academic ways. By dint of native force and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7177" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7177"></td>
        <td id="LC7177" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">grace he made rules unto himself. Some of them were not entirely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7178" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7178"></td>
        <td id="LC7178" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">successful, and in drawing he might have profited by school training;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7179" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7179"></td>
        <td id="LC7179" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but he was of a peculiar poetic temperament, with a dash of melancholy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7180" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7180"></td>
        <td id="LC7180" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">about him, and preferred to work in his own way. In portraiture his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7181" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7181"></td>
        <td id="LC7181" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color was rather cold; in landscape much warmer. His brush-work was as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7182" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7182"></td>
        <td id="LC7182" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">odd as himself, but usually effective, and his accessories in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7183" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7183"></td>
        <td id="LC7183" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">figure-painting were little more than decorative after-thoughts. Both</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7184" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7184"></td>
        <td id="LC7184" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in portraiture and landscape he was one of the most original and most</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7185" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7185"></td>
        <td id="LC7185" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">English of all the English painters--a man not yet entirely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7186" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7186"></td>
        <td id="LC7186" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">appreciated, though from the first ranked among the foremost in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7187" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7187"></td>
        <td id="LC7187" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">English art.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7188" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7188"></td>
        <td id="LC7188" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7189" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7189"></td>
        <td id="LC7189" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 96.--GAINSBOROUGH. BLUE BOY.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7190" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7190"></td>
        <td id="LC7190" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7191" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7191"></td>
        <td id="LC7191" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Romney (1734-1802), a pupil of Steele, was often quite as masterful a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7192" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7192"></td>
        <td id="LC7192" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portrait-painter as either Reynolds or Gainsborough. He was never an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7193" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7193"></td>
        <td id="LC7193" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artist elaborate in composition, and his best works are bust-portraits</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7194" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7194"></td>
        <td id="LC7194" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with a plain background. These he did with much dash and vivacity of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7195" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7195"></td>
        <td id="LC7195" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">manner. His women, particularly, are fine in life-like pose and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7196" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7196"></td>
        <td id="LC7196" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">winsomeness of mood. He was a very cunning observer, and knew how to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7197" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7197"></td>
        <td id="LC7197" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">arrange for grace of line and charm of color.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7198" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7198"></td>
        <td id="LC7198" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7199" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7199"></td>
        <td id="LC7199" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">After Romney came Beechey (1753-1839), Raeburn (1756-1823), Opie</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7200" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7200"></td>
        <td id="LC7200" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1761-1807), and John Hoppner (1759-1810). Then followed Lawrence</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7201" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7201"></td>
        <td id="LC7201" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1769-1830), a mixture of vivacious style and rather meretricious</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7202" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7202"></td>
        <td id="LC7202" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">method. He was the most celebrated painter of his time, largely</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7203" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7203"></td>
        <td id="LC7203" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">because he painted nobility to look more noble and grace to look more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7204" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7204"></td>
        <td id="LC7204" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">gracious. Fond of fine types, garments, draperies, colors, he was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7205" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7205"></td>
        <td id="LC7205" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">always seeking the sparkling rather than the true, and forcing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7206" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7206"></td>
        <td id="LC7206" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artificial effects for the sake of startling one rather than stating</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7207" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7207"></td>
        <td id="LC7207" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">facts simply and frankly. He was facile with the brush, clever in line</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7208" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7208"></td>
        <td id="LC7208" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and color, brilliant to the last degree, but lacking in that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7209" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7209"></td>
        <td id="LC7209" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">simplicity of view and method which marks the great mind. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7210" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7210"></td>
        <td id="LC7210" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition was rather fine in its decorative effect, and, though his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7211" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7211"></td>
        <td id="LC7211" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lights were often faulty when compared with nature, they were no less</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7212" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7212"></td>
        <td id="LC7212" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">telling from the stand-point of picture-making. He is much admired by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7213" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7213"></td>
        <td id="LC7213" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artists to-day, and, as a technician, he certainly had more than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7214" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7214"></td>
        <td id="LC7214" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">average ability. He was hardly an artist like Reynolds or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7215" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7215"></td>
        <td id="LC7215" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gainsborough, but among the mediocre painters of his day he shone like</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7216" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7216"></td>
        <td id="LC7216" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a star. It is not worth while to say much about his contemporaries.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7217" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7217"></td>
        <td id="LC7217" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Etty (1787-1849) was one of the best of the figure men, but his Greek</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7218" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7218"></td>
        <td id="LC7218" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">types and classic aspirations grow wearisome on acquaintance; and Sir</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7219" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7219"></td>
        <td id="LC7219" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Charles Eastlake (1793-1865), though a learned man in art and doing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7220" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7220"></td>
        <td id="LC7220" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great service to painting as a writer, never was a painter of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7221" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7221"></td>
        <td id="LC7221" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">importance.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7222" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7222"></td>
        <td id="LC7222" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7223" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7223"></td>
        <td id="LC7223" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">William Blake (1757-1827) was hardly a painter at all, though he drew</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7224" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7224"></td>
        <td id="LC7224" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and colored the strange figures of his fancy and cannot be passed over</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7225" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7225"></td>
        <td id="LC7225" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in any history of English art. He was perhaps the most imaginative</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7226" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7226"></td>
        <td id="LC7226" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artist of English birth, though that imagination was often disordered</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7227" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7227"></td>
        <td id="LC7227" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and almost incoherent. He was not a correct draughtsman, a man with no</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7228" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7228"></td>
        <td id="LC7228" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">great color-sense, and a workman without technical training; and yet,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7229" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7229"></td>
        <td id="LC7229" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in spite of all this, he drew some figures that are almost sublime in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7230" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7230"></td>
        <td id="LC7230" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">their sweep of power. His decorative sense in filling space with lines</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7231" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7231"></td>
        <td id="LC7231" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">is well shown in his illustrations to the Book of Job. In grace of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7232" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7232"></td>
        <td id="LC7232" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">form and feeling of motion he was excellent. Weird and uncanny in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7233" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7233"></td>
        <td id="LC7233" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">thought, delving into the unknown, he opened a world of mystery,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7234" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7234"></td>
        <td id="LC7234" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">peopled with a strange Apocalyptic race, whose writhing, flowing</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7235" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7235"></td>
        <td id="LC7235" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bodies are the epitome of graceful grandeur.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7236" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7236"></td>
        <td id="LC7236" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7237" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7237"></td>
        <td id="LC7237" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 97.--CONSTABLE. CORN FIELD. NAT. GAL. LONDON.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7238" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7238"></td>
        <td id="LC7238" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7239" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7239"></td>
        <td id="LC7239" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">GENRE-PAINTERS: From Blake to Morland (1763-1804) is a step across</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7240" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7240"></td>
        <td id="LC7240" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">space from heaven to earth. Morland was a realist of English country</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7241" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7241"></td>
        <td id="LC7241" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">life, horses at tavern-doors, cattle, pigs. His life was not the most</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7242" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7242"></td>
        <td id="LC7242" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">correct, but his art in truthfulness of representation, simplicity of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7243" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7243"></td>
        <td id="LC7243" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting, richness of color and light, was often of a fine quality. As</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7244" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7244"></td>
        <td id="LC7244" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a skilful technician he stood quite alone in his time, and seemed to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7245" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7245"></td>
        <td id="LC7245" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">show more affinity with the Dutch _genre_-painters than his own</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7246" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7246"></td>
        <td id="LC7246" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">countrymen. His works are much prized to-day, and were so during the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7247" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7247"></td>
        <td id="LC7247" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter&#39;s life.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7248" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7248"></td>
        <td id="LC7248" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7249" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7249"></td>
        <td id="LC7249" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sir David Wilkie (1785-1841) was also somewhat like the Dutch in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7250" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7250"></td>
        <td id="LC7250" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subject, a _genre_-painter, fond of the village fete and depicting it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7251" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7251"></td>
        <td id="LC7251" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with careful detail, a limpid brush, and good textural effects. In</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7252" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7252"></td>
        <td id="LC7252" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">1825 he travelled abroad, was gone some years, was impressed by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7253" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7253"></td>
        <td id="LC7253" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Velasquez, Correggio, and Rembrandt, and completely changed his style.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7254" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7254"></td>
        <td id="LC7254" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He then became a portrait and historical painter. He never outlived</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7255" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7255"></td>
        <td id="LC7255" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the nervous constraint that shows in all his pictures, and his brush,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7256" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7256"></td>
        <td id="LC7256" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though facile within limits, was never free or bold as compared with a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7257" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7257"></td>
        <td id="LC7257" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Dutchman like Steen. In technical methods Landseer (1802-1873), the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7258" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7258"></td>
        <td id="LC7258" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter of animals, was somewhat like him. That is to say, they both</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7259" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7259"></td>
        <td id="LC7259" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had a method of painting surfaces and rendering textures that was more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7260" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7260"></td>
        <td id="LC7260" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">&quot;smart&quot; than powerful. There is little solidity or depth to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7261" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7261"></td>
        <td id="LC7261" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brush-work of either, though both are impressive to the spectator at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7262" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7262"></td>
        <td id="LC7262" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">first sight. Landseer knew the habits and the anatomy of animals very</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7263" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7263"></td>
        <td id="LC7263" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">well, but he never had an appreciation of the brute in the animal,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7264" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7264"></td>
        <td id="LC7264" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">such as we see in the pictures of Velasquez or the bronzes of Barye.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7265" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7265"></td>
        <td id="LC7265" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The Landseer animal has too much sentiment about it. The dogs, for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7266" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7266"></td>
        <td id="LC7266" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">instance, are generally given those emotions pertinent to humanity,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7267" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7267"></td>
        <td id="LC7267" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and which are only exceptionally true of the canine race. This very</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7268" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7268"></td>
        <td id="LC7268" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">feature--the tendency to humanize the brute and make it tell a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7269" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7269"></td>
        <td id="LC7269" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">story--accounts in large measure for the popularity of Landseer&#39;s art.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7270" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7270"></td>
        <td id="LC7270" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The work is perhaps correct enough, but the aim of it is somewhat</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7271" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7271"></td>
        <td id="LC7271" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">afield from pure painting. It illustrates the literary rather than the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7272" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7272"></td>
        <td id="LC7272" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictorial. Following Wilkie the most distinguished painter was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7273" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7273"></td>
        <td id="LC7273" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Mulready (1786-1863), whose pictures of village boys are well known</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7274" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7274"></td>
        <td id="LC7274" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">through engravings.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7275" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7275"></td>
        <td id="LC7275" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7276" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7276"></td>
        <td id="LC7276" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 98.--TURNER. FIGHTING TEMERAIRE. NAT. GAL.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7277" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7277"></td>
        <td id="LC7277" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">LONDON.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7278" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7278"></td>
        <td id="LC7278" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7279" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7279"></td>
        <td id="LC7279" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE LANDSCAPE PAINTERS: In landscape the English have had something to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7280" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7280"></td>
        <td id="LC7280" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">say peculiarly their own. It has not always been well said, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7281" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7281"></td>
        <td id="LC7281" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">coloring is often hot, the brush-work brittle, the attention to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7282" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7282"></td>
        <td id="LC7282" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">detail inconsistent with the large view of nature, yet such as it is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7283" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7283"></td>
        <td id="LC7283" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it shows the English point of view and is valuable on that account.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7284" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7284"></td>
        <td id="LC7284" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Richard Wilson (1713-1782) was the first landscapist of importance,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7285" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7285"></td>
        <td id="LC7285" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though he was not so English in view as some others to follow. In</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7286" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7286"></td>
        <td id="LC7286" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">fact, Wilson was nurtured on Claude Lorrain and Joseph Vernet and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7287" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7287"></td>
        <td id="LC7287" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">instead of painting the realistic English landscape he painted the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7288" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7288"></td>
        <td id="LC7288" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pseudo-Italian landscape. He began working in portraiture under the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7289" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7289"></td>
        <td id="LC7289" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">tutorship of Wright, and achieved some success in this department; but</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7290" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7290"></td>
        <td id="LC7290" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in 1749 he went to Italy and devoted himself wholly to landscapes.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7291" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7291"></td>
        <td id="LC7291" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">These were of the classic type and somewhat conventional. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7292" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7292"></td>
        <td id="LC7292" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">composition was usually a dark foreground with trees or buildings to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7293" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7293"></td>
        <td id="LC7293" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">right and left, an opening in the middle distance leading into the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7294" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7294"></td>
        <td id="LC7294" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">background, and a broad expanse of sunset sky. In the foreground he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7295" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7295"></td>
        <td id="LC7295" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">usually introduced a few figures for romantic or classic association.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7296" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7296"></td>
        <td id="LC7296" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Considerable elevation of theme and spirit marks most of his pictures.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7297" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7297"></td>
        <td id="LC7297" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">There was good workmanship about the skies and the light, and an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7298" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7298"></td>
        <td id="LC7298" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">attentive study of nature was shown throughout. His canvases did not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7299" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7299"></td>
        <td id="LC7299" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">meet with much success at the time they were painted. In more modern</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7300" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7300"></td>
        <td id="LC7300" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">days Wilson has been ranked as the true founder of landscape in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7301" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7301"></td>
        <td id="LC7301" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">England, and one of the most sincere of English painters.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7302" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7302"></td>
        <td id="LC7302" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7303" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7303"></td>
        <td id="LC7303" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE NORWICH SCHOOL: Old Crome (1769-1821), though influenced to some</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7304" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7304"></td>
        <td id="LC7304" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">extent by Wilson and the Dutch painters, was an original talent,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7305" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7305"></td>
        <td id="LC7305" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painting English scenery with much simplicity and considerable power.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7306" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7306"></td>
        <td id="LC7306" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He was sometimes rasping with his brush, and had a small method of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7307" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7307"></td>
