        <td id="LC7307" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">recording details combined with mannerisms of drawing and composition,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7308" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7308"></td>
        <td id="LC7308" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and yet gave an out-of-doors feeling in light and air that was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7309" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7309"></td>
        <td id="LC7309" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">astonishing. His large trees have truth of mass and accuracy of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7310" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7310"></td>
        <td id="LC7310" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">drawing, and his foregrounds are painted with solidity. He was a keen</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7311" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7311"></td>
        <td id="LC7311" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">student of nature, and drew about him a number of landscape painters</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7312" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7312"></td>
        <td id="LC7312" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at Norwich, who formed the Norwich School. Crome was its leader, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7313" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7313"></td>
        <td id="LC7313" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the school made its influence felt upon English landscape painting.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7314" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7314"></td>
        <td id="LC7314" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Cotman (1782-1842) was the best painter of the group after Crome, a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7315" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7315"></td>
        <td id="LC7315" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">man who depicted landscape and harbor scenes in a style that recalls</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7316" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7316"></td>
        <td id="LC7316" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Girtin and Turner.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7317" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7317"></td>
        <td id="LC7317" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7318" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7318"></td>
        <td id="LC7318" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The most complete, full-rounded landscapist in England was John</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7319" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7319"></td>
        <td id="LC7319" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Constable (1776-1837). His foreign bias, such as it was, came from a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7320" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7320"></td>
        <td id="LC7320" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">study of the Dutch masters. There were two sources from which the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7321" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7321"></td>
        <td id="LC7321" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">English landscapists drew. Those who were inclined to the ideal, men</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7322" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7322"></td>
        <td id="LC7322" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">like Wilson, Calcott (1779-1844), and Turner, drew from the Italian of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7323" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7323"></td>
        <td id="LC7323" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Poussin and Claude; those who were content to do nature in her real</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7324" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7324"></td>
        <td id="LC7324" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dress, men like Gainsborough and Constable, drew from the Dutch of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7325" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7325"></td>
        <td id="LC7325" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Hobbema and his contemporaries. A certain sombreness of color and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7326" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7326"></td>
        <td id="LC7326" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">manner of composition show in Constable that may be attributed to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7327" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7327"></td>
        <td id="LC7327" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Holland; but these were slight features as compared with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7328" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7328"></td>
        <td id="LC7328" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">originality of the man. He was a close student of nature who painted</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7329" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7329"></td>
        <td id="LC7329" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">what he saw in English country life, especially about Hampstead, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7330" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7330"></td>
        <td id="LC7330" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painted it with a knowledge and an artistic sensitiveness never</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7331" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7331"></td>
        <td id="LC7331" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">surpassed in England. The rural feeling was strong with him, and his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7332" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7332"></td>
        <td id="LC7332" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">evident pleasure in simple scenes is readily communicated to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7333" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7333"></td>
        <td id="LC7333" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spectator. There is no attempt at the grand or the heroic. He never</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7334" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7334"></td>
        <td id="LC7334" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">cared much for mountains or water, but was fond of cultivated uplands,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7335" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7335"></td>
        <td id="LC7335" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">trees, bowling clouds, and torn skies. Bursts of sunlight, storms,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7336" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7336"></td>
        <td id="LC7336" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">atmospheres, all pleased him. With detail he was little concerned. He</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7337" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7337"></td>
        <td id="LC7337" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">saw landscape in large patches of form and color, and so painted it.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7338" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7338"></td>
        <td id="LC7338" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">His handling was broad and solid, and at times a little heavy. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7339" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7339"></td>
        <td id="LC7339" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">light was often forced by sharp contrast with shadows, and often his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7340" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7340"></td>
        <td id="LC7340" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictures appear spotty from isolated glitters of light strewn here and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7341" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7341"></td>
        <td id="LC7341" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">there. In color he helped eliminate the brown landscape and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7342" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7342"></td>
        <td id="LC7342" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">substituted in its place the green and blue of nature. In atmosphere</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7343" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7343"></td>
        <td id="LC7343" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he was excellent. His influence upon English art was impressive, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7344" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7344"></td>
        <td id="LC7344" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in 1824 the exhibition at Paris of his Hay Wain, together with some</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7345" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7345"></td>
        <td id="LC7345" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work by Bonington and Fielding had a decided effect upon the then</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7346" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7346"></td>
        <td id="LC7346" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rising landscape school of France. The French realized that nature lay</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7347" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7347"></td>
        <td id="LC7347" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at the bottom of Constable&#39;s art, and they profited, not by imitating</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7348" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7348"></td>
        <td id="LC7348" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Constable, but by studying his nature model.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7349" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7349"></td>
        <td id="LC7349" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7350" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7350"></td>
        <td id="LC7350" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 99.--BURNE JONES. FLAMMA VESTALIS.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7351" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7351"></td>
        <td id="LC7351" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7352" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7352"></td>
        <td id="LC7352" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Bonington (1801-1828) died young, and though of English parents his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7353" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7353"></td>
        <td id="LC7353" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">training was essentially French, and he really belonged to the French</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7354" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7354"></td>
        <td id="LC7354" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school, an associate of Delacroix. His study of the Venetians turned</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7355" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7355"></td>
        <td id="LC7355" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his talent toward warm coloring, in which he excelled. In landscape</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7356" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7356"></td>
        <td id="LC7356" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his broad handling was somewhat related to that of Constable, and from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7357" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7357"></td>
        <td id="LC7357" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the fact of their works appearing together in the Salon of 1824 they</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7358" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7358"></td>
        <td id="LC7358" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">are often spoken of as influencers of the modern French landscape</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7359" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7359"></td>
        <td id="LC7359" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7360" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7360"></td>
        <td id="LC7360" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7361" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7361"></td>
        <td id="LC7361" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Turner (1775-1851) is the best known name in English art. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7362" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7362"></td>
        <td id="LC7362" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">celebrity is somewhat disproportionate to his real merits, though it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7363" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7363"></td>
        <td id="LC7363" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">is impossible to deny his great ability. He was a man learned in all</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7364" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7364"></td>
        <td id="LC7364" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the forms of nature and schooled in all the formulas of art; yet he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7365" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7365"></td>
        <td id="LC7365" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was not a profound lover of nature nor a faithful recorder of what</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7366" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7366"></td>
        <td id="LC7366" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">things he saw in nature, except in his early days. In the bulk of his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7367" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7367"></td>
        <td id="LC7367" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">work he shows the traditions of Claude, with additions of his own. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7368" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7368"></td>
        <td id="LC7368" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">taste was classic (he possessed all the knowledge and the belongings</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7369" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7369"></td>
        <td id="LC7369" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the historical landscape), and he delighted in great stretches of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7370" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7370"></td>
        <td id="LC7370" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">country broken by sea-shores, rivers, high mountains, fine buildings,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7371" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7371"></td>
        <td id="LC7371" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and illumined by blazing sunlight and gorgeous skies. His composition</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7372" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7372"></td>
        <td id="LC7372" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was at times grotesque in imagination; his light was usually</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7373" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7373"></td>
        <td id="LC7373" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">bewildering in intensity and often unrelieved by shadows of sufficient</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7374" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7374"></td>
        <td id="LC7374" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">depth; his tone was sometimes faulty; and in color he was not always</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7375" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7375"></td>
        <td id="LC7375" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">harmonious, but inclined to be capricious, uneven, showing fondness</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7376" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7376"></td>
        <td id="LC7376" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for arbitrary schemes of color. The object of his work seems to have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7377" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7377"></td>
        <td id="LC7377" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">been to dazzle, to impress with a wilderness of lines and hues, to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7378" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7378"></td>
        <td id="LC7378" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">overawe by imposing scale and grandeur. His paintings are impressive,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7379" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7379"></td>
        <td id="LC7379" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decoratively splendid, but they often smack of the stage, and are more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7380" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7380"></td>
        <td id="LC7380" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">frequently grandiloquent than grand. His early works, especially in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7381" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7381"></td>
        <td id="LC7381" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">water-colors, where he shows himself a follower of Girtin, are much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7382" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7382"></td>
        <td id="LC7382" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">better than his later canvases in oil, many of which have changed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7383" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7383"></td>
        <td id="LC7383" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color. The water-colors are carefully done, subdued in color, and true</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7384" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7384"></td>
        <td id="LC7384" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in light. From 1802, or thereabouts, to 1830 was his second period,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7385" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7385"></td>
        <td id="LC7385" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in which Italian composition and much color were used. The last twenty</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7386" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7386"></td>
        <td id="LC7386" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">years of his life he inclined to the _bizarre_, and turned his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7387" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7387"></td>
        <td id="LC7387" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">canvases into almost incoherent color masses. He had an artistic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7388" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7388"></td>
        <td id="LC7388" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">feeling for composition, linear perspective, and the sweep of horizon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7389" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7389"></td>
        <td id="LC7389" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">lines; skies and hills he knew and drew with power; color he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7390" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7390"></td>
        <td id="LC7390" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">comprehended only as decoration; and light he distorted for effect.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7391" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7391"></td>
        <td id="LC7391" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Yet with all his shortcomings Turner was an artist to be respected and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7392" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7392"></td>
        <td id="LC7392" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">admired. He knew his craft, in fact, knew it so well that he relied</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7393" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7393"></td>
        <td id="LC7393" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">too much on artificial effects, drew away from the model of nature,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7394" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7394"></td>
        <td id="LC7394" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and finally passed into the extravagant.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7395" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7395"></td>
        <td id="LC7395" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7396" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7396"></td>
        <td id="LC7396" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE WATER-COLORISTS: About the beginning of this century a school of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7397" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7397"></td>
        <td id="LC7397" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">water-colorists, founded originally by Cozens (1752-1799) and Girtin</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7398" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7398"></td>
        <td id="LC7398" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1775-1802), came into prominence and developed English art in a new</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7399" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7399"></td>
        <td id="LC7399" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">direction. It began to show with a new force the transparency of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7400" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7400"></td>
        <td id="LC7400" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">skies, the luminosity of shadows, the delicacy and grace of clouds,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7401" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7401"></td>
        <td id="LC7401" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the brilliancy of light and color. Cozens and Blake were primitives in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7402" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7402"></td>
        <td id="LC7402" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the use of the medium, but Stothard (1755-1834) employed it with much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7403" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7403"></td>
        <td id="LC7403" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentiment, charm, and _plein-air_ effect. Turner was quite a master of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7404" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7404"></td>
        <td id="LC7404" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">it, and his most permanent work was done with it. Later on, when he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7405" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7405"></td>
        <td id="LC7405" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rather abandoned form to follow color, he also abandoned water-color</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7406" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7406"></td>
        <td id="LC7406" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for oils. Fielding (1787-1849) used water-color effectively in giving</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7407" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7407"></td>
        <td id="LC7407" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">large feeling for space and air, and also for fogs and mists; Prout</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7408" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7408"></td>
        <td id="LC7408" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1783-1852) employed it in architectural drawings of the principal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7409" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7409"></td>
        <td id="LC7409" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">cathedrals of Europe; and Cox (1783-1859), Dewint (1784-1849), Hunt</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7410" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7410"></td>
        <td id="LC7410" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1790-1864), Cattermole (1800-1868), Lewis (1805-1876), men whose</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7411" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7411"></td>
        <td id="LC7411" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">names only can be mentioned, all won recognition with this medium.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7412" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7412"></td>
        <td id="LC7412" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Water-color drawing is to-day said to be a department of art that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7413" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7413"></td>
        <td id="LC7413" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">expresses the English pictorial feeling better than any other, though</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7414" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7414"></td>
        <td id="LC7414" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this is not an undisputed statement.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7415" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7415"></td>
        <td id="LC7415" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7416" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7416"></td>
        <td id="LC7416" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 100.--LEIGHTON. HELEN OF TROY.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7417" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7417"></td>
        <td id="LC7417" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7418" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7418"></td>
        <td id="LC7418" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Perhaps the most important movement in English painting of recent</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7419" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7419"></td>
        <td id="LC7419" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">times was that which took the name of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7420" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7420"></td>
        <td id="LC7420" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7421" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7421"></td>
        <td id="LC7421" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PRE-RAPHAELITISM: It was started about 1847, primarily by Rossetti</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7422" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7422"></td>
        <td id="LC7422" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1828-1882), Holman Hunt (1827-), and Sir John Millais (1829-1896),</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7423" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7423"></td>
        <td id="LC7423" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">associated with several sculptors and poets, seven in all. It was an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7424" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7424"></td>
        <td id="LC7424" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">emulation of the sincerity, the loving care, and the scrupulous</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7425" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7425"></td>
        <td id="LC7425" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">exactness in truth that characterized the Italian painters before</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7426" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7426"></td>
        <td id="LC7426" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Raphael. Its advocates, including Mr. Ruskin the critic, maintained</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7427" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7427"></td>
        <td id="LC7427" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that after Raphael came that fatal facility in art which seeking grace</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7428" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7428"></td>
        <td id="LC7428" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of composition lost truth of fact, and that the proper course for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7429" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7429"></td>
        <td id="LC7429" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">modern painters was to return to the sincerity and veracity of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7430" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7430"></td>
        <td id="LC7430" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early masters. Hence the name pre-Raphaelitism, and the signatures on</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7431" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7431"></td>
        <td id="LC7431" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">their early pictures, P. R. B., pre-Raphaelite Brother. To this</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7432" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7432"></td>
        <td id="LC7432" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">attempt to gain the true regardless of the sensuous, was added a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7433" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7433"></td>
        <td id="LC7433" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">morbidity of thought mingled with mysticism, a moral and religious</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7434" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7434"></td>
        <td id="LC7434" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pose, and a studied simplicity. Some of the painters of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7435" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7435"></td>
        <td id="LC7435" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Brotherhood went even so far as following the habits of the early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7436" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7436"></td>
        <td id="LC7436" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Italians, seeking retirement from the world and carrying with them a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7437" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7437"></td>
        <td id="LC7437" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gothic earnestness of air. There is no doubt about the sincerity that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7438" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7438"></td>
        <td id="LC7438" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">entered into this movement. It was an honest effort to gain the true,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7439" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7439"></td>
        <td id="LC7439" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the good, and as a result, the beautiful; but it was no less a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7440" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7440"></td>
        <td id="LC7440" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">striven-after honesty and an imitated earnestness. The Brotherhood did</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7441" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7441"></td>
        <td id="LC7441" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not last for long, the members drifted from each other and began to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7442" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7442"></td>
        <td id="LC7442" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">paint each after his own style, and pre-Raphaelitism passed away as it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7443" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7443"></td>
        <td id="LC7443" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had arisen, though not without leaving a powerful stamp on English</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7444" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7444"></td>
        <td id="LC7444" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art, especially in decoration.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7445" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7445"></td>
        <td id="LC7445" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7446" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7446"></td>
        <td id="LC7446" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Rossetti, an Italian by birth though English by adoption, was the type</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7447" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7447"></td>
        <td id="LC7447" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the Brotherhood. He was more of a poet than a painter, took most of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7448" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7448"></td>
        <td id="LC7448" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his subjects from Dante, and painted as he wrote, in a mystical</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7449" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7449"></td>
        <td id="LC7449" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">romantic spirit. He was always of a retiring disposition and never</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7450" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7450"></td>
        <td id="LC7450" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">exhibited publicly after he was twenty-eight years of age. As a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7451" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7451"></td>
        <td id="LC7451" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">draughtsman he was awkward in line and not always true in modelling.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7452" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7452"></td>
        <td id="LC7452" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In color he was superior to his associates and had considerable</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7453" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7453"></td>
        <td id="LC7453" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">decorative feeling. The shortcoming of his art, as with that of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7454" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7454"></td>
        <td id="LC7454" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">others of the Brotherhood, was that in seeking truth of detail he lost</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7455" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7455"></td>
        <td id="LC7455" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">truth of _ensemble_. This is perhaps better exemplified in the works</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7456" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7456"></td>
        <td id="LC7456" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of Holman Hunt. He has spent infinite pains in getting the truth of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7457" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7457"></td>
        <td id="LC7457" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">detail in his pictures, has travelled in the East and painted types,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7458" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7458"></td>
        <td id="LC7458" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">costumes, and scenery in Palestine to gain the historic truths of his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7459" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7459"></td>
        <td id="LC7459" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Scriptural scenes; but all that he has produced has been little more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7460" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7460"></td>
        <td id="LC7460" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">than a survey, a report, a record of the facts. He has not made a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7461" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7461"></td>
        <td id="LC7461" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">picture. The insistence upon every detail has isolated all the facts</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7462" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7462"></td>
        <td id="LC7462" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and left them isolated in the picture. In seeking the minute truths</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7463" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7463"></td>
        <td id="LC7463" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he has overlooked the great truths of light, air, and setting. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7464" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7464"></td>
        <td id="LC7464" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color has always been crude, his values or relations not well</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7465" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7465"></td>
        <td id="LC7465" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">preserved, and his brush-work hard and tortured.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7466" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7466"></td>
        <td id="LC7466" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7467" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7467"></td>
        <td id="LC7467" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Millais showed some of this disjointed effect in his early work when</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7468" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7468"></td>
        <td id="LC7468" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he was a member of the Brotherhood. He did not hold to his early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7469" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7469"></td>
        <td id="LC7469" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">convictions however, and soon abandoned the pre-Raphaelite methods for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7470" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7470"></td>
        <td id="LC7470" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a more conventional style. He has painted some remarkable portraits</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7471" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7471"></td>
        <td id="LC7471" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and some excellent figure pieces, and to-day holds high rank in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7472" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7472"></td>
        <td id="LC7472" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">English art; but he is an uneven painter, often doing weak,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7473" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7473"></td>
        <td id="LC7473" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">harshly-colored work. Moreover, the English tendency to tell stories</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7474" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7474"></td>
        <td id="LC7474" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with the paint-brush finds in Millais a faithful upholder. At his best</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7475" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7475"></td>
        <td id="LC7475" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">he is a strong painter.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7476" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7476"></td>
        <td id="LC7476" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7477" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7477"></td>
        <td id="LC7477" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Madox Brown (1821-1893) never joined the Brotherhood, though his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7478" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7478"></td>
        <td id="LC7478" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">leaning was toward its principles. He had considerable dramatic power,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7479" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7479"></td>
        <td id="LC7479" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with which he illustrated historic scenes, and among contemporary</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7480" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7480"></td>
        <td id="LC7480" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artists stood well. The most decided influence of pre-Raphaelitism</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7481" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7481"></td>
        <td id="LC7481" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shows in Burne-Jones (1833-), a pupil of Rossetti, and perhaps the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7482" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7482"></td>
        <td id="LC7482" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">most original painter now living[18] of the English school. From</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7483" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7483"></td>
        <td id="LC7483" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Rossetti he got mysticism, sentiment, poetry, and from association</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7484" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7484"></td>
        <td id="LC7484" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with Swinburne and William Morris, the poets, something of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7485" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7485"></td>
        <td id="LC7485" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">literary in art, which he has put forth with artistic effect. He has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7486" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7486"></td>
        <td id="LC7486" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not followed the Brotherhood in its pursuit of absolute truth of fact,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7487" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7487"></td>
        <td id="LC7487" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but has used facts for decorative effect in line and color. His</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7488" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7488"></td>
        <td id="LC7488" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ability to fill a given space gracefully, shows with fine results in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7489" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7489"></td>
        <td id="LC7489" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his pictures, as in his stained-glass designs. He is a good</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7490" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7490"></td>
        <td id="LC7490" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">draughtsman and a rather rich colorist, but in brush-work somewhat</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7491" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7491"></td>
        <td id="LC7491" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">labored, stippled, and unique in dryness. He is a man of much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7492" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7492"></td>
        <td id="LC7492" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">imagination, and his conceptions, though illustrative of literature,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7493" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7493"></td>
        <td id="LC7493" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">do not suffer thereby, because his treatment does not sacrifice the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7494" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7494"></td>
        <td id="LC7494" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artistic. He has been the butt of considerable shallow laughter from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7495" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7495"></td>
        <td id="LC7495" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">time to time, like many another man of power. Albert Moore</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7496" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7496"></td>
        <td id="LC7496" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1840-1893), a graceful painter of a decorative ideal type, rather</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7497" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7497"></td>
        <td id="LC7497" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">follows the Rossetti-Burne-Jones example, and is an illustration of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7498" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7498"></td>
        <td id="LC7498" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the influence of pre-Raphaelitism.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7499" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7499"></td>
        <td id="LC7499" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7500" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7500"></td>
        <td id="LC7500" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 18: Died 1898.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7501" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7501"></td>
        <td id="LC7501" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7502" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7502"></td>
        <td id="LC7502" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">OTHER FIGURE AND PORTRAIT PAINTERS: Among the contemporary painters</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7503" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7503"></td>
        <td id="LC7503" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sir Frederick Leighton (1830-1896), President of the Royal Academy, is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7504" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7504"></td>
        <td id="LC7504" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">ranked as a fine academic draughtsman, but not a man with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7505" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7505"></td>
        <td id="LC7505" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">color-sense or the brushman&#39;s quality in his work. Watts (1818-1904)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7506" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7506"></td>
        <td id="LC7506" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">is perhaps an inferior technician, and in color is often sombre and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7507" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7507"></td>
        <td id="LC7507" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dirty; but he is a man of much imagination, occasionally rises to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7508" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7508"></td>
        <td id="LC7508" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">grandeur in conception, and has painted some superb portraits, notably</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7509" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7509"></td>
        <td id="LC7509" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the one of Walter Crane. Orchardson (1835-) is more of a painter, pure</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7510" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7510"></td>
        <td id="LC7510" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and simple, than any of his contemporaries, and is a knowing if</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7511" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7511"></td>
        <td id="LC7511" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">somewhat mannered colorist. Erskine Nicol (1825-), Faed[19] (1826-),</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7512" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7512"></td>
        <td id="LC7512" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Calderon (1833-), Boughton (1834-1905), Frederick Walker (1840-1875),</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7513" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7513"></td>
        <td id="LC7513" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Stanhope Forbes, Stott of Oldham and in portraiture Holl (1845-1890)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7514" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7514"></td>
        <td id="LC7514" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and Herkomer may be mentioned.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7515" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7515"></td>
        <td id="LC7515" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7516" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7516"></td>
        <td id="LC7516" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 19: Died 1900.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7517" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7517"></td>
        <td id="LC7517" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7518" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7518"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7519" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7519"></td>
        <td id="LC7519" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7520" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7520"></td>
        <td id="LC7520" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">LANDSCAPE AND MARINE PAINTERS: In the department of landscape there</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7521" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7521"></td>
        <td id="LC7521" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">are many painters in England of contemporary importance. Vicat Cole</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7522" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7522"></td>
        <td id="LC7522" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1833-1893) had considerable exaggerated reputation as a depicter of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7523" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7523"></td>
        <td id="LC7523" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sunsets and twilights; Cecil Lawson (1851-1882) gave promise of great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7524" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7524"></td>
        <td id="LC7524" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">accomplishment, and lived long enough to do some excellent work in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7525" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7525"></td>
        <td id="LC7525" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">style of the French Rousseau, mingled with an influence from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7526" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7526"></td>
        <td id="LC7526" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gainsborough; Alfred Parsons is a little hard and precise in his work,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7527" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7527"></td>
        <td id="LC7527" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but one of the best of the living men; and W. L. Wyllie is a painter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7528" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7528"></td>
        <td id="LC7528" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of more than average merit. In marines Hook (1819-) belongs to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7529" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7529"></td>
        <td id="LC7529" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">older school, and is not entirely satisfactory. The most modern and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7530" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7530"></td>
        <td id="LC7530" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the best sea-painter in England is Henry Moore (1831-1895), a man who</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7531" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7531"></td>
        <td id="LC7531" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">paints well and gives the large feeling of the ocean with fine color</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7532" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7532"></td>
        <td id="LC7532" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">qualities. Some other men of mark are Clausen, Brangwyn, Ouless,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7533" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7533"></td>
        <td id="LC7533" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Steer, Bell, Swan, McTaggart, Sir George Reid.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7534" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7534"></td>
        <td id="LC7534" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7535" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7535"></td>
        <td id="LC7535" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">MODERN SCOTCH SCHOOL: There is at the present time a school of art in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7536" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7536"></td>
        <td id="LC7536" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Scotland that seems to have little or no affinity with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7537" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7537"></td>
        <td id="LC7537" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">contemporary school of England. Its painters are more akin to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7538" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7538"></td>
        <td id="LC7538" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Dutch and the French, and in their coloring resemble, in depth and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7539" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7539"></td>
        <td id="LC7539" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">quality, the work of Delacroix. Much of their art is far enough</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7540" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7540"></td>
        <td id="LC7540" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">removed from the actual appearance of nature, but it is strong in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7541" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7541"></td>
        <td id="LC7541" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentiment of color and in decorative effect. The school is represented</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7542" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7542"></td>
        <td id="LC7542" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by such men as James Guthrie, E. A. Walton, James Hamilton, George</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7543" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7543"></td>
        <td id="LC7543" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Henry, E. A. Hornel, Lavery, Melville, Crawhall, Roche, Lawson,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7544" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7544"></td>
        <td id="LC7544" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">McBride, Morton, Reid Murray, Spence, Paterson.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7545" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7545"></td>
        <td id="LC7545" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7546" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7546"></td>
        <td id="LC7546" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     PRINCIPAL WORKS: English art cannot be seen to advantage,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7547" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7547"></td>
        <td id="LC7547" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     outside of England. In the Metropolitan Museum, N. Y., and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7548" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7548"></td>
        <td id="LC7548" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     in private collections like that of Mr. William H. Fuller in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7549" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7549"></td>
        <td id="LC7549" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     New York,[20] there are some good examples of the older</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7550" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7550"></td>
        <td id="LC7550" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     men--Reynolds, Constable, Gainsborough, and their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7551" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7551"></td>
        <td id="LC7551" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     contemporaries. In the Louvre there are some indifferent</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7552" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7552"></td>
        <td id="LC7552" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Constables and some good Boningtons. In England the best</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7553" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7553"></td>
        <td id="LC7553" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     collection is in the National Gallery. Next to this the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7554" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7554"></td>
        <td id="LC7554" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     South Kensington Museum for Constable sketches. Elsewhere</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7555" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7555"></td>
        <td id="LC7555" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     the Glasgow, Edinburgh, Liverpool, Windsor galleries, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7556" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7556"></td>
        <td id="LC7556" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     the private collections of the late Sir Richard Wallace, the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7557" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7557"></td>
        <td id="LC7557" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Duke of Westminster, and others. Turner is well represented</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7558" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7558"></td>
        <td id="LC7558" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     in the National Gallery, though his oils have suffered</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7559" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7559"></td>
        <td id="LC7559" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     through time and the use of fugitive pigments. For the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7560" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7560"></td>
        <td id="LC7560" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     living men, their work may be seen in the yearly exhibitions</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7561" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7561"></td>
        <td id="LC7561" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     at the Royal Academy and elsewhere. There are comparatively</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7562" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7562"></td>
        <td id="LC7562" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     few English pictures in America.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7563" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7563"></td>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7580" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7580"></td>
        <td id="LC7580" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     _Life and Letters of Washington Allston_; Galt, _Life of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7581" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7581"></td>
        <td id="LC7581" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     West_; Isham, _History of American Painting_; Knowlton, _W.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7582" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7582"></td>
        <td id="LC7582" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     M. Hunt_; Lester, _The Artists of America_; Mason, _Life and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7583" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7583"></td>
        <td id="LC7583" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Works of Gilbert Stuart_; Perkins, _Copley_; _Scribner&#39;s</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7584" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7584"></td>
        <td id="LC7584" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Magazine_; Sheldon, _American Painters_; Tuckerman, _Book of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7585" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7585"></td>
        <td id="LC7585" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     the Artists_; Van Dyke, _Art for Art&#39;s Sake_; Van</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7586" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7586"></td>
        <td id="LC7586" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Rensselaer, _Six Portraits_; Ware, _Lectures on Allston_;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7587" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7587"></td>
        <td id="LC7587" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     White, _A Sketch of Chester A. Harding_.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7588" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7588"></td>
        <td id="LC7588" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7589" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7589"></td>
        <td id="LC7589" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7590" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7590"></td>
        <td id="LC7590" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">AMERICAN ART: It is hardly possible to predicate much about the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7591" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7591"></td>
        <td id="LC7591" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">environment as it affects art in America. The result of the climate,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7592" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7592"></td>
        <td id="LC7592" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the temperament, and the mixture of nations in the production or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7593" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7593"></td>
        <td id="LC7593" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">non-production of painting in America cannot be accurately computed at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7594" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7594"></td>
        <td id="LC7594" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">this early stage of history. One thing only is certain, and that is,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7595" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7595"></td>
        <td id="LC7595" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that the building of a new commonwealth out of primeval nature does</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7596" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7596"></td>
        <td id="LC7596" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not call for the production of art in the early periods of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7597" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7597"></td>
        <td id="LC7597" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">development. The first centuries in the history of America were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7598" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7598"></td>
        <td id="LC7598" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">devoted to securing the necessities of life, the energies of the time</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7599" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7599"></td>
        <td id="LC7599" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were of a practical nature, and art as an indigenous product was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7600" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7600"></td>
        <td id="LC7600" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">hardly known.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7601" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7601"></td>
        <td id="LC7601" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7602" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7602"></td>
        <td id="LC7602" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">After the Revolution, and indeed before it, a hybrid portraiture,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7603" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7603"></td>
        <td id="LC7603" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">largely borrowed from England, began to appear, and after 1825 there</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7604" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7604"></td>
        <td id="LC7604" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was an attempt at landscape painting; but painting as an art worthy</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7605" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7605"></td>
        <td id="LC7605" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of very serious consideration, came in only with the sudden growth in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7606" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7606"></td>
        <td id="LC7606" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">wealth and taste following the War of the Rebellion and the Centennial</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7607" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7607"></td>
        <td id="LC7607" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Exhibition of 1876. The best of American art dates from about 1878,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7608" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7608"></td>
        <td id="LC7608" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">though during the earlier years there were painters of note who cannot</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7609" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7609"></td>
        <td id="LC7609" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">be passed over unmentioned.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7610" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7610"></td>
        <td id="LC7610" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7611" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7611"></td>
        <td id="LC7611" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 102.--WEST. PETER DENYING CHRIST. HAMPTON CT.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7612" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7612"></td>
        <td id="LC7612" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7613" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7613"></td>
        <td id="LC7613" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE EARLY PAINTERS: The &quot;limner,&quot; or the man who could draw and color</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7614" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7614"></td>
        <td id="LC7614" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a portrait, seems to have existed very early in American history.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7615" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7615"></td>
        <td id="LC7615" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Smibert (1684-1751), a Scotch painter, who settled in Boston, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7616" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7616"></td>
        <td id="LC7616" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Watson (1685?-1768), another Scotchman, who settled in New Jersey,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7617" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7617"></td>
        <td id="LC7617" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were of this class--men capable of giving a likeness, but little more.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7618" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7618"></td>
        <td id="LC7618" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">They were followed by English painters of even less consequence. Then</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7619" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7619"></td>
        <td id="LC7619" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">came Copley (1737-1815) and West (1738-1820), with whom painting in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7620" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7620"></td>
        <td id="LC7620" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">America really began. They were good men for their time, but it must</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7621" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7621"></td>
        <td id="LC7621" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">be borne in mind that the times for art were not at all favorable.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7622" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7622"></td>
        <td id="LC7622" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">West was a man about whom all the infant prodigy tales have been told,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7623" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7623"></td>
        <td id="LC7623" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but he never grew to be a great artist. He was ambitious beyond his</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7624" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7624"></td>
        <td id="LC7624" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">power, indulged in theatrical composition, was hot in color, and never</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7625" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7625"></td>
        <td id="LC7625" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was at ease in handling the brush. Most of his life was passed in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7626" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7626"></td>
        <td id="LC7626" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">England, where he had a vogue, was elected President of the Royal</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7627" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7627"></td>
        <td id="LC7627" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Academy, and became practically a British painter. Copley was more of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7628" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7628"></td>
        <td id="LC7628" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">an American than West, and more of a painter. Some of his portraits</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7629" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7629"></td>
        <td id="LC7629" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">are exceptionally fine, and his figure pieces, like Charles I.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7630" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7630"></td>
        <td id="LC7630" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">demanding the Five Members of House of Commons are excellent in color</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7631" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7631"></td>
        <td id="LC7631" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and composition. C. W. Peale (1741-1827), a pupil of both Copley and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7632" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7632"></td>
        <td id="LC7632" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">West, was perhaps more fortunate in having celebrated characters like</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7633" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7633"></td>
        <td id="LC7633" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Washington for sitters than in his art. Trumbull (1756-1843) preserved</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7634" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7634"></td>
        <td id="LC7634" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">on canvas the Revolutionary history of America and, all told, did it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7635" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7635"></td>
        <td id="LC7635" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">very well. Some of his compositions, portraits, and miniature heads in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7636" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7636"></td>
        <td id="LC7636" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Yale Art School at New Haven are drawn and painted in a masterful</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7637" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7637"></td>
        <td id="LC7637" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">manner and are as valuable for their art as for the incidents which</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7638" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7638"></td>
        <td id="LC7638" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">they portray.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7639" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7639"></td>
        <td id="LC7639" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7640" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7640"></td>
        <td id="LC7640" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 103.--GILBERT STUART. WASHINGTON (UNFINISHED).</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7641" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7641"></td>
        <td id="LC7641" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">BOSTON MUS.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7642" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7642"></td>
        <td id="LC7642" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7643" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7643"></td>
        <td id="LC7643" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gilbert Stuart (1755-1828) was the best portrait-painter of all the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7644" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7644"></td>
        <td id="LC7644" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early men, and his work holds very high rank even in the schools of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7645" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7645"></td>
        <td id="LC7645" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to-day. He was one of the first in American art-history to show</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7646" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7646"></td>
        <td id="LC7646" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">skilful accuracy of the brush, a good knowledge of color, and some</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7647" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7647"></td>
        <td id="LC7647" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artistic sense of dignity and carriage in the sitter. He was not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7648" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7648"></td>
        <td id="LC7648" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">always a good draughtsman, and he had a manner of laying on pure</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7649" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7649"></td>
        <td id="LC7649" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">colors without blending them that sometimes produced sharpness in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7650" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7650"></td>
        <td id="LC7650" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">modelling; but as a general rule he painted a portrait with force and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
