        <td id="L7651" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7651"></td>
        <td id="LC7651" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with truth. He was a pupil of Alexander, a Scotchman, and afterward an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7652" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7652"></td>
        <td id="LC7652" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">assistant to West. He settled in Boston, and during his life painted</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7653" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7653"></td>
        <td id="LC7653" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">most of the great men of his time, including Washington.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7654" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7654"></td>
        <td id="LC7654" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7655" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7655"></td>
        <td id="LC7655" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 104.--W. M. HUNT. LUTE PLAYER.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7656" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7656"></td>
        <td id="LC7656" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7657" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7657"></td>
        <td id="LC7657" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Vanderlyn (1776-1852) met with adversity all his life long, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7658" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7658"></td>
        <td id="LC7658" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">perhaps never expressed himself fully. He was a pupil of Stuart,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7659" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7659"></td>
        <td id="LC7659" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">studied in Paris and Italy, and his associations with Aaron Burr made</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7660" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7660"></td>
        <td id="LC7660" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">him quite as famous as his pictures. Washington Allston (1779-1843)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7661" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7661"></td>
        <td id="LC7661" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was a painter whom the Bostonians have ranked high in their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7662" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7662"></td>
        <td id="LC7662" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art-history, but he hardly deserved such position. Intellectually he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7663" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7663"></td>
        <td id="LC7663" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was a man of lofty and poetic aspirations, but as an artist he never</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7664" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7664"></td>
        <td id="LC7664" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had the painter&#39;s sense or the painter&#39;s skill. He was an aspiration</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7665" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7665"></td>
        <td id="LC7665" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">rather than a consummation. He cherished notions about ideals, dealt</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7666" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7666"></td>
        <td id="LC7666" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in imaginative allegories, and failed to observe the pictorial</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7667" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7667"></td>
        <td id="LC7667" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">character of the world about him. As a result of this, and poor</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7668" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7668"></td>
        <td id="LC7668" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">artistic training, his art had too little basis on nature, though it</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7669" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7669"></td>
        <td id="LC7669" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was very often satisfactory as decoration. Rembrandt Peale</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7670" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7670"></td>
        <td id="LC7670" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1787-1860), like his father, was a painter of Washington portraits of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7671" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7671"></td>
        <td id="LC7671" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">mediocre quality. Jarvis (1780-1834) and Sully (1783-1872) were both</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7672" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7672"></td>
        <td id="LC7672" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">British born, but their work belongs here in America, where most of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7673" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7673"></td>
        <td id="LC7673" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">their days were spent. Sully could paint a very good portrait</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7674" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7674"></td>
        <td id="LC7674" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">occasionally, though he always inclined toward the weak and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7675" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7675"></td>
        <td id="LC7675" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentimental, especially in his portraits of women. Leslie (1794-1859)</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7676" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7676"></td>
        <td id="LC7676" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and Newton (1795-1835) were Americans, but, like West and Copley, they</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7677" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7677"></td>
        <td id="LC7677" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">belong in their art more to England than to America. In all the early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7678" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7678"></td>
        <td id="LC7678" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">American painting the British influence may be traced, with sometimes</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7679" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7679"></td>
        <td id="LC7679" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">an inclination to follow Italy in large compositions.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7680" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7680"></td>
        <td id="LC7680" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7681" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7681"></td>
        <td id="LC7681" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE MIDDLE PERIOD in American art dates from 1825 to about 1878. During</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7682" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7682"></td>
        <td id="LC7682" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">that time, something distinctly American began to appear in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7683" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7683"></td>
        <td id="LC7683" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">landscape work of Doughty (1793-1856) and Thomas Cole (1801-1848). Both</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7684" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7684"></td>
        <td id="LC7684" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">men were substantially self-taught, though Cole received some</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7685" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7685"></td>
        <td id="LC7685" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">instruction from a portrait-painter named Stein. Cole during his life</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7686" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7686"></td>
        <td id="LC7686" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">was famous for his Hudson River landscapes, and for two series of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7687" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7687"></td>
        <td id="LC7687" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">pictures called The Voyage of Life and The Course of Empire. The latter</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7688" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7688"></td>
        <td id="LC7688" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">were really epic poems upon canvas, done with much blare of color and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7689" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7689"></td>
        <td id="LC7689" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">literary explanation in the title. His best work was in pure landscape,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7690" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7690"></td>
        <td id="LC7690" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">which he pictured with considerable accuracy in drawing, though it was</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7691" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7691"></td>
        <td id="LC7691" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">faulty in lighting and gaudy in coloring. Brilliant autumn scenes were</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7692" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7692"></td>
        <td id="LC7692" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his favorite subjects. His work had the merit of originality and,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7693" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7693"></td>
        <td id="LC7693" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">moreover, it must be remembered that Cole was one of the beginners in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7694" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7694"></td>
        <td id="LC7694" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">American landscape art. Durand (1796-1886) was an engraver until 1835,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7695" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7695"></td>
        <td id="LC7695" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">when he began painting portraits, and afterward developed landscape with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7696" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7696"></td>
        <td id="LC7696" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">considerable power. He was usually simple in subject and realistic in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7697" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7697"></td>
        <td id="LC7697" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">treatment, with not so much insistence upon brilliant color as some of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7698" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7698"></td>
        <td id="LC7698" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his contemporaries. Kensett (1818-1872) was a follower in landscape of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7699" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7699"></td>
        <td id="LC7699" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the so-called Hudson River School of Cole and others, though he studied</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7700" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7700"></td>
        <td id="LC7700" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">seven years in Europe. His color was rather warm, his air hazy, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7701" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7701"></td>
        <td id="LC7701" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">general effect of his landscape that of a dreamy autumn day with poetic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7702" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7702"></td>
        <td id="LC7702" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">suggestions. F. E. Church (1826-[A]) was a pupil of Cole, and has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7703" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7703"></td>
        <td id="LC7703" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">followed him in seeking the grand and the startling in mountain scenery.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7704" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7704"></td>
        <td id="LC7704" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">With Church should be mentioned a number of artists--Hubbard</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7705" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7705"></td>
        <td id="LC7705" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1817-1888), Hill (1829-,) Bierstadt (1830-),[21] Thomas Moran</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7706" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7706"></td>
        <td id="LC7706" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1837-)--who have achieved reputation by canvases of the Rocky Mountains</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7707" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7707"></td>
        <td id="LC7707" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and other expansive scenes. Some other painters of smaller canvases</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7708" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7708"></td>
        <td id="LC7708" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">belong in point of time, and also in spirit, with the Hudson River</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7709" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7709"></td>
        <td id="LC7709" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">landscapists--painters, too, of considerable merit, as David Johnson</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7710" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7710"></td>
        <td id="LC7710" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1827-), Bristol (1826-), Sandford Gifford (1823-1880), McEntee</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7711" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7711"></td>
        <td id="LC7711" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1828-1891), and Whittredge (1820-), the last two very good portrayers</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7712" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7712"></td>
        <td id="LC7712" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of autumn scenes; A. H. Wyant (1836-1892), one of the best and strongest</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7713" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7713"></td>
        <td id="LC7713" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the American landscapists; Bradford (1830-1892) and W. T. Richards</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7714" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7714"></td>
        <td id="LC7714" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1833-), the marine-painters.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7715" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7715"></td>
        <td id="LC7715" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7716" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7716"></td>
        <td id="LC7716" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 21: Died, 1900.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7717" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7717"></td>
        <td id="LC7717" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7718" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7718"></td>
        <td id="LC7718" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 105.--EASTMAN JOHNSON. CHURNING.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7719" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7719"></td>
        <td id="LC7719" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7720" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7720"></td>
        <td id="LC7720" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PORTRAIT, HISTORY, AND GENRE-PAINTERS: Contemporary with the early</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7721" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7721"></td>
        <td id="LC7721" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">landscapists were a number of figure-painters, most of them</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7722" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7722"></td>
        <td id="LC7722" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">self-taught, or taught badly by foreign or native artists, and yet men</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7723" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7723"></td>
        <td id="LC7723" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">who produced creditable work. Chester Harding (1792-1866) was one of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7724" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7724"></td>
        <td id="LC7724" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the early portrait-painters of this century who achieved enough</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7725" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7725"></td>
        <td id="LC7725" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">celebrity in Boston to be the subject of what was called &quot;the Harding</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7726" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7726"></td>
        <td id="LC7726" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">craze.&quot; Elliott (1812-1868) was a pupil of Trumbull, and a man of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7727" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7727"></td>
        <td id="LC7727" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">considerable reputation, as was also  Inman (1801-1846), a portrait</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7728" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7728"></td>
        <td id="LC7728" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and _genre_-painter with a smooth, detailed brush. Page (1811-1885),</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7729" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7729"></td>
        <td id="LC7729" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Baker (1821-1880), Huntington (1816-), the third President of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7730" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7730"></td>
        <td id="LC7730" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Academy of Design; Healy (1808-[22]), a portrait-painter of more than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7731" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7731"></td>
        <td id="LC7731" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">average excellence; Mount (1807-1868), one of the earliest of American</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7732" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7732"></td>
        <td id="LC7732" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">_genre_-painters, were all men of note in this middle period.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7733" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7733"></td>
        <td id="LC7733" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7734" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7734"></td>
        <td id="LC7734" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 22: Died 1894.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7735" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7735"></td>
        <td id="LC7735" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7736" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7736"></td>
        <td id="LC7736" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Leutze (1816-1868) was a German by birth but an American by adoption,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7737" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7737"></td>
        <td id="LC7737" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">who painted many large historical scenes of the American Revolution,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7738" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7738"></td>
        <td id="LC7738" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">such as Washington Crossing the Delaware, besides many scenes taken</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7739" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7739"></td>
        <td id="LC7739" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">from European history. He was a pupil of Lessing at Dusseldorf, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7740" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7740"></td>
        <td id="LC7740" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had something to do with introducing Dusseldorf methods into America.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7741" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7741"></td>
        <td id="LC7741" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">He was a painter of ability, if at times hot in color and dry in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7742" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7742"></td>
        <td id="LC7742" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">handling. Occasionally he did a fine portrait, like the Seward in the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7743" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7743"></td>
        <td id="LC7743" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Union League Club, New York.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7744" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7744"></td>
        <td id="LC7744" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7745" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7745"></td>
        <td id="LC7745" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">During this period, in addition to the influence of Dusseldorf and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7746" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7746"></td>
        <td id="LC7746" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Rome upon American art, there came the influence of French art with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7747" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7747"></td>
        <td id="LC7747" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Hicks (1823-1890) and Hunt (1824-1879), both of them pupils of Couture</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7748" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7748"></td>
        <td id="LC7748" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">at Paris, and Hunt also of Millet at Barbizon. Hunt was the real</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7749" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7749"></td>
        <td id="LC7749" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">introducer of Millet and the Barbizon-Fontainebleau artists to the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7750" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7750"></td>
        <td id="LC7750" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">American people. In 1855 he established himself at Boston, had a large</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7751" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7751"></td>
        <td id="LC7751" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">number of pupils, and met with great success as a teacher. He was a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7752" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7752"></td>
        <td id="LC7752" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painter of ability, but perhaps his greatest influence was as a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7753" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7753"></td>
        <td id="LC7753" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">teacher and an instructor in what was good art as distinguished from</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7754" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7754"></td>
        <td id="LC7754" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">what was false and meretricious. He certainly was the first painter in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7755" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7755"></td>
        <td id="LC7755" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">America who taught catholicity of taste, truth and sincerity in art,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7756" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7756"></td>
        <td id="LC7756" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and art in the artist rather than in the subject. Contemporary with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7757" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7757"></td>
        <td id="LC7757" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Hunt lived George Fuller (1822-1884), a unique man in American art for</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7758" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7758"></td>
        <td id="LC7758" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the sentiment he conveyed in his pictures by means of color and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7759" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7759"></td>
        <td id="LC7759" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">atmosphere. Though never proficient in the grammar of art he managed</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7760" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7760"></td>
        <td id="LC7760" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by blendings of color to suggest certain sentiments regarding light</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7761" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7761"></td>
        <td id="LC7761" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and air that have been rightly esteemed poetic.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7762" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7762"></td>
        <td id="LC7762" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7763" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7763"></td>
        <td id="LC7763" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 106.--INNESS. LANDSCAPE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7764" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7764"></td>
        <td id="LC7764" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7765" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7765"></td>
        <td id="LC7765" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">THE THIRD PERIOD in American art began immediately after the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7766" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7766"></td>
        <td id="LC7766" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Centennial Exhibition at Philadelphia in 1876. Undoubtedly the display</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7767" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7767"></td>
        <td id="LC7767" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of art, both foreign and domestic, at that time, together with the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7768" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7768"></td>
        <td id="LC7768" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">national prosperity and great growth of the United States had much to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7769" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7769"></td>
        <td id="LC7769" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">do with stimulating activity in painting. Many young men at the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7770" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7770"></td>
        <td id="LC7770" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">beginning of this period went to Europe to study in the studios at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7771" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7771"></td>
        <td id="LC7771" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Munich, and later on at Paris. Before 1880 some of them had returned</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7772" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7772"></td>
        <td id="LC7772" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to the United States, bringing with them knowledge of the technical</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7773" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7773"></td>
        <td id="LC7773" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">side of art, which they immediately began to give out to many pupils.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7774" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7774"></td>
        <td id="LC7774" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Gradually the influence of the young men from Munich and Paris spread.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7775" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7775"></td>
        <td id="LC7775" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The Art Students&#39; League, founded in 1875, was incorporated in 1878,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7776" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7776"></td>
        <td id="LC7776" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and the Society of American Artists was established in the same year.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7777" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7777"></td>
        <td id="LC7777" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Societies and painters began to spring up all over the country, and as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7778" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7778"></td>
        <td id="LC7778" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a result there is in the United States to-day an artist body</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7779" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7779"></td>
        <td id="LC7779" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">technically as well trained and in spirit as progressive as in almost</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7780" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7780"></td>
        <td id="LC7780" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">any country of Europe. The late influence shown in painting has been</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7781" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7781"></td>
        <td id="LC7781" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">largely a French influence, and the American artists have been accused</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7782" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7782"></td>
        <td id="LC7782" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">from time to time of echoing French methods. The accusation is true in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7783" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7783"></td>
        <td id="LC7783" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">part. Paris is the centre of all art-teaching to-day, and the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7784" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7784"></td>
        <td id="LC7784" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Americans, in common with the European nations, accept French methods,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7785" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7785"></td>
        <td id="LC7785" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">not because they are French, but because they are the best extant. In</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7786" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7786"></td>
        <td id="LC7786" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">subjects and motives, however, the American school is as original as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7787" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7787"></td>
        <td id="LC7787" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">any school can be in this cosmopolitan age.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7788" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7788"></td>
        <td id="LC7788" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7789" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7789"></td>
        <td id="LC7789" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">PORTRAIT, FIGURE, AND GENRE PAINTERS (1878-1894): It must not be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7790" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7790"></td>
        <td id="LC7790" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">inferred that the painters now prominent in American art are all young</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7791" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7791"></td>
        <td id="LC7791" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">men schooled since 1876. On the contrary, some of the best of them are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7792" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7792"></td>
        <td id="LC7792" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">men past middle life who began painting long before 1876, and have by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7793" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7793"></td>
        <td id="LC7793" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dint of observation and prolonged study continued with the modern</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7794" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7794"></td>
        <td id="LC7794" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">spirit. For example, Winslow Homer (1836-) is one of the strongest and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7795" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7795"></td>
        <td id="LC7795" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">most original of all the American artists, a man who never had the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7796" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7796"></td>
        <td id="LC7796" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">advantage of the highest technical training, yet possesses a feeling</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7797" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7797"></td>
        <td id="LC7797" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">for color, a dash and verve in execution, an originality in subject,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7798" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7798"></td>
        <td id="LC7798" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and an individuality of conception that are unsurpassed. Eastman</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7799" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7799"></td>
        <td id="LC7799" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Johnson (1824-) is one of the older portrait and figure-painters who</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7800" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7800"></td>
        <td id="LC7800" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">stands among the younger generations without jostling, because he has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7801" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7801"></td>
        <td id="LC7801" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in measure kept himself informed with modern thought and method. He is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7802" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7802"></td>
        <td id="LC7802" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a good, conservative painter, possessed of taste, judgment, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7803" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7803"></td>
        <td id="LC7803" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">technical ability. Elihu Vedder (1836-) is more of a draughtsman than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7804" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7804"></td>
        <td id="LC7804" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a brushman. His color-sense is not acute nor his handling free, but he</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7805" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7805"></td>
        <td id="LC7805" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">has an imagination which, if somewhat more literary than pictorial, is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7806" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7806"></td>
        <td id="LC7806" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">nevertheless very effective. John La Farge (1835-) and Albert Ryder</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7807" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7807"></td>
        <td id="LC7807" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1847-) are both colorists, and La Farge in artistic feeling is a man</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7808" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7808"></td>
        <td id="LC7808" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of much power. Almost all of his pictures have fine decorative quality</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7809" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7809"></td>
        <td id="LC7809" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in line and color and are thoroughly pictorial.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7810" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7810"></td>
        <td id="LC7810" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7811" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7811"></td>
        <td id="LC7811" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 107.--WINSLOW HOMER. UNDERTOW.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7812" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7812"></td>
        <td id="LC7812" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7813" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7813"></td>
        <td id="LC7813" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The &quot;young men,&quot; so-called, though some of them are now on toward</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7814" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7814"></td>
        <td id="LC7814" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">middle life, are perhaps more facile in brush-work and better trained</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7815" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7815"></td>
        <td id="LC7815" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">draughtsmen than those we have just mentioned. They have cultivated</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7816" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7816"></td>
        <td id="LC7816" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">vivacity of style and cleverness in statement, frequently at the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7817" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7817"></td>
        <td id="LC7817" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">expense of the larger qualities of art. Sargent (1856-) is, perhaps,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7818" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7818"></td>
        <td id="LC7818" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the most considerable portrait-painter now living, a man of unbounded</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7819" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7819"></td>
        <td id="LC7819" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">resources technically and fine natural abilities. He is draughtsman,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7820" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7820"></td>
        <td id="LC7820" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">colorist, brushman--in fact, almost everything in art that can be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7821" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7821"></td>
        <td id="LC7821" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">cultivated. His taste is not yet mature, and he is just now given to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7822" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7822"></td>
        <td id="LC7822" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">dashing effects that are more clever than permanent; but that he is a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7823" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7823"></td>
        <td id="LC7823" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">master in portraiture has already been abundantly demonstrated. Chase</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7824" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7824"></td>
        <td id="LC7824" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1849-) is also an exceptionally good portrait painter, and he handles</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7825" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7825"></td>
        <td id="LC7825" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the _genre_ subject with brilliant color and a swift, sure brush. In</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7826" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7826"></td>
        <td id="LC7826" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">brush-work he is exceedingly clever, and is an excellent technician</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7827" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7827"></td>
        <td id="LC7827" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in almost every respect. Not always profound in matter he generally</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7828" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7828"></td>
        <td id="LC7828" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">manages to be entertaining in method. Blum (1857-) is well known to</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7829" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7829"></td>
        <td id="LC7829" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">magazine readers through many black-and-white illustrations. He is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7830" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7830"></td>
        <td id="LC7830" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">also a painter of _genre_ subjects taken from many lands, and handles</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7831" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7831"></td>
        <td id="LC7831" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">his brush with brilliancy and force. Dewing (1851-) is a painter with</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7832" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7832"></td>
        <td id="LC7832" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a refined sense not only in form but in color. His pictures are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7833" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7833"></td>
        <td id="LC7833" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">usually small, but exquisite in delicacy and decorative charm. Thayer</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7834" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7834"></td>
        <td id="LC7834" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(1849-) is fond of large canvases, a man of earnestness, sincerity,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7835" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7835"></td>
        <td id="LC7835" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and imagination, but not a good draughtsman, not a good colorist, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7836" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7836"></td>
        <td id="LC7836" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a rather clumsy brushman. He has, however, something to say, and in a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7837" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7837"></td>
        <td id="LC7837" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">large sense is an artist of uncommon ability. Kenyon Cox (1856-) is a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7838" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7838"></td>
        <td id="LC7838" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">draughtsman, with a strong command of line and taste in its</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7839" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7839"></td>
        <td id="LC7839" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">arrangement. He is not a strong colorist, though in recent work he has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7840" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7840"></td>
        <td id="LC7840" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">shown a new departure in this feature that promises well. He renders</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7841" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7841"></td>
        <td id="LC7841" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the nude with power, and is fond of the allegorical subject.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7842" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7842"></td>
        <td id="LC7842" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7843" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7843"></td>
        <td id="LC7843" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The number of good portrait-painters at present working in America is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7844" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7844"></td>
        <td id="LC7844" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">quite large, and mention can be made of but a few in addition to those</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7845" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7845"></td>
        <td id="LC7845" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">already spoken of--Lockwood, McLure Hamilton, Tarbell, Beckwith,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7846" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7846"></td>
        <td id="LC7846" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Benson, Vinton. In figure and _genre_-painting the list of really good</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7847" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7847"></td>
        <td id="LC7847" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">painters could be drawn out indefinitely, and again mention must be</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7848" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7848"></td>
        <td id="LC7848" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">confined to a few only, like Simmons, Shirlaw, Smedley, Brush, Millet,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7849" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7849"></td>
        <td id="LC7849" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Hassam, Reid, Wiles, Mowbray, Reinhart, Blashfield, Metcalf, Low, C.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7850" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7850"></td>
        <td id="LC7850" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Y. Turner, Henri.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7851" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7851"></td>
        <td id="LC7851" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7852" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7852"></td>
        <td id="LC7852" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 108.--WHISTLER. WHITE GIRL.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7853" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7853"></td>
        <td id="LC7853" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7854" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7854"></td>
        <td id="LC7854" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Most of the men whose names are given above are resident in America;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7855" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7855"></td>
        <td id="LC7855" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">but, in addition, there is a large contingent of young men, American</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7856" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7856"></td>
        <td id="LC7856" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">born but resident abroad, who can hardly be claimed by the American</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7857" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7857"></td>
        <td id="LC7857" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school, and yet belong to it as much as to any school. They are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7858" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7858"></td>
        <td id="LC7858" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">cosmopolitan in their art, and reside in Paris, Munich, London, or</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7859" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7859"></td>
        <td id="LC7859" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">elsewhere, as the spirit moves them. Sargent, the portrait-painter,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7860" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7860"></td>
        <td id="LC7860" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">really belongs to this group, as does also Whistler (1834-[23]), one</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7861" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7861"></td>
        <td id="LC7861" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of the most artistic of all the moderns. Whistler was long resident in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7862" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7862"></td>
        <td id="LC7862" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">London, but has now removed to Paris. He belongs to no school, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7863" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7863"></td>
        <td id="LC7863" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">such art as he produces is peculiarly his own, save a leaven of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7864" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7864"></td>
        <td id="LC7864" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">influences from Velasquez and the Japanese. His art is the perfection</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7865" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7865"></td>
        <td id="LC7865" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">of delicacy, both in color and in line. Apparently very sketchy, it is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7866" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7866"></td>
        <td id="LC7866" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in reality the maximum of effect with the minimum of display. It has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7867" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7867"></td>
        <td id="LC7867" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the pictorial charm of mystery and suggestiveness, and the technical</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7868" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7868"></td>
        <td id="LC7868" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">effect of light, air, and space. There is nothing better produced in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7869" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7869"></td>
        <td id="LC7869" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">modern painting than his present work, and in earlier years he painted</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7870" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7870"></td>
        <td id="LC7870" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">portraits like that of his mother, which are justly ranked as great</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7871" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7871"></td>
        <td id="LC7871" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">art. E. A. Abbey (1852-) is better known by his pen-and-ink work than</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7872" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7872"></td>
        <td id="LC7872" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">by his paintings, howbeit he has done good work in color. He is</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7873" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7873"></td>
        <td id="LC7873" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">resident in England.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7874" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7874"></td>
        <td id="LC7874" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7875" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7875"></td>
        <td id="LC7875" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 23: Died, 1903.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7876" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7876"></td>
        <td id="LC7876" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7877" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7877"></td>
        <td id="LC7877" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 109.--SARGENT. &quot;CARNATION LILY, LILY ROSE.&quot;]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7878" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7878"></td>
        <td id="LC7878" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7879" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7879"></td>
        <td id="LC7879" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In Paris there are many American-born painters, who really belong more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7880" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7880"></td>
        <td id="LC7880" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">with the French school than the American. Bridgman is an example, and</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7881" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7881"></td>
        <td id="LC7881" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Dannat, Alexander Harrison, Hitchcock, McEwen, Melchers, Pearce,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7882" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7882"></td>
        <td id="LC7882" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Julius Stewart, Weeks (1849-1903), J. W. Alexander, Walter Gay,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7883" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7883"></td>
        <td id="LC7883" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Sergeant Kendall have nothing distinctly American about their art. It</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7884" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7884"></td>
        <td id="LC7884" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">is semi-cosmopolitan with a leaning toward French methods. There are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7885" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7885"></td>
        <td id="LC7885" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">also some American-born painters at Munich, like C. F. Ulrich; Shannon</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7886" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7886"></td>
        <td id="LC7886" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">is in London and Coleman in Italy.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7887" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7887"></td>
        <td id="LC7887" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7888" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7888"></td>
        <td id="LC7888" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">LANDSCAPE AND MARINE PAINTERS, 1878-1894: In the department of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7889" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7889"></td>
        <td id="LC7889" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">landscape America has had since 1825 something distinctly national,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7890" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7890"></td>
        <td id="LC7890" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and has at this day. In recent years the impressionist _plein-air_</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7891" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7891"></td>
        <td id="LC7891" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">school of France has influenced many painters, and the prismatic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7892" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7892"></td>
        <td id="LC7892" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">landscape is quite as frequently seen in American exhibitions as in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7893" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7893"></td>
        <td id="LC7893" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the Paris salons; but American landscape art rather dates ahead of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7894" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7894"></td>
        <td id="LC7894" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">French impressionism. The strongest landscapist of our times, George</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7895" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7895"></td>
        <td id="LC7895" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Inness (1825-[24]), is not a young man except in his artistic</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7896" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7896"></td>
        <td id="LC7896" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">aspirations. His style has undergone many changes, yet still remains</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7897" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7897"></td>
        <td id="LC7897" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">distinctly individual. He has always been an experimenter and an</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7898" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7898"></td>
        <td id="LC7898" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">uneven painter, at times doing work of wonderful force, and then again</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7899" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7899"></td>
        <td id="LC7899" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">falling into weakness. The solidity of nature, the mass and bulk of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7900" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7900"></td>
        <td id="LC7900" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">landscape, he has shown with a power second to none. He is fond of the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7901" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7901"></td>
        <td id="LC7901" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">sentiment of nature&#39;s light, air, and color, and has put it forth more</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7902" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7902"></td>
        <td id="LC7902" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in his later than in his earlier canvases. At his best, he is one of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7903" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7903"></td>
        <td id="LC7903" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the first of the American landscapists. Among his contemporaries Wyant</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7904" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7904"></td>
        <td id="LC7904" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">(already mentioned), Swain Gifford,[25] Colman, Gay, Shurtleff, have</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7905" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7905"></td>
        <td id="LC7905" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">all done excellent work uninfluenced by foreign schools of to-day.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7906" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7906"></td>
        <td id="LC7906" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Homer Martin&#39;s[26] landscapes, from their breadth of treatment, are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7907" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7907"></td>
        <td id="LC7907" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">popularly considered rather indifferent work, but in reality they are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7908" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7908"></td>
        <td id="LC7908" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">excellent in color and poetic feeling.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7909" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7909"></td>
        <td id="LC7909" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7910" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7910"></td>
        <td id="LC7910" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 24: Died 1894.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7911" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7911"></td>
        <td id="LC7911" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7912" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7912"></td>
        <td id="LC7912" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 25: Died 1905.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7913" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7913"></td>
        <td id="LC7913" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7914" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7914"></td>
        <td id="LC7914" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 26: Died 1897.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7915" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7915"></td>
        <td id="LC7915" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7916" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7916"></td>
        <td id="LC7916" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The &quot;young men&quot; again, in landscape as in the figure, are working in</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7917" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7917"></td>
        <td id="LC7917" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">the modern spirit, though in substance they are based on the</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7918" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7918"></td>
        <td id="LC7918" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">traditions of the older American landscape school. There has been much</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7919" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7919"></td>
        <td id="LC7919" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">achievement, and there is still greater promise in such landscapists</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7920" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7920"></td>
        <td id="LC7920" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as Tryon, Platt, Murphy, Dearth, Crane, Dewey, Coffin, Horatio Walker,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7921" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7921"></td>
        <td id="LC7921" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Jonas Lie. Among those who favor the so-called impressionistic view</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7922" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7922"></td>
        <td id="LC7922" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">are Weir, Twachtman, and Robinson,[27] three landscape-painters of</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7923" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7923"></td>
        <td id="LC7923" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">undeniable power. In marines Gedney Bunce has portrayed many Venetian</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7924" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7924"></td>
        <td id="LC7924" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">scenes of charming color-tone, and De Haas[28] has long been known as</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7925" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7925"></td>
        <td id="LC7925" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">a sea-painter of some power. Quartley, who died young, was brilliant</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7926" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7926"></td>
        <td id="LC7926" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">in color and broadly realistic. The present marine-painters are</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7927" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7927"></td>
        <td id="LC7927" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Maynard, Snell, Rehn, Butler, Chapman.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7928" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7928"></td>
        <td id="LC7928" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7929" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7929"></td>
        <td id="LC7929" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 27: Died 1896.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7930" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7930"></td>
        <td id="LC7930" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7931" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7931"></td>
        <td id="LC7931" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Footnote 28: Died 1895.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7932" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7932"></td>
        <td id="LC7932" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7933" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7933"></td>
        <td id="LC7933" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">[Illustration: FIG. 110.--CHASE. ALICE.]</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7934" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7934"></td>
        <td id="LC7934" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7935" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7935"></td>
        <td id="LC7935" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     PRINCIPAL WORKS: The works of the early American painters</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7936" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7936"></td>
        <td id="LC7936" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     are to be seen principally in the Boston Museum of Fine</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7937" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7937"></td>
        <td id="LC7937" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Arts, the Athenaeum, Boston Mus., Mass. Hist. Soc., Harvard</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7938" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7938"></td>
        <td id="LC7938" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     College, Redwood Library, Newport, Metropolitan Mus., Lenox</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7939" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7939"></td>
        <td id="LC7939" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     and Hist. Soc. Libraries, the City Hall, Century Club,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7940" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7940"></td>
        <td id="LC7940" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Chamber of Commerce, National Acad. of Design, N. Y. In New</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7941" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7941"></td>
        <td id="LC7941" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Haven, at Yale School of Fine Arts, in Philadelphia at</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7942" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7942"></td>
        <td id="LC7942" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Penna. Acad. of Fine Arts, in Rochester Powers&#39;s Art Gal.,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7943" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7943"></td>
        <td id="LC7943" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     in Washington Corcoran Gal. and the Capitol.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7944" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7944"></td>
        <td id="LC7944" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7945" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7945"></td>
        <td id="LC7945" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     The works of the younger men are seen in the exhibitions</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7946" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7946"></td>
        <td id="LC7946" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     held from year to year at the Academy of Design, the Society</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7947" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7947"></td>
        <td id="LC7947" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     of American Artists, N. Y., in Philadelphia, Chicago,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7948" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7948"></td>
        <td id="LC7948" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Boston, and elsewhere throughout the country. Some of their</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7949" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7949"></td>
        <td id="LC7949" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     works belong to permanent institutions like the Metropolitan</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7950" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7950"></td>
        <td id="LC7950" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     Mus., the Pennsylvania Acad., the Art Institute of Chicago,</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7951" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7951"></td>
        <td id="LC7951" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     but there is no public collection of pictures that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7952" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7952"></td>
        <td id="LC7952" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     represents American art as a whole. Mr. T. B. Clarke, of New</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7953" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7953"></td>
        <td id="LC7953" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     York, had perhaps as complete a collection of paintings by</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7954" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7954"></td>
        <td id="LC7954" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">     contemporary American artists as anyone.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7955" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7955"></td>
        <td id="LC7955" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7956" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7956"></td>
        <td id="LC7956" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7957" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7957"></td>
        <td id="LC7957" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7958" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7958"></td>
        <td id="LC7958" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7959" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7959"></td>
        <td id="LC7959" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">POSTSCRIPT.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7960" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7960"></td>
        <td id="LC7960" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7961" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7961"></td>
        <td id="LC7961" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">SCATTERING SCHOOLS AND INFLUENCES IN ART.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7962" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7962"></td>
        <td id="LC7962" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7963" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7963"></td>
        <td id="LC7963" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7964" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7964"></td>
        <td id="LC7964" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In this brief history of painting it has been necessary to omit some</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7965" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7965"></td>
        <td id="LC7965" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">countries and some painters that have not seemed to be directly</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7966" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7966"></td>
        <td id="LC7966" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">connected with the progress or development of painting in the western</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7967" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7967"></td>
        <td id="LC7967" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">world. The arts of China and Japan, while well worthy of careful</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7968" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7968"></td>
        <td id="LC7968" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">chronicling, are somewhat removed from the arts of the other nations</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7969" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7969"></td>
        <td id="LC7969" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">and from our study. Moreover, they are so positively decorative that</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7970" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7970"></td>
        <td id="LC7970" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">they should be treated under the head of Decoration, though it is not</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7971" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7971"></td>
        <td id="LC7971" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">to be denied that they are also realistically expressive. Portugal has</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7972" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7972"></td>
        <td id="LC7972" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">had some history in the art of painting, but it is slight and so bound</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7973" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7973"></td>
        <td id="LC7973" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">up with Spanish and Flemish influences that its men do not stand out</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7974" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7974"></td>
        <td id="LC7974" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">as a distinct school. This is true in measure of Russian painting. The</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7975" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7975"></td>
        <td id="LC7975" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">early influences with it were Byzantine through the Greek Church. In</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7976" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7976"></td>
        <td id="LC7976" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">late years what has been produced favors the Parisian or German</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7977" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7977"></td>
        <td id="LC7977" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">schools.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7978" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7978"></td>
        <td id="LC7978" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7979" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7979"></td>
        <td id="LC7979" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">In Denmark and Scandinavia there has recently come to the front a</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L7980" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="7980"></td>
        <td id="LC7980" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">remarkable school of high-light painters, based on Parisian methods,</td>
      </tr>
